reviews.review: Evening concert series is a religious experience. We attended one of the Evening concert series and heard a string instrument performance of Vivaldi's Four Seasons. no words. The beauty of the cathedral paired with the magic of the music was incredible.

Shabby.. This is another of those check-list sites that people feel compelled to visit mostly in order to be able say that they had been there. For us this was strictly a target of opportunity in that we were walking by, saw that there was no line, and decided to pop in. It is very poorly maintained. For example, on the stone ledges below each of the stained glass windows there had to be at least an inch of dirt and dust. You could use a small shovel to clean much of the filth away.If you do feel compelled to go here, do your homework as to what time of day the sun will have the most favorable exposure. It is necessary for the sun to back-light the windows in order to see what the original builders were trying to accomplish.

A must see!. I have been to Paris a few times before, but this is the first time I visited the Sainte-Chapelle. Boy was I missing out. The Chapelle is beautiful and a must see. We purchased our tickets at the La Conciergerie. If you plan on visiting both, visit La Cociergerie first. The line was very short there, however it looked to be at leas

Jaw dropping. This is my favorite church/cathedral that I have been to in Europe, surpassing Notre Dame, St. Peter's (Rome), the duomo in Florence, and La Sagrada Familia (Barcelona). The size of the stained glass and the colors that come through when the sun is shining is incredibly impressive. It is much smaller and more intimate in my opinion than most other churches/cathedrals. This is a "must-do" if you are in Paris. Plus, it is a very short walk from Notre Dame, so it makes it easy to knock out both in a morning or afternoon. However, the lines can get very long, so plan ahead. Probably best to go early in the morning.

The light is all around. The light is incredible. The art on glass is to be amazed. Be prepared to spend at least 2 hours, because the beauty is all around. The history, the architeture is fascinanting.

A must see on a sunny day!. Saint-Chapelle was my favorite chapel in Paris. The stained glass cannot be beaten. Its a short stop and well worth the effort. Get there early to avoid lines! Even in November we, had a bit of a wait!
A must see! A rare jewel. This is one of the most amazing churches/chapels I have ever seen. Highly recommended. It is quite unique.

Gorgeous Stained Glass. We walked in and couldn't believe the beauty of the first floor. You will then find a stairway to take you to the second floor which is amazing as well. Highly recommend this as a stop on your tour of Paris.
Well worth the wait.. Truly a unique sight. This medieval stained glass walled box is truly beautiful and very difficult to believe that it was created hundreds of years ago.

Breathtaking! . Absolutely the most stunning display of stained glass I've ever seen. I would strongly recommend at least a short visit while visiting Notre Dame. It is just a short walk from the cathedral.

One of the MOST Beautiful places I have ever visited. Words can not describe how beautiful Sainte-Chapelle is. Every surface is covered in paint (all churches used to be) and the windows! Oh my. I started to cry. It must have been a wonder to those worshiping so long ago. It is not very large, so does not take long to visit, but it made a large impact on us.

Breathtaking . How did I miss this before? So glad I got there this time. The line to get in was short and we were able to spend unlimited time gazing at the exquisite glass stain windows. Wonderful gift store too!
Astonishing . Not a big one but the glasses are astonishing more than lot of them I've seen all over Europe. Worth the entrance fee.

One of the most beautiful series of stained glass you will ever see.. If you haven't been here, take the time to go. It is breathtaking!!! The windows that reach towards the sky lift your spirits. Go on a sunny day to experience the magic of the colors reflecting throughout the Chapelle.
Nice stained glass. This takes about 20 minutes to see at most. 10 euros to get in. Rick Steves gave it 3 stars (his highest) but I wouldn't recommend it unless you have nothing else to do.
Incredible sight. This once-church is an incredible sight, but for 10 Euro I wouldn't go back to it a second time. Be prepared for a 50 step spiral staircase going up to the main area.

Beautiful, especially on a sunny day. -small, beautiful church, the stained glass is pretty amazing with very high ceilings
-not wheel chair accessible
-a bit pricey, but I hear they also offer concerts here, so that might be an activity to look up. It was 10E, whereas Notre Dame and Sacre Coeur were free.
Ms . Family friendly environment. Physical activity. Drink lots water go early. If you been to the other venues same requirement growd control. Remember to wear comfortable shoes and clothing
Must see in Paris!. Beautiful! We had a private tour guide and it was so nice as there is so much beyond just st the beauty.

Vitrage - must see. This is a fantastic little place in the gothic style with astonishing, one of a kind vitrage views on the second floor. It is definitely worth it's 10 euro of admission (as of 2016). It's best to see on a sunny day so the glass catches the light

Breathtaking!. It was our first time to visit this amazing chapel. We had read of its beauty, but we were amazed. Don't miss. We heard that there are concerts there some evenings. I wish we had known sooner,

Different Kind of Church. Many churches in Europe begin to look the same, but this one is different then the rest. The church is not very big but the stained glass is amazing. I can only imagine how pretty it would be when the light hits just the right way.

Don't Miss. If you are going to be on the Ile de la Cite to take in the well-known tourist attraction that is the Notre Dame cathedral, make sure you build in an extra hour and stop by Saint Chapelle! It is only a 6 to 8 minute walk from Notre Dame and it will give you a chance to see the Bible told book by book in beautiful Stainglass windows.

Worth the wait. I did have to line up for quite a while to visit this stunning chapel. When I first entered the building I was a little disappointed. It took me a moment to realise that the real show was up a little winding staircase in the corner of the room. Wow, just wow! So much stained glass in one place!
Breathtaking. When you walk into this place it will take your breath away...do not miss this if you are in Paris. So beautiful.

Beautiful church with lots of stained glass. We bought the musuem pass so went here, we have seen a lot of churches in Europe and they all start to look alike, but this was definitely different. Lots of beautiful stained glass and worth a visit. would go here before going to Notre Dame
Beautiful . Beautiful churck windows. It is a quick tour so can be done near to Notre dam. Museum pass gets you in.
Don't miss it!. In the same area as its more famous cousin Notre Dame. Avoid the lines there and be rewarded with a serene interior and the most beautiful stained glass you can imagine.

Worth a visit but dont take your crash helmet. Too avoid the queues see and buy a joint ticket at the Conciergerie next door (leave your helmet there) - this has a lot more history an is better value for money. St Chapelle is great for photos of the windows if you can get clear shot. Apart from than it was a bit disappointing. Not worth queuing for !

Spectacular. The newly renovated Sainte Chapelle is absolutely beautiful. The renovation is superb. There were large crowds when we visited but it didn't really detract from the wonder of the place. If you can afford it and have the opportunity there are concerts held here and the acoustics would be amazing.
Go on a sunny day. The stained glass windows are beautiful regardless of the weather, however on a sunny day they are breathtaking!

Hear a concert here in the evening. Buy a $25 classical music ticket for an evening concert here. You can sit for an hour and a half, gazing at this beautiful, nearly 1000 year old stained glass, from the comfort of a padded chair, without the crowds.
I was in awe!. The line was a bit long, but totally worth the wait. Beautiful stained glass windows cover the cathedral. Must do it at least once if you are in Paris!

Splendid stained glass. It seems almost pointless to review this building because its stained glass windows are so beautiful. Only Chartres cathedral is comparable. Now that the windows have been restored, this is a must-see destination.
Amazing Windows. Sainte Chapelle is a beautiful church that is worth a visit. The windows and architecture are beautiful.

Go on a sunny day!. The upper chapel is reached by a windy spiral staircase (it did not appear to me to be handicap-accessible). The soaring stained glass windows are remarkable! Many bible stories are illustrated in the colorful glass. Definitely a monument to the money and power of the royalty of the past. There are charts available near entrance that explain the various windows, if you want to do it yourself, and audio tour sets available. Groups were being led by guides as well. It's sort of hidden and adjacent to a courthouse, behind a courtyard. Covered by the ParisPass card for admission. It's also a great place to attend the many evening concert events.

NOT to be missed!. There are no words. You are quite literally surrounded by stained glass. The chapel has the most extensive 13th century stained glass collection of anywhere in the world. Each panel tells a story. If you have the two day pass, you can get in but you do have to wait in line. If you visit La Conciergerie, where they kept Marie Antoinette imprisoned before her beheading which is next door, you can skip the extensive line and enter Saint Chappelle. is an absolute MUST do! For the faithful, this was where the Crown of Thorns was originally housed when brought back to Paris. While they are not there now, knowing that they were there...well...its quite something.
Magnificent building . Found this church by accident, whilst walking from Harry's bar. Amazing building on the inside, well worth a viewing even if you're not religious
Sainte-Chapelle Experience. Sainte Chapelle is worth viewing inside. The stain glass windows are so intricate and numerous that it is beautiful to gaze at when the sunlight streams in.

Stunning!. It can be difficult to find and could have a long line, but it is worth it! Sainte-Chapelle is located within the interior courtyard of the Department of Justice Building. There are free toilets available inside. In order to enter, you must wait in a security line and go through a metal detector. No food or glass containers can be brought in (just like at the airport, things like that are confiscated). Lines can be long, but luckily there was nearly no one in line when we went. The exterior of Sainte-Chapelle is basic and functional. The lower level has great architecture and color. It also has a gift shop area. The top level with wall-to-wall stained glass towering over you from every direction is amazing! We stared in awe for a long time. One of the most beautiful church interiors I have ever seen. "Seen one, seen them all" does not apply to this place. It's a must visit!

Incredible. Lovely gem and very doable. Stain glass windows telling all the stories were fascinating. Seating helped this visiter and enabled me to stay a little longer to marvel at the beautiful windows.

Nothing compares. This is a must see in Paris. It is well worth any wait to get inside. Absolutely breathtaking. New security measures require your bag to be xrayed so be prepared if you carry sensitive film.

Best stained glass in Europe. Small chapel featuring almost wall to wall floor to ceiling stained glass of over a thousand exquisitely detailed and colorful biblical scenes, most from the Old Testament. Use your Museum Pass to get in.
Concert that transported us. Eight voices and four chamber orchestra strings in concert - in this location - simply transcendental. Beyond words how this added to our Paris experience.

A beautiful attraction, well worth a visit and not expensive. . This is a site that was recommended to us by friends. We were very pleased with it. Lots of gorgeous stain glass windows that turn into great pictures. Although you can spend lots of time there, it is also a great place to see if your time is limited.

A special place in Paris. Sainte-Chapelle is gorgeous. The "sign-boards" are a great help in interpreting the windows -- especially if you're not up to snuff on your Old Testament. If you have them don't forget some mini-binoculars - like the ones I left in the apartment.

Stunning setting for beautiful music. In September my husband and I attended a chamber music concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons in Sainte Chapelle. It was a highlight of our 3 weeks in France. First, the stained glass at Sainte Chapelle is the most beautiful I have ever seen! We went to the early evening concert, which I highly recommend, as we experienced seeing the stained glass go from brightly lit to nighttime darkness. The music was beautifully performed and the violin soloist was amazing! Both the church and the music were wonderful on their own, but combined it was very, very special.

See it to believe it. Prettiest and most impressive church windows you'll ever see. Odd setting in the court of a court building (thus tight security), and always a line to get in, but totally worth it!

Breathtaking! A must see!. We took the train to Paris from London so we were only here for the day. A friend said that Sainte-Chapelle was not to be missed and boy was he right. It's gorgeous! Breathtaking! Spiritual! There is an upper and lower chapel so make sure to visit both. I liked how there was an info card you could use during the tour that provided info of each section. Upstairs is where the 15 window-over 1000 stained glass piece depiction of creation up to the passion of the christ is. Awesome!! Highly recommend that you put this on your Paris must-do list!

Truly amazing stained glass windows. How can one describe such amazing stained glass windows, particularly when the sun is shining through them . This chapel is a very special place and not to be missed. If you have difficulty walking the steps are a bit of a challenge also because there are lots of people going up and down but do persevere as it's worth the effort . Lots of information cards in different languages.

A very underestimated place. We called into this church as we had some time to spare. We were shocked at the 10 euro price to enter until we saw the amazing stained glass windows.
This place will blow you away with it"s beauty.
I am so glad we got to see it.
Lovely!. We walked through this lovely church. It is worth a visit, the stained glass and pillars- it was bigger on the inside then we thought from walking around the grounds.

A short visit of 10 minutes. The Chapelle was fine but our tickets also included The Conciergerie , ( around the corner) this is the prison where people were brought during the French Revolution before making their way to the Guillotine, Marie-Antoinette spent 2 months here before her final outcome. If you have an interest in history, this visit will be your cup of tea, a fair amount of information is provided, I would suggest that you brush up on that period prior to your visit, then you will be able to appreciate what's in front of you. We went in for what we thought to be an hour...we spent a lot more

Wow!. If you only have a few days in Paris, make sure this is on your to do list! One of the most beautiful churches I have seen. You could spend all day looking at stained glass windows. If you have a Paris pass (recommended) or a Museum pass, you can skip the line too !!
My favorite chapel in all of Europe!. This chapel is the most gorgeous chapel I've ever seen. Rich colors make you feel like you've stepped inside an illuminated manuscript. Truly magical!
Don't Miss. We're didn't pay for many tours on this trip but someone said we just had to do this...so we did...and I'm glad we did. Absolutely gorgeous.

Stunning Little Chapel. Sainte Chapelle is a hidden treasure in Paris. It is just a few blocks from Notre Dame Cathedral and almost hidden by the Court a House Building that was built around it. Facing the Court House look to the left for the small sign for Sainte Chapelle. Go through the security for the Court a House and find the chapel standing on the inside courtyard. You can buy your tickets at the little ticket office---about 10 euros, I think.The upstairs chapel is stunning. Just stand, or sit, if you are lucky to find a seat, and just gaze up at the beauty! It is gorgeous!!! Make sure to go out to the little balcony, which once connected the chapel to the King's residence, and look back through the door---then enter the chapel through this door---to get the full impact of entering the chapel the way the King did. It is an incredible view!Also, watch the video of the recent restoration / cleaning of the glass panels. It is interesting. A few other interesting facts are 1). The stained-glass panels are all original, 2). The stained-glass panels have been removed only two times---once for the recent restoration and during WWII they were removed, labeled, and moved to a chateau in the south of France and hidden to keep them out of the hands oh Hilter. When the war was over, the panels were returned and placed in their proper places. I applauded the French people for saving such a masterpiece! Well Done!!?

Greatr music, great venue!. WE bought tickets for one of the many concerts offered here. We heard Les Solistes Francais play Pachelbel, Vivaldi and Albinoni. We loved it and bought the CD, recorded in the church. We didn't have time to visit during the day but the stained glass "walls" must be breathtaking on a sunny day.

Highly recommend classical music concerts in the evenings.. We went twice to concerts in this beautiful chapel.One was Vivaldi's four seasons and the second Mozart 's clarinette quintette.We. We're many times in Paris and the first time to these concerts which were of the highest quality.This chapel should also be visited during the daytime to enjoy the magnificent painted windows.

Best stained glass anywhere. This beautiful chapel puts all the others to shame with it's spectacular stained glass. From the inside, you are surrounded by huge vertical spires of stained glass that seem to have very little if any support. The illusion makes you feel almost as if you are in stained glass box. Small but spectacular and well worth the visit even if there is a line!
Stained glass that Inspires!. The stained glass is the star of the show in this church and it does not disappoint. Well worth a visit while in Paris.

Not worth what they extort from you.. Went there today as a friend recommended it, if you are choosing between this and Notradame then give this one a miss, over priced for what you can see, and all over in 15 mins, does have some fancy stained glass windows but honestly just look it up on the net, you can sit and take it in but there are far more places in Paris to do this without being robbed at the ticket box, half the price would have still been a bit much.
Gorgeous inside and out. Amazing stained glass and very ornate. One of the many neat churches that must be seen to believe. A must do.

Unbelievable experience.. Important to go on a sunny day! This is our second experience at the church and each time we were blessed to have a sunny day. The church has been renovated and it is truly beautiful.

Brilliant!. We visited on a cloudy morning around eleven am (there was a line but it moved quickly). Once inside, we made our way upstairs to see ALL that glass! Amazing. There are large, laminated cards (we found a little later in the visit) that explain the windows (the story) in all languages and also how stained glass is made and the story behind the building. The sun came out and we were then able to see the brilliance of the glass. A definite must see when in Paris! Also, nearby is Notre Dame and an alleyway of many cafes, souvenir shops, kiosks for crepes and more goodies!

Quaint Historic Chapel in Paris. Sainte-Chapelle is a block from Notre Dame and a block from the Seine river. Very charming and lovely. The upstairs is filled with stained glass panels. Get the laminated sheet in the corner stand upstairs that explains the stories and depictions in the glass and its done in several languages. Look for the British flag symbol for English. Also do the tour of the former prison next door - fascinating history. And the Justice Dept next door too.
Awesome!. Sainte-Chapelle is beautiful and not to be missed!! Best seen on a sunny day when the stain glass' colors are at their best!
Stunning!. Sainte Chapelle was a pleasant surprise! The stained glass is stunning. Better than Notre Dame in my opinion.
Beautiful place!. This place is amazing. I would recommend including it when visiting paris. Be prepare to pay 10 Euros per person entrance fee.

Worth a visit. Beautiful stain glass windows. It's a little bit tucked away. Very small church in comparison to the most other churches in Paris. We loved this church, the glass windows are just amazing and absolutely breathtaking. So many details and amazing craftsmanship . We went in the afternoon when the sun shined into the windows and highlighted the beautiful colors.Definitely worth a visit!As a special tip; they have sometime classical concerts at night. We went to one and it was a very special experience .

Finally. On 3 previous trips to Paris (many years back) we were never able to get into Sainte-Chapelle. It was worth the wait. We were a bit underwhelmed by the lower chapel, but were knocked out when we went upstairs. The interiors and the stained glass windows took our breath away. 10 Euros each for admission, but well worth it.
Gorgeous!. Do not miss going upstairs to see the stained glass windows. They are magnificent and a do not miss!

hidden gem. on the opposite side of Ile de cite you find this church which has spectacular stained glass windows on 2 levels you go up a narrow spiral stair to see the top church which is fantasic dark royal blue ceiing with gold fleur de lys and stained glass 360 degrees

Stunningly beautiful; come as early as possible.. Now and then you come to places where you gasps from the beauty that you see.The upper part of Saint Chapelle is one of those places on earth. You simply cannot leave Paris without seeing the marvelous stained windows of this chapel. One word of advice; the Chapel is open at 9.30 am. Try to be there before opening time so that the crowd is still manageable in the Chapel. Otherwise it is a bit of 'a nightmare'. People don't tend to be quite when there entering a chapel or a church, especially not the groups.When we visited the Chapel it was allowed to take handbags and small rug sacks.
wow. it was very nice visiting this church, a piece of art and history, we took a lot of photos, assistant audio devices were very helpful.
Better than Notre Dame. If you are looking for history go no further. This place is the missing link in French history. Founded by King (St.) Louis IX it is magnificent and overwhelming
Not to be missed. This place is easy to walk right by. Please seek it out. This place is very impressive and was a highlight of our trip.

Amazing. Simply the best attraction of Paris. If I had just a few hours to spend in Paris this is the place I'd visit. I was breathless. It may take a little time to enter because of check but don't miss this wonder!

A stunning chapel!. Although small, and a little difficult to find, it is well worth the visit. Note that you come in on a small bottom floor and you must go up to an upper level to see the amazing stained glass windows. There are laminated cards in various languages for a self guided tour.
Beautiful. Small but the stained glass is special. Be sure to go on a sunny day so you can enjoy it. It is a special place with much history.

Shocked by the rudeness of staff. So we were excited to isn't this church because of the historical value and obvious beauty in the architecture and all that would remain true I'm sure. However, when we came to visit (well within visiting hours) a group of about 12 of us came through security and started heading to the church and were stopped by a staffer. He asked if we could speak French and when 5 of us said no (i do in fact speak a little), we were immediately and unceremoniously ushered out with no further explanation while the French speakers were taken right in. We had not experienced anything like this anywhere else in France and are still quite shocked about it.

Must see for stained glass. This is a small structure but the stained glass is AMAZING!! Pictures just don't do it justice...We were fortunate to have watched a violin concerto here one evening. If you get a chance to go for a concert, Do!!

Chance of a life time. We read about concerts in Sainte-Chapelle and asked our hotel to arrange tickets for us. IT was an experience we will treasure forever. An hour concert of Vivaldi in the beauty of the chapel-indescribable. Such beauty in the music and the chapel. An experience not to miss if you are in Paris.

Stunning. This church is amazing as you climb up the stairwell to the second floor only to be in awe of the beautiful stain glass windows that surround you. A lot of work went in to uncovering the beauty from the pollution and years of neglect .It is a gem for Paris.

Don't be put off by the lines or the cost. This is one of the best examples of gothic art. The stained glass was an inspiration for other churches in Europe, and it is evident why. It will likely be crowded, so if you are looking for inner harmony, you won't get it here. But the art is wonderful, crowds and all.

An amazing surprise. So glad we went.. In my trip planning, Sainte-Chapelle slipped through the cracks. When my wife brought me over I rolled my eyes thinking it was just another church. It turned out to be the most impressive church we visited, even surpassing the nearby Notre Dame. The first floor was impressive based on the age and learning about the history of the church, but I was not impressed yet. Once we went up stairs the sun hit the stained glass and I was speechless. Incredible! To imagine peopled building something so beautiful and intricate 900+ years ago is astounding.
this is a must in a Paris visit. when you walk up the stairs and see the actual stain glass windows.. your breath evapourates !!!if you have chance to experience concert here don't miss it !!

Beautiful Display of Stained Glass and Gothic Architecture. Do yourself a favor and buy the city pass that gets you into most of the big sites. It will save you time waiting in lines to buy tickets and money as long as you go see quite a few places. Okay, Sainte-Chapelle is the most beautiful display of stained glass I have ever seen. The stained glass artists created a beautiful stained glass story chronologically telling the Bible story. I wish I could have seen the panes up high as well. The architecture is amazing and this was a gem I did not know about until we got there. It's located between the Louvre and Notre Dame so it is right in the midst of the big sites you came in to definitely see and this is a big site as well...its just not very big.
Breathtaking. Go on a sunny day because the light makes this even better. It's incredible and I highly recommend it. So much to see sand absorb. Places inside to sit and enjoy.

Simply the most beautiful church in Paris. My fourth visit to this wonderful church and it never disappoints. My partner had never been before and was enthralled by the exquisite stained glass, the history, architecture and just feeling of a wonderful space. I have been to concerts in the past and the acoustics are superb. I would always visit St Chapelle whenever I am in Paris.

Vivaldi Concert at Sainte Chapelle - FANTASTIC. I saw a 1 hour concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons performed in the Sainte-Chapelle, the Kings former private chapel, and it's was heaven. The walls are all stained glass, a treasure of French Gothic architecture and the music was tremendous. Only 6 musicians, one on a harpsichord and the one on violin was a genius!!~

Stunning first floor wall to wall stained glass windows. This was an unexpected delight. The church on the ground floor is unusual with its decorated columns however the hidden treasure is on the first floor. The stained glass windows are absolutely stunning - much more impressive than Notre Dame.
Stunning . Saint Chapelle is an easily accessible taste of historical & religious glory without too many crowds. Our 4 yo loved it. Stunning.

Most amazing cathedral we saw!. Notre Dame is bigger, but this cathedral will take your breath away in a way that Notre Dame won't. Stunning -- you will never forget it! Easy to get to. In fact, we visited once in the afternoon, and then returned in the evening for a string concert (through Classic Tix -- highly recommend this venue for a concert as well!).

Amazing!. We were in Paris for a couple of days and I looked up "Things to Do" while here. I truly went to this location COMPLETELY because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and it was honestly one of the best visits- the pictures completely represent this breathtaking cathedral. Walking distance to Notre Dame.

Visiting Sainte-Chapelle is my number one priority every time I'm in Paris. Some places are worth a single visit. Some are definitely worth revisiting. Sainte-Chapelle is worth many visits. In marked contrast to many French cathedrals, its interior is bright and incredibly colorful. It is almost like being inside a kaleidoscope! The windows especially, but also the decorative motifs on the walls, are just exquisite. I gladly spent nearly an hour just sitting and scrutinizing in detail the many facts of its windows. They are worth further study using resources on the web. They, and the rest of the chapel, are simply breathtaking. Don't miss it, if you have even the slightest interest in medieval art and architecture. This is a gem.

Breathtaking stained glass. This church contains some of the most beautiful stained glass anywhere in the world. There is a 10 Euro admission fee, but it is worth it to be able to see the windows. Highly recommend. There is a concert series almost every evening.

Sainte-Chapelle. Sainte-Chapelle is a definite must see if you are going to Paris. You got to time it just right to catch the tide coming in and covering the base of Mt. Sainte -Chapelle a fantastic view and experience. The quaint village surrounding the Chapelle has many places to grab something to eat and rest as the climb to the top of the Chapelle consist of many, many steps, but the view is well worth it.

Jaw-dropping stained glass. Sainte-Chapelle is and ornate 13th-century, gothic cathedral on Ile de la Cite, just a few blocks from Notre-Dame Cathedral. Inside lies some of the most beautiful stained glass you'll ever see, it's simply beautiful and worth a short visit.
Simply stunning. No words can do justice to this wonder of architecture and stained glass. It simply is a must-see. Go there!

Most beautiful church in the world. This place is breathtakingly beautiful. I spent the summer studying in Europe and visiting churches/religious areas was among the top of my list as I traveled. I primarily stayed in Paris and visited many in France, but none could compare to the beauty of sainte chapelle. Pictures cannot do this place justice. It literally took my breath away. Highly recommended. If you only get to see the inside of one church in all of Europe, this gem is the way to go. Fantastic. Wow!!!

Glad to visit great old iconic place. A 13th century church, its beautiful upper chapel is formed of intricate stained-glass windows and a richly decorated ceiling. It is a must see attraction. When I visited the place that time very few people were there. peace and silence will take you to different world away from today's crowded world. visited 2 times.
Stunning. If you love the churches, don't miss this one. We were lucky enough to stumble upon a concert there, just before it started, last tickets. I will never, ever forget.
King's chapel. The stained glass is unbelievable, too much to possibly take in in such a short time. Try for mid-day when light is brightest

My Favorite. This is a jewel of a church and unlike any other I have seen. I enjoyed it more than any other church we visited as well The size is manageable. It is located a little bit out of the way and within a group of government buildings but don't let that get in your way.

Magnificent. This place is even lovelier than Notre Dame, and so much quieter too. The Windows here are incredible, as is the paintwork. I loved the Braille signage and the tactile diagrams on the information panels. I also recommend the Vivaldi concert here too. Book tickets as soon as possible as they sell,out fast. I booked on lone in April and am so glad I did.

unique in it's kind and no long waiting lines. I have visited the Sainte Chapelle for the second time now, and it is even more beautiful than the first time. I really like the lower chapel, it is a quiet place and it feels really medieval. The walls are painted with beautifull motives and the stained glass is really unique in it's kind.I think it is the most beautiful place in Paris I have visited and you don't have to stay in line for hours for it.
Really Beautiful Stained Glass. The upstairs stained glass is a beautiful site to behold. The main floor chapel is not too shabby either.

Absolutely Stunning Stained Glass. Such a brilliant display of colored light that fills this chapel. It's small and doesn't take long to see, but is absolutely worth a visit. The initial WOW moment when you first walk up the stairs into the chapel is pretty awesome. Also, as a side note - it could be helpful to bring a pair of binoculars. That may sound a little ridiculous for such a small chapel, but there is SO much detail in the stained glass and much of it is too far up to see well. Or even if you aren't worried about seeing the stained glass in detail, the overall effect is still stunning.
Sainte-Chapelle. This is a beautiful cathedral. Bathrooms were not working at the time of our visit, a definite downfall.

Gorgeous!. The stained glass and high ceilings are amazing! The outside is unassuming since the chapel is tucked away in administrative buildings. Be prepared for going through a metal detector before entering. Take note of the time when visiting. When we were there, we arrived right at the end of their hour lunch. Some people had been waiting for over an hour to enter since it was closed for the lunch hour. I have been to the Vatican, St Pauls, Saint Mark's Basilica, Notre Dame, Duomo and, although its smaller, I feel this is the most beautiful of them all.
Gorgeous Little Chapel!!. Chapel built by Saint Louis IX for the crown of thorns (which are currently house at Notre Dame). Gorgeous stained glass and colorful patterns on walls and ceilings.
Stunning. One of the best places in Paris to see the most beautiful stained glass windows. Hardly any crowds with easy access into this beautiful chapel. One of my favourite places in Paris

Astonishingly beautiful. Very busy but worth putting up with the crowds. The stained glass windows are just breathtakingly beautiful, the overall impression is rich, varied, and predominantly blue. The detail is amazing and interesting but almost impossible to take in, partly because your eye keeps wandering and partly because it would take you hours and hours to look at every one of the thousand plus scenes separately. Grab a seat if you can!
Very beautiful insides. The chapel is not that interesting on the outside, but the insides are worth a visit. The painted windows are soo pretty. And it is free for young people(18-25).

Can't miss the GORGEOUS stained glass!. This beautiful little chapel is full of history, since it was part of one of the original royal residences of Paris. The oldest wall painting in all of Paris is also in this church! And truly, the light shining through the glass is magical. Its incredible what has survived through the ages and is well worth your time to go see it!
Beautiful. This place is so beautiful. Often overlooked, but very nice to see. Sit and enjoy the panels of the Old Testament. Use museum pass to get in quickly.

Beautiful Stained glass. Toured during day. Went to a concert that evening. Wonderful!. Old. Lovely. Historic. One of the best places to visit in Paris. There is a wooden painting in the lower Chapel, up front and to the left-hand side, that is supposedly the oldest painting in Paris. At least that is what I overheard a tour guide tell his group. Take lots of photographs and notice the details.

Beautiful!. A small chapel with huge stained glass! This is the loveliest example of stained glass that I saw on my visit to Paris. We attended an evening concert here that was the highlight of my trip.

Stunning chapel - a must go and see. Beautiful small chapel, with amazing stained glass windows. Wonderful and a must see. Go early in the day as queues are longer later on. Note students (with proof) can get in free.
What an impressive place!. We saw this on a cloudy day, and inspite of that thw stain glass windows were still quite amazing. A must see to believe!
Beautiful - A must see. This Church is impressive. 15 panels of stained glass all telling a story. Easy to get to and worth a visit.

A piece of history. This Chapelle is in the castle where the king and queen were held before being beheaded. It is one of the most ornate and beautiful Chapelle I have ever seen. I felt very peaceful here, and it made me think of them on their last day and hope that they were able to find peace here too.

Excellent, must see in Paris.. It is always amazing. It doesn't matter if at morning or during sunset. Most probably at morning you can get even better photos with phone camera, because white balance is not destroyed by light from windows.
Highly recommended - queues are not so long, but it is always better to buy ticket online.
Magnificent. One of the most magnificent displays of stained glass in the world. Do not miss this. Lines are sometimes long since it is relatively small but we'll worth the wait.

Concert in Saint chapelle. Wow, what treat - we chose tickets to a Les Rouger Francois string quartet to view the magnificent chapel. To listen to such talented musicians, under the guide of Paul Rouger, in such a unique place is a special memory. The acoustics were perfect.

Amazing. As far as stained glass goes I feel this is in my top 5 of cathedrals I have seen. It's not a very big church which can be good if you have people that can't walk to far. There is one flight of stairs to reach the main floor.
Glad we visited. I think it was 10 euros per person which was expensive but we felt it was a good contribution to this beautiful chapel. The second floor is very impressive and well preserved.

I LOVE STAINED GLASS!. Words and pictures will not replace what it's like to experience walking into this amazing church. Awe inspiring. Holy crap inspiring. You won't regret going to see this place as it truly is an unforgettable and astounding experience.

Worth a Visit To Behold the Stained Glass Windows. This is a Paris attraction that I believe is often overlooked. Take the time to visit this facility just for the stained glass windows. You won't be sorry. Located across the river from Notre Dame Cathedral. Easy to get to via subway since the Metro exit is across the street from the entrance. The Metro subway is safe and easy to use and costs only 1.60 euro for a one way ticket that includes transfers.

Breathtaking. The ground floor is ok. looks like a church with a gift shop so wandered around thinking hmmm. climbed the spiral stair case which opened up into the most awesome spectacle i have ever seen. The pictures don't do it justice. Floor to ceiling stained glass windows.
Overwhelming. I was overwhelmed by the beauty of the stained glasses inside this church. I was lost for words while stood in the middle of the church!

Jaw dropping interiors. It's one thing to see them in pictures and another to see them in person. This is one of the places in Paris that truly made me speechless. The interiors of the place was so magnificent to look at.

Beautiful Jewel of a Chapel. The stained glass here is stunning. Make sure you go upstairs to see the incredible floor to ceiling panels. Choose a sunny day if possible. This place is more stunning than Notre Dame!
A must see, to believe. Hard to explain.....As you stand in the middle of stained glass windows, hundreds of feet high, each panel different shapes. A story told on each panel.

amazing lead light windows- go on a sunny day if you can. The lead light windows are breathtaking. This church is located near Notre Dame so you can easily do both at the same time. The queue outside looked quite long, but then I realised that the entrance is shared between the Chapel and another attraction (i think it was the Palace of Justice - maybe) The chapel queue is to the right when facing the building (not to the left which was the other one where lots of people were standing) Once i figured this out, I walked straight in and to the chapel entrance , bought a ticket there (about a five minute wait) and then in I went. The downstairs section is interesting but if you find the spiral staircases at the back and head up to the chapel's second floor - wow!! The 360 degrees of leadlight windows depicting various bible scenes is truly amazing. If you can, make sure its a sunny day as this accentuates the effect of the windows. It is one of those breathtaking moments where you see something unlike you have ever seen before. This is one of those slightly less obvious touristy things that Paris has to offer that are truly worth it. Check out the description of how the windows wee made and also how they were restored. Very interesting.

Unique and overwhelming. This is a must see in Paris. It is one church on top of another. The bottom one is ancient and reflects much of the past history of Paris. The top one has perhaps the best stained glass windows in the world.

It's all about the stained glass. If you are doing the old Paris walk, this is certainly one of the best stops. With your Paris Museum Pass in hand, check out this church and its most amazing stained glass windows. The church itself was gutted of anything of value during the revolution, but the wonderful building itself with the windows remain.

A Stained Glass Wonder. Sainte-Chapelle was our second choice the day we visited as Notre Dame lineups were too long. I am thankful we made this choice. From the moment one enters, it presents one with a reverence and an appreciation of the entire Biblical story told in stained glass. I can hardly imagine the work that goes into keeping each section of glass cleaned and dirt-free. The tiles on the ancient floor are incredible considering they are hundreds of years old. Be sure to visit the chapel up a long and winding narrow stairway to view the spectacular depiction of the Bible told in frames of beautiful coloured glass. This is a must see if you are in Paris.
not do be missed. Somehow we missed Sainte-Chapelle on our previous 2 visits.Pitty..The place is absolutely gorgeous on the sunny day when raysare blasting thru the stained glass.

Amazing place. Wow! This place is amazing, so beautiful. The design is stunning and it is a magical place. Worth the 10 euros and I think a must see in Paris. Less known than lets say the eiffeltower, but just as unique and simply stunning to see
beautiful. Be sure and take a tour where you get all the good info. Lots of stained glass. Very old church that at one time housed the crown of thorns which is now in Notre Dame.

Best part of Paris. I loved this place, it was so small and tucked out of the way that hardly anyone was there when we visited. Granted the entry cost of 10€ per person is a little steep but I would say well worth it. Initially I was disappointed as you enter a long "cave" like room which is beautifully painted and very peaceful but not 10€. Then we went upstairs, it took our breath away. There are no words to describe the beauty of this place and it is worth a visit. My partner and I are in no way religious but it was lovely to sit out on the balcony and look into a room filled with brilliant, colourful light. It was calming and inspiring and a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of Paris (although it is close to the Lourve and a stones throw from Notre Dame). Downside: It is not wheelchair or pram friendly and there are no facilities. I am sure you would be able to leave your pram with security and the steps aren't too difficult to negotiate (I have a dodgy hip and I managed them). Top tip: go on a sunny day to get the full effect of the windows!
Stunning. Was surprised once we walked upstairs and saw all of the stained glass stories. Truly not to be ,missed when visiting Paris. No line and we were not charge ( not sure if they do charge)

Stunning!. We went and toured this beautiful church using our 4 day museum pass, and it was simply stunning. While there we noticed the posters for the concerts held there in the evenings and returned a second time for one of those, and it was simply amazing....I will never forget that night.
Break-taking Stained Glass. Pay the money and go see this, it is stunning!! Better yet, buy the Paris Museum Pass and it's one of the stops included.
Probably my favourite visit in Paris.. Glorious windows, try to visit on a sunny day. Stunning. If you can attend a concert in the evening don't miss it. Wonderful.Free with Museum Pass.
Another church. Not my favorite by far but okay if you like this sort of thing. Check out Genevieve for a truly beautfiul church
Across Notre Dame. Ste-Chapelle is across Notre Dame, it's good to stop, if you like to visit church you will enjoy your visit.
Stunning.. Small, but worth a visit. Stunning windows, Interesting history with easy to follow information provided. Lines can be long, but seem to move fairly quickly.

Got stained glass?. After revisiting Notre Dame, we walked over to Sainte-Chapelle. There is a 10 Euro admission, I guess that was my only surprise, but the stained glass in this cathedral is incredible. The visit is pretty quick, which works for me.
The glass has been cleaned. Sainte-Chapelle is filled with color. The glass has recently been cleaned and the colors are vibrant. The line was short and the stay long.

One of my favorites. Was there 39 years ago and recall going higher up to see the stained glass. They have finished cleaning the glass and it is beautiful. The "altar" area seems to be undergoing some renovation as it looks different from my previous photos. There are two adjacent lines to enter the complex. one for the courts and one for Sainte-Chappelle. Ask the guard before you get in line.
Speechless. This place is worth a visit. With wall to wall stain glass it is just gorgeous. I would go early so you can enjoy it and go on a sunny day!
Wonderful. A stunning church with amazing windows. Stand at the top of the stairs and watch people coming up. You'll see their jaws drop as they enter!

Stunning Stained Glass!. After attending mass at Notre Dame Cathedral on a beautiful, sunny Sunday morning we walked the short distance to Sainte-Chapelle. It is a impressive Gothic 13th century Roman Catholic Chapel. The most famous features of the chapel are the stunning stained glass windows that depict both Old and New Testament history. We could have sat for hours enjoying the sun streaming through the stained glass windows. Sainte-Chapelle is definitely worth a visit and is also included in the Paris Museum Pass!

Magnificent stained glass windows. Only discovered this church through Trip Advisor but so glad we did. Great history but the 360 degree stained glass windows in the second level are just magnificent. One of the most spectacular churches we've seen.

A beautiful gem. I highly recommend visiting Sainte-Chapelle. It is a beautiful gem and a hallmark of stained glass artistry. From the entry with its blue and gold domed ceilings to the stained glass paneling which is truly magical. I would go for this over Notre Dame. It's more intimate and a lot quieter!

Spectacular Stained Glass. We went to Sainte- Chapelle on two occasions, during the day and for a concert at night. The acoustics were wonderful, quite intimate and peaceful, The stained glass goes floor to ceiling with intricate stories, with the wait in line for sure
What a Place!. We visited this place along with Notre Dame since they are close. The museum pass will help skip the long lines. Wonderful stained glass windows and its steeped in history.

The most beautiful place on earth. When entering the first floor, although interesting, it isn't memorable. But climbing those stairs! You enter into a fantastical stained glass heaven. If the sun is shining thru the windows, it's that much more magical.
Always visit. We went on a cloudy day and stain glass was not "popping" as on brighter day. still very special. Some Sundays entry is free.
Incredible!!. Wow! If you can only visit one church, this should be it!!! Incredible stained glass! This church is so beautiful!

Must See. Sainte Chapelle is a hidden treasure, it has only recently been reopened to the public after extensive renovations. It was used as a grain store for many years and therefore not open to the public so much of the interior is original as opposed to Notre Dame. Entry is 10 Euro but totally worth it. It was a real surprise for me as I was told to go there but not told why. The ground floor is impressive but the second floor is breathtaking. Try and go on a sunny day when the stained glass windows really shine. There are detailed information boards that tell you about each window and are worth reading.
Concerts. if possible attend an evening concert in this magical setting - I was lucky enough to get a last minute ticket to a performance of Vivaldi's four seasons

Impactful visit to a breathtaking Chapel.. Visited here one evening and got the opportunity to hear a classical string concert. Easily one the the most memorable moments on my two week vacation in France. See this place if you get the chance.
Beautiful. It happened to be free on the weekend we were here but on the paris museum pass. Beautiful stained glass and great history to absorb. Take the time to visit.

Beautiful Stained Windows. If you love architecture, stain glassed windows and history in general then this a must visit. There are audio sets and information inside to assist with the history/story of the church

Medieval Stained Glass . I try to visit Sainte - Chapel whenever I'm in Paris. The stained glass is awe inspiring. It is hard to imagine that this church was built so long ago, yet the glass is still so bright and beautiful. This is a fairly touristy site, but we'll worth it the visit.

Gorgeous stained glass. Wow. Absolutely adored this small chapel. We arrived on a Friday morning & immediately entered without any wait. The entrance fee was 10 euro a person. The chapel took seven years to construct to house relics of Christ's Crucifixion. Circa 1248 Gothic architecture. The stained glass is the star here. The oldest stained glass windows in Paris. Enter the narrow staircase to the upper chapel to view the walls of stained glass. Each one depicts a different story of the old & new testaments.There are large descriptor tablets next to the stairs which explains each panel in detail in multiple languages, The large rose window above the doors is absolutely breathtaking. Certain evenings concerts are held in the chapel.
The most beautiful church in Paris. Beautiful gothic churce in the centre of the city, close to Notre-Dame. On of the "must see" and really worth the wait.

Difficult to find, but visit while close to Notre Dame. A bit confusing to enter, but it is worth stopping by this church for a few minutes. Be sure to go to both levels of the church. This place is in ill repair, but what is standing is worth a few minutes of your time. I would not make a special trip for this sight though.
Exquisite stained glass. Early arrival is best and take time to sit and contemplate how the windows were designed and executed. The glass is simply without equal.
Simple church. The church was beautiful but very simple and small compared to other churches hence I recommend visiting if prioritity is a necessity.
Quite beautiful. The pictures will not do this church justice. The remarkable detail must be seen in person to be believed.
Beautiful sight -- must see!. If you like beautiful buildings, Sainte-Chapelle's preserved glass windows are very beautiful. The busy world seems to disappear within these coloured walls.

Arrive early!!!. I arrived at 9:15am just before the tour buses came, I did not have a ticket or museum pass as I stood in the line on a Wednesday morning. €10 for both Sainte-Chapelle and the Conciergerie next door. The best €10 I have spent in a while. Very few people were there, and the sunshine coming through the colored stained glass windows on the upper level were beautiful. My advice, go early if you want to see it before the crowds. While I was there, only about 10 people were inside.

Small but stunning. beautiful church, as churches go, only small, but the floor to ceiling windows are truly breathtaking. Apart from the Segrada Familia in Barcelona, this is the most stunning church that ive visited.

Really 10 euros?. I realize that it was built in the middle of the Royal Palace by Louis the 13th and has beautiful stained glass but really 10 euros for a short visit? Too much for me. The goths love it though!

The most beautiful place in the world.... La Sainte-Chapelle is amazing. Downstairs is lovely. Gothic architecture, deep blue ceiling with gold stars. THEN you go up the stairs. How there can be that much gorgeous stained glass held up by that little stone (and standing there for about 600 years) is unbelievable. It is just amazingly beautiful. DO NOT MISS IT. And also not a bad place to go to a concert, which I did for the first time this year.
Took My Breath Away. A must see while Paris. Magical, spiritual and reminded me how small I am! Do not rush through, read the well explained signage about the history. Nice gift shop too.
Stunningly beautiful. Another must see on the Isle de la Citi. Beautiful architecture and don't miss the 2nd floor where the stained glass windows will mesmerize you. Truly special and a must see.

A must for stained glass lovers. This church was built to house and showcase the stained glass. The walls are extremely thin stone columns, just enough to house walls of stained glass. To say it is awe inspiring to stand in the church and look around would be a great understatement. This church is covered by the Paris Museum Pass. It is located in the Department of Justice buildings, about 2 blocks from Notre Dame Cathedral.

Worth the trip. When you first walk in you are not sure why you paid ten dollars to get in but once you climb the stairs to the chapel you know why...truely a beautiful chapel! The stained glass is amazing!

Why had I never heard of this before ?. We found this exquisite jewel of a building by accident after having spent a day in the area of Notre Dame.By luck only we didn't go in until around 5.30pm. How fortuitous ... just as the West windows began to take advantage of the lowing sun. Don't think that an early start would give you the dawn light on the East windows ... buildings would obscure it.I feel fortunate to have experienced this building before I had seen the photographs.Built to house the Crown of Thorns this is one of the little gems of architecture which lifts the spirit as a monument to the artisans who executed the inspired design

Sunday. Most museums in Paris were free today, and we had to go back to this jewel. So stunning, especially the stained glass panels up the spiral staircase. We came back hours later and the line was very long. So glad we went fairly early.

Gorgeous . When I saw pictures of the stained glass windows of this church online, I knew I had to go see it. 600 meters from Notre Dame, one can make a day out of it and see Saint Chapelle, Concierge, Palaic De Justice, Notre Dame and the Two Towers and the Notre Dame Crypt all together. The Chapelle remains closed from 1-2:30 pm, so you can drop by here after lunch. The entry for Saint Chapelle and Concierge together is 15€. The Chapelle is drop dead gorgeous. The stained glass windows are mesmerising. Walk around the church or sit just outside with the view of the entire church. I wonder how it would be to visit early in the morning when the Rays of sun hit through all the windows.!

Absolutely stunning. My 3rd visit as I love it. I suggest you visit st chapelle by booking an evening concert there.You get to sit for an hour watching the stained glass glow with the setting sun while listening to some heavenly music.I have heard 4 seasons played there twice now (5 years apart) and both have been excellent performances.The glass in st chapelle always amazes me. Only in modern times have we started to engineer buildings to have the amount of glass st chapelle has. So really it was 700 years ahead of its time.
Must see, only takes a few minutes. The windows are really gorgeous and the painting on the walls. Very small, but beautiful. 30 minutes tops when you are near Notre Dame. Very worth it.
Beautiful Stained Glass. This little gem is a great place to see when in Paris if you love stained glass and quaint small churches.

Sneaky Surprise . Tucked away next to another building but close to our accommodation in Saint Germain, this somewhat derelict cathedral has an amazing amount of stained glass that has recently been restored. The inside is remarkably ornate & even on a dull day was worth seeing.

take the guided tour (esp if you speak French). Stunning, stunning piece of art and architecture. The guide was a mine of information about the history of the building - from its conception to the revolution and WWII.

Small Gothic chapel. Smaller chapel but worth the visit. Lots of relics and imposing
stained glass. Narrow circular steps take you to the top to see the
former royal chapel. Its inside the gates of the Palais de Justice which are a site to see. Gold and very ornate.

Very special and very intimate feel!. A short walk away from the huge Notre Dame Cathedral, much smaller and somewhat hidden away, but certainly not less impressive. It's a gem in the middle of Paris, with a very intimate feel and steeped in history. Definitely worth a visit!

Building is amazing- consider going to a concert as well!. The building by day is great. They have some graphics about how stain glass is made and looking at the glass is really cool. It is very impressive. Consider doing a concert as well. There was an instrumental quartet doing a show a couple nights while we were there. The performance was about 1.5 hours and we bought tickets online. You can just show them on your phone when you get there. Arrive a little bit early. There were only about 40 people and we had a front row seat and listening to the music as the sun sets over the glass was VERY cool! Highly recommend. The tickets were about $30 each, but I think if you wait and buy them the night of, in person, they go on sale.

Gorgeous Gothic Chapel. I would recommend to anyone wanting to visit Sainte-Chapelle to book a classical music concert which takes place inside of the chapel after working hours. We listened to string quartet which played Beethoven and Vivaldi! It was a magical experience
Beautiful and acoustically alive. We heard a concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons in this chapel. A gorgeous work of art by itself, its acoustics make it a wonderful venue for a concert.

Breathtaking, beautiful and unique church. This was one of my favorite highlights while in Paris. We came on a Sunday in the late afternoon. There was a bit of a queue for tickets, but we bought tickets online in advance, so we skipped the line. There's two levels to the church. The upper level is where you see the tall, beautiful stained glass windows. It was one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen. I heard that the church is the most beautiful on a sunny day when light comes through the stained glass windows, but we came on a cloudy day unfortunately, so definitely something to keep in mind!
MY FAVOURITE. This place is my absolute favourite in Paris. I didn't want to leave and the gift shop is also very unique to it too. Prepare to be hushed a lot by the security.

Evening Visit paid off. On the Wednesday that we targeted visiting Sainte Chapelle, they closed for a few hours in the afternoon, but offered a 6 PM to 9 PM visitation. We arrived back around 7 PM and had an awesome visit. There was no wait at security or in the Chapel. I would guess there were less than 50 people in the upper chapel, which allowed for a stress free visit.
Impressive. You walk up the stairs to the second floor and the stain glass windows are impressive. Its best to go on sunny day.

Breathtaking. From outside it seems a small chapel. Inside you are surrounded by walls of colorful light. It is mind- boggling how much work,skills and imagination were put to create the first palace. And it was happening in the 13th century. There are signs of tear and wear, but what would you expect from such an old place?

Wonderful concert!. What a fabulous place to watch ensemble play Vivaldi Four Seasons!! Don't miss this place! Great eating place across street and appreciated the additional security- so arrive early.

Stunning end to our trip!. We were lucky enough to attend a concert of beautiful music at Sainte Chapelle on our last night in Paris. The security to get in is tight so come early and bring only what you need. It is within a working government complex and they are serious about security. The gates outside the church are marvelous for a great pic. We saw many beautiful churches on our three weeks in France but I must say that this one is second to none. If you can schedule the concert and dinner do so. If you can only see the church then do that. It is worth your time and effort to see this stunning place. It's among my favorite memories of a great trip to Paris.

Vivaldi Concert at La Sainte Chapelle . We have just attended a beautiful presentation of Vivaldi's Les Quatre Saisons and Pachelbel's Canon in the magnificent La Sainte Chapelle. What an evocative experience! This is a series of 7pm concerts held in this fully stained glass chapel which was built for the exclusive use of royalty. It is very reasonably priced at €30. There are cheaper seats at €16-€25 and in such a (relatively) small chapel where you are surrounded by such beauty wherever you sit, any priced seat would give a similar experience. If you want to see the stunning La Sainte Chapelle with its intricate stained glasses do consider seeing it during one of these concerts for not much more than the entry price during the day. The added benefit is the effect of the setting sun reflecting through the windows. Awe inspiring!

Came around the corner and ... .. was absolutely astounded by the stained glass vision before my eyes. I wasn't sure what to expect (and was a bit thrown off by the ticket purchase we had to make to get in), but it was worth every penny. Gorgeous. Sit down and just soak it all in.

Must see !. The oldest of all the churches we have seen and although it is going through some constant repair it has the most beautiful stained glass you will ever see. Loved this chapel - it's my favourite of all I've seen.

Incredible. This is spectacular. The many thousands (or millions) of pieces of glass were removed and cleaned several years ago, so it is truly beautiful. There are two levels, which is more interesting.

Ok but too expensive. When we arrived and paid our money we tought it was ok but nothing more,Was nice to see the stained glass windows but...Looking back the cost to come in here is far to high,Compared to most attractions this is expensive and way down the list of best things to do,I would say leave this to last,If you get time then go but dont rush here.

Don't miss it.. Even if you are in Paris for just a few days, you have to visit the Sainte Chapelle. Not only for the stunning glass work or the architectural wonder, but to understand the intertwined religious and intellectual roots of France. A miracle of strength and poetry. Very inspiring.

Unexpected surprise. Absolutely lovely. I popped round to Saint Chapelle on my way to Notre Dame and was completely blown away. Small but perfectly formed. No matter how short your stay in Paris, make time for this!

A must-see for Paris visitors. When one is visiting Paris, it would be a pity to miss Saint Chapelle. Located on Ile de la Cite, a scant few steps from the Notre Dame cathedral, it's really accessible. There are no religious services performed in Sainte Chapelle, but one can still appreciate the splendour of the Lower and Upper Chapel. The Upper one is particularly famous for its stained glass windows, which are a wonder of both art and architecture. It's a singular experience, especially on a sunny day, so I would warmly recommend anyone to make time for this place.
Beautiful. . Beautiful interior, in my opinion although different but I would prefer this over cathedral of notre dame. Quite small though.

AMAZING.. I cannot recommend this place more, just read the other reviews and be sure it's even more marvelous once you see it there. My tip is: have a sit and spend some time enjoying the reaction of the people arriving at the second floor... it's so addicting! ;)

Excellence and Vivaldi. I have visited Sainte-Chapelle every year for the last five years. I would not visit Paris without including a concert in the chapel. I was there again recently in the last week of August and the concert I attended was the music of Vivaldi. To listen to beautifully played music with violins being the dominant instrument in such a spectacular venue is one of the highlights of my visit to Paris each year.

beautiful place for a classical concert. we want there for a Vivaldi concert. The place is absolutely fabulous, unique in paris, not so big but an exceptional deco. You don't need to take a jersey, the temperature is really good compared to other churches. My advice for a concert : the sooner you arrive the bettwr you will see.
Glorious stained glass. The windows are absolutely marvelous in their details and their colors, Be sure to get a brochure which will help in deciphering what each set of windows depicts.

Stunning. 15 Stunning Windows each 15 metres high, the stained glass panes depict 1,113 scenes from the Old and New Testaments recounting the history of the world until the arrival of the relics in Paris.almost unbelievable to think that was built in only 7 years... Amazing Gothic Style .. never saw something more perfect and beautiful than that..

Amazing Stain glass windows. Went here because it said a very nice place to visit with amazing glass stain Windows and yes they were lovely but that was all,only spent about 20 minutes here then left just looking around but my 16 year old thought it boring so we left,not a place to take children.Anyone under the age of 21 in the EU it's free to get in and not in the EU anyone under the age of 18 is free.
Magnificent windows. We have been going to visit for ages but on this trip had the opportunity. Well worth the 10 euros for a ten minute visit, just magnificent. Try to go on a sunny day.
Church. Wandered around and looked at the impressive stain glass windows and mosaic floor. well worth a visit.

The Place To Be. Absolutely necessary to visit it. The history it’s here, The glorious past come back like in the dream. It’ s necessary book before and organise but you can’t never miss the visit.
Enjoy
il ne faut pas rater une visite ici, l’histoire est au rendez vous . Organise bien avant ta visite , c’est magique

Near Notre Dame. We stood in line for awhile to get into this. It is very small and you go upstairs to see the church interior. Many of the old colors were still there. There was damage to the windows during the war but most was preserved. We didn't hear music here. Very quaint!
Amazing Stained Glass!. So glad I visited Sainte-Chapelle on this visit. The stained glass windows are not to be missed, and a lovely gift shop.

Absolutely Stunning...A Paris Gem. I live in Paris and simply cannot get enough of Sainte-Chapelle. This often missed structure is definitely not to be missed if you are Paris on a sunny day. If you can go on a sunny day, re-arrange your schedule as many of the other "must see" things on your list will delight rain or shine...but the glass here in the sun is magnificent..especially coupled with the facts of it's completion. Many visitors visit Notre Dame and don't have the chance or time for Sainte Chapelle...it's right around the corner so make the time (again, especially if it's sunny).

I love only a half mile from the Sainte Chapelle and often take foreign (and French!) visitors there.. Of course, the very tall stained glass windows are breath taking for their sheer beauty, but also for the image and vision of the Middle Ages which they convey. This jewel of a building is the living Middle Ages among us. Do not miss a concert in the building. The acoustics are also remarkable.

Small but mighty. What a small church with a huge history and the most incredible stained glass windows! It actually took my breath away when we entered. It was fairly crowded and we had to wait in line for entry but it was so worth it! Pictures don't do it justice. Even our little kids appreciated it and loved to learn about the scenes in the windows.

Suprize for us. This was our 5th trip to Paris and we had never visited this site before. It is a hidden gem, as we thoroughly enjoyed the stained glass windows and walking through the bible presented on the stained glass
Tour of Sainte Chapelle. This is a must see sight in Paris. The stained glass is the most amazing I have ever seen. There are stairs to the main chapel.

Sublime. I have been to Paris three times, and this by far my favourite place. The entrance is to the lower chapel, which as I recall was for the servants. It is a lovely old painted medieval chapel. The visitor then walks up a small winding staircase to the upper chapel, and the first time (nearly 30 years ago) I saw the upper chapel, my breath was taken away. The upper chapel is more 'glass than wall'. Blue stained glass windows soar to the ceiling. It is relatively small space, and it is a place to simply sit and absorb its beauty. The only problem is, despite signs asking for quiet, many visitors cannot refrain from loud chatter. Despite this it is a beautiful experience. The second time I was in Paris, my husband and I were also able to attend a concert of baroque music in the chapel. Unlike the day visits we entered the chapel through its large doors from the Palais De Justice. It has been a long time since I visited Paris (well before October 2015 - I had to pick a date), but the Sainte Chappelle is somewhere I would recommend to anyone.

Mesmerizing. It's impossible to adequately describe Sainte-Chappelle; must be experienced. We spent almost an hour here, just sitting and marveling at the craftsmanship, and the history. I found more peace here than at Notre Dame.
Vivaldi and the Four Seasons . This church is just stunning. Listening to great classical music while enjoying the sunset through the stained glass was priceless. A must do while in Paris.

A Jewell. The last time I visited Sainte-Chapelle in 2006, I attended a string concert featuring musicians from The Opera House. They were performing Vivaldi's Four Seasons. At a stirring moment, a shaft of evening lights came through one of the stained glass windows like a spot light on the lead violinist standing at the alter and te colours danced on the floor. What a magical moment in a space that someone called a petit jewell box. This picture does not do the colours justice.The drop down box for dates did not allow me to choose the correct one so I indicated it in my review.

Magnificent Gothic Artichecture and Stained Glass!!!!. Sainte-Chapelle is one of the most beautiful Chapels I have ever visited. The interior of the space is essentially all stained glass and gothic arches. Located on Île de la Cité in the heart of Paris it should not be missed. I attended a concert of string players performing a concert of favorite classics which was amazing and the acoustics were wonderful. Attending a concert is a great way to spend an evening and while being immersed in the beauty of the space.

Stunning. I lined up for 40 minutes to get into Saint-Chapelle. It was worth it! Though if you have the Museum Pass, you still have to line up for security but once through that you can 'skip the line' and head straight in. This is a beautiful place indeed and should be on everyone's list of must-sees in Paris. There's even a few benches around so you can enjoy it while resting your feet. Excellent in every way.

Stained Glass Windows are Remarkable. I honestly don't know if I'd have paid full price to get in. The stained glass was stunning but I don't know if it would have been worth 12 Euros to get into. For amazing photos definitely visit, we didn't spend long here but half hour of photo taking was long enough for us.

Hard to find gem. A visit Sainte-Chapelle is well worth the difficulty (at least for us) of actually locating its entrance). Spectacular, in fact. Such beauty and craftsmanship in such a small space. Soaring stained glass windows as beautiful as any to be seen anywhere.

Most beautiful Stained Glass in Paris. If you love stained glass this is a must visit for you. Visited on a partly cloudy day, but was not disappointed at all. Watch the video on the cleaning of the stained glass it is very interesting. Not as easy an one would think. Make sure you go up to the top.

Gorgeous Chapel!. Sainte-Chapelle is a must see when you are in Paris. Like Notre Dame, it is on the Île de la Cité, but Sainte-Chapelle was much easier for us to get into. And it is totally worth going in because the stained glass windows are remarkable.

A beautiful place at the heart of Paris. Located at the Ile de la Cite and very close to Notre Dame and the Louvre, this relatively small chapel keeps a hidden treasure...The quality, design and motif of their stained glasses, covering all surfaces in the upper part of the chapel is incredible rich, plenty of symbolism and telling stories since hundred years.I strongly recommend a visit to this gem while in Paris

One does gasp when walking in. After a few mishaps with opening times - it closes for various reasons and isn't posted, it was worth is. Pictures can't capture the grandeur of the space and amazing window. A must see.

stained glass and the some. We looked to add something to our 4 day museum pass and saw this one the pass, never having gone before. Very glad we did. The first floor of the chapel is a great example of the picturesque setting of the early middle ages with decorations, coloring, and some examples of heraldry with the columns and arches to amaze. The second floor, going up a narrow winding stairway in the front opened into a room with the most amazing stained glass. Most definitely worth the visit. Good thing a brought along a (very) wide angle lens, captured quite a bit, but still not enough to get more than a couple of panels. Its a quick visit in the chapel adjacent to the palace of justice, and walking up to it saw the advocates in black garb and white bibs on the stairway talking the air (to some mostly). The entire experience was just great and a great adjunct to a visit of the Notre Dame Cathedral. Best on a sunny day to get the best effect of the stained glass.

At the end of the list. Expensive, long wait and practically.... Nothing fascinating. Excellent location, next to Notre Dame but I really do not think that it is worthy to spend time to this one, especially if you have to visit other sites..

Gorgeously over the top. Do take a double ticket and visit the Concierge Prison as well - Too many visitors spoilt the ambience of this chapel at ground level a bit but do climb the stairs and go to the chapel on the second floor - gorgeously gold and where relics of Christ's passion were stored. Bloodthirsty revolutionary history in the Conciergie
Stunning. Beautiful place to reflect on all your blessings in this life. I recommend to stop and take a moment here for yourself.
The windows are worth the admission. Very difficult steps to see the church. The church is close to Notre Dame. We chose to tour this one instead. The Windows tell the stories of the Bible.
A beautiful structure with amazing stained glass. As you enter the church you are in awe but wait until you go up the stairs to the second level and you will really be amazed.

Wow. We waited an hour to get in, but it did not disappoint. Every inch of this place is decorated beautifully. It is ancient, cared for, and ornate. The stained glass is spectacular, and the accompanying signAge and handouts in many languages interpret it nicely.

Speechless! . Three of us visited and we were blown away. Our first visit, we were taken back by the grandeur and volumes, the stained glass, the whole atmosphere. Would recommend to visitors in Paris. We got a combined ticket for the Conciergerie too, also worth a visit and just next door.

One of humanity's greatest creations. If you can possibly find yourself here without crowds, this is one of the most beautiful and spiritual places humanity has ever built. Try to get there when sun is bright and halfway up, around 10 or 11 AM or 2 to 3 PM. Not when sun directly overhead. Light through windows is magical. Evening classical concerts wonderful as well.

Sainte-Chapelle - amazing after 7 year renovation. No line. 10euro per adult. Kids free. short security check. I don't know why more people don't stop by while visiting Notre Dame. It was a major undertaking - to say the least - and the results are magnificent. Floor to ceiling stained glass church - it is where stained glass was invented. On the left side is a small tv with a short video that shows the work and how the project was accomplished.

Too beautiful to visit only once. Sainte-Chapelle is a place I visit every time I am in Paris. If you last visited 10, or even 5 years ago, before the 40-year restoration of the stained glass was completed, it's time to go again

WOW my wife's fav place in Paris. Absolutely beautiful Chapelle...Stained glass abounds and the story of the Redemption fo mankind is detailed in stained glass all the way around the building. A must see.
Come and admire. The little known and not so crowded attraction is satisfying with it's beautiful stained glass windows. Lots of history and definitely not overwhelming
