Have to see it to believe it!. When we first entered we thought it was pretty, but were pretty disappointed - UNTIL we realized that there were stairs to the actual cathedral. UNBELIEVABLE! No pictures could fully portray how BEAUTIFUL this church is. This is a MUST see.
not as good as advertised. smaller church than expected. while the glass is excellent, it was difficult to find and not worth the price of admission.
Stunning!. The stained glass is breathtaking! Definitely worth a visit. On a bonus, once you're in you can also do some (free) exploring in the judicial building near the exit gate!
Simply Stunning. Overlooked and overshadowed by its big neighbour Notre Dame, this is more colourful, and much brighter. Hidden away almost it is definitely worth a visit.

We Nearly Skipped it--So glad we didn't. Of course, beauty surrounds you at Sainte-Chapelle, and peace. Wonderful to understand better the efforts that have gone into protecting and restoring this astonishing chapel.
The most beautiful church. We walked into the basement of the church which looked like many others. Little did we know what awaited us at the top of the spiral staircase. Absolute Beauty!!
Breathtaking!. Must see if doing Notre Dame as well. If Notre Dame has a massive queue, worth the 5min walk to check the length of the line for Sainte Chapelle which is usually significantly shorter.

This is the most beautiful church/chapel in Paris. Serious must see!!! The stain glass, ceilings are incredible. Closed between 12pm and 2:15pm so make sure to line up at 1:45pm. By 2:15pm the line is 100 people long. So worth it - rivals the Notre Dame in a big way although much smaller.

A concert at Sainte-Chapelle is a must. Even if it is a touristy thing to do, seeing one of the concerts at this gem is a highlight. The quintet was truly great and the setting is unbelievable! How did we miss this before?!?

The stained glass!!!!. Saint Chapelle is a small chapel but has the most exquisite stained class windows. It is ancient and has tiny spiral staircases that are well worth climbing to see all the sites of this beautiful place. The line is long because not many people can enter at one time. We were on a tour that allowed us to enter before the line. there is a small gift shop that has a nice selection of items at fairly reasonable prices.

Wonderful Vivaldi Concert. Visited two years ago while under renovation so didn't see all the carvings and window details. Completed now and looks wonderful. String quintet was superb - extremely talented conductor and soloist with amazing technique presenting Vivaldi Four Seasons. Could not have been a better location.

Breathtaking.. This relatively less known chapel a few blocks from The Notre Dame has 360 degrees of eye popping stained glass windows that bathe the nave in soft hues especially at dusk.With its excellent natural acoustics it is the perfect setting for evening classical music concerts which have an almost beatific effect on even the most cynical and critical of people such as myself. Do check it out.
Grand. The best monument of Paris. Worth the wait and a big surprise awaits you once you climb the stairs. Make sure you visit on a sunny day. The overtaking feeling is more powerful.
The most beatifull church of Paris. The most beatifull church of Paris, if their is one than it is the one you must see. Close from Notre-Dame de Paris
Beautiful !. What a incredible chapel ! Amazing !Unbelievable !The architecture is spectacular and it was built 1242/48 it is hard to believe !

an humbling experience. This small church, built in the mid-13th century, had its marvelous stained glass panels restored in 2015. The result is breathtaking. The colors, the stories, the grand presentation all make this a worthwhile stop on your Paris tour.
Beautiful setting for a concert. Came here for a concert of Bach's passion of the Christ. Beautiful setting though quite warm during the concert. Worth visiting.
Awesome stained glass windows. A small chapel that is a quick and good visit. In Paris, must be the place where are the most beautiful stained glass windows.

My favorite site in Paris!. We saw a lot while we were in Paris, but this was undoubtedly the best thing I saw. The light coming in through the stained glass during the day was beautiful and amazing to see. Don't miss it!!
Beautiful and endearing church. Definitely worth a visit. So amazing and beautiful church with a wonderful history, visit it on a sunny day - then comes the amazing windows to his right.
Very beautiful stained glass. This cathedral has the most beautiful stained glass I had seen in any of the churches in my euro trip. Definitely go to first floor!

Just Alright. My husband and I walked into to the Saint Chapelle not knowing what it was. We walked out about ten minutes later still not knowing what it was. Eventually we figured it out but there isn't really anything inside that tells you about the place. The stain glass is beautiful and tells a story of how Christianity began and there are two floors of these beautiful glass artworks. Maybe stain glass really isn't our thing but overall the place was beautiful but not really worth the price.

Breathtaking & unforgettable. A must-visit in Paris, this is a much smaller place than nearby Notre-Dame but equally worth seeing. I visited 3 years ago now, and it is still 1 of my favourite places in our 3 week Europe holiday.Make sure you head upstairs, because if you think the bottom floor as you enter is beautiful, the stained glass windows upstairs will take your breath away! Unfortunately for me, large parts of the windows were undergoing restoration when I visited but I believe those works are complete and I would love to visit again in the future.

Stunning stained glass!. Sainte-Chapelle is the lesser known neighbor of the famous Notre Dame de Paris, and in my opinion is much more breath taking. It costs 10 euros to enter and it is very small with a gift shop and information on the first floor. You climb a spiral staircase to the second floor and you are greeted by walls of stained glass everywhere you look. Words cannot really describe the beauty and I recommend you see it for yourself if in Paris. It's much less crowded than the Notre Dame (though the Notre Dame is definitely worth seeing as well), and it has a more intimate and calm feel.

Stunning! . So beautiful. You can prepay for your tickets on line it makes it a little easier but you don't have to. Make sure you check the hours because they were closed for a couple hours in the middle of the day (I think for mass) You can take photos and you will want to take a million. Make sure you go up the stairs because that's where the most beautiful part is. The downstairs also has a beautiful display of stained glass but nothing compares to what you will see upstairs!

Medieval Magic. When we entered Ste. Chapelle we were awed by the lower chapel, with its sided arches, richly coloured ceiling, niches and alcoves. Then we mounted the spiral stairs . . . We forgot about that ground floor, as we saw the stained glass soaring upwards all around us. There were too many people, but they seemed insignificant in that space. We retreated for a while to a terrace at one end, and amused ourselves trying (not with total success) to interpret the scenes beautifully carved on the monumental doorway. Then back to the glorious interior for a last "fix" before returning to the busy real world of the flower market and Notre Dame.

Gorgeous Chapel. The building and, most notably, the stained glass is amazing. There were a lot of steep stairs to get to the top level to see the main area, although they may have another entrance if you have mobility issues. It only took us about a half hour but was well worth seeing. We purchased combined admission next door at the Conciergerie which saved us some money.
Magical Spot. Exquisite stained glass creates makes an ethereal impression. Rent the headset t really enhance the experience.

Simply stunning. This once royal chapel is a must visit when you are in Paris. The stained glass in this chapel is absolutely beautiful. I've visited my fair share of chapels, churches and cathedrals when traveling in Europe but I'll always remember this little gem tucked away in the corner. It maybe overshadowed by Notre Dame cathedral which is a 10 mins walk away but it is equally if not beautiful in its own unique way.
Don't miss this gem.. Don't miss this gem. This is the best and prettiest church in all of Europe. It isn't as busy or formal as the other churches. Perfect for kids.

Breathtaking holy space. I wanted to rate this with more than excellent as it is a breathtaking, holy, georgeous, magic and beauty space where I had the honour to visit. From my experience it is a must see and experience in Paris.

Absolute must while in Paris!!!. Whilst in Europe as you imagine we seen a lot of church's and a lot of well known ones at that however Sainte-Chapelle isn't at the top of many peoples list of things to see in Paris although it should be!The church is very close to Notre Dame and fairly cheap to get into.The ground floor of the church is amazing in its own respect but just wait till you go up stairs as it will take your breath away! Stain glass windows from floor to ceiling all the way around the church make for spectacular photos. Absolute must while in Paris.I recommend going on a sunny day to get the full beauty of the church, also you should out of respect cover your shoulders and knees whilst in the church. This isn't heavily enforced however I recommend it.You can take photos and should be silent while in the church.

Crazy if you don't go.. In Paris and wondering if you should? ?? Get the pass and be prepared to be wowed. When you realize when this stained glass was made you will just stand there and be awed. Enough said

Hidden Gem!. Since it's basically besides Notre Dame Cathedral and we had the museum pass we decided to check it out. From the outside it's nothing spectacular but once you get inside it's breathtaking. The second floor is even more amazing than the first floor. If it wasn't for it closing we could have sat in there for hours. Definitely worth a visit!

Classical concert in an amazing setting. Booked an evening (around sunset) concert performance of Vivaldi's Four Seasons, which was incredible! A truly magical experience listening to amazing classical music in such a gorgeous setting. Tickets were still available on the night for those that didn't book in advance.Highly recommend visiting more than once (if you have the museum pass) at different times of day to see how the sun shines through the stained glass. Of course, this depends on how busy it is (when we went in last week of August to first couple days of September, it was low season so there were practically no lines to all/any of the tourist spots, which allowed us to visit and really enjoy Sainte-Chapelle several times).Explanations of each of the panels of stained glass are available in several different languages as well, which might help you appreciate them even more if you're interested.
Beautiful . Gorgeous stained glass windows and the ceiling is lovely as well. We only went through quickly but it was definitely worth stopping in

Beautiful chapel.. This was a very pretty church, the stained glass let so much light in. It definitely is in the process of repair and cleaning but it was beautiful none the less. I highly recommend visiting.

Breathtaking Beauty. When you first walk in, you think "really, I waited for this?". But, just wait until you get upstairs. One of the most awe-inspiring churches you will ever go into. I visit every time I'm in Paris. Words can't adequately describe this. It should be your first stop, before any other Paris site.

Number ONE!!!!. If this church doesn't mesmerize you towards the heavens, then all is lost. I could spend hours in here and I am not religious. The stained windows are spectacular and change with the light. There are 1,100 panels detailing the Bible from creation to the end of time. Bring binoculars! !!

Classic concert. The best way to see the Chapelle is by enjoying an evening concert. It has specular acoustics and you it allows you lots of time to enjoy the wonderful stained glass and with less crowds.

Stunning. We used our museum pass and walked right on in! The windows are just stunning. They have information cards by the front door that will give the history of each window section. Sit on down and soak it up as the light changes.
inspiring. This is an excellent example of period stained glass. There is not a great deal more to see that is not available elsewhere, but its big and its nice.

Breathtaking Stained Glass. Try to go on a sunny day, it lights up the glass and makes it even more beautiful. Watch your step as you emerge from the spiral staircase and see it for the first time -- it literally takes your breath away.
Stained glass glory. It seemed sort of hidden,and the first part nice,but then you walk in to all that glorious stained glass...nearly knocked my socks off!
Saint Chapelle Concert. We only saw a concert there - Moving! Les Solistes Francais Paul Rouger and Company - Wonderful - Schubert, Pugnani, Massenet - Don't miss these concerts!
Truly special. Everyone talks about Notre Same. Sainte-Chapelle is truly special because of its stained glass windows. Do not miss this church. Paris Museum passes also sold here.

The most beautiful Church of Paris. To make the most of it:
Buy ticket online to skip part of the queue;
Pick up a SUNNY day to ensure you're overwhelmed by the beauty of the interior.
Take binoculars to see in detail the (very small) details of each window.
In the afternoon sun hits the rose window and the light is magical.
Stunning!. The stained-glass are a sight to see. If you happen to be there on a sunny day, the view is stunning. Be ready to be amazed by the architecture and design of this beautiful church.
Well worth a visit. Sainte-Chapelle is lovely and well worth the visit and the 10 euro entry fee. Both chapels are beautiful and unlike anything else in Paris.

Classical music in classic beauty. Sainte-Chapelle is the most beautiful chapel I've ever seen (and I visit religious structures regularly on my travels to admire the architecture). Go to just admire it, and if you can stay for one of the evening classical music concerts, they're a glorious experience - in every sense of the word.

Stunning. The Chappell is just mesmerising. Absolutely stunning and a must if visiting Paris. There is a €10 entry fee.
There are seats and cards in the chapel explaining all the individual stories of each glass panel.
Best to view during the daytime when the sun is shining through the glass

Evening concert. We recently attended an evening concert at St. Chapelle, featuring Vivaldi's Four Seasons. What a magical experience - excellent music, surrounded by the astoundingly beautiful stained glass in the cathedral. Very reasonably priced, but it's a small chapel so reserve tickets early. I think this may be a summer-only event. Highly recommended.

beautiful. i completely recommend this over the notre dame, although it is free and nearby so you could always do both.it is exquisite and beautiful and peaceful, and well worth the entrance fee. buy a combined ticket to the conciergerie next door because it is also fascinating! (note that if you're 18-25 and an eu citizen, like me, you get in free by showing your passport)

Find quiet time.... ... the most stellar stained glass (in the world?) is somewhat hampered by less than perfect museum organization. Signs, loud voices: if you are aware of these, then enjoy. Or come at the margins, when it might be empty. Not as busy as the Sistine Chapel, about the same size, but worth the 4-star visit.

A Paris Beauty. Another "not to be missed" Paris icon. The brilliantly colored stained glass windows alone make this a "must see"--the tall narrow windows and the large round rose window are unique and beautiful.
Stain Glass Windows not to be Missed. Historic chapel used by King Louis who became a saint. Architecture and stain glass windows sublime. Short distance from Notre Dame and should not be missed.

Stunning. Do not miss this. If there's too long a line for Notre Dame, go to Sainte-Chapelle instead. There's something about the smaller scale that gives it a greater impact and, to me, a more sacred feeling. The main floor has you gaping and awed -- but then you go to the upper chapel, and . . . it's incredible, indescribable.
The best place to visit in paris. Would have missed this gem if I hadn't done my research. Absolutely beautiful and left both my partner and I stunned.
The concerts are amazing . Paid to go to an evening concert at the Chappelle. The place is stunning, surrounded by stain glass and fantastic acoustics. Highly recommend this magical place.

Beautiful old building with limited access. Saint-Chapelle is an interesting historical site, and the interior sights that are open to the public are gorgeous and in large part, newly-restored to be more visible (removal of pollution and dirt etc from the centuries of exposure). It is essentially now two large rooms open to the public, and the remainder of the building has been taken over by the Police - still somewhat visible externally, but inaccessible for touring as a member of the public. The stained glass windows on the second floor of the building are particularly stunning, and show several books of the bible in order, however the stairs to ascend are steep and somewhat uneven for anyone who is unsteady on their feet - not sure of alternative access options. There is a mural on the wall near the altar downstairs which is from the 12th or 13th century - stunning again in its longevity and clarity. There is also a fascinating interactive media simulation of what the original Saint-Chapelle looked like, complete with its various functions that was fun to go through, but as a single machine that could be operated by one person at a time, it took a long time to go through its entirety and was not really conducive to a venue like that - as an online invitation or an educational supplement for school children, it would be really great.

Sainte-Chapelle meets Vivaldi. A Vivaldi concert in Sainte-Chapelle! Se magnifique!! Truly this is a once in a lifetime experience. The chapel glimmers as dusk skims across the stained glass. The musicians are some of the finest. Surrounded by beautiful music and the most amazing stained glass in the world, you are transported to a place of peace and world class artistry.

stumbled upon a gem. W actually were not looking for this Chapelle but stumbled upon it. It is smallish compared to the grandeur of some of the other churches in the area BUT I loved the colors inside. It really felt like I was there in history. The ceiling is blue and gold. Very simple but beautiful. The stained glass is fantastic and when you get further inside it is very intimate. I felt like I was in a Shakespearean Play.

Visually stunning. We went to Sainte-Chapelle because of the huge line at Notre Dame. It was an excellent choice. This is a visually stunning church, small and intimate, situated inside the Palais de Justice. Not only is the church a jewel box of stained glass, it is fascinating to see how the other buildings have been built around it and into it.
Surprisingly unique. The antiquity of the inside viewing objects catches one off guard as well as the beauty of the stained glass

For 10€ you will be amazed.. Probably the best value paid for 'attraction' in Paris. Having recently been cleaned and refurbished it is now absolutely stunning. One does not in any way need to be of a religious nature to enjoy this place, but if you are a fan of colour and light........WOW.

Classical music in Sainte-Chapelle. Every now and then there are organised classic music concerts for a limited audience. Twice have been listening a certain Frédéric Moreau, a virtuoso of the violin, EXCELLENT !Acoustics are not done for the music but the beauty is compensating all.

WOW. Not too much of a queue....walk into small chapel....what's the fuss about...then realize there's further to go up a narrow spiral staircase.....do yourself a favour and take a look at the stained glass windows....

Amazing Stained Glass Windows. We enjoyed our visit to Sainte-Chapelle. We had the Paris Museum pass so there was no wait to enter. We visited the same day as Notre Dame since it is just a few blocks away. The stained glass windows are beautiful. If you have the Paris Museum Pass then you should definitely spend 20 minutes of your day here. Otherwise I do not think it is worth a separate admission ticket or time out of a busy touring schedule.

Stunning. The stained glass of the Sainte Chapelle must be amongst the most beautiful ever. A symphony of colour and light. I first went with my grandfather 50 years ago, and still visit whenever I get the chance.
Must See for Catholics. The interior is large, the second floor is impressive. Beautiful windows and architecture. Not nearly as crowded as per sites.

Beautiful and historic . I found the entrance fee of 10 euros a bit high for what you get. The chapel is historic and the stained glass windows are beautiful. But there's only two rooms and not much to see other than the stained glass.
Must visit !!. A beautiful chapel with renovated stained glass.The walk to the upstairs chapel is easy. Go just before closing to see it without the tour groups.
Good but expensive in regards to what you get. Well it's beautifull and the story is charming, but I think it's overpriced in regards to what you get, 10 euros and I was there for 10-15 minutes...

Outstanding stained glass!. The stained glass windows in this church are absolutely beautiful! This sight is just up the road from Notre Dame and its a real must see!You can climb the stairs to get up to the top where there is some beautiful art on the second level!

Breathtaking--a treasure. The first time I saw this chapel, my jaw dropped when I reached the top of the stairs. Every vignette is in jewel colors. I had to sit in one of the chairs along the side and look up to take it all in. My second visit was no less thrilling. It is a must see in Paris.

Get rid of the souk!. Great disappointment to see the first floor of this amazing place stuffed with commercial booth of all kinds. These belong outside in the court!!! To appreciate the first floor, it needs to be emptied, if not 10€ are much too expensive.The upper-level is simply awesome, with its fresh refurbished stained-glass windows
Don't miss this. Absolutely fabulous and is a must see location in the heart of Paris. Where all the kings of France were crowned. Lead light windows are the best in Europe.

Make sure you go to a concert here.. The stain glass is breathtaking but if you really want to enjoy this space make sure you "see" a concert here. The acoustics are legendary for a reason. We saw Vivaldi Four Seasons and we were blown away. The lead violinist would move around the church in order to give different levels to the music since there are no mikes this is the only way to do it. Beautiful and utterly unique.

Finest Windows I've ever Seen. The stained glass windows here will blow you away, they are absolutely spectacular. Only five minutes walk from the more famous Notre Dame, if you're on the island definitely try and come here too. €10 entry is a little steep for what is primarily just the one room, but you certainly won't regret your visit.

Absolutely Stunning!!. The Sainte Chappelle, a chapel in Paris is absolutely stunning. Most churches are beautiful but St. Chapelle is different in that it has stained glass windows on most of its walls. It is located close to the Notre Dame & is a must visit in Paris. Once you enter the Chapel, you can stare at the altar, the ceiling & the windows for time immemorial. Stunning is an understatement.
Proving bigger is not always better.. Sainte-Chapelle is one of the most important sites to see in all of France. Absolutely do not miss this historic work of art.

Spectacular. The stained glass windows were more spectacular than anyone can describe. This brilliant little gem adjacent to Notre Dame on Ile de la Cite, is worth seeing. I can only imagine what it must be like to attend a concert here, but we weren't able to schedule that this trip.
Jewel in the crown . Hadn't planned this visit but stumbled across the chapel by chance.Beautifully designed and built, and restored too.Doesn't take too long to visit but it's worth taking the time
Sainte-Chapelle . Beautiful stained glass. Expensive for how long you are really there. Must go through through security because of it's proximity to the Palace of Justice.

Attended concert in St Chapelle - magnificent. Instead of doing a tour of this church we attended a concert. As it was springtime and still light we were able to see the breathtakingly beautiful stained glass windows while listening to Vivaldi. We simply bought tickets online and presented our phones for entry. Very easy no queuing and simply superb acoustics. Highly recommended.

Stunning. This place is stunning. As soon as I saw the stained glass windows I gasped, it's so pretty. I read that the building is receiving a monumental investment to renovate the stained glass. They are doing a great job. Although the chapel is small you still have entry into the surrounding buildings, but the main attraction is the chapel. There is a €10 charge, but is free for students and under 18's. If you are visiting the notre-dame nearby definitely come to this.
Breathtakingly beautiful. Visit early as the ques to enter is long, but well worth the visit-Breathtaking, beautiful and well worth a visit.

Best in Paris . I cant say enough about this site. So beautiful and full of information. Plan to take some time to understand the biblical backgrounds and work. It was only 10€ . I could have stayed for hours.

Breathtaking. I did a walking tour and it was the guide that told us to actually go here instead of Notre Dame (of course we still did Notre Dame). This is hidden right near Notre Dame and the palace. At first I walked in and was wondering what the guide was talking about -- then you walk up the stairs and it was "wow". It is a quick visit, not much to see, read or do but it is worth the small cost to say you saw it.

Only recently reopened after stained glass windows were cleaned. Sainte-Chapelle was not open on previous visits. There were long lines but you can buy a joint ticket that will allow you to skip the line. Get the oral guide and take your time. The newly cleaned windows are breathtaking.

A Small, But Absolutely Beautiful Old Church. St, Chapelle was built to house the relics brought back from the Crusades, including the Crown of Thorns (now at Notre Dame). It is a great gothic structure and very different inside from the other famous Paris Churches. It is small, so it does not take much time. It is on the Paris Pass.

The most amazing stained glass windows. The windows in this church are just amazing. Well worth the visit. Personally l prefer this to Notre Dame. So, if you have time to visit only one church, go here and visit first thing in the morning to avoid the crowds.

Don't Skip This!. Do no skip this place! Once you climb the steps (not many at all) and get to the top, your breath will be taken away! Stunning does not even begin to describe. Find a seat and just gaze!

Like entering a rainbow. Notre Dame is impressive, but Sainte-Chapelle is even more of a show-stopper in my opinion. Slender columns of stone support soaring "walls" of stained glass. When the sun comes through you feel like you've in the middle of a rainbow. Not to be missed!

Awe Inspiring Sainte-Chappelle. Sainte-Chappelle is a must see. Go to the evening concert. Make ticket application for the concerts early and online and then enjoy the music, but most of all, experience the beauty that is Sainte-Chappelle's walls of stained glass windows. Breathtaking. With your tickets in hand, you will be able to avoid the rather disorganized ticket purchase and distribution process. Handicapped persons will be treated politely and offered an elevator to/from the second floor.
Sainte Chapelle. trapped inside of justice palace, aggressive security guards , worth visiting is you got it included in your tour pass, otherwise €10 for entry is too much for what it is,
MOst Amazing Chruch!. The glass work in here is incredible! It is the most beautiful stained glass work I have ever seen! I skipped the lourve to see this and I am SO glad we did!

Beautiful stain glass windows. Not much to look at on the exterior, especially after going to Notre dame, but the windows are plentiful, intricate and beautiful. There are 2 level since- first floor with no windows but shows the renovation process, including computer app. 2nd floor are where the Windows are. Each picture is small and requires focus to truly look at each window and to see the details, I.e. Etchings to make the robe folds, multiple colors, etc.I probably wouldn't go out of my way to see it on a first time trip, but if you have the time and are in the area, then consider a visit. It was 10E for just entry to the chapel.Tip- don't forget to look at the ceiling

Beautiful chapel with breathtaking stained glass windows. Worth getting a Museum Pass to avoid the long queues but a must to visit in Paris.The stairs up to the Chapelle anr not easy for elderly people. I am not sure if there is a lift.

Stunning, but go as early as you can. Absolutely stunning- we stayed an hour just gazing at the windows. Do try and get there as early as you can though, or you end up with someone's camera stuck up your nose every 5 seconds...
Breathtaking. There was a long wait to enter but this is the most breathtaking church/cathedral I have ever been to. Not to be missed.

Stunning!!. My mouth dropped when I walked in! Took my breath away. Must see! We saw a string quartet in the Chapelle one evening at sunset. It was excellent. Just be cautious because there's no Air Conditioning - when we were there it was really hot but I don't regret it.

Incredible stained glass windows. King Louis IX's Chapel completed in 1248 (in record time) to house the holy relics that the King cleaned out the treasury to purchase from the Byzantines. The stained glass is amazing.

Vivaldi concert in a stunning venue. We booked tickets for a Vivaldi concert in this stunning venue with dinner in a nearby restaurant . This was a highlight of our trip to paris. We enjoyed the concert as the sun set and amplified the colours of the stained glass chapel walls. An unforgettable experience and one I would thoroughly recommend to anyone who likes classical music and beautiful historical architecture.

Small but beautiful chapel with amazing stained glass windows. We went because it was included on our Museum Pass. I am glad we did! The stained glass was really stunning. It was pretty small so we did not stay long, so consider the that when deciding to wait in line. Our Museum Pass allowed us to skip the line so it was not an issue for us.
Vivaldi and the Chapelle. Extraordinary beauty, before sunset attended a Vivaldi concert.Very high security, but helpful and professional. Place it as the top three events we did in Paris.

A little jewel. The stained glass windows are lovely, the architecture is delicate, and the official "shhhher" is amusing. They're quite serious about being quiet, but in a friendly way.
This is a lovely place to visit, but it doesn't need to be on the top 5 list.
Must see. This is the most beautiful church in the world! Do not leave Paris without visiting this gem. The steep 10 euros admission is well worth it!
Beautiful. My husband and I went to Sainte-Chapelle on our own without a guide. We would have benefited from having the knowledge a guide could convey.

A medieval gem. Situated in the middle of the Palais de Justice on the Ile de la Cite, Sainte-Chapelle is a medieval relic that is well worth a visit. There was a very short queue to get in. The upper chapel has magnificent tall stained glass windows dating from the 13th century and half of these have recently been restored. The under chapel has richly painted walls and there is a small shop with souvenirs there.

Hidden gem. There was only a small queue when I visited compared to the monster queue at Notre Dame. Entry is via a small chapel and gift shop. I was about to quit in disgust when I noticed a small spiral staircase. I thought that this might be the access to a bell tower so I ascended the stairs only to enter the main chapel. The stained glass windows are awesome.

Hidden gem! . Many people miss this one as its smaller and shadowed by the Notre Dame, but I would highly recommend it! It is only a five minute walk on the same island as the cathedral and the view inside of the stain glass windows is amazing! If you are from the EU and aged between 18-25 this attraction is also free!!

Small and beautiful. I very much recommend you to visit this beautiful small and intimate church. When entering the floor with the most beautiful coloured windows pick up one of the board at the entrance of the floor with the explanation of each of the windows.

The Most Beautiful Cathedral in Paris. While most people would surmise that Notre Dame Cathedral is the most beautiful church in all of Paris (and it IS stunning), I would have to say that my visit to Sainte Chappelle was even more awe inspiring. While it is a fraction of the size of Notre Dame, the small church has one of the most amazing rooms I've ever been in. The stained glass windows inside the king's chapel are perhaps one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. Do not overlook this spot if you are in Paris. Like all of the top attractions (The Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, The Louvre, The Musee D'Orsay, Etc) this should absolutely be on the top of your list. I'd suggest going on a sunny day to really experience the stained glass in all of it's intricate glory.

A concert in Sainte-Chapelle. If you have an opportunity during your visit take a look at the calendar of events that they have going on at Sainte-Chapelle during your stay. We recently visit Sainte-Chapelle and attended one of the best Four Seasons / Vivaldi performances I have ever experienced. But much of that also has to do with who is performing. While the acoustics were good I would certainly would recommend getting seats towards the front of the chapel to get the best acoustics. But what really brings the Sainte-Chapelle to life is attending a lovely concert; just sit back, listen and simply look around at the stain glass comes to life and the light shines in, what an experience not to miss.

Prepare to have your mind blown. Nothing can quite prepare you for how incredible and stunning the stained glass is, there is simply nothing like it. It tels the whole story of the bible and lots of scenes are easily identifiable. If you go when the sun is rising or beginning to set, the whole chapel is lit up like a dream.

Small but Jaw Dropping. Wow, just wow. It's definitely not what you expect. You walk into this small foyer (also amazingly decorated, however), climb up this tight stone spiral staircase and walk out into this brilliant chapel whose walls are almost entirely stained glass. Best chapel in Europe, let alone Paris!
Impressive. Love the place, you don't expect it when in line to get into the complex. Visit might be quite short.

Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful "chapelle" I have ever seen. All the windows and the color, the details are incredible. It is very small and in about 15-20 minutes or even less you are done seeing it. It is expensive, about 10€ but if you are a student you get a discount.

Truly Lovely. Loved this small chapel. It is on a side street and not very well sign posted but well worth finding.....just make sure you go upstairs. It is beautiful and no long queues to get in either
Nice Chappelle.. Its really nice and beautiful chappelle. The stain glass windows are worth visiting the place. One should visit this calm place.
Beautiful!. Was surprised there isn't more written about this Gem! I find it to be more impressive than Notre Dame. The tour was informative. Absolutely stunning. A must see when in Paris!
Stunning!. Amazing place, extremely beautiful. Has a soothing and peaceful effect :) Guides in English are available
Amazing stain glass windows. I've been through a few cathedrals but never seen the anything like the windows of Sainte Chapelle. It's a must see in Paris.

Incredibly Beautiful - A Must See!. This little chapel is so beautiful! No trip to Paris is complete without seeing it. The colours are incredible and the attention to detail is amazing...you have to visit!
I recommend getting there early in the morning to avoid queues. Also its included on the Museum Pass.
Great concert. The concert in this church are amazing. It is suggested to arrive early or to book in advance. It looks to be in Oxford in the college churces but with a beautiful French touch.
Church with stained glass all over. It was a nice church with stained glass all over. That's all there is to it. I wouldn't say it is a must see but if you have time, why not.
Fantastic colourful windows. Go inside to see the huge windows. Be there in the morning at the time they open to avoid the long queue.

A must see...spectacular. This by far is my favorite church in Paris. The two levels are amazing for their own reasons, but the stained glass is the best I have ever seen. It feels like you are standing in a jewelry box. This is part of the museum pass so well worth the stop.
Amazing !!!. You enter this worn little unassuming chapel, a place relics were kept in the days of the Kings. You travel upstairs and are just blown away !!! A must see !!
So beautiful. A real feast for the eyes! When you walk up the steps and into where the stained glass is, it's a really big WOW moment! Stunning

Smaller Than You Realize. Buy the Paris Pass! Seriously, it gets you through a lot of lines. We went here on a Paris trek and loved this little place. It looks a lot bigger on the interwebs. Once you're in through, whew, pictures don't do it justice. They don't let everyone and their brother in at once, so you're not backside to belly button with a bunch of tourists. Take your time and check out the stained glass. It's really gorgeous.
If you have the time. Only go if you have the time, if you are in Paris for a weekend then it is not impressive enough compared to other venues.
Beautiful stained glass and Architecture. An expensive 10 minutes but worth the effort and cost . Amongst the best stained glass Ive seen anywhere and beautiful architecture!
Beautiful!. Went to a concert in the Sainte- Chapelle so did not visit the 'normal way'! Gorgeous colours and light.

If you like stained glass .... This astonishingly beautiful church right near Notre Dame is a little bit hidden and not quite as frequently visited as its big sister down the street but anyone who is interested in stained glass should make Sainte-Chapelle a top priority. My husband and I went late in the day and didn't find crowds but only had half an hour to visit before they closed. If I were to go back, I'd go first thing in the morning and get either an audio guide or take a tour. Better yet, I'd look to see if there were any night time music performances in the space as that would be an amazing way to experience it. One thing that is probably obvious but bears repeating: there are two spaces here, one that you see when you walk in and another that's up a windy flight of stairs. The bottom one is worth visiting but it's the top where you'll find stained glass that just soars into the heavens.

WOW Wow wow!. Wow wow wow is the reaction of most people when they enter the upstairs of the Church!The lower part is very nice but when you go upstairs, it is incredibly beautiful! The whole church left us with a " really good feeling", nothing intimidating or eerie feeling. My family was first not too that keen after Notre Dame, especially since we had to pay to get in and stand in a cue for a few minutes but everyone was so glad we DID visit the little Chapelle! I will go back to visit this little church again at our next visit to Paris.
Beautiful. The stained glass is amazing. Its depicts scenes from the bible. It is an old church and it is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen in my life. It was built in 13th century.
Filled with light. If you enjoy churches that are filled with light and color, be sure to visit this very special place.

Amazing Stained Glass. Didn't get to see this beautiful place the last time I was here. So glad I was able to do it this time. Make sure you get the audio guide. It is so informative, so much to learn. The stain glass work is simply beautiful. It's funny but the chapelle sits behind a building so you really can't see it from the street! Beautiful place, don't miss it!

Lovely. Ever since my first visit 7 years ago, Saint-Chapelle in my mind, is the standard by which I compare other stained glass filled cathedrals and churches. Nothing comes close.If you're travelling around Europe and don't want to feel "cathedral'd out", at least visit Sainte-Chapelle. I'd even go as far as to suggest visiting this over Notre Dame.
Small, But Beautiful. A lot smaller than Notre Dame, but very beautiful. Recently remodeled in 2015. Try going a night, when crowds are smaller.

Transcendent experience. The fabulous coloured light filled interior is heart-stoppingly beautiful. Take a long time to drink in the experience. Unforgettable. Go on a bright day to get the benefit of the light illuminating the magnificent stained glass windows.

Stunning. Stunning Windows ... Only critism was that where you enter the building there are no indications that you need to climb a very narrow stone spiral staircase and the entrance is hidden behind the entrance door,Unfortunately the staff on duty that day didn't speak English and we nearly missed the boutique Windows

Breathtaking!. Being surrounded by these magnificent stained glass windows was a site to see. We just wanted to stand there and soak in each pane;. It was a cloudy day on our visit and I can't imagine the intensity if the sun was shining brightly. There is a narrow circular staircase to get to the second floor to visit the chapel and unfortunately, my mom was not able to navigate the stairs with her bad knees. She stayed on the first floor and looked in the small gift shop area. Having the museum pass does save time at this site. The line on the street to enter through security is the same, but once you are on the property, you can bypass the actually line to purchase tickets to enter. This was a huge time saver for us and well worth the cost of the museum pass.
You can't miss it!. Its one of the most beautiful chapels I've seen! Of course you have to pay an entrance, but I recommend you to.

most beautiful I've seen. This was by far my favorite of the famous cathedrals in and near Paris, including Notre Dame and Chartres. The glass looks like hundreds of thousands of jewels and the architecture is grand but delicate.

Beautiful and historical. We bought the combined ticket for Sainte-Chapelle and the Conciergie. We thought it was a little pricey but it turned out to be well worth the money and the time. Last time we were in Paris, St. Chapelle was being renovated so it was a wonderful surprise to tour.

Astonishing. A beautiful piece of history. If you like to visit old churches with stained glass -- it is a must visit! It won't take long and it is very small. Buy the combo ticket and see the conciergerie along with it.
Do Not Miss This. If you only go to one Cathedral in Paris, skip the lines for Notre Dame and come see the amazing and glorious windows at Sainte-Chapelle!!!!
A stunning windows!. The stained glass windows were so beautiful and yet pictures don't do them justice. Completely amazing!

Stunning stained glass. I've been here twice, and been awestruck both times. Sainte-Chapelle is all about the glass, and it really delivers. My 14-year-olds, who are not much into visiting churches, thought it was great.

Iconic Stained Glass. This is a beautiful church and the glass is magnificent. On a sunny day you can get some really great photos of the glass. There is a lot to see in Paris of course.but spare an hour of your day. Sainte Chapelle will not disappoint

Surprise surprise!. Just few steps from the Notre Dame de Paris and you are in Sainte-Chapelle! First floor is pretty amazing, but the real beauty is in the second floor! First few minutes you are in shock how beautiful it is and then you do not want to leave this place. For students is free, so don't miss it! And for me it is much prettier than Notre Dame... And there are not a lot of people :)

Prettiest church in Europe. Book a concert!. St. Chapelle is so breathtaking, has always been my favorite place in Paris. But it is hard to appreciate standing there, neck craned, with a hundred other people looking around too. Next visit I'll book a concert ticket (when it is light outside!) and have time to drink it in from a chair, with music. Is so much closer to what that place of worship was designed to support, and wow, to have a couple of hours to just gawk at the windows...

My favorite building in Paris. I know that is saying a lot but the architecture, color and grace of this chapel is a must see. Only a few blocks from Notre Dame. The small fee and small lines encourage you to stop by.

Breathtaking stained glass windows. If you happen to be in Paris, you have to visit the Sainte-Chapelle.
The stained glass windows and the rose in the second level are really breathtaking.
I have never seen windows such as these in any other place.
For me, the Sainte-Chapelle is the most beautiful church I have ever seen.

Concert at Sainte Chapelle was our favorite activity in Paris. Attended a 7:30 pm concert here in a Friday evening. Security was very intense - about 50 police, dogs, and tighter than airport type screening (believe some VIP family was in attendance) but the concert was outstanding!!!
Great acoustics. Heard three pieces, ending with Vivaldi's Four Seasons.
A highlight of our trip!
Amazing Windows!!. The second level with an entire ceiling of stained glass is simply stunning. Narrow stone spiral staircases provide entry and exit. Well worth the visit.
Mesmerizing. Sainte- Chapelle, is, from my view point, the most beautiful church I have ever seen. Golden, colorful, unique...the best.

If you have time. Beautiful church to see. I would do this if you are on a walking tour that takes you nearby. Don't think I would make a special trip for this. Only because there is so much to see and do in Paris. Can't do everything - unless you are moving there!
Unbelievably Beautiful. This is a don't miss attraction in Paris. The stained glass is extraordinary. Such colour and 900 years old. Combined ticket with the Conciergerie is good value.

Heavenly. This is a wonderful side trip just for admiring the colors and designs of the stained glass and rose window. I brought a small pair of binoculars and sat on one of the side benches to take in the scenes on the windows. Since the windows are all over head it is difficult to see any detail without binoculars or a good zoom on your camara

Wow!. No other place have we ever seen windows such as these . It really needs a sunny day to appreciate the beauty and craftsmanship that went into this stained glass display.Another tourist spot that does not get much publicity.
No brainer if going to Notre-Dame. Beautiful stained glass at Saint Chapelle. A few minutes from Notre-Dame, so if you're going there be sure not to miss this.
Nice quick stop with Museum pass. Overall small but the stained glass was very ornate and of you appreciate stained glass it is worth a look. There is a climb to the 2nd floor to see it thouh....

5th trip to Paris 1st time to Ste Chapelle. Why did I wait???. Every other time I've come to Paris the line for the Sainte Chapelle was wrapped around the building. We never wanted to wait. This time I read on TA to go about an hour before it closes and the line will be short. That's exactly what we did. Got there about 5:00 pm and waited in the security line for about 5 mins. then walked right into the chapelle. It was absolutely stunning. One of the best kept secrets as you can't see the beauty from the street. Don't miss it.
Absolutely stunning. Do not miss this. With all the long lines all over Paris attractions I was shocked that this church with amazing stained glass (huge)was a walk on with almost no wait at all

Gem of Stained Glass Windows. If you enjoy stained glass windows (or just beautiful churches) this church is a must see. I actually prefer it over Notre Dame even though it is much smaller. There is a lower chapel, which was for the palace staff to worship, and an upper chapel with the stain glass windows, which was for the king his close friends. I recommend seeing this in the morning on a sunny day so you can enjoy it in all its splendor.

Surprisingly Astonishing.. Costs 10 Eros for adults to enter. Bit high for what it is. The stained glass windows are overwhelmingly beautiful, and way too much to take in. One must also have good eyesight as they are quite small depictions of historical and biblical events

Well worth stepping in. This may be the smallest church we visited in France, but what it lacks in size it more than makes up for in detail. The stained glass is no doubt very impressive, but I was also struck by the painted ceilings with the fleur de lis designs in gold. Lovely. I will admit when we arrived and walked in to the ground floor of the chapel, I thought that was it. It was pretty but also pretty small and I couldn't figure out what the fuss was about. You appear to be in just a single room with no way out other than the way you came in. However, there is a (very) small circular staircase hidden in a closet in the corner that you take up to the main level of the chapel, where the real magic is. The detailed stained glass and the painting make you feel like you are inside a beautiful little music box.

Such a wonderfull place. 2 Level in the saint chapelle, to be emerge in Paris history. I recommand to live a concert during evening. And to go to the saint chapelle during a sunny day. Then lets be surprise
Must see in Paris . This was our absolute favorite site in Paris. It's impossible to describe the beauty. Get there early, because the security line gets long fast!

A Stunning, Magnificent and Inspirational Place. My first glimpse of Sainte-Chapelle's colorful, towering stained glass windows made the entire trip to Paris worthwhile . It is such a jewel, such a great achievement, that anyone who sees it will be stunned, whatever their religious background. Sainte-Chapelle was built by Louis XIV to house his extensive Christian relic collection (including the Crown of Thorns) and to serve as the private royal place of worship. Beneath the main chapel is a smaller, but still quite impressive, chapel that was built for the ordinary folks who worked/lived in the royal residence. The chapel was greatly damaged during the French Revolution but over the succeeding centuries, it has been restored to its original brilliance.

Like a blue jewel. Since the restoration of the windows the interior is stunning - the light and colour is mesmerising.It is a must visit - I would recommend getting the dual ticket to include the Conciergerie

Spectaculor Stained Glass. Sainte-Chapelle is certainly a must see in Paris. Make sure you go upstairs (though downstairs is interesting, too) in order to see the incredible stained glass. It's a very memorable experience. Go early to avoid crowds (I went when it opened, bought the Paris Museum Pass there, and was in right away). You won't regret it!

More impressive inside than Notre Dame. I have always enjoyed Sainte Chapelle inside and it's surrounding area of St. Germain de Pres more than Notre Dame. Deux Magots is nearby. Get an outdoor table on a nice day at look at Sainte-Chapelle and the passing crowd.
Glorious!. The stained glass windows are glorious! A must-see gothic church. The place was recently renovated on our recent visit and we were lucky enough to see it. It was just magnificent!

Light inside. Book in advance (I bougth the tickets without a date), arrive on time, and be ready for the Xray scanner (like an airport), but then enjoy your visit in the 2 wonderful floors of this jewel. Take your time to look at the marvelous windows, and intercept the amazing light that enter from the colored panels... Of course, you should book for a sunny day!

Hidden gem. Why have I not heard of this beautiful chapel before? It is small which makes for a quick visit but well worth the effort to swing by (close to Notre Dame) and worth the 10 euro ticket to see.
No finer staned glass in the world.. overwhelming stained glass. While everyone should see Notre Dame, when you have, come here to see what its like to live inside a prism.

Breathtaking Stained Glass. This chapel was once part of the King's Palace and was beautiful.The stained glass was more impressive here than at Notre Dame Cathedral. It has been completely restored and is really worth a visit.

August 2016. This upstairs church is breathtaking!! There is a chapel downstairs that the poor people went to but that is beautiful, too. The way upstairs is up a curved staircase, very small steps, be careful. But, once entering the upstairs chapel, you will be awestruck with the beauty of the stained glass windows. Absolutely beautiful!!!

Beautiful Chapel. The stained glass in this chapel is incredible! This was our second stop of the day, so it was a little crowded, but everyone was looking up anyway, so it didn't really matter. We did wait in a short line because we opted not to get the Paris attractions pass. Those people that had the pass went right in, so if the pass makes sense for you, that's a plus!
Top 10 sight. Very interesting church with lots of quirky bits. Heavily guarded as next to court room. Great restaurant for lunch opposite.

Beautiful. A beautiful chapel that seems to have been overlooked by most of the tourists. We got a joint ticket with The Conciergerie which was actually free for my daughter as she is under 26 and an EU resident.There was no queue to get in and i wish that i had spent more time there-we didn't go upstairs. The only problem for me was that there were a lot of people talking loudly despite signs and someone shushing them, so there was little time for peaceful reflection. The chapel itself is so beautiful that i would love to go back if ever in Paris again.
Stunning . What a beautiful building. In great order with a very interesting explanation of the restoration of the fabulous stained glass windows. Well worth spending 30 minutes when in the area.

Breathtaking! Don't miss this gem. Truly spectacular - the photos simply cannot do it justice. The sheer size and rich color of the almost endless stained glass is really worth a visit. It's an affordable and easy stop. I was there Sunday morning in early August and strolled right in at 10 am.

Stunning. I don't want to give away spoilers - you will have to pay for this and you will wonder why you did if you've never seen pictures. But the view upstairs... phenomenal. A must see if you have a bit of time. Not a long visit and not a tour but absolutely worth a stop. You will be breathless.
Stunning!! . This chapel is so beautiful! The upstairs is the best part. If you have the Paris Museum Pass you can cut line which was worth it for us because the line was long.

a jewel in the heart of Paris. try to attend one of the many classical music concerts held in the evenings. The Chapelle is amazing on its own, but the addition of music meant to be heard in this magnificent space elevates the experience immeasurably.

Best church in Paris. Notre Dame and Sacre Coeur and beautiful and of course very famous, but this chapel is simply amazing. The painted glass makes it very special. It was not on my list of places to visit, but the second time I went to Paris i went to see it as well....i was very impressed. You should not miss it, don't just go for the most popular. Entrance fee was around 8 euros, the line was quite long because you get check with metal detectors before. Don't go around noon, it is closed during lunch time for an hour or 2.

Gorgeous, amazing! . Amazing to think that all that glass survived so many wars. Gorgeous stained glass- this is why you came to Paris. Use the museum pass. Even the tiled floors are beautiful. You will stand amid one of the most beautiful, man-made sites in the world, humbled and amazed.

Absolutely beautiful. Sainte-Chappelle is just down the road from Notre Dame and it was absolutely beautiful, as you first walk in, the view is lovely but you think where is the beautiful stained glass then you have to go up a very narrow winding staircase but when you reach the next level it is just wow. The architecture and glass is stunning. would definitely recommend and go again. The history of the building is also interesting. It cost approximately £10 to get in but worth every penny.
gorgeous place. Yes it is' another ' church ' one could think but all the stained glass is so beautiful and you might not regret to have waited in line to see this amazing work of art.

One of the loveliest churches anywhere. The medieval stained glass and walls are magical. Practically hidden way off a busy Paris street, try to come at a time that's less popular, as lines can be very long.
Best Stained Glass Anywhere. Beautiful church very close to Notre Dame. Long slow line that is well worth it. Small church so once inside its a quick visit.
Unforgetable. The famous Sainte Chapelle is a gorgeous experience to enjoy... Thank you le "Centre des monuments nationaux" for this perfect renovation... it is a must-go when in Paris!

Dazzling. We were discouraged by the lines to tour Notre Dame but as we were walking back to our hotel, we noticed that there was next to no line to enter Sainte-Chapelle. It turned out that the line outside was to the security check and once you got through that, there was another line for tickets which was also short.Seeing the beautifully restored stained glass was beyond words. Pictures are not adequate. Well worth a visit.

My favorite spot in Paris!. Every time I enter Sainte Chapelle it takes my breath! I can stand in this space for some time and marvel at the beauty. It amazes me the color and light and the time of day can change this to a new place all together

This magnificent church brought tears to my eyes. As I entered the second story of the chapel, I cried from the beauty. The stained glass windows in both the upstairs and lower chapels are greatly detailed. A favorite in Paris will return for every trip.
So beautiful and accessible . Way more accessible than Notre Dame and rich in history and beauty. We did Fat Tire Tour and highly recommend them. Very accommodating to us with young kids (5 and 7).

Beautiful Hidden Gem. Sainte Chapelle is hidden within the compound of Palais du Justice courts in Ile de France. It was worth visiting, although it's not the first place one would think of when visiting Paris. This is for someone who has already seen Paris and wishes to see more than the usual spots. The magnificent stained glass windows are located upstairs. At first sight I did not really appreciate the panels. due to an overcast sky. I took some photos. But when the sun's rays shone through, it was magically breathtaking. The colors shone gloriously. I took a whole new set of pictures. It was used as the French king's chapel many centuries ago, but now it's no longer in use. The only drawback - just like many old buildings in Europe, the musty odor would give me nasal allergies. It's a nice quiet place where one cannot help but feel reverently peaceful. Many tourists were there too, but all of them were basking very quietly. I also enjoyed passing by the court house, seeing the judges go about their business in their gowns. (I am naturally curious about ordinary Parisian life). A great experience. Expect long queues outside and inside the compound.
Beautiful!. The most stunning room I have ever entered. The windows are amazing. So close to other attractions and not nearly as crowded.

Worth (re)visiting. I had visited Sainte-Chapelle once earlier. We had been to Musee de Cluny and Saint Severin later that day so I thought it would suit well to the theme to pay a visit to Sainte-Chapelle. The entrance fee is rather expensive (it is free for EU citizens under 25, though). But it is worth the price. Sainte-Chapelle is a stunning piece of medieval architecture. The highlight is of course the colorful stained glass panels all over the second floor. This place is one of its kind in the world.

Wow! Beautiful in the sunshine.. We visited on the last day of our holidays, feeling a bit cultured out, but I still 'oohed' when I walked up the little spiral stairway into the larger chapel. The stained glass is incredible, particularly if you go when it is sunny. Even the two hard to impress teenagers appeared to enjoy it in their own sweet way! A little pricey for the length of time you are in there, but I had a museum pass, which is great as you get to skip some queues and it includes so many places, including this one. I love the fact that teenagers go free to all these places!
Beautiful!. Another not-to-be-missed Paris attraction. The stained glass windows are beautiful, especially since the resent restoration/cleaning.

Gorgeous. I wanted to see this again as it had been many years. I purchased a concert ticket to avoid the lines. It was magic. Better than the first time because with the concert there was time to get all the photos I wanted and the music enhances the experience.

Breath taking!. What an amazing place to visit, the stained glass windows, so colourful and a story to go with each window. As I could not climb the stairs I was guided to the lift and got the benefit of seeing the upstairs part as well. We also came back a couple of days later for the Vivaldi Concert.....this was incredible with great acoustics to match. Well worth the visit.

Worth the long waiting line. Seeing the stained glass windows listening a chamber music concert does not go any better for a magical experience. Dont go yust for the vitrals. Go for the full experience.
Breathtaking. A Paris MUST! Unlike any church we have ever been in! The stain glass walls....speechless! Words cannot describe its beauty! Lines weren't long at all.

A little church that is just awesome to see!. So, this is a quick stop, maybe 30-45 minutes tops. The church is quite small, but has so much history. The first floor is mostly all very cool architecture and wall coverings dating back to the 1200's... Pretty impressive. But the second floor, which you access by walking up an 800 year old spiral, stone staircase (not great for those that are clostrophobic) to the most amazing displays of stained glass I've ever seen, much more impressive than Notre Dame. Each panel tells a story so just sitting there and going thru each panel, reading about the meaning of each panel is so cool. Just loved it! This is a small but powerful site to see! You GOTTA go!
What a work of art…... Truly dazzling! The stained glass of this Chappelle are so astoundingly beautiful….am short of words.

Off the radar of most. This isn't one of your most highly recommended sites of Paris however we thoroughly enjoyed looking at the ornate Stainglass which tells the story of the Bible. Amazing detail.I would recommend. You can spend 15–20 minutes there or an hour soaking everything in...

Beautiful vitrales but a bit too small. The vitrales are really beautiful, as you've seen in the pictures. However, I was expecting something larger, more majestic. This is actually a small chapel (the name is sainte-chapelle!) so I should have set the expectations properly. Still, beautiful vitrales. Very hot in the summer. Good to kill some time if you are around. Heard that the vitrales look particularly beautiful end of day, depending on the angle of the sun light. It may be worth a try next time.

Amazing . Amazing chapel. Be prepared for crowds. I have not ever been when there is a crowd. So much detail. The amazing glass, tiles on the floor, and of course the walls. Well worth the cost of admission.
Wonderful . I love this church and on my recent visit I got tickets to see lovely classical music here. It was a wonderful way to get to enjoy the beauty of this church.

Fabulous stain glass windows. Went to a concert one evening -- just breath taking! Acoustics were perfect and as the sun set all the windows looked different every 5 minutes. But it was hot! Take a fan!

Stunning. We never tire of Sainte-Chapelle. Walking up the winding stairs from the lower chapel to the upper level, and then stepping out into the breathtaking light of the main chapel, is one of the most glorious experiences in Paris. The cleaning and restoration of the stained glass was completed in 2015, and if at all possible, plan on visiting on a sunny day to fully appreciate the beauty of this gothic masterpiece.

Incredible glass. This iconic chapel is absolutely gorgeous. I don't think there's any place like it in the world. It was visually stunning, a must see. My only complaint was the huge crowd but I assume you could avoid this by going early.

Beautiful chapel! . I loved this chapel!!! We went here as a last minute sight! Get there early or you might have to wait in line! It is well worth the line! Also, check out the justice building next door as well!

The easiest place to see a magnificent Cathedral. The security lines are very long at Notre Dame de Paris, so you may not have time to get inside. But the line was much shorter at Sainte-Chapelle. It is the place for the fulness of the cathedral experience. It is on the Ile, very near Notre Dame. The stained glass windows and high ceilings will inspire you and make you feel small. This is good.
Stunning. Although only a small church, it has beauty like no other. Its not a big building so your visit can be as long or as short as you'd like, but it is not to be missed.

More impressive in person than expected. This was a most beautiful church. We went inside and walked around thinking that the the church was just OK. We then saw a staircase and walked up. When you reach the top floor, you see the wow moment. The stained glass windows were magnificent.

Stunning example of medieval stained glass. The lower and upper chapels are equally breathtaking, in their own way. The stained glass in the upper chapel is superb; I have never seen anything like it.
mesmerizing!. The view inside the Chappelle is amazing. The stain glasses just leave you speechless and in awe of them. Place must visit during the Paris visit.

A magical place in Paris.. This must be one of the most magical places anywhere. The stained glass all over is superb. The art is excellent, the feeling is just from another world, and I am not being religious here. We have visited Sainte-Chapelle several times, every time we visit Paris. This Gothic style church was built in the early thirteenth century and served as the residence of the French kings for a while. It took seven years to build, quite an achievement for that time. It has been damaged at various times and rebuilt and restored, most recently between 2008-2014. The stained glass windows are 15 metres high! The stained glass panes depict 1,113 scenes from the Old and New Testaments recounting the history of the world until the arrival of the relics in Paris. A visit to Sainte_Chapelle is a must for anyone.

One of the most beautiful chapels we've ever seen.. The claim to fame in this chapel is the nearly floor to ceiling stained glass. We went on a cloudy day but it was still awe inspiring. After Notre Dame walk over to Sainte Chappell it's only a few minutes away, you'll be thankful you did. It's the King's private Chapel, so it's easy to see all of it in an hour. If you know your Bible you'll be impressed that the stained glass panels tell the story of the scriptures from Genesis to Revelation. Get the audio tour headsets so as not to miss the minute details in these amazing panels.

Paris's Best Kept Secret!. Unfortunately I think Sainte-Chappelle is often forgotten as it does sit in the shadow of the Notre Dame Cathedral on Ile de la Cite. It is beautiful and not to be missed. While there are people, the sheer volume is nothing compared to the throngs you will find outside and inside the Notre Dame! My 13 year old daughter and I decided to venture in while wandering around Ile de la Cite and we both fell in love with all of the wonderful features! The stained glass windows are every bit as beautiful as those of the Notre Dame and Saint-Chappelle is every bit as charming as well. We also had tickets for one of the evening concerts and found this to be in our top ten activities in Paris as the string quartet music was almost haunting! A definite stop while in Paris!
Must see. The stained glass window is incredible, so is the old walls and designs. It's beautiful medevial structures are well kept
Stunning. SO beautiful - a little jewel. If you haven't got time to wait in the queue for the big Paris tourist attractions (and even if you have!) - come here for an hour.

Sainte-Chapelle: A Hidden Treasure. Sainte-Chapelle is a hidden treasure in the middle of Paris, near Notre Dame. its is a small church from the XIII century with magnificently beautiful and well preserved stain glass fro that era. The experience changes with the intensity of the sun outside, but the beauty of these windows is always there.

Best church in Paris. Shhhh...!. The most beautiful stained glass windows and an amazing story about how it was built. Small and intensely beautiful. Try to get tickets to one of the regular evening concerts. Simply stunning to sit & listen whilst contemplating the architecture & history. We come back here every time we come to Paris.

Amazing and beautiful - don't miss this gem!. We weren't sure if we wanted to take the time to visit Ste. Chapelle, since our Paris must-see list was long, but the friends we were traveling with did, and I'm sure glad we went. A cathedral built in the 1200s, this small yet gorgeous original stained glass and medievally decorated building is stunning. We wish we would've had time to stay for the Vivaldi string quartet concert that evening, which my cousin expressed "gives you chills" in this historical environment. Covered by the museum pass, and not crowded when we went around 4:00 pm in mid July.

Small chapel with beautiful stained glass windows. The Sainte-Chapelle is a small chapel situated near Notre Dame beside the Seine. It is situated within the complex which houses the Palais de Justice, but separate entry tickets (around 8 euros) are to be bought for each. Both places have security control like in airports and sharp / corrosive articles are likely to be confiscated. The accessible part of the chapel is in 2 floors and the most visually enchanting portion is on the 2nd floor. The tall stained glass structures are worth a visit.

combined tour with Notre Dame. This place wasn't on my radar, it was just a combined tour with Notre Dame, however it blew me away. Fascinating interior and I loved the stained glass. Well worth a visit!!

Sainte-Chapelle. I was recommend from friends to go, we had just finished Notre Dame and walked to Sainte Chapelle. We had a little wait in line, once inside there was a souvenir shop, the chapel is actually on the 2nd floor, the spiral stairs up to the chapel are in the corner and not well signed. If I hadn't seen pictures of the chapel, I could have thought the ground floor was it. Once I found the stairs, the chapel was beautiful, we were there on a drizzly day, so could imagine on a sunny day it would be magnificent.

Not to be missed..!. I've been to Paris a few times now, I've walked passed Sainte-Chapelle a couple times, but this time we did go in, the place is amazing!! Hard to describe - the amount of detail and stained glass...WOW! It's one of my favorite places now.

Beautiful- shouldn't have to pay though! . The Chapelle was absolutely amazing. The stain glass windows are definitely a beautiful sight to see. Disappointed that you had to pay €10 ($15AUD) to get into a chapel and a further €4.50 for an audio tour as everything is written in French (which is understandable, but more €€€€€). Very appreciative of the heavily armed guards at entry and exits.
Precious Gem in the City of Light. Go here when the sun is shinning to view the incredible stained glass panels in the upstairs chapel. You will not be disaapointed!

Amazing surround color at top of stairs. Reading about this experience is nothing like the colors when you reach the top of the stairs. Your are surrounded on all sides with the colors streaming through the stained glass windows. It leaves an incredible, lasting memory.
Really nice . Really beautiful chappel. I also recomend going to the catedral de notredam that is near here. For views the best spot is the montparnasse tower

Incredible!. Although this church is lesser known than Notre Dame it is just as beautiful! It is known for its stained glass windows and you can't believe how beautiful they are until you see them. Definitely worth a visit.

Sainte-Chapelle. Only one word describes the stained glass windows: Wow! I am not fond of climbing those stairs, but it is definitely worth it. This is not something that will take hours to see, but the beauty of those windows is worth taking the time to stop by.

Not much of a line up when early includes Marie Antoniette Museum on 15 Euros, no tripods allowed. It may appear like it was a church or chapel but it was not. The ceiling was really pretty. The main floor had a souvenir shop, the chapel was on the second floor. Both had a good place for photo but be aware that tripods are not allowed.

Best stained glass windows in the world in my opinion. Well worth the steps, not far fro Notre Dame and next to the palace of Justice. Get off the metro at Citie and also go wandering through the flower market.

Dream Come True. I first learned about Sainte-Chapelle almost 20 years ago, in a medieval art history course my freshman year of college. Seeing my professor's PowerPoint presentation of the stained glass windows made me even more interested in history, especially through art and architecture. Therefore, visiting this chapel was extremely exciting for me and I highly recommend a brief stop here when visiting Paris. The museum pass includes Sainte-Chapelle and the neighboring Conciergerie, and Notre Dame is just up the street so I planned to do all three in the same day, which was extremely manageable. This chapel is a beautiful example of gothic architecture and was built to house the King's relics from the Passion including the Crown of Thorns. A visit takes less than an hour and it's location near other significant attractions makes it a perfect stop on your route.
Beautiful Stained Glass!. Make sure you put this church on your itinerary for tours of Paris. The stained glass is breathtaking. Go on a sunny day if you can so you get the full effect.

(Psst....better than Notre Dame!). I would return Sainte-Chapelle again and again if I could. Solid stained glass...beautiful! There's a video inside, showing how they restored the windows a few years ago. Amazing. Don't kiss it!

A must visit. We were on a walking tour and we visited Sainte-Chapelle. Visiting in the afternoon (around 3pm) surprisingly there were no queues.Downstairs there is an interactive display showing the key features of Sainte-Chapelle. Nothing prepares you for the beautiful environment in the chapel itself. Our guide talked through the key stain-glass panels.Whether you are religious or not, Sainte-Chapelle is a must.Tip: before climbing up the stairwell, our guide blocked the stairs for about 20 seconds. Then we went up. He mentioned you do not want to get caught behind others as the stairwell is small.

Hidden gem in Paris. This is quite an impressive church, hidden within the Department of Justice area. I suggest you by tickets at the adjoining Conciergerie and visit the former prison which housed Marie-Antoinette before her beheading. The ticket then allows you to miss the queue and you can go straight into Sainte-Chapelle. Stunning floor to ceiling stained glass windows are the reason for the visit, and you will not be disappointed. Allow 60 - 90 minutes for you visit to both places.

One of the most amazing places. You can't imagine how amazing the Sainte-Chapelle is if you haven't seen it! It was built for the relic of the Crown of Thorns (not there anymore, but in the treasury of Notre-Dame). A fitting reliquiary!

Breathtaking Stained Glass In A Pint Size Historic Church.. This wasn't my first visit to St. Chapelle so knew what to expect but the riot of colour in the pencil thin gothic windows always takes your breath away, probably only Chartres is comparable.Security has always been strict here being next to the Ministry of Justice but there again this place is simply irreplaceable. You can buy combined tickets at the Conciergerie 100 yards away but there's no queue jumping. It's a good idea to do both sightstogether although they're something of a contrast1

A Sacred and Stunningly Beautiful Place. It is small-but amazing! Make sure you go upstairs to see the stained glass in mid day. Absolutely stunning and breath taking!! Check out the balcony for the continued 'story' carved into the stone. Take the opportunity to revel in the beauty of it!
Beautiful windows. Paris pass allowed us to fast track and then we were in the stunning surroundings in no time. Superb stained glass.

Amazing church!. We skipped Notre Dame Cathedral when we saw the massive line up and went here; no line ups and very reasonable cost. The restored stained glass is wonderful and awe-inspiring. Worth a visit for an hour.

Heavenly!. Visited on a previous trip but were fortunate enough to get tickets to a Pachobel/Albinoni/Vivaldi concert this time. Because of the intimacy of the space, and the extraordinary acoustics, it was a highlight of our trip. The chapel is well worth exploring at any time but doing so in conjunction with a concert is extra special. The stained glass defies description and the painted details invite close inspection. Another benefit of attending a concert is that you enter and leave through the law courts so have a quiet and uncrowded opportunity to examine soe of those spaces as well.

A peice of the rainbows end. tf you go on a sunny day, you will never forget this more than bright experience.But be aware, you have to be patient for the line. See if its possible to buy the ticket in advance.If you are lucky enough to go to a musical presentation there, you will never forget it
Visit to Sainte-Chapelle. Easy to access using the Cite metro stop. I was in awe as soon as I ascended the steps and got my first glimpse of the stain glass. It was lovely to view on a sunny day.

Wings of a butterfly. This place is a hidden gem. It is the only Cathedral that charges due to the location.
