When you walk in it will seem like you paid too much (which by the way they will ask you if you want to see the jail... don't do it, it's waste only do the church) I don't want to say too much. Just know that there is an up stairs and a down stairs and it's simply marvelous.

Truly amazing site to see. This small chapel is beautiful beyond words. However getting in is quite a feet. We got there when it opend in the AM and were #24 and 25 in line (I counted). It took 50 minutes to get in the gate. Granted once inside we had the chapel almost to ourselves. However by the time we got in the queue outside had several hundred people in it, many of which we not going to get inside that day, even if they waited in line the full 8 hours!

Stunning stained glass. We were overwhelmed by the art work in this church. The lower floor shows some of the restoration work they have done on the church and what pieces have crumbled off the exterior walls.We went upstairs and were amazed at the stained glass. After paying to get into the church we weren't too keen to pay for the audio guide. Sadly, I really wish we had. Once we were finished in the church my husband found a plaque full of descriptions for the stained glass (it is to the right of the open doors - try to find this it is very helpful!).We knew the windows told the stories from the books of the bible but again I wanted more info. We finally figured out that the story of Jesus crucifixion was behind the large altar at the end of the church. This was disappointing because the altar was placed in such a way that we couldn't see this art work.If you decide to go, which I do recommend, get the audio guide and I also recommend you arrive early. We got there 10 min before it opened and there was already a line up. You have to go thru extra security because the church is surrounded by the Palais de Justice.

Magnificent Stained Glass Windows. Just a short walk from Notre Dame you can discover this beautiful Gothic chapel within the walls of the Palais de Justice. The wait time to enter is a bit shorter than Notre Dame. The entrance fee for adults is €10 and an additional €4.50 for the one hour audio tour, but well worth it. You need to climb a narrow stone spiral staircase to access the main upper chapel and you're rewarded with sunlight streaming through the magnificent recently restored 49ft. stained glass windows depicting biblical scenes. There is also a short video available to view the restoration process.

Beautiful !. A beautiful church which is a two minutes walk from Notre Dame. Many will not go here but it is a must see.The glass windows are a marvel to look. We thoroughly enjoyed here. A must go if one is in Paris.

AMAZING!. We bought the museum pass. We started at Notre Dame but the line was so long we came here. We had NO IDEA what we'd be looking at! Entering the courtyard was very confusing. We then saw the line for the Chappelle. We were able to skip the line with the museum card. Sainte-Chapelle is remarkable. It was spectacular and I highly recommend stopping by.

Wow, spectacular renovation. Definitely worth a stop, a close walk from Notre-Dame. Get the audio tour to understand more of the intent of this chapel. It is not easy to spot right off the main street.

Way Lotta Pretty. Lisa's 1st time, my 3rd. A most favorite place. Beautiful stained glass, mostly naturally lit.
A must see. Ten Euros.
Well-marked, but Justice Center is built around it. Watch for signs of both.
Tom and Lisa
Broomfield, CO

Beautiful stained glass windows. Although admission was a bit overpriced, the church was amazing. The stain glass windows are beautiful. Tip for avoiding lines- We went as soon as they opened and there was only a 2-3 minute wait to get in.

Beautiful and unique chapel in central Paris. This chapel is unlike any other and worth the visit if you are in Paris. The stained glass is stunning and you could spend hours exploring the stories in each pane of glass.

Beautiful stained glass. This place does not get the glamour / fame the other churches get.
However it is beautiful and we were lucky not to have long lines when we visited. Make sure you go to the second level up the winding staircase.

Wow!. This church is STUNNING! Friends recommended that we visit this place and said that we would be surprised...we definitely were! I could not believe the amount of stainless steel glass and the detail in each window! You CANNOT miss this attraction while you're in Paris!

awful concert. this was my 3rd time watching a concert in this chapel in a span of 15 yrs. The 1st 2 times were fantastic. This time the concert was extremely boring. They played pieces that were not popular. It was advertised as Vivaldi but they didn't even play the most popular "four seasons" piece. There was a boring flute player that had some solo numbers. I remember the concerts before having popular all time classical pieces and the musicians were young and good looking. This time they were all old. Wasted my time and my money. Watched July 28

A hidden gem. Most think that Paris is defined by the cathedral of Notre dame but a second rare treat is the stained glass of Sainte-Chappelle. Inside the main sanctuary are 18 stained glass panels that illustrate many of the books of the bible. Much of the glass is original and it is a remarkable place to visit.

Visit in a SUNNY day. A beautiful chapel in Gothic style with breathtaking stained glass. From the lower level take the narrow stairs up to the upper level and enjoy the great stained glass windows.IMPORTANT: Visit during a sunny day (unfortunately it was cloudy during our visit).Would recommend combining a visit to the Notre Dame, Conciergerie + Saint Chapelle, buying a combo ticket for the last two attractions.

Breathtaking. It was smaller than I expected but it was more beautiful than I could have possibly imagined. The stained glass is literally the entire wall and the colours are truly incredible. It is hard to make out individual scenes in the window about the first few rows, but the beauty and the detail can still be appreciated and admired. It was busy but not crazy when I visited. This is the most beautiful church I have ever been in anywhere to date.

Beautiful stain glass windows. I was recommended to go here by a friend and was not disappointed. Its behind Notre Dame and although a small church the windows are spectacular. Although it wasn't a sunny day when i visited a sunny day would show the windows at their best

The most magnificent stained glass i have ever seen. This church is beyond amazing. While it is a small Chapel the stained glass windows are one of the most incredible I have ever seen. In fact I would be very hard-pressed to indicate any which I've ever seen which were as magnificent as this Chapel. And I have seen a lot of churches. We had to wait in line for almost two and a half hours even with our Paris pass to get into this church. I was to say the least unhappy. But the minute I saw these windows it was all worthwhile. If you like magnificent stained glass you can't miss this church
Lovely stained glass. The stained glass inside Sainte-Chapelle is extraordinary. The is a stop for a very quick visit. The judges and those going to the court next door are also very interesting.

Beyond words. We experienced Sainte-Chapelle and the Palace of Justice during the evening, by purchasing tickets to a classical music concert there. The chamber group was fabulous, the stained glass amazing in the evening light, and being able to leave through the beautiful gates of the Palace was the perfect end to the night.
Nice but nothing special. Very nice stained glass and nothing more. Expensive. Nothing special. If you have plenty of time then you can go there if you do not - not worth it.

Same island as notre dame. Beautiful chapel. Stark contrast to notes dame despite being built at the same time. Worth seeing. Get the museum pass - notre Dane Saint chappelle, and the concierger are all very close. The rick Steve's app has a cool historic walk as well.
Stunning stain glass. See when bright out. Short excursion but worth the trip. Stain glass is breathtaking. Visit when bright outside. Close to Notre Dame

Absolutely worth a visit !. This was my second visit to Paris, and I had already finished up a lot of the major touristy stuff on my first visit, so I decided to visit the Sainte-Chapelle on this visit. I was not disappointed at all. The chapelle is so breathtakingly beautiful with all its stain glass painted walls, and gorgeous ceilings, that its definitely worth a visit if you have the time.I highly recommend.

Beautiful, another must do in Paris. Saint-Chapelle is only a couple of streets away from Notre Dame but could not be more different. It is tiny, very old and the stained glass is just incredible. It is well worth taking time to read or listen to the story behind all the windows and the history of the chapel itself then sit about there and give yourself time to think about it. One of the highlights of our trip. It isn't a cheap visit but well worth the money. Highly recommended

Wonderful concert in a beautiful and intimate venue. My husband and I attended a concert at Sainte Chapelle one night that was a truly incredible experience. My husband actually picked up a flyer from our hotel which I typically write off as being to "touristy" but this was a treat. If you have an opportunity to attend any musical event here go for it and don't think twice. It was truly mesmerizing and one of the highlights of our trip.

WOW. WOW is all you can really say about Sainte-Chapelle. From the first floor initially I was like, "this is nice," but once you take the winding stairs up to the second level and the saturated light from the stained glass pours over you realize why this is such an attraction. And if you continue to stand near the entry stairwell, "WOW is what you'll hear over and over again.

Do not miss this beautiful church. We were shocked at the beauty of this church! The stain glass was exquisite. Coming the first thing in the morning would be a great plan. It was the surprise of our trip!
Beautiful. Finest stained glass anywhere. My son and I visited 10 Cathedrals and Abbeys on this vacation to France and the UK. None had stained glass windows to compare with Sainte-Chapelle
What a Chapel!!!. a few blocks away from Notre Dame, this lovely chapel is definitely worth a visit... you will see some of the best windows ever!!!
Most beautiful windows in Europe. . This little gem is a must-see each time I visit Paris. Fairly quick entry but €10 is a bit high. I think it's included in the Paris museum pass.
Breathtaking! . I am not one who cares about churches or stained glass, but this was probably my favorite place in Paris. Absolutely breathtaking. Like being inside a kaleidoscope.

Breathtaking stained glass windows. My husband and I were touring Paris and this was one of our first stops along the way. We visit the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Sainte-Chapelle was nearby. We took beautiful pictures both indoors and outdoors. What a breathtaking site this was. Wonderful pic ops. Don't forget to stop here on your tour.

must see. Sainte-Chapelle is very beautiful place
I spent two hours here because it's
interior is very attractive and colour combination is also good
previously it was a residence of King of France.

Simply Beautiful!!. What a sight, it was such a beautiful place to see and it has been on my Mum's bucket list for a very ling time!! So glad we all went and that it's one think we have ticket off the bucket list!! Well worth the time and money!!

Breathtaking. We had no plans to see Sainte-Chappelle until a friend recommended it. So we booked a skip-the-line tour for both Sainte-Chappelle and Notre Dame. I'm not a history buff or a lover of visiting old churches, but this place was breathtaking. Stained-glass, of course, is always pretty to look at - but the way it's done in Sainte-Chappelle, takes it to a whole other level, almost ethereal. It's only a few blocks from Notre Dame - it's worth a see!

Highlight of Paris!. We booked a half-day walking tour of Ile de la Cite, which included Sainte-Chapelle. This chapel was a highlight of our Paris visit! It's like being inside an exquisite, luminous jewel box. I've never seen anything so beautiful as this stained glass. Our guide, Manuela, was knowledgeable and provided wonderful historical context for the visit. We highly recommend this tour.
Not worth it!. Pretty impressive but most definitely not worth the wait time (Not too much for us) and for sure, not worth the money they charge. Once in and you look around, that's pretty much it.
Breathtakingly beautiful. Such a beautiful chapel. Probably the highlight of my trip to Paris city. The blue windows are magical and the entire church is brimming with life and energy. Just fabulous!
Beautiful!. Well worth a visit. The windows are just awe inspiring. We visited in the evening for a concert. I would recommend this to anyone such a beautiful chapel.

Booked a Tour. My teenage daughters and I booked a tour through Fat Tire (see my review of Fat Tire under Tours) called 'Skip the Line Notre Dame Towers and Sainte-Chapelle' and so glad we did. Having the passion and knowledge of our guide, Lavanya, enhanced the experience for us. The Chapelle itself is stunning, possibly the most beautiful building in Paris. There are large laminated cards that are freely available to explain all the different images and stories from the Bible in the stained glass windows. Make sure you visit this spectacular place.

Holly and colors . Saint -chapelle is very very special and attractive. You going up to stairs and suddenly you are shocked. . . Magical space, full of colour and surprising. I like it. This church is a one of the important hallmark in paris.

Best stained glass. This was such a small chapel but the stained glass was beautiful. Mostly in reds. The floor had very interesting mosaics that I took several pictures of. It was very hushed. We entered under the chapel in the gift shop then went up a tight stairwell to reach the chapel. It would not be easy for someone who had trouble walking.
Visually stunning. This small chapel is a wonderful gem! The full length, stained-glass windows are absolutely stunning.
Breathtaking!. We attended a concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons in Sainte-Chapelle. The beautiful music combined with the setting made for an experience I will never forget.
This is a must see. Easy walk from Notre Dame. Breathtaking stained glass - I wish it was a more sunny day but still beautiful.

Suprise your children with the upper level. When you go with unexpected guests (such as children or friends who don't do research ahead), say nothing while you view the pretty lower portion. Take them wordless to the upper level and let them be utterly delighted by the windows. Go on only sunny days. Don't forget to look at the wall carvings, which are in fantastic shapes and tell familiar biblical stories that will delight even the little ones.
Impossible not to visit it!. One of the most beautiful chapels in the whole world. It´s amazing! It´s very near the Notre Dame Cathedral.
The Glass!. Everyone talks about the stained glass at Sainte Chaelle. All the hype is true. Don't miss it, it's spectacular.

Go to a concert at Sainte-Chapelle! You won't regret it.. We visited Sainte-Chapelle to see the windows and it's a beautiful place. But if you really want to experience it, go to a concert there. We heard a chamber ensemble perform Baroque music (including Vivaldi) and it was breath-taking. You can get tickets for the concert at the tabac across the street.

Sainte-Chapelle is SO beautiful!. I first experienced Ste. Chapelle 25 years ago and it made a lasting impression on me for its jewel box size and incredible stained glass windows. Skip the line with the museum pass and head right in - it's small and beautiful; take a card to read about the different stories represented by each stained glass window. You're in and out in one hour and perfectly placed to head over to Notre Dame for the grand cathedral viewing. Don't miss out on this lovely gem in Paris!
Stunning. Simply stunning - the architecture, light, colours.eu10 entrance fee, but well worth the experience - a must see, possibly more than the much larger N.D. Cathedral - less of a queue though
What a beautiful place. I would highly recommend a stop here. We lucked out and, despite not having tickets in advance, we got in right away. This really is a magical place.

Fantastic catheedrale. Everyone crowds to go into Notre Dame and doesn't realize that steps away is a smaller cathedrale which is prettier and has some of the most amazing stained glass windows in any church in France. Definitely a must visit spot.

Small but beautiful. I highly recommend going to Sainte-Chapelle. Admission was 10 euros, which I didn't think was too bad. King Louis IX built it to hold the crown of thorns he had purchased, so spires on the outside are decorated with the crown of thorns. The stained glass is spectacular. If you want to see an excellent example of Gothic architecture, you can't beat this one.
Spectacular. Sometimes overlooked but an absolute must in Paris, breathtaking chapel with the most beautiful windows in the world! My absolute number one in Paris
wow 3 times. As soon as we entered the firs level of the Chapelle my wife and 2 "kids " went WOW , It is so nice to hear that from teenagers since nothing seems to amuse then this days !!!

a must-see to be bathed in colors and light!. The Sainte-Chapelle is a gorgeous Gothic chapel with windows that tell the stories of the Bible and of the relic that used to be housed here. It's a block from Notre Dame, so swing by when you're on the island! And if you're coming in the (crowded) summer, go on the night they have extended hours, and arrive 30 minutes before closing. You'll be among a handful of people and can appreciate the space as royalty did - plus you get to see the rose window at its best, with the sun setting behind it. There is an audio tour as well as helpful flyer to describe the windows and the layout of the chapel. Plus there's a great (silent) video running in the chapel that shows the process of restoration that the windows have undergone. Don't miss it!

Defines beautiful chapel. Europe, France especially, is famous for its Gothic cathedrals, but none of them approach the sheer beauty of the chapel at Sainte-Chapelle. We were there during the evening and had the opportunity to experience the sun setting through this amazing collection of stained glass windows. The room itself is small, by cathedral standards, which is really a blessing as it allows you to take your time to concentrate on select portions of the room. An absolute must for anyone visiting Paris; close to Notre Dame and, maybe, even worth the time instead-if your pressed for time.

My personal favorite monument on Il de la Cite, in all of Paris in fact. Sainte-Chapelle is mind-blowing. When you climb that little circular staircase and step out into the upper chapel, every person has the same response. Wow. The floor-to-ceiling extraordinarily gorgeous stained glass is so wonderful. I just walked around again and again, looking at it all. There are laminated cards with information about the various windows and so forth, but it never occurs to me to refer to them, I am just so enthralled by the building's beauty.

Now go here and have your mind blown.. To marvel at ancient stained glass in so many churches and chapels in Europe is such a gurgly delight, but Sainte-Chapelle is to be stood on a rock at the top of the ocean and lifted to heaven.The glass is ALL... hardly enough stone to hold it in place, and it is SMALL... nothing vast and religiony here... you can imagine the Kings and Queens and small court worshipping here each morning before petit dejeuner. It is a delightful and silently uplifting place. If you CAN they do have concerts there sometimes, not expensive, but aaaahhh to sit there and listen to Vivaldi or Mozart and just let the mind go ..... YAY!

Breathtaking stained glass. It looks like an ordinary church from the outside, dull and old. Once you walk upstairs, you will be amazed by the stained glass. Very beautiful and I think it's by far the most beautiful stained glass I've seen. There was no line when we went there, it was on a weekday 2 weeks ago. Remember to pick up the guide in the rack next to the staircase as it explains how stained glass is made and how to read the windows, it tells the story of mankind from the Creation to Christ's Resurrection. Amazing.
The most extraordinary stained glass windows. a hidden gem, a most extraordinary example of gothic architecture. Interestingly located within a government compound. Highly recommended!

Some times things are so beautiful, you cry. This is one of them.. As the title of the review says, I cried. It was the #1 thing I wanted to see in Paris. We got there very very early this April. There was almost no line up (waited at security for about 5 minutes) and we were in. To be sure finding the right entry way is tricky and I can see how this would cause frustration as well as the heightened security due to the chapel's location. BUT. It. Is. Worth it. On a sunny day you feel like you have found the back door to heaven. It is incredible. Even out 5 year old and 7 year old were struck mute in awe. We didn't spend long there, but that time was not something any of us will soon forget. I do regret not getting the audio guide but it wasn't practical at the time with our kids.

Breathtaking views. Not a huge fan of stained glass, mostly because they are too busy and too many colours, but have to say, this is the most beautiful church I have ever seen in my life. Every one comes back from Paris boasting they went to the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and the Notre Dame Cathedral. You never hear anyone say they went to Saint-Chapelle!!! PUT IT ON YOUR TO DO LIST. Not to say Notre Dame isn't beautiful too, but this church is just so unique, it is not something to miss if you are ever in Paris. The pictures on line simply do not do it justice. Some things just have to be seen in person to be appreciated for their true beauty.
Gasp. As you arrive at the top of the stairs your body will gasp in bewilderment. Very very beautiful. I'm extremely glad we visited.
it simply takes your breath away. seriously, everyone slows down as they climb the stairs into the chapel. It just simply is a beautiful jewel box.

Wow! A must see!. We visited the Sainte-Chapelle. The chapelle has two floors. The first one is quite dark, but need to be seen. The upper floor is incredible. The glass windows are huge and incredible. A must see.

Amazing Church!!!!!!. I have visited Paris 5 times and never been to Saint Chapelle.
I was amazed to see how beautiful this church is. It is a must.
You can't miss it.

Must visit. Most people visiting Paris go to NotreDam , but in my opinion, if there is one church you have time to visit in France it should be Saint -Chapelle! They have the most amazing stained glass I have ever seen in my life. If possible go right before the sun sets so you can see the reflection of the sun through the stained glass.

Well worth a visit. This is a beautiful Chapelle, the stained glass windows are something very special and unique. There is a more intimate atmosphere here than some of the more larger churches, which enhances the visit. It is very near the Notre Dame cathedral, so easy to visit both whilst in the area.

Simply breathtaking!. The smallish chapel has the most exquisite stained glass. If you enjoy classical music I highly recommend seeing a concert in the church. You will be able to take in the beauty of the glass while listening to concertos. If you don't have time, or the inclination for that, I recommend visiting on a sunny day. The sunlight streaming through the glass is stunning.

Spectacular . Words are simply not enough to describe how incredibly beautiful this place is. We couldn't stop saying wow and staring. The place commands all your attention because its so awe inspiring. We fell in love. Be sure to bring a camera to try and capture the beauty and also pick up the little guides to the side that tell you the story of whats going on in each glass painting. Really fascinating. If you want to read the paintings..you need many hours id imagine. .maybe days..unsure. Make sure you visit this. The most beautiful cathedral around.

Worth the Wait. The line is usually pretty long for this one but it is worth the wait. It's like being inside a music box. They were cleaning the glass at the front when I was there last so parts were blocked off. If you're brave, lay down in the center of the floor and look up!
Impressive. This is a small church, but it is very beautiful. Close to Notre Dame, even if there is a line (like everything during the Summer) the cost is quite reasonable.
Don't miss it. .I strongly advise going into the Chapelle. It is overwhelming. I didn't had any line so I got inside very fast, but heard sometimes the lines are very long.

Beautiful Stained Glass. Although this cathedral does not have the grandeur of Notre Dame, the stained glass windows on the second floor make it a must see. Absolutely stunning!!! Do not miss the second floor...so much prettier than the first.

Beautiful!. I'm not a big fan of visiting cities, museums and in this case chapels but this one is beautiful!! Very interesting. Make sure to read the guide they provide to understand the murals. Must see

Jewel box of Paris chapels--do not miss it. A short walk from Notre Dame is this unassuming entry to the place that King Louis built to store holy relics--Saint-Chapelle. A rather long wait to get in there for us as it was a nat'l holiday. You enter what seems to be a basement with lovely, ornate & colored walls--then ascend a narrow staircase to--astonishing beauty. Walls of stained glass--all restored in the last few years--soar to a vaulted ceiling of blue and gilt, each window of different shapes and panes telling various holy stories. We went in the late afternoon and the windows glowed. On the west end is a rose window, and doors used by the king to enter the chapel. Tours seemed to be offered only in French, but there are laminated boards in various languages that help explain the history and restoration process. My favorite historical place in Paris, period.

Sainte-Chapelle. This is the second time I have visited the chapel and it is still one of the most beautiful sights I've ever seen. You can sit and look at the incredible stained glass windows and all of their intricacies for a long time! Do not miss this sight. I think it costs around $10 to visit.

Better than Notre Dame. We visited the Sainte-Chapelle church after visiting Notre Dame and we were so happy that we did! Notre Dame was so dark and underwhelming as compared to the beauty of the stained glass work in the Sainte-Chapelle.
STUNNING!. One of the most beautiful places on earth. You must go there when you visit Notre Dame, It will take your breath away.

Small but beautiful!. This is a very small cathedral with beautiful stained glass. It won't take you long to view the two floors. It is wonderful to view each of the panes of glass that follows the Passion Story. It tells a great story, but will not take you long to visit.

A gem and classic example of the best of gothic architecture and artistic vision. Almost every time we visit Paris we stop in at Saint Chapelle to enjoy its beauty and inspiration. Almost in one view the whole of its meaning and representation can be imagined. I appreciate its size and sparkle, it's splendor and preciousness, its history and timelessness. In the summers concerts are scheduled each evening for good value and a chance to sit quietly and take in the marvel of this building while listening to the sounds of Bach or Vivaldi or Beethoven.

an absolute gem of gothic architecture. The Sainte-Chapelle was built to house holy relics - Christ's crown of thorns and pieces of the true cross - which cost more than the chapel itself cost to build. The light cast by the stained glass windows is the highlight, and to experience it at its best, join the line at least 30 minutes before opening time so that this tiny chapel is not crowded when you get in there. Head straight upstairs via the tiny spiral staircase and prepare to be entranced. Don't forget to look down at the floor tiles, either. You will see why.

Exquisite . You must visit this Church when you go to Paris. We were told about it, the 1st time we went, by a Doctor friend, and have now seen it 3 times and told all our friends about it. The lead light is exquisite, and unique.

Hard to believe the work. Not as popular as some attractions but very well worth it. The windows are works of intricate art. You really need time to study them to appreciate what it took to make them!

Must See. The chapel was much smaller than I anticipated but despite that I could easily have sat all day just looking and taking it all in. Such a beautiful place to visit. This was my favourite place in the whole of my rip....recommend

"Beautiful Church". We had not intended to visit Sainte-Chapelle but did os on a whim. We were so pleased that we did. It is beautiful. We looked around downstairs which is lovely in itself. We then walked upstairs. Nothing had prepared me for the beautiful sight as I got to the top of the stairs. It was a lovely sunny day outside and this meant that the stain glass was shown at its most glorious. It seemed not to be as busy as many of the other Paris sights but this should be on everyone's to see list.

the crown jewel of gothic churches in Paris. only 5 minutes walk away from Notre Dame Cathedral, this much smaller church will wow you with its beautiful and color stained glasses dating back to 13th century. There is a bit of a queue to get inside the church but its definitely worth the wait!

Try a Concert. We visited one afternoon and saw they also have evening concerts. So, returned for a Vivaldi -Four Seasons concert. What an amazing experience to listen to beautiful music in this gorgeous setting.

fantastic work of old masters. this outstanding Chapelle in gothic style one of the great historical monuments of medieval times of stained glass collections. It will always remain a mystery for me how old masters could achieve such thoroughness of execution and beauty.

The most amazing church I have visited!. I have been to a lot of churches on my travels and I mean a lot. I used to get dragged around by my parents when we went travelling as a kid but now that I am older I really appreciate them. I had visited Paris 5 times before I finally managed to visit the Sainte-Chapelle and I am so glad I did on this trip. It is amazing! The stain glass windows are like nothing you have seen before - so I absolutely recommend this church as a place that you spend the time to visit. Arrive early to be ready to wait in a long line but it is worth it. If it is raining make sure you take a umbrella or rain jacket as when waiting in the line to get in their is no cover or places to sit and stay dry - trust me on this point as I got wet...
Amazing stained glass. This should be a must do on any visit to Paris. It doesn't take long out of your day, but the stained glass is worth the price of the entry ticket.

Beautiful glass!!. This chapel has astonishing stained glass. The line was long, but very quick moving. Be sure to go upstairs when you get there. We did not realize that the main beauty was on the second floor. The stairs are steep and not conducive to those who have difficulty walking or bad knee problems. No elevators are available.

Aaaaawesome!. There is so much to see in Paris -- and I liked Notre Dame very much -- but St Cappelle was such a beautiful place to absorb the handiwork of others... a long, long time ago: A Masterpiece. Slow down and take in all the St. Chapelle has to offer.
An added bonus. Visit Sainte-Chapelle, the history of this amazing place is incredibleand the inside brings you back in time.
A hidden gem. The church is beautiful and not at all crowded. There was plenty of time to look around and enjoy the stained glass.

Breathtaking!. When we entered the chapel, I gasped - the beauty is indescribable. I cannot imagine what it took to construct this masterpiece. I wish we had more time to explore this wonder - absolutely gorgeous and a must see!

Unbelievable!. Most people go to Notre Dame and might miss this gem that is nearby but a little hidden. The stained glass windows are like nothing you have seen. I like that you go into a very pretty little room at first and people think that is it...then their faces are fun to watch as they go up the steps and enter "the room". It blows you away. Especially when you understand the age and of it and see the complexity of the glass. Very worthwhile and highly recommended and nice walk from Notre Dame.

Awe-inspiring stained glass in historic setting. Climbing the spiral staircase and emerging upon the second floor surrounded by light-filled stained glass was stunning. 3 pm on a Wednesday afternoon there was no line, which felt miraculous.

Number 1 on my must see in Paris. If you have 30 minutes spare in your Paris schedule and this is not already on the list, add it. When you visit, remind yourself when it was built, what has happened since then and how fragile the glass is. Simply amazing.
Unreal. Unbelievable Church. The stained glass in the sanctuary alone is worth the trip. Lines not bad, can get in with the museum pass.

beautiful windows. atleast 30 min wait if you cannot skip the line with a museum pass/not with a guided tour. Lower level has very informative pamphlets in several languages - can alos be downloaded online. Upper level is amazing - so well-lit and gorgeous stained glass windows and rose window. My favorite chapel so far!!

STUNNING and tiny!. Had no idea how small this venue was so be sure to go when its not too crowded. we lucked out on a summer day with it busy but not awful. the glass and the height are STUNNING. its amazing the beautify of such Huge glasswork. when you enter you come into what was the basement and now is the gift shop, so be sure you know to go upstairs! Really gorgeous

Beautiful, give yourself some time.. Look at the schedule ahead of time to see if there will be any concerts. We hapenned upon a school demonstration of gregorian chant (with a violinist). It was really amazing to sit and listen, while gazing at the windows. Still needs some serious repair on the floor (windows were repaired/cleaned a few years ago). This costs! For some reason we took the Rick Steve's free walking audio tour and didn't realize it would have stops on the route that cost.
Beautiful stained glass windows.. This is a beautiful church with amazing stained glass windows. Well worth a visit and the walk up and down the stairs. Not big inside and can get crowded.
Amazing glass windows. Such a beautiful sight to see. The Chapel is amazing and although there were renovations being done at the time of our visit it was still well worth the visit.
Quiet beauty. we loved this chapel....beautiful and not overly crowded. People were respectful here and you could hear yourself think.

The Most Beautiful Church in Paris. Not as busy as Notre Dame but just a few blocks away is this hidden gem. No line ups, and a reasonable entrance fee. Built for the Royal family to use, the lower chapel was where the servants and members of the household went to church, Upstairs had stunning stained glass windows. Could imagine Louis XIV or Marie Antoinette there. Large Cards available near the exit to describe all the glass panels and where they fit in telling all the old and new testament stories.
Amazing stain glass. This is a small church with a big punch. The stain glass was the most beautiful I have ever seen. This should take your breath away, amazing.

Sainte-Chapelle. This church is just west of the Notre Dame and the spectacular stained glass up the winding staircase is well worth the additional exercise.Every time I'm in Paris in visit both churches, but I especially enjoy Sainte-Chapelle!
Beautiful restoration!. The stained glass restoration was an incredible endeavor and is truly spectacular! We could have remained there for hours.

Great structure with amazing stained glass!. Visit this wonderful structure when you go to Notre Dame. Sainte-Chapelle is close to Notre Dame. The stained glass and gothic architecture are awesome. We immersed ourselves in the amazing stained glass art. We did not do a guided tour, and were happy to do the tour ourselves. However, we saw guided tours there. Next time, we would love to do a guided tour so that we get more detailed information on intrepetations of the stained glass panels.

Stunningly glorious!. Twelve stained glass windows depicting biblical stories and the four first books of the Old Testament. Large laminated cards tell the story of every window including how the colors were created. Near the bottom of the stone arch at the entrance is carved senses depicting Stories from the bible - the days of creation, Noah's ark, ... Remember the common man had no bible to read until the Reformation. There is construction outside and the top floor which is accessible by narrow winding concrete stairs not for the faint hearted. Public restroom accessible in adjourning courtyard to the Conciergerie another must see. There is a security screening prior to entering. They did allow water bottles.

VERY beautiful church inside and out. This chapelle has very beautiful glasspaintings on its windows. Painting show the whole story from the start of Holy Bible to the death of Jesus Christ. Chapelle isn't so big like some cathedral but it is still a must thing to see.. :)

Almost equal to Notre Dame. Next to Notre Dame, but smaller. However, the stained glass windows are more impressive. Entrance tickets to both are included in the Paris Museum Pass, so stop at both. Don't wait in the long ticket line if you have the Paris Museum Pass; just walk in. Be sure to go upstairs to King Louis IX's private chapel.

Disappointing. We visited here not knowing that renovations were in the process. Dissppointed that we could only view part of this beautiful church.
The stained glass windows are truly magnificent. Try and visit on a sunny day to maximise its beauty.

Probably one of the least visited, and most beautiful.. Sainte-Chapelle, is one of the most beautiful sites in Paris, it's absolutely spectacular both upstairs and down. Beautiful glass and architecture.

Evening concert at St. Chapelle ... our second year in a row. We visited St. Chapelle last year and enjoyed an evening concert there. So when we visited Paris again this year, we decided to try it again. What a beautiful and moving experience. Even if you're not into classical music, please do this! The gorgeous cathedral, the incredible acoustics, and the lovely music made this a highlight of our trip to Paris
less well-known than Notre Dame but I prefer it. I'm happy if the crowds want to go to Notre Dame because then it means less crowding in this lovely Cathedral. A place of beauty.
Beautiful. A very pleasant surprise. We loved going to the second floor to see the windows. Amazing work and a joy to see
Exquisitely beautiful!. Take time to see this stunning cathedral. The stained glass is breathtakingly beautiful, especially when the sun shines through. It can be a quick stop, but not to be missed.
Wow!. At the end of the stairs - wow.Well worth a visit!Also the church below is beatiful. The magnificent colours

Jewel box. Sainte Chapelle feels like an architectural jewel box, gem of the middle ages, so precious that it almost feels too good to be true. Do note that it's located inside the Palais de Justice and that you have to go through the security controls!

Excellent - do this with the Conciergerie!. We booked online for a ticket to both the Saint-Chapelle and Conciergerie and this is a great value. We went to the Conciergerie first, which was a great choice because it was lovely and quiet and empty. By the time we were ready to be on, tour buses had arrived and it got noisy but still room to enjoy all the wonderful exhibits - including an actual guillotine blade! Sainte-Chapelle was gorgeous. Mike sure you go upstairs!

some of the most amazing mediaeval stained glass anywhere. A chapel built by Saint Louis to house what he believed was the Crown of Thorns of the crucifixion. On 2 levels, both remarkable, but the upper one-accessed by a spiral staircase, is sublime. Likely the finest mediaeval stained glass in the world. A must see among top Paris sights.
Beautiful stained glass!. The stained glass on the upper part of this chapel were simply gorgeous. I loved looking at the details. Would like to recommend this place.

Astonishing in beauty as well as historical refernce. I had seen so many cathedrals by the time I got to Paris on my first trip to Europe, that when my friend practically dragged me there I was like, "Oh Boy, another church"... I climbed the narrow stone staircase to the main chapel room with little enthusiasm, only to be met with an astonishing, and I mean astonishing, spectacle of light and color that left me astounded. Walls of color and light pour into the senses, and I just sat on one of the gothic benches, almost in a meditative state.If you opt for one of the concerts, you will find the acoustics perfect, and again, what better atmosphere for the lover of classical music.Historically the chapel is fascinating as well, when you realise the windows have survived upheaval, power struggle, revolution, monarchy and republic, world wars, spanning 700 years.The Saint Chappell is a MUST-see for any aesthete or lover of history.

What a Gorgeous Stain glassed Chapel. Sainte-Chapelle is a stunning stain glassed chapel. It goes from top to bottom and is awe inspiring. There is plenty of seats so you can just sit in quite and take this gorgeous building all in. They have lamented cards in different languages so you can read the story about this great chapel. Well worth a visit.

So glad we went!. I had read from other trip advisor fans that this was a hidden gem. We went early and had no lines. The stained glass is astaounnding and so beautiful with the sun shining through. It is about a block from Notre Dame Cathedral.

A beautiful surprise. Wasn't expecting such a beautiful building especially from the outside. Incredible stained glass windows and church decoration.Hard to find and bit pricey for the time you spend there, but personally I think it's worth the visit. Maybe look at getting the Paris museum pass if you're planning to do lots of sights

Do not miss this gem. Hidden away in the courtyard of a palace that is now a police headquarters not far from Notre Dame. Amazing stain glass chapel still under renovation. Arrange to get there as the sun begins to set for a breathtaking experience.

One big beautiful chapel with a picturesque enormous 360 degree? stained windows.. The one room chapel is enormous with very beautiful display of stained windows. The price charged for this minimal bit beautiful thing to see is too much. I could have saved my money
Jaw dropping . This beautiful chapel is a must see. Intricate stained glass tells the story of the Christian Bible in breathtaking panoramic views. Awe inspiring.

Beautiful, but as it is not an active church it charges admission. It is worth your time to study up about it a bit before you go so that you can appreciate the art and symbolism to the fullest. Its smallish size makes it easier to become fully absorbed than is easy to manage at a full blown cathedral. Look at the pictures on the web - they don't do it justice asthe stained glass is makes the beautity of the place come alive, even if it's cloudy.

Don't miss the second floor. The private chapel of Saint Louis. It would be easy to miss the narrow, winding staircase in the corners to the second floor where the most beautiful stained glass windows fill the walls. Also note strict closing time. The people right behind us were denied admission.

Beautiful windows. These windows are worth seeing when the sun is bright outside -- it makes the glass so bright as it streams though. This is perfect for a self tour unless you desire a lot of details. The brochures there explained a lot.

Fabulous stained glass. Buy tickets online to avoid the long line. When you first enter you think 'wow this is nice but not worth the line,' then you go up some steps and it is totally amazing to see all the stained glass windows and structure of the building. Most incredible place to visit and well worth it. Learn the history of the man who built it so you understand the story on the glass.

Not to be Missed!!. Yes, Notre Dame which is walking distance from Ste. Chapelle is beautiful. I especially think that Notre Dame is worth walking around on the outside. But, if you have to stand in line to go inside, rather walk over to Ste. Chapelle and stand in line there (or buy your timed ticket ahead of time). For a Jewish girl from NYC, this is the only place that could convert me to Christianity! I guarantee you will be in awe of the walls of stained glass windows. The tiled floor, the bas relief, the sculptures are all jaw dropping. It's a small-ish space at the top of a stone spiral staircase. Go!
heavenly. The light inside the chappel is just heavenly. The craftsmaship of the stained glass, the cealing above your hebdomadaire see ms suspended and weightless.
Small church with amazing stained glass. This is a really small church and you stand in line a long time to get in. The Stainglass on the inside is impressive but I've seen better.

even a nicer visit than Notre Dame. Because it was so close to Notre Dame and we had read how beautiful it was; we went to Sainte Chapelle on the same day. It was definitely not as crowded so it added to the nice experience. I really felt that it was more beautiful than Notre Dame.

Stunning. Go out of your way to see this!. We visited on a slightly rainy day. The wait was not long, maybe 15 minutes. Once inside security and the ticket window, walk up a winding staircase and be prepared to be amazed. Best sight in Paris. This is my third trip to the city, and Sainte Chapelle is the sight above all others. My college aged son was mesmerized by the stained glass. Each window tells a story, much of it familiar and you can find lots of vignettes you will recognize. There is no way to prepare you for the glory of colors that shine through every direction. Take your time, take a camera, spend an hour and look for Noah, Adam and Eve, and other stories throughout. If you see one thing in Paris, make it this. If you see two or three, make this one of them!

nice but not exceptional. Felt this place was quite overrated; yes the glass windows are nice, but nothing too amazing. Feel it is not on par with some of the other attractions as highly rated on trip advisor.

Why didn't I hear about this before?. This place is amazing. You got through security and walk over, get a ticket and go in and think is this it? And then you go up the stairs and get your socks blown off. Amazing architecture, art, and preservation. Just go and look around. Bring a camera but sod to spend all your time looking through the lens. Amazing place.
On the recommendation of a guide.... On the recommendation of a guide we visited this cathedral/chapel. The beauty practically converted my husband.
Mesmerizing. This one of the prettiest churches we have ever seen. The downstairs is beautiful but the stain glass upstairs is breathtaking!
Amazing!. Well worth the €10 entrance price! The Sainte-Chappelle really has the wow factor! It's only a short walk from Notre-Dame so you could visit the two on the same day.

Listening to Vivaldi at Sainte-Chapelle - quite am experience.... My wife and I recently attended a Vivaldi concerto at Sainte-Chapelle where an 11 piece orchestra ensemble performed the Four Seasons.
The effect of listening to great music while admiring the stained glass windows with the sun streaming in was quite a surreal experience and would highly recommend trying at least once...

Gorgeous Stained Glass Church. St Chapelle has two levels. The bottom floor for non royals is pretty but no comparison to the top floor which is walls of stained glass windows depicting bible stories. Originally built by King Louis IX for Jesus' crown of thrones, one of the most beautiful churches in Paris. A must see!

See Sainte-Chapelle. I believe the nickname for this chapel is "The Jewel Box Church" and rightfully so. The stained glass windows create a stunning jewel-like effect. The chapel is very, very old and the artifacts and art from previous centuries are simply fantastic. There is a small fee to get in, but considering that the Notre Dame is free, pay the entrance fee for Sainte-Chapelle and experience the beauty. Clean restrooms. Non-smoking. Steep, winding staircase. Not sure if there is an alternative route.

One of the most stunning rooms on earth!. You walk up to the Chapel, turn the corner and are awed by the inspiring beauty and light. It literally takes your breath away. Spend a little time and sit if you can and breath it in. Go when it opens, it's so much better with fewer people.

My favorite spot in Paris. This royal chapel, not far from Notre Dame but certainly not as well known, is a spectacular Gothic jewel. I have never been as wowed by stained glass and a feeling of being in a special place. There is a wait to get in which is annoying, but visiting creates a numinous experience you'll never forget. Tip: A sunny day will improve the light in the Chapellet as well as your experience of waiting in the courtyard.

If you love stained glass, this is a must see. The care of the reconstruction of the stained glass is sublime. There is so much to see. If you are a biblical historian you can follow the entire bible through the most amazing stained glass. Worth the €10.

Beyond expectations - visted in May, 2012. Take your time here there is so much history in the glass, it's Truly breathtaking. Even though there was some construction type maintenance work going on, it didn't take away from the visit at all.
Don't miss it. Took a tour which included this church, and the incredible windows produced a lot of audible gasps and "wows". It takes a lot to amaze my kids and this did it.
Incredible. Not only is this attraction stunning, it kept the interest and attention of our four-year old! If you are impressed by Notre Dame, Sainte-Chapelle will blow your mind!

Brings tears to my eyes. The first time I saw Sainte-Chapelle (1999), beauty made me gasp and brought tears to my eyes. I wondered if my response would be the same in 2016. Yes, its beauty still resonates on some physical level and I choked back tears again although I was glad they fell. Many more people were there in 2016, and filled the space, but the towering stained glass can be enjoyed with no interference from humans. They instill reverence and I could have stayed longer just absorbing the feeling.

A gem...!. I've been here several times and it never ceases to impress me. This "gem" is hidden behind the walls of the Hall of Justice. Going into the upper chamber is a "wow". The stain glass is absolutely stunning.
Beautiful and impressive. Small Chapelle but really beautiful and impressive! The second floor is unbelievable! Each window tell you a different chapter in the bible!

Unbelievable Stained Glass. You'll enter at the lower level and your first thought may be what's the big deal. But then you'll see the small narrow spiral stairways with no signs and you'll go upstairs to an unbelievable expanse of stained glass and delicate Gothic architecture. It's a few blocks from Notre Dame and well worth the visit.

astounding beauty. The Saint Chappell, a block away from Notre Dame is a hidden gem.This was the King's chapel and in the 12th century Louis endeavoured to live his life as depicted in the biblical story which unfolds in the stain glass windows. The large rose window in the west tells the story of Revelations. The stain glass windows reach from floor to ceiling and has a magnificent presence. Next door ,is the old kings palace, before they moved to Versailles,which is now the Palace of Justice,and the old prison where the trials were held at the French revolution 1790-1795 including the royal family. Robespierre being arrested in 1795 and the bloodied guillotine was put to rest.

Vivaldi Concert in Sainte-Chapelle. What a wonderful experience to hear Vivaldi's Four Seasons performed in the beautiful chapel! With the light of the sunset illuminating the famous stained glass windows, we were treated to a great performance by Les Solistes Francais orchestra and the amazing and charismatic violin soloist Paul Rouger. We were transported, an evening to remember.
Make a Big effort to visit this!. I took a tour and was at a time that a classical music performance. It is so very beautiful and ison same island as Notre Dame.

Great for a quick stop. We stopped in here on our way to the Pompadieu, as it was free with our mueseum pass. It was stunning. All the stained glass is on display right now, none is under restoration.

Thrilling!. A friend and I reserved seats for a beautiful evening concert (Vivaldi and Pachelbel) in the Sainte-Chapelle on our last night in Paris. Such gorgeous music in such a spectacular setting ... the whole experience was like a dream!

Inspiring. Please go see this Chapel if you get the chance. It is so beautiful on the ground floor, but when you climb the stairs to the 2nd level you are awestruck! Stained glass windows all the way to the ceiling - truly inspiring. This is a medieval Gothic chapel built from 1239 to 1248 commissioned by King Louis IX and includes Christ's Crown of Thorns.

An Amazing Venue!. I had heard so much about this - and I was not disappointed! The stained glass windows are just amazing! One point - in my reading I was cautioned against the "long lines" to get through security. We waited in a line, but it was not terribly long and it moved quickly enough. It is worth the wait!
Sainte-Chapelle. This is a lot smaller of a place as it seems in the pictures and for all the hype it gets, but beautiful nonetheless. A quick stop after visiting Notre Dame.

AMAZING!. In my opinion, this is a MUST-SEE. You will not be disappointed by the level of detail inside this church. Beware that they do close for lunch - we made that mistake and ended up having to come back at a later time, but it was well worth it.
Breath-Taking. This church is amazing. If you have the time, please take your family here. You won't regret it... I promise you that.

The stained glass gets five stars. Worth a bit of a queue. This is a 2 story reliquary and most unusual. If you are a lover of church glass, this is the ultimate as most of the walls are simply magnificent stained glass windows, just like a picture bible opened in front of you, so it was fun guessing the stories depicted in each " cartouche" of a window. But you can get a feel for the place in 15 minutes. It's a bit expensive for that, hence only 4 stars, but will leave a lasting memory. A concert there would be fab if you have a spare evening in Paris!
So beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Sainte-Chapelle. It is smaller and less crowded than Notre Dame. Having recently been cleaned and restored, the windows are particularly gorgeous.

Stunning!. Sainte-Chapelle is unlike any other place of worship that I've seen. The lower chapel one enters is very beautiful, but the large upstairs chapel with the long stained glass windows is truly stunning. It was beautiful on a sunny day. There is a narrow twisting staircase from the lower to the upper chapel, which could be problematic for some people.
Stunning stained glass windows . It's hard to explain without seeing it in person but Sainte-Chapelle is worth a visit while in Paris. There isn't a whole lot to see, but what you do see is worth it.

beautiful. We were amazed that we were able to get in to see this marvel, there were lines of course but it seemed well organized. We had a small lunch at the sidewalk cafe to wait until it was open after lunch. A good way to wait your turn in line. Worth seeing. Staff a little harried and a little rude, but sometimes when it is so crowded you expect this.
Not worth the admission. Very small and grossly overpriced. I would give a better review if i felt I'd got my money's worth. The windows are nice but you'll be left feeling "that's it?"

Concerto na Sainte-Chapelle. Had the oportunity to go to a string concert of Vivaldi´s Four Season´s on Sainte-Chapelle. It was in the evening, and the sun shone bright through the most amazing vitrals. An unforgettable experience. Strongly recomended.

Spectacular. A painstaking, seven-year restoration project of tiny Sainte-Chapelle was finally completed in May 2015. We have no idea how great it looked before its restoration, but we were completely blown away by just HOW dazzling, spectacular the 6,458 square feet of stained-glass windows are now. Yes, it was crowded, but it was truly beautiful, overwhelming. Intellectually, we’d seen pictures of the stained-glass windows in Sainte-Chapelle and thought we knew what to expect, but actually seeing those windows in person was awe-inspiring, exhilarating. Of course, the windows are most spectacular on a sunny day, but that’s also when Sainte-Chapelle is the most crowded, so you have to choose which is the most important to you – avoiding the crowds or seeing the windows at their best.Because there is so much security (both police and military) and there’s so much restoration taking place in the area, it can be a little difficult to locate the entrance to Sainte-Chapelle, but it’s certainly worth searching out. Don’t miss Sainte-Chapelle when you’re in Paris.
The most Beautiful Stained Glass!. Wonderful, short trip to see the famed stained glass. Needed stay more than an hour. Notre Dame is very close. You can see two excellent sights in an afternoon!

Looks amazing! Just maybe a bit too expensive for a church.. The upper windows are very very beautiful, it's great! But yeah, we had to wait in the waiting line and pay 10 euro per person, I'd say it was good to see, but just for one time, it's quite a price for visiting a church.

Nice stainglass. The church has odd opening times. It is beautiful, smaller than Ithought. We were at the Notre Dame the day before. So, maybe, that is why I am giving this an average review. Notre Dame is incredible and free!
Great place to attend a concert. Attended a concert here, which was a doubly enchanting experience. If you liked Notre Dame, con't miss this.

Beautiful chapel in the heart of Paris. Don't miss this beautiful chapel with the spectacular stained glass windows that tells the story of the entire bible. Near Notre Dame. This was our favorite church in Paris, just beautiful!

Such a Beauty. This is a church in need of much repair but it has to be seen! The stained glass windows on the second floor are breathtaking telling the store of the life of Christ from the birth to the resurrection. A rare beauty!

We went before they dusted the place.. It was actually disgusting. In the tour that you get to see where they held marie Antoinette lost her head. It was alright.We head into the chapel and it was a 1/4" to 1/2" layer of dust over everything. It was almost alarming.Too bad they didn't do a DNA sample of what dead skin cells and hair follicles that were coating everything were made of. It is a small chapel, but it is very quaint. If you have the Paris Museum Pass it is well worth the time to go see.

Indescribable Cathedral. We finally made it after trying several times. You have to go early to avoid the long lines. Go on a sunny day to get the best colors from the stain glass. It's magnificent even if you have seen a thousand churches. You can stay there for hours and will only scratch the surface of the history.

Beautiful . The place I wanted to see on my bust . A tower nah a arc nope a dam no this really is the place to visit . The sun shining through the glass amazing . Spoke to friends who have visited and some missed this .DONT

Lovely quick sight!. The stained glass was lovely here! It's located within a police compound, so you have to know it's there. It's a small place with great stories in the stained glass - perfect stop to a walk on the islands. It has a free bathroom access outside the chapel too.

Awesome sight to behold!. This is one of the most breathtaking chapels in Paris! When I first entered, I did not like it at all. Dark room, gift store, but then you go upstairs and it is incredible. The windows are 360 degrees around and it is a wonderful experience. Stay as little or as long as you like!

Gorgeous chapel in the heart of Paris . Near to the better known Notre Dame Sainte-Chapelle can often be overlooked, but it shouldn't be! The first room is dark and filled with intricately patterned wall coverings. It's not until you go upstairs that the breathtaking stained glass appears. All the walls are filled with beautifully detailed windows, bathing the whole chapel in purple light. It is the perfect attraction to visit after the Notre Dame.

History. The place is in the middle of the town...near of Notre dame. You must visit the second floor of this chapelle, where you find all the beauty of the big ans colorful windows. Read the history before leave the place...is very interesting

Awe inspiring!. Fabulous visit. The work that has been achieved there recently is truly awe inspiring. It is also documented in a well produced film shown on site. To add to the experience, we were able to get tickets to attend a performance of Bach in the Sainte Chapelle that evening. These are advertised online, and on posters in the area. An unforgettable experience.
Breathtaking. Take your time to sit back and admire this amazing piece of art as each window is different and the whole church is simply stunning.

Wonderful chapel amazing stained glass. You enter directly from the Boulevard de Palais - you will see the small red sign over the archway. The entrance to the Royal Palais is on the other side of the arch. You go through security and then proceed past the outside of the chapel to your right. You will enter a line to buy tickets, then proceed into the lower level of the chapel. After touring this room proceed up the stairs to the main chapel. We visited on a cloudy day and can only imagine what it would be like on a sunny day. Amazing anyway, but I am sure it is even better with much more sun. We purchased a combination ticket with the Conciergerie which was also a nice place to visit.

Worth the price . Came here based on a recommendation of a friend. Went to the first level and was slightly disappointed. At the time I didn't know there was a second floor. Went to the second floor and literally had my breathe taken away. The stained glass was stunning. I don't have much of a religious background and I didn't pay for the guided tour but the stained glass alone was amazing.

Beautiful. This is a destination I have been waiting to go all my life. It definitely lived up to its pictures and was way more beautiful in person. It is great on rainy days and to do with your family as there are many beautiful paintings and architecture.
A must see!. Gorgeous stained glass work with a story to tell in each window. The upstairs is breathtaking while the downstairs is intriguing.

Stunningly Beautiful Stained Glass Windows. Although we found ourselves with less than half an hour to visit Sainte-Chapelle at the end of the day, the brief visit was well worth it. Especially late in the day, with afternoon sun streaming through them, the stained glass windows in the upper gallery are stunningly beautiful and genuinely awe- inspiring. Just leave yourself at least an hour to see both levels of the chapel and do full justice to its visual delights.
Interesting historical church in the heart of Paris. The stained glass in the upper chamber is absolutely gorgeous. It's hard to describe because it is so overwhelming.

My favorite historic church in Paris. Loved this one because of the stained glass windows! Beautiful workman ship! The church is in the process of being renovated and it is open to the public during the renovation. For me this is a must see I Paris!

The Best Venue for Vivaldi. This is a definite twofer! Vivaldi's Four Seasons in the beautiful Sainte-Chapelle with its incredibly beautiful stained glass windows. Tickets may be purchased in advance on line or at the restaurant across the street from the chapel.

Concert was the highlight of our Paris trip!. We attended the Vivaldi concert featuring Bertrand Cervera on May 26th. It was truly moving. The combination of the setting and the music were just incredible! If you ever have the opportunity to attend a performance here don't miss it!

Magnificent stained glass. This was the most beautiful example of stained glass I have ever seen. The windows are 3 stories high. There are over 1100 scenes from the bible depicted on them. It was absolutely breathtaking.
AMAZING don't miss it. An amazing experience to see the beauty of this amazing cathedral. Pictures don't do it justice -- it's a must see.

My Favorite Place in Paris. I have been in many cathedrals but this one is the best, not just in Paris....it is the best I have been in anywhere. The age of the facility coupled with the sheer grandeur of some of the most spectacular church windows on earth is stunning. Do not miss this when you are in Paris. This place is jaw dropping!

Fabulous concert in wondrous setting. Great place to hear Vivaldi's "Four Seasons." The concerts sell out quickly but sometimes they have a few tickets left over the night of the event. Do not miss if you have an opportunity. We've never entered Sainte-Chapelle through the court building before so we got an interesting view of that as well. I don't know if this is normally the night entrance or whether it was due to increased security. The chapel itself was as beautiful as ever.

Stunning!. Our tour guide suggested we check this out because it is equally stunning to Notre Dame. The first floor of this chapel is beautiful but upstairs is absolutely magnificent. The lines were not nearly a fraction of Notre Dame. It was definitely worth it!

Did not worth the 10€ entrance price!. Based on the queue and the write up about the stained glasses of this Chapelle, we paid our entry fees to check out the stained glass windows. And to our disappointment the chapel was very very small! There were probably about 15 window panes to look at. All the stained glasses were very small if you have been to most of the churches, cathedrals, and chapels in Italy. On the next day we visited Montmatre's Sacre Coeur it was free and had a lot more stained glass windows to see. If you only have time to go to one of these two sites, I strongly recommend you to chose Montmartre over Saint Chappelle.
Breathtaking. So close to Notre Dame but hardly anyone goes. The stained glass was beyond belief. Even my 18 and 11 year old were impressed.

Stunning little chapel!!!. My husband compiled the list of museums to see on our 2 day museum pass. I had no clue what some would hold. Definitely drop in on this one with your museum pass!!!! Avoid lunch time between 1 and 3, apparently the line moves very slowly. This Chapelle is surrounded by other court buildings, so quite unassuming from the vantage of the line. Even the outside of the Chapelle does not hint to its interior. You have to go inside and climb the stairs to appreciate the gorgeous stained glass story of Christ and be amazed at the artistry.We did the Rock Steve's free audio tour and loved the history and his pointing attention to the panels along the stained glass. Just amazing.Highly recommend.

Stunning. You have to visit this little chapel!Tucked away in the middle of the Palais du Justice de Paris, this beautiful chapel is often overlooked - but you simply have to see it to believe it.The crypt is lovely when you first walk in however wait until you get to the top of the spiral staircase - be prepared to be quite speechless! Your eyes aren't deceiving you and it's not a figment of your imagination, or a scene from Harry Potter's school ceiling. This is a real place!The glasswork is absolutely breathtaking and we spent ages staring upwards. If ever you wanted to feel you were in the heavens, this is the place.There can be long queues but the entry of €10 is well worth it for this under-rated 13th century masterpiece.
Stunning chapel! A short walk from Notre Dame. Stunning chapel worth a visit...kids are free.Vivaldi Four Seasons concert was being held there the next next - that would be amazing!

Well Worth the Stop. Sainte-Chapelle was an amazing stop during a Paris walk. The stained-glass windows are like none we have ever seen before. So incredibly restored and so many of them. Truly a place to visit.

The stairs are hidden to the left. As we were entering the building some tourists asked if the little chapel was all. I guess they didn't see the small unlabeled staircase in the left corner as you walk in. Poor women didn't get to see the spectacular main chapel. Go see a concert there if you can...simply amazing!

Arguably more beautiful than Notre Dame. A short walk from Notre Dame is St Chapelle. This cathedral has walls of stained glass that, on a sunny day, show the true beauty of this structure. Don't miss if you go to see Notre Dame!
A gothic jewel. jjust a short stride from notre dame , breathtaking majectic oppulant and the 15 stained windows take your breathe away literally.. dont miss it.

Beautiful Glass windows. This chapel is beautiful. It is quite small and hard to locate. When you arrive make sure to read the signs and you can ask people around you. We walked around the place three times before finally finding it! The chapel is located inside the justice building, so if you see a man guarding a door, you are probably close! It was quite small but a nice visit for sure.

If you like Staned Glass.... This beautiful cathedral not far from Notre Dame is a must see if you like stained glass. The windows tell the story from the Old testament all the way through the New testament. It is awe inspring

Saw a beautiful string quartet here. Our hotel bought tickets to a string quartet here, and I thought I would die of happiness. The light shone through the magnificent windows and we listened to the most delightful music.
Beautiful stained glass. This may be the finest church for stained glass in all of Paris. The upper floor is simply stunning, and a must see.
Beathtakingly gorgeous. Be sure to visit this gem. It is the only building that has ever brought tears to my eyes. It's not far from Notre Dame, and worth the walk and any wait to get in. Lovely!

Just barely worth it. There are stained glass windows, and then there is Sainte Chapelle. The second floor is breath taking. It's expensive to get in, but if you're a fan of churches and cathedrals then this is one you ought to see.

Beautiful. I absolutely loved this little chapel. The stained glass is so impressive and quite beautiful. SO many details everywhere- even the floor was beautiful! This was one of my favorite stops in Paris. Would be a quick stop on your itinerary and one you wont regret.

Stunning stain glass windows . This is a must see if interested in French history and church history. The artwork and beauty of the stain glass is worth the 10 euros. Pickup the free paper guide or the audio guide for insight to the history.

Do not miss - an unbelievable treasure. Sainte-Chapelle is unique - for its beauty, light and colour- totally unlike any other church, chapel or cathedral I've ever been in. It's not large but take your time, look at the stories and history depicted in the glass windows and admire the craftsmanship and history of it all. Stand at the main door with your back against the middle pillar to truly see the chapel as royalty and pilgrims alike would have seen it. Extraordinary.

Always one of my favorite spots in Paris. It seems I cannot visit Paris without visiting Sainte Chapelle, as I always seem to be traveling with someone who hasn't yet seen it. And you must see it, if you like stained glass. The chapel is small, but I have never seen such glorious stained glass anywhere in the world. It is also somewhat less frequented than other sites, and if you manage to arrive early in the day, before the tour groups start appearing, it can be hushed and quiet. It's a wonderful place to marvel at human ingenuity -- who would have thought that such delicate supports could be built to frame such extensive glass in the 13th century?

Stunning. If you have just about had enough of cathedrals and churches hold on. This is one you just have to visit. The windows when seen from inside are stunning.Tip: Sainte-Chapelle closes for lunch. Avoid the queue by buying a joint ticket at the nearby Conciergerie (also well worth a visit). A joint ticket gives you express access.

Simply WOW. Walking up the narrow spiral staircase to the second floor, I had no idea just how amazing the sea of stained glass would be. A MUST see. Take the 30 minutes first thing in the morning, on your way to Notre Dame Cathedral. Sainte Chapelle will not disappoint.
Stained glass like never seen before. Clubbed it with Notre Dame for a short 1 hour visit. The stained glass walls on the first floor are simply awesome. Painstakingly done up & very well maintained.
Amazing. This was my favorite church, chapel or cathedral to enter. It is something that has to be seen in person to really appreciate. Pictures don't do it justice.

It's ok. The glasses truly are amazing. But, for the price of admission isn't worth it. I don't think you can spend more than 1 hour in here. Really not much to see, so the price wasn't worth it for me.

Beautiful Church...not worth 10 Euro. This church was beautiful, the stain glass inside is incredible!I'm giving three stars though because I do not believe this church was worth 10 euro per adult. If it is free to see the Arc de Triomphe, this should definitely be free! It's relatively small and there isn't much to see, so I don't feel it is worth the money...
Extraordinary. Beautiful stained glass windows with laminated cards in many languages that guide your understanding. Wish we had been there for a concert.
Small but amazing . This should not be missed. It is small but beautiful. This two-floor tourist attraction will blow your mind with its beauty.

Beautiful chapel. We booked a tour with Fat Tire and met early in the morning at a nearby cafe. I was glad we had a tour guide to explain the history. The chapel was stunningly beautiful. There is a gift shop inside. Would do again in a second.

Try to see a concert here!. We had the great fortune of getting tickets for the VIP section (front rows) of a strings concert that was fantastic. The chapel is stunning inside. The bathroom situation was not a good one so don't count on that. Our tickets included champagne at a bistro across the street and that was great fun for our teens to have their first taste in Paris.
A Must See. This amazing church with 1113 stained glass windows, is really an architectural marvel. I haven't seen anything quite like it over my years of travel.

Magnificent now that the scaffolding is down.. One of our favorite places in Paris. Amazing achievement at the time it was built, especially moving now that the windows have been thoroughly cleaned. Try to visit early in the day or otherwise when not too many tourists. Last time there were too many, and the experience was not nearly as good.

Amazing Glass work. It is worth paying ,it has amazing glasswork,and some jesus relics are here . They show the story of restoration of tinted glass . each and every glass tells the story of christ's life.
St chapelle. Went here for a concert. The most magnificent stained glass I have ever seen. Great violin concert. A must see in paris.

Beautiful but expensive!. It's a small structure with 2levels. Nothing much to see on the ground floor. There is stained glass work in the chapels in other French churches as well but the sheer size (ground to roof) of the windows on the first floor makes Saint Chappele stand out from the other chapels/churches.
overwhelming!. simply breathtaking - the stained glass here was the finest we saw in France, and the room is surrounded by it.

Wonderful Concert. We saw an evening concert in Sainte-Chapelle. It was excellent and made very special in this gorgeous venue. This makes a wonderful evening. But be sure to arrive early to go through all the security to enter the place.

A hidden gem. This is not one of the main sights of Paris but it is a must do as it was the highlight of our trip. It is not advertised highly but it is truly a hidden gem. What we saw took our breath away and silenced us completely. No words can describe it

Picture Worth Thousand Words. Sainte-Chapelle is one of Paris hidden Jewels. We had and outstanding experience there when we visited. We were up front by the pulpit and a group of youth made there way forward. All of a sudden they broke out and sang, just great spiritual experience!The photos do not do justs!

Beautiful stain glass windows but nothing else to see. Squeezed this into my 1 day of sight-seeing and wasn't overly impressed with Sainte-Chapelle. I managed to get a reduced fee being under 25 so remember to bring your ID with you to benefit from that. You first enter into the lower chapel, where there isn't that much to see, you then take the stairway to the main attraction which is the stain glass windows. Beautiful windows, but that's all there is to see. If it's a busy day, there's also nowhere to sit in the chapel which was difficult, especially after a full day of sight-seeing.
Hidden Gem. The stained glass windows are stunning. It was a little hard to find all tucked away but was definitely worth the money. We only stayed about 30 minutes but it is absolutely gorgeous.
Stain glass windows that must be seen. The small chapel has magnificent stained glass windows. Pop in to see them on your way to Notre Dame, you won't be disappointed.

Magnificent Church. When visiting the chapel, you first enter into the lower chapel. Although it is lovely, it is clearly not the main attraction. After ascending the staircase to the upper level, you know you have reached your destination. The room is almost completely made of stained glass. The 15 Windows recount the stories of the bible. Absolutely the most impressive stained glass I have ever seen.

Hope it is a sunny day. There is only one reason you are going here - the stained glass windows. So I do hope it is a sunny day when you visit. Now for the technical stuff. Buy the tickets on line in advance. That way you do not need to stand in line for an hour or two while waiting to buy a ticket. Second, there is a tight security here since the church in in the courtyard of the Justice Ministry, the French version of the US Department of Justice in Washington DC. They are efficient but they are serious. No metal in your pockets and no sharp pointy objects. Finally if you go in the morning from around 9 am to 14:00, there will be large crowds of people in the place.
