All the tour buses will be there and the big tour groups will be all surrounding their tour leader who will be lecturing in one of a number of different languages. If you are not there as soon as they open, then go around 14:00. Far fewer people. In fact go to the Concierge first in the morning and then go here. That is the reverse order and a lot of the bus tours seem to make it optional.

Beautiful glass work . Better to buy your ticket on line or in advance. It is a very small place but honestly sooooo beautiful . We went there once in the morning and once at the sunset for a concert.the colors and the lights are amazzzzinnngg specially at the sunset . So many change of colors. It is an impressive chapel, small with high ceiling all glass work . Have to do it absolutely .

Amazing!. Upon its entrance, you'll be led to a unassuming altar. But dont let that fool you... Proceed to the stairs going to the second floor located at the back of the chapel and see the beauty that is Sainte-Chapelle.
Gothic church. Beautiful Gothic church with colorful glass windows. This church was built in 1242 and completed in 1248. Entrance ticket is 10 euro. That is a little bit expensive but it is worthy.

Stained glass. Stumbled into this place by accident when looking for the Concigiere. This is connected to an active courthouse, so there is a lot of security here and a lot of police or military walking around. Signage here is a little confusing to find, we had to ask a few times and walked around in circles for ten minutes. Once you get out past the security check, go straight a bit and look for the doors to the right. There should be some ropes for those with and without passes.Once inside, this is a five to ten minute visit. You get to see a lot of stained glass, but that is it.

Awestruck. You would never have guessed the amount of work that went into the chapel till you go to the second floor and that's when I was blown away by its beauty. I found myself standing there looking up at all of the stained glass and the motives on the wall that were put there 100's of years ago

Superb!. My husband and I visited Notre Dame right before going to Sainte-Chapelle. That's the way to do it. The amazing architectural differences from the huge, heavy, dark structure to the incredibly light and delicate structure was wonderful. We would love seeing both again, in this order, to have more of the experience. Definitely worth going!

Amazing stained glass!. We missed Sainte-Chapelle on our first visit to Paris a few years ago so I was determined to see it this time. You enter into a lower level sanctuary that is lovely but not nearly as stunning as the upstairs with its amazing windows. If you can visit in late morning or afternoon while the sunlight streams through the glass you won't be disappointed! Lines can be long at times so we walked past the church on a few different days before we saw a short wait and jumped in line. Bring your camera

Breathtaking. We went to a classical music concert in Sainte-Chapelle and it had to be one on the high points of our trip to Paris. The stain glass windows are stunning especially at sunset. We bought our tickets online for the 7 pm concert which allowed us about an hour worth of music and then we went to dinner in Montmarte afterward. Be sure to use the rest room ahead of time because the facilities there are very limited and primitive.

Blown away by stunning stained glass. This is a small chapel, so do not expect the size of a cathedral. Well worth time and effort to go. Would buy ticket ahead of time or arrive there a few minutes before opening. Close to Notre Dame and slightly hidden unless you watch where you are going. Good rainy day activity. Must for those who appreciate beauty and stained glass. Pictures do not do it justice.

A Stand Out in a City Full of Beautiful Churches. The Mr and I missed out on seeing Sainte-Chapelle during our first visit to Paris in 2014. We did not make the same mistake twice. It was definitely worth a two year wait! I have no words to describe this beautiful church. The stain glass windows are extraordinary. Pro tip: Get the audio guide. The backstory is fascinating!

A Little Gem of Churches. The stained glass windows in this little church remind me of the artistic counterpart of Bach's quote about music, they exist, "for the enjoyment of man and the glory of God." A much better bet than Notre Dame.

Breath taking. A beautiful cathedral with breath taking stain glass windows. A much simpler church than Notre Dame but just as gorgeous.A must see in Paris. The concert we went to in the evening at St. Chapelle (tickets purchase a head of time) was amazing esp. in such a gorgeous atmosphere

Absolutely stunning. The stained glass windows of the Sainte-Chapelle are absolutely stunning and magical. You can stare at them for hours. I've never seen such amazing stained glass work. The King who built this "jewelry box" used to have Jesus' crown of thorns and a small portion of the cross here. I'm not religious but that is pretty significant. I did this tour combined with Notre Dame in one day. I recommend it.
chapelle with art. to see this kind must have some time to spend so we can enjoy if the temp is hot we can spend more time the tall in side roof wil give more compert

Wow!. I visited many museums and churches throughout Europe, but the Stain Glass in Saint Chapelle absolutely amazed me! Chapelle is centrally located not far past the Louvre and Notre Dame, the cost is a little pricey for the time you spend in the facility, but the beauty of it makes it all worth it. If you can go on a sunny day it's even more breathtaking.
Stunning stained glass windows. This is a small church not far from Notre Dame. Lines were manageable. Plan to spend less than an hour.

Don't miss.. When people mention Paris, people think Eiffel Tower or Notre Dame. I tell all my friends going there they must visit Sainte Chapelle.It's not that easy to find because it's in the active Palais de Justice and there is high security (well, that's true everywhere nowadays)It's the Royal private chapel and it looks like it. Though the stain glass isn't original, it does not detract from the immense beauty. It's like you're inside a kaleidoscope.Don't miss.

Breathtaking. We went on a rainy day and it was worth it. The building is under constant restoration but they keep the area clean. We entered into a small dome area with lots of items for sale, presumingly the gift shop, all of which was surrounded by stain glass windows. Then you go thru a narrow staircase and behold the church! Simply breathtaking! Very quiet and well setup, and you can take photos, sit, meditate or pray, soak in the 1000 plus stain glass windows. Plenty of information to read and follow along to get the experience. When we were leaving, we saw a flyer for an evening concert(Vivaldi and Bach). We came back in the evening and simply incredible!!!! We got front row seats and it was one of the nicest concerts I've ever been to. We video recorded everything and the sound/acoustics was the best! If you go, do everything you can. No regrets! We even made friends at the concert whom we roamed the city with later. Enjoy!

Amazing. The stain glass windows are beautiful. Not sure if it was worth 10 euros per person though. You have to go through heavy security to get there because it's in the same area as the courthouse, but it's worth it.

A truely amazing site.. Although the admission fee is 10 euros and you need to go through a security line which includes a baggage x-ray machine, it is most definitely worth it! When you enter in on the first floor it is a bit underwhelming and I was initially disappointed. But there is a small doorway to the side of the entryway which has a very narrow, winding staircase to the second floor. As you step out of the staircase and into the room you will experience a jaw dropping moment! The high stained glass 'walls' are breathtaking! There are 15 stained glass windows with 1,113 scenes, each telling part of the story of mankind (read them left to right, bottom towards top). I would highly recommend going to their website and printing a copy of the booklet (Go to Prepare for your visit) as it explains the layout of the upper chapel. I did not see any while I was there. A MUST see during your visit to Paris!

Divine!. Since reading Without Reservations, by Alice Steinbach, a number of years ago I have always wanted to visit St Chappelle. I was not disappointed. We were fortunate to visit on a sunny afternoon. The stunning stained glass windows are breathtaking. The vast number of them and the sunshine ensured the light in the chapel reflected many different colours. My husband loved it too.

Unforgettable. I am always stunned by the beauty of this small chapel with very large stained glass!! It is often overlooked because of its location to Notre Dame de Paris, but this intimate chapel is absolutely beautiful in every regard. I have mentioned to others in passing and they did not even know that it existed on the Ile de Cite. It would be a shame to miss this masterpiece.

Sainte-Chapelle is a Paris must see. The 1200s chapel is still one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. Most of the windows are the original stained glass. Take the time to see the chapel when you see Notre Dame.

There are TWO levels. Visited this stained glass masterpiece twice. You enter at the lower/gift shop level and then ascend a spiral staircase to the brilliant upper chapel. You probably only spend a half hour inside. Don't miss it, though. Very close to Notre Dame.

Is there a wait to get in? It's worth it!!!. The stained glass and altar are AMAZING-- I had seen many photos prior to our visit but did not imagine how beautiful they would be. Given the potentially long wait times, limited interactive features and tight quarters, and that this is a place of worship (ssshhhhh!!!!), I would not recommend including this on a short list of places to visit for families with small children. For everyone else, visit NOW! It's incredible!!!

A hidden gem. I have been in and out of Paris for 25 years and never felt the urge to visit the chapel of the medieval kings.
About time today!
Almost encrusted in the Conciergerie, and therefore the Palais de Justice, it is a hidden gem.
The vitraux are sheer masterpieces. Wow.

Prepare to be overwhelmed!. You enter on a side street into what looked like an office building. Once inside, you are the gift shop area in what looked like it might have been a small chapel at one time. You take one of the staircases upstairs (narrow, small and curvy) and into a room where you are dazzled by the three story high stained glass windows and gothic arches. There is a small altar area but no pews or other do-dahs as in other churches - just these magnificent windows. We spent a couple of hours spellbound looking upward. I'd go back in a second......

Stunning!. Tucked away inside the Palais de Justice, the Sainte Chapelle is accessed from an entrance on the Bld du Palais, not far from Métro St Michel (Line 4). The queues tend to be long and the security measures are tough, but once you are inside, you won't regret the effort made. The stained glass is nothing short of stunning - it easily rivals that of Notre-Dame nearby, or the cathedral of Chartres. The medieval workmanship and artistic achievement are in a class of their own. Stunning and sublime.Evening concerts / recitals of a very high standard are often held in the Sainte-Chapelle. Check them out! You won't be disappointed.

Don't miss!. This is a spectacular sight with floor to ceiling stained glass windows. I can't even guess how high the ceilings are. Each window tells a bible story, starting with Genesis and ending with Judgement Day. It doesn't matter if you're religious or not. You will be in awe! Go when it opens though, as lines get really long. It doesn't take long to visit, but you're really missing something if you skip it.

Gorgeous Stained Glass. If you visit Notre Dame don't miss Saint Chapelle This could be easily overlooked as the church is hidden inside a courtyard in a building complex Walking into the lower level is pretty but it's the second level up that has the incredible view Amazing artisanship hundreds of years old.

Stained glass magic. Visited Sainte- Chapelle first thing in the morning in an attempt to "beat the crowds". I lucked out and after going through security, I was able to walk right up to ticket desk with no waiting. Loved the stained glass and history of Sainte-Chapelle. I would probably forego the extra charge for the headset guide, as there was plenty of material to read once up in the chapel to understand it's history, relevance, and stories behind each stained glass panel. It was truly breathtaking!

Sainte-Chapelle. Amazing place and for some reason Parisians could not give us accurate directions to find it.It is not too far from Notre Dame, use Google Maps or something.Church has TWO sanctuaries, one on the ground floor and one is on second floor.DO NOT MISS the second floor, it is where the amazing stained glass windows are.

Must See. I bought tickets on-line and downloaded them to my phone. Highly recommended as you avoid standing in line! We went right up to the entrance and the clerk easily scanned the tickets from my phone. $4.50 extra for the audio guide or 2 for $6.00. If it's your first time, I think the guide is worth it. I didn't find the place spiritual but the WINDOWS!! There is more sq. ft. of windows than walls. Restorers spent 7 years (2007-20014) cleaning the windows inside and out so they were especially stunning. This belongs on your must see list some time when you are in Paris.
Original Stained Glass Several Centuries Old. Original Stained Glass Several Centuries Old and not to be missed. The stairs may be a challenge for some folks but it's due able.
Amazing stained glass (short visit). Amazing stained glass (short visit). The stained glass is amazing. I have visited twice and is always a highlight of my visit to Paris.

Takes Your Breath Away!. This is a fabulous work of art! The stained glass tells the story of the Bible without words. We took our (adult) children as we had been there before. When you walk in on the ground floor, you will think 'what's the big deal?', but then you will climb the circular stairs to the sanctuary... Be prepared to have your breath taken away it is that spectacular (even if you are not religious). We kind of got tired of visiting all the old churches in Europe, but will never tire of this one!
Stunning !!!. Breathtaking chapel attached to the Palais De Justice. Was recommended to me by a friend and so glad she did. Not to be missed.

Breathtaking!. My niece recommend that we visit Sainte-Chapelle while in Paris and we are so glad we did! The stained glass in this small chapel is beautiful. Be sure to climb the narrow stairway to the second floor or you will miss the most amazing display of stained glass ever! I wish we had had the opportunity to attend a concert in the chapel while we were in Paris! Maybe next trip! Love, love, loved it!!
Unexpected beauty.. You can't tell from the outside but the inside is truly stunning. Make sure to go on a sunny day. Very beautiful.

Absolutely amazing. What an incredible place. The Windows, the columns, the statues are all incredible. This is an absolute must see and, how amazing is it to see the work that has been done to restore many elements of the place. This is a photographer's dream.

Big disappointment with the schedule. We arrived 1/2 hour before 6 p.m. We could visit the upper and the lower level, but at 5:45 p.m. we were told to leave because they are closing. I asked why and they told us that they need to close. I asked to speak with a manager, but he didn't know English. I explain that we have 15 minutes, but nothing happen. The bullies and the manager told me to come another time, like we live across the street and we can come anytime. When people are spending thousands on flights, hotels, admission for Paris passes, it is very disrespectful from the museum's part to close earlier only because they share the entrance with a public institution. I showed them their sign advertising the schedule, but it was useless. Some people do not have another chance, everything is on a tight schedule. I hope somebody will read this and change the schedule for visitors.

A jewel-box of stained glass. Don't miss the Sainte-Chapelle when visiting Paris. The museum pass will get you to the front of the line. When you walk in on the ground level you'll think "what's all the fuss about?" But, when you go upstairs you'll be bowled over by the beauty of the glass - especially now that much of it has been cleaned and restored.

Attend a concert if you can!. Paris is full of venues with classical music. Often inexpensive hour long concerts play here. Combine your visit with some music. We heard Viviali's Four Seasons for 30Euro here. The jewel box of a Capelle located inside the Department of Justice is a must see with the best stained glass windows you will ever see

small, crowded, not worth the money... unless you're very very enthusiastic about art. I visited Sainte-Chapelle on a particularly grey day in February... and still regret the visit. It's not that I don't like stained glass or gothic buildings... I just felt it was too small and not private at all. Compared to the Louvre, which was fairly empty when I visited it, Sainte Chapelle felt like an overcrowded market. And not just for taking photos... one could not stand and admire the art/decor for too long because people kept pushing in. Overall, I found it too expensive and not satisfying at all.

Incredible!. Pictures cannot do justice to the stain glass in this chapel. When you first walk in to the entrance of the chapel, you do not realize the incredible beauty you are about to view up the stairs. Once you climb the staircase to the second level you are immersed in the beauty of the 360 degree views of stain glass. It is extremely beautiful and moving. It does not take long to view. Definitely a must on a tight time table because you can get in and out quickly. Definitely worth the visit.

wow. first floor wasnt that amazing but definitley go upstairs, it is amazingly beautiful. If you are under under 19 and have a valid EU passport (or can show you are studying in the EU) you get free entry

Must see. The stained glass windows in Sainte-Chapelle are not to be missed! It can be crowded, especially because you need to get through security before you enter. I went in the late afternoon on a week day and it was easy to get in. Don't be disappointed when you get to the first floor. The second floor is magnificent. They have a good guide explaining each window. Will definitely go back again.

Amazing!. Having being brought here by a friend I didn't know what to expect. I found the bottom floor pretty and really interesting. And then we went upstairs. That reveal was breath-taking! Definitely worth the wait.

Stunning stained glass windows !!. On the lle de la Cite, Sainte-Chapelle somewhat understandably plays second fiddle to Notre Dame, but in a smaller way, is no less spectacular.That said, it is well worth the 10Euros entry fee, so wander around the ground floor chapel before ascending a steep, spiral staircase to the renovated main chapel with its stunning stained glass windows.Entering the room, just about everyone goes "wow" at the first sight of these huge colourful and spectacular windows.The chapel dates from the mid 1200s and time had taken its toll on the glass, but a combination of private investment by Velux and a grant from the EU has seen a ten million Euro project of restoration and boy, what a job they've done.A video shows the work carried out in restoring the magnificent glasswork and if you have time, there is a narrative to take in about the messages conveyed in the glasswork.

Beautiful. Sainte-Chapelle is an absolutely gorgeous monument in Paris. The stained glass windows are breath taking, and it is definitely something worth doing. The line to get in is pretty long sometimes, and there isn't much to do besides walk around one room and take pictures. It can definitely be done in an hour!

Sitting in a Jewel Box. Whether day or night, a visit to this exquisite "jewel box" is a delight. I had seen it in daylight when the stained glass windows are magnificent, but on our last trip (in December) we attended a strings concert at night. I felt like I was in a Renaissance painting as the lights were low and the spotlight on the musicians cast a magical glow.
Most Beutiful. Of all the chapels, churches and cathedrals we have visited in Italy, Germany and France, this one is by far the most beautiful! Must see.

The most beautiful cathedral in the world. This is my favorite place in Paris. The stained glass is spectacular. The size of the chapel is small compared to other landmarks (it was just for the king), but it packs a punch. The architecture is phenomenal. I could stay there all day.
Must See. A beautiful example of stained glass windows, a church with interesting history. Get there early to avoid line ups.

stunning. Get there early to try to beat the queue which will form !This is one of the most beautiful sights in this city of beauties! There are two chapels - one immediately on entry which is small and lovely, then climb up for the outstanding upper chapel which has just been restored. When we were there someone came into the upper chapel and said "Oh!...Oh!..Oh!..Oh!..Oh!.." and that about sums it up. This is the finest example of stained glass I know. Take the time to sit and admire.

Breathtaking. I guess part of my reaction was not knowing what to expect, but I got goose bumps all over upon entering the main chapel. Rick Steve's app does and nice job on the walking tour giving you the history behind the place. The level of detail in that glass, telling the entire story of the bible, and that this was all done in the 1200's, simply is amazing.
Chamber Music!. Was fortunate to have ordered tickets prior to arrival in Paris for chamber music! How beautiful the setting for hearing such beautiful music!! Was certainly fantastic!
Stunning. Visually stunning and fascinating, well worth a visit and can be seen separately from the Conciergerie and therefore quite quickly

My Fav!!!. Crazy as it may seem, this was maybe my favorite thing in Paris! Do not miss it! It's a vision like you have gone to heaven. Amazing. I went on an overcast day, without good light and when I walked in my breath was taken away. I was in awe at the stained glass and it's colors. I was expecting stained glass but THIS IS STAINED glass heaven. DO NOT MISS!

Breathtaking. Although a bit difficult to find, this small chapel is definitely worth your time to visit. It's not far from Notre Dame, and the stained glass work will astound you! It's much more intimate than other landmarks, and you will enjoy the beauty of this special place.

Stunning . Now that some of the stained glass has been cleaned the beauty of this eglise is even brighter. Simply stunning at both the lower entry level and in the upstairs chapel. The colour and brightness on a sunny day will take your breath away. A museum pass helps jump the ticket queues and gets access to a quicker security check too.
Wasn't expecting that!! . Such an amazing church with so much history. Looking from the outside, you wouldn't expect the beauty of the stained glass windows found inside!

Outstanding stained glass of 13th century. It's 10 euros and a walk up a spiral staircase that will take your breath away. Royal funds produced a chapel fit for a king. That it is almost 800 years old is immaterial to its beauty, but fascinating to contemplate. Do not miss the opportunity to see this.

Stunning!!. Third time in Paris and I was looking for places I had never been to and came across this gem. Pictures do not do it justice! Definitely must visit to see the beautiful double.triple height stained glass windows. Try getting there before 5pm and book in advance if possible, there was a 20-25 minute line. Entrance was not free but 6-10 Euros per person.
Costly but worth it. I hadn't come across any fee for entry before arriving to Sainte-Chapelle, so I was surprised when it cost 10 euros to get in, but it was absolutely worth it.
wow. a tie between this and notre dame. truly spectacular as upper chamber is for only one person!!! relly an impressive place to visit with no long lines in the AM.
don't miss this. incredible, awesome, breath-taking beauty...don't be fooled by the humble lower level...and don't be dissuaded by the long security line...it is so worth it!
Beautiful Church. Remember ladies can't enter unless they are wearing pants many people don't know that. The church has some of the most amazing stain glass i have ever seen.

A must see stop on your tour of Paris. Sainte Chapelle is absolutely stunning. Pictures simply cannot do it justice, one must experience it to understand the depth of the beauty and workmanship. We visited with 8 family members and spent well over an hour identifying what part of the Bible story each pain of stained glass was depicting. This was one of the highlights of our 10 day stay in Paris
Most magnificent !. I enjoyed this much more than my visit to Notre Dame...the mosaic work is absolutely breathtaking. Try to go to a service; they are quite inspirational
A mosaic of light. Absolutely stunning …two chapels one on top of the other … every window tells a biblical story… decor & flooring amazing!A MUST see!

Stunning stained glass and a must see!. This small church has the most stunning stained glass I have seen to date anywhere in the world. It is slightly out of the way but so worth it to go and wait in the security line to see this beauty. It is in the middle of a government complex so the security here is tighter than anywhere we toured in Paris.

A gem, and, like true gems, small. Small and exquisite, Sainte-Chapelle is a beauty only spoil by being a beauty share by crowds.The amazing thing is the glass to stone ratio more than the glass itself. Buy a combined ticket at the less visited Conciergerie net door.
Pathway to heaven.. This was a diamond lost in all the others! So glad our Fat Tire Bike Tour guy told us to put it at the top of the list.

A pure Middle Age jewel recently restored. King Saint Louis dedicated this masterpiece of the Gothic Style (which is totally French whatever German sounds this name) to the Passion of Jesus Christ. It should be mentioned that the King's palace was all around the "Sainte-Chapelle" before it moved to The Louvre 200 years after.When you enter this holy place, you feel immediately surrounded by a colorful light falling from the stain glass shaped in exquisite embroideries a lime stone. These large windows tell in a captivating way numerous stories of the Ancient and New Testaments. It's not a big chapel, but it's probably one of the very finest gems of the XIIIth century, although drastically restored during the XIXth century.

Must see stained glass!. This was a little known place to me but I LOVED the stained glass. It is simply amazing and I am so glad I went. I got there one day after they had just closed and so happy I went back!

Make sure to spend time just being there... not just taking pictures!. Paris is full of incredibly beautiful buildings, but this one has to be ranked near the top of the list. I took lead on planning our trip, so my husband didn't really know what he was in for. We waited in line for about 30 minutes and then visited the first level. He was impressed, but maybe a little underwhelmed. I then asked if he was ready to go upstairs (he hadn't noted that there was an upstairs!). As we walked up the narrow spiral staircase, all you could hear was the immediate reactions of those ahead of you... Ooooh! Oh my! Wow! I studied this building in architecture school 20 years ago, but nothing prepares you for the experience in person. During our time there, we learned that the glass was meticulously cleaned last year, so if you've seen it before, maybe it's time to see it again.
Beautiful glass. Do yourself a favor and vista this chapel. Pay attention to the stone carvings that tell the story of the Old Testament. Restoration of the glass is amazing.
Stunning stained glass. If you are not careful, you could miss the stairs to the main chapel. The stained glass is absolutely stunning and, on a sunny day, it is illuminated beautifully.
Jewel box. I had forgotten how beautiful this little church is. It is one of the highlights of Paris. Downstairs is like being inside a little jewel box and then the wonders of upstairs await!

Tiny. If I didn't have a museum pass and paid 10€ to get in, I would have been quite upset. A little tiny chapel that is cute to see but it took longer to wait in line and go through security than it took for our entire visit. We stayed maybe 5 minutes. Half of the inside of the chapel is the junky souvenir stand. Would not recommend.

Beautiful Church. We found this by accident. We were looking for Notre-Dame & a fellow we asked for directions told us about this church.It is a masterpiece of stained glass & has Gothic columns.It is located next to the Palais de Justice & The Conciergerie. You can buy tickets to see all 3 or just one.We spent about an hour seeing all three.
Stunning. It's just stunningly beautiful! We attended a Bach concert. The opera singer, orchestra ensemble and childrens choir were amazing. An experience you won't forget!
Magnificent...A Must See!. Sainte Chapelle is truly incredible. It's my favorite landmark to visit in Paris. The stain glass windows are so beautiful; it's a must see!!

Stunningly Gorgeous Stained Glass. Sainte-Chapelle's beautiful stained glass walls are well worth the price of admission (and the security search at the entrance). As Rick Steves says, be sure to lean 'way back and take a photo of the ceiling's ribs and painted stars.

ABSOLUTE MUST EXPERIENCE BEFORE YOU DIE. The MOST Beautiful Room. Built by King Louis IX (Saint Louis IX), this gorgeous chapel was intended to be the home for the Crown of Thorns as well as other relics. You have NEVER seen anything like this. While it is is true that it is something to behold on a bright, sunny day, it is also very powerful on a somber, cloudy / rainy day. A bright day is probably ideal to experience the chapel, just DO NOT MISS visiting! It is the definition of the word, "awesome." I have visited Paris many times and always make a stop here. It is simply good for the soul!
Incredible stained glass. Beautiful church. Smaller than Notre Dame, which is nearby. The stained glass windows are worth the effort to see this place.

Rich with history and meaning. . Sainte-Chapelle is one of the must-see places in Paris. Stunning stained glass windows. Go on a sunny day. Buy advance tickets to avoid lines. Check out the Conciergerie next door too. Must be able to navigate circular staircase.

THE MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACE IN PARIS. we have been in Paris several times and always return to the Sainte Chapelle since it is for us the most marvelous place. When entering by the normal entrance of the old antique staircase your eyes remain wide open with such a beauty! but when you attend a concert if the afternoon, after the closure time, the magic is in the outmost point!!!!! there you have the whole place for you, with the marvelous music performed by a group and the change of lights between sunset and night that make the vitraux look astonishingly beautiful!!!!
A Beautiful Chapel. Perhaps a lesser known stop among the tourist venues, the Sainte-Chapelle offers stunningly beautiful stained gllass windows which tell a story.

The most exquisite stained glass you'll ever see!. Well worth visiting, just for the stunning stained glass on the top level of the building. It is also amazing to realise that it is the oldest chapel in Paris, and that's saying something! Just note that it can take a little while to get into the chapel on a weekend, as it seems local Parisian's like to visit then too!
Loved it.. Kinda magical. Don't want to say too much, but it was the one place I will remember more than anywhere we went in Paris.

Best stained glass windows in the world . More than meets your expectations. In any weather the light streams in and lights the chapel. I would consider it a true wonder of the medieval times. Go early and quickly go up to the chapel before it is crowded.

Always stunning. Have been here a few times before, but it never ceases to amaze. When you enter the second floor room you find yourself in a cathedral of stain glass. This church is a must see for anyone visiting Paris.
Concert at St. Chapelle. This was our second visit to Sainte-Chapelle and it was as wonderful as our first! We enjoyed an evening concert there on both occasions. It is stunning!
Paris during floods.. If you like stained glass windows this is a MUST! The most stained glass you will ever see in one place. We spent a couple of hours just observing and taking pictures.

Don't miss this place!. One of the most beautiful places we visited on our trip to Europe. The stained glass work is amazing. Buy a combo ticket at the Concierge and you can skip the line to get in here.

Restored Beauty: Best on a Sunny Day. We last visited Ste. Chappelle in 2009, during the restoration of the windows. It was most worth it to come back and see it after most of the restoration work has been completed. Our only regret is that we visited during a time when sun was in very short supply.

A real must-see. We were in Paris in 2012 for the first time, visited this old church with no preparation or expectations (a friend of our daughter-in-law's told us we HAD to see it). We were stunned -- and that with more than 1/3 of the stained glass windows under repair. We returned to Paris this year and Sainte-Chapelle was an absolute must-see so we could see all the windows. Even on a cold rainy day, it was again amazing. The entire Bible is "told" in the stained glass windows. We probably stayed 20 minutes and would have stayed longer had we not been chased out for the lunch break. Yes, they shut it completely down from 1 pm to 2:15 pm for lunch. I recommend the All Museum pass generally and it covers this. However, there is no preferential entry here for the pass and the line can be long (it took us about 1/2 hour waiting in line). It is worth the wait. Really. And pictures simply can't capture the experience of actually being there. Don't miss this.

The one attraction I will be sure to return to on every future trip to Paris.. Of all of Paris' top attractions this is the one you should absolutely not miss, if you're even a little bit interested in church architecture, history and stained glass. The amazing 13th century stained glass alone would make this a magical place, but Sainte-Chapelle is so much more than just stained glass. You really must see it to believe it. If you get a chance, be sure to attend an evening concert in the upper chapel. The violin concert we attended was memorable.

WOW - stunning stained glass. Absolutely stunning stained glass on the second floor of this church. There are printed laminated guides in multiple languages close to the exit door on the second level.

Amazing stained glass. Sainte-Chapelle was the highlight of the days I spent in Paris. The stained glass is absolutely stunning and was just restored in 2015, making it even more bright and colorful. Words can't describe the sight and it is well worth the wait to get in. We went at around 3 and waited in line for half an hour. It's very close to Notre Dame so make an afternoon of the two and then go grab ice cream at Le Berthillon (a short walk away).

How can anyone not give this five stars?. It's a little hard to find - about a block from Notre Dame.Enjoy the ground floor, but don't miss going upstairs, where the real show is. Bonus : find the carved little guys shown in one of my pictures. Who knows what they are doing?
A virtual jewel box. This place is not to be missed. Cool part: if you know your Bible, you can see it depicted from Genesis to REvelation in the stained glass. SUPER cool. And Super old.

Beautiful location.. Well worth the visit, although I found the shop souvenir person very rude and ruined the visit.For the Chapel, prepare and research before you arrive to get the full value of the visit.

"If you go a Notre Dame-Dame see this wonderful chapel". Is very close by Notre dame so you have to go, is very impressive chapel the espectacular stained glass telling the bible episodes in the superior chapel, in general you should see it

Breathtaking stained glass. I visited Sainte Chapelle 14 years ago with my husband and thought it was beautiful. In 2015 the stained glass panels were all painstakingly removed and cleaned put back together and replaced. The effect is Stunning! The first floor is lovely and where the commoners worshipped God. The second floor was where the nobles and royalty worshipped in the glow of the magnificent stained glass... Gods light. From the left side going clockwise the entire bible story from Genesis to Revelation is told in illuminated pictures. Don't forget to look down the floor is also beautiful.

Don't miss! Very beautiful, a hidden jewel.. This was the only time in Paris we didn't use a skip the line pass or a museum pass. We had to wait in line about 30 minutes. It was worth the wait. The Chapel is small both upstairs and downstairs. It is beyond words being upstairs surrounded by the stained glass. Take your time and look at each one, they have cards available in many languages that explain each one. The Chapel is around the corner from Notre Dame, you can do both on the same day. Saint-Capelle is not to be missed.

Heaven shines through it's widows. Sainte-Chapelle is not real large but it's interior is unsurpassed. The stained glass windows are the most beautiful that you'll ever see. Every color imaginable shines through. The upper chapel reserved for royalty is the spell binder. It appears that the windows are holding up ceiling. This is not to be missed.

Great example of unusual architecture and more stained glass than imaginable.. Our group was too large to all get in at once. So a third of us did a quick walk-by of Notte Dame. Located on the island with good nearby restaurants there and on the right bank so you can see the Louvre and Chappell in one day is fortuitous. Don't miss it.

The windows at sunset, plus music is an ethereal experience!. I am not a very religious person, but this is one place where i definitely feel "a presence." Adding in the concert to sitting for one hour and looking at all the windows is really almost magical. Be sure to book the concert for 7 pm--so the sun is still shining through the windows. It was worth the money to sit in the A section too.

Better than notre dame. Have seen many many churches in europe and thought twice about paying 10 euro admission. It was well worth it. The stained glass windows are amazing! 900 yrs old colorful and fillsthe whole upper floor. Trulythe most amazing stained glass displays i have ever seen
Stunning. Best seen on a sunny day when the light is streaming through the windows, this is still absolutely stunning at any time.

Most beautiful church in the world!. This church it is a jewel! The church at the second florr doesn't have walls,instead penny of colored vitraux (stained glass) , the ground church is also very beautiful.You can visit it using the Paris Musseum Pass ( you could buy it at the airport)Go at the end of the morning or at 2 for avoiding doing the line after that you could also go at night for a concert ( around 35 E)

Awesome Chapel, Overpirced And Over-Rated Concertss. The chapel and its history are brilliwnt...5+ stars. We both expressed "Wow" upon entry. Some reviews noted that the evening light was magical during the evening concerts, but please note that the audience faces East and the most enchanting Western light will be on entering from the "rose window" behind the audience in the evening. Unfortunately, the comcert we atended (VIP seats 2nd row, center, Bach performance on 18 June '16) paled in comparison with the venue, especially considering the roughly $50 USD (40 Euro) per ticket cost of the seats. We knew in advance that the acoustics of the Chapel would be challenging. After all, what can be expected of a 13th century building? Yet, for the price, one would expect far higher quality musicianship (2 violin, 1 viola, 1 cello, 1 bass and harpsichord). Although the concert provided great opportunities to enjoy the stunning stained glass, I would not recommend the VIP seats to be closer to the musicians. My classically trained, former-cellist wife likened the performance to a school talent show, especially because the children's chorus was not of the highest caliber, but also due to less than ideal acoustics of the space and sub-par performances by the "pro" musicians accompanying the chorus. The kids tried hard though anf I was a little less crtical. Was it horrible? No. Was it what you expect for 40+ Euros (an investment that buys decent seats at any European symphony, such as Amsterdam's' magnificent Concertgebouw)? No way, no how. If you are not a music snob and do not need the VIP seats, perhaps it is worth it at 30 Euros per seat, especially considering what 30 Euros of entertainment buys in downtown Paris in the evening. If you are accustomed to first-rate classical performances, be prepared for disappointment. Either way, it is a stunning space despite the organizers chasing us out immediately after the performance.

Beautiful Stained Glass. This is a must-see for anyone who loves stained glass as the upper floor windows cover the entire walls. We were there on a partly-cloudy day, but when the sun came out the windows were much more spectacular. Be ready for the security checkpoint. All the Paris attractions search bags and many have metal detectors, but this one was adjusted to be extremely sensitive. More than the airport or any other checkpoint, this one would alarm if you had a ring or tiniest piece of metal. The guard kept telling everyone to go back and look for more metal on your person. Anyway, outside and beyond is the Church entrance line and periodically someone would ask for Museum Pass holders to come to the front. It was very crowded, but since you are looking upward it was easy to see the stained glass.

Most beautiful concert ever. My husband and I stumbled into a concert here. We thought we were in line to see the chapel (even though we were pretty sure it was closed). Knowing that we weren't going to return to this area of Paris, we decided to buy tickets and see the concert and the chapel. The stain glass is simply stunning! It is so beautiful inside...words actually escape me! The concert, Vivaldi 's Four Seasons, was lovely. The sound quality and expertise of the musicians was perfect!

Awe inspiring. This was the second time I visited and the windows are truly magnificent. It's crazy to me to think that these windows were made almost 800 years ago and are still standing. This is a must visit.

Very beautiful . I did not know about this place until a friend told me. It is simply beautiful. I thought it was only the ground floor when I saw a door and attach staircase. When I went I almost could not believe what my eyes were seeing. Incredibly beautiful.

Go for the upper chapel. Our tickets were booked online (valid for 1 year). There was a short security check line and then we were inside. The lower chapel was full of broken pieces that had been excavated... nothing impressive. The upper chapel has the stained glasses, and what beauty! Breathtaking :)

A Must See in Paris. Originally built by King Louis IX to house the Crown of Thorns of Christ. It is a Gothic church that is being renovated and is a spectacular example of stained glass. Admission is free with the Paris Museum Pass.
Wow!. The entry level is remarkable and very cool with an ancient feel to it. Then you walk upstairs and it's absolutely amazing.

Evening concert of 4 seasons. We listened to a top tip from a local and ended up booking an evening's concert of Vivaldi's 4 Seasons at Sainte-Chapelle. We have never visited before, having been put off by the long queues around the block on previous visits. We booked tickets online and sat in the B seating which was perfect, we could see the musicians very well. The venue is beautiful, we sat for 60 minutes and could not stop looking around at the stained glass stories and paint work. The highlight for us was that every time the sun broke through the clouds,the Chapelle was illuminated by sparkling, multi-coloured lights. Would recommend this event to anyone.
Hidden Gem. Breathtaking! I think it is prettier inside than the Notre Dam Cathedral! Has the whole Old Testament in the stained glass windows!

A Magnificent Dance of Light and Color. The upper chapel of Sainte-Chapelle is one of our favorite site in Paris. Aside from the beauty, it is amazing to think how the mostly stained glass wall was made and installed taking into consideration the height of the wall and the age of the church! The chapel is bathed in light in contrast to most other great churches with the stained glass windows surrounded by massive amounts of stone. We lingered in wonder for a good half hour. Sainte-Chapelle is only a few minutes from Notre Dame. As has been mentioned, the entrance is in the court yard of the Palace of Justice. You enter first into the lower chapel and have to go through a narrow stairwell on the left to reach the upper chapel.

Quite beautiful but fee is high. The Sainte Chapelle chapel is quite beautiful but the admission fee is high compared to the alternatives. It is quite interesting also as it is connected to the justice center so you share the security line with the courts.

Beautiful stained glass windows. When I first entered the Chapel i was in a small dark room with some interactive screens. I was very disappointed. Where were all the stained glass panels I had come to see? Then I noticed a narrow winding staircase in the corner. I climbed the stairs and entered the upper chapel and my jaw dropped. I sat quietly on a red velvet chair just staring at the windows for a good 20 minutes trying to take in all the magnificence of the colored glass and the stories it told. Each panel tells the story of the different books of the bible, eg. Book of Genesis, there are scenes from Exodus, Leviticus, etc. Tarif: euros 10
Stained Glass. Beautiful stained glass on the second floor of this cathedral. I enjoyed our time here. It wasn't too crowded and we were able to take our time.

Breathtaking!. Sainte-Chapelle is beautiful. The stained glass windows are just amazing. I enjoyed the visit of course but it was the last day of our trip and I had sensory overload by that time so I feel I didn't really get as much out of it as I could have. I hope to see Sainte-Chapelle again some day, spend more time there and learn more of the history.

Who could imagine?. Restored in 2015 - the stain glass beauty!!!!Yes it is breathtaking and well worth the climb up the narrow spiral staircase.Be warned though, they close for lunch 1PM - 2:15PM. We waited the time and found that it was an advantage to be first on the queue!The Conciegerie (extra 4€) is outside off the street - next to Justice palace was interesting but not spectacular (particularly if you have traveled a lot)

Levitating beauty . Marvelous! Not easy to enter since it is in the courtyard of the palace of justice. You enter and feel a little disappointed by the stained glass you see and compare to what you expect. Then you find the narrow stairs to the upper chamber and, after a short and vertiginous climb, you discover the absolute beauty of the peak of the gothic churches and the most slender and levitating stone building. Breathtaking

Magnificent. This is not to be missed. Built in 20 years in 1 gothic style! The upper or Royal chapel is filled with Windows that let in so much light even when it is raining. It is designed so differently that most churches and truly for the King (Louis IX) and his court. The under chapel was just as amazing but without the wonderful stained glass windows. If you go to the Cluny Museum, you will see some of the original Medieval stained glass displayed.

Outstanding concert. Concerts are held here most every night of the year and I highly recommend attending one. Hearing music played in the chapel is far better than just touring it. The concert I attended was excellent--a string quartet and a choral group performing Bach and Vivaldi. As the concert went on, the sun started to set and shine through the incredible stained glass windows.Getting in to the concert was a bit tricky. When I arrived slightly before the designated time, the entrance was closed up tight and no one around to ask questions. But when the time on the tickets rolled around, people showed up to unlock the entrance and escort us through security and into the chapel. Would be nice to have some information on where to wait to get into the concerts on the tickets or on site.

A sight to see. Sainte-Chapelle is outrageously beautiful! The color, the detail, everything will have you in awe. Do beware: that this attraction is compromised of two rooms. On the plus side, you can easily fit into your trip an hour to go see it!

Don't miss!. One of the most stunning cathedrals I have ever seen, Sainte-Chappelle has 1,113 stained glass windows encircling the room that each tell a biblical story. Amazingly, it was built in only seven years and recently underwent a six year restoration (completed in 2014) in which each window was meticulously cleaned! Do not miss this one!

Unforgettable. Though I have been to Paris several times before, I somehow missed visiting Sainte Chapelle until this visit. That was definitely an oversight on my part. Of the several hundred churches, cathedrals, and mosques that I have visited in my life, this would have to be in the top five or so. The massive amount of stained glass is just overwhelming. If you are visiting Paris for just a few days and anywhere in the area of Notre Dame, don't miss this attraction. You won't regret it.
Amazing Glass, Visit on a sunny day!. Small but amazing church space. Be sure to have a museum Pass as it lets you cut the line and go right in. A must see!

Small but stunning. You can tell it is no longer an active church by the fact they charge 10 euros to enter ;).It is small, but breathtaking. Sadly, like most of the past 30 days there was no sun to illuminate the stained glass. Nevertheless, with virtually no lines and few people inside, you can take your time to really appreciate the artistry. The carved stone entryway into the chapel itself (upstairs from the tourist entrance) depicts the classic scene of the weighing of souls with the damned to the left of God (on the right facing the doorway) and the saved on the right. It is worth spending time looking at the details which are visible from up close - something not always doable at bigger attractions.

My favorite visit in Paris. I am born in Paris and it is my favorite visit. You can spend hours looking at the stories described on the stained glasses.Bring a camera with a zoom or binocular if you want to see plenty of details.Dont be scared by the queue at the entrance, it is usually quite fast only additional security because you have to enter the Paris Court (Palais de Justice) to access to the Sainte Chapelle.
Must see!. Gorgeous, unique, incredible. See if you can attend a concert there (you will have to buy tickets), but also, must see in daylight too!

Stunning. We went on a cloudy day, and the stained glass still was impressive. Had we gone on a sunny day I'm sure it would be even better. It is a neat stop for up to an hour, if you read and watch everything about the history etc, but not much longer than that. Definitely worth seeing.
A must see when visiting Paris!. The windows here are just so beautiful. Best to visit on a sunny day, however, even on cloudy days the windows are amazing. I highly recommend a visit!

Stained Glass at its Finest!. Sainte-Chapelle is one of our favorite places in Paris. The stained glass windows is definitely a site to behold. The colors and the details of the windows are absolutely amazing. The ceiling is interesting and an architectural beauty too. With the Paris Museum Pass, we were able skip the long line. Similar to other Paris attractions, you'll go through security metal detectors, but the line goes pretty quickly. Pick up a guide before heading upstairs in the chapel. The stairs are narrow so we took it easy going up the steps, especially because it was crowded. There are classical music concerts in the chapel and you'll find a piano in front of the chapel. Lastly, going on a sunny day would be ideal for the light through the colorful windows.
Amazing stained glass. We almost missed the best part at Sante-Chapelle - you have to go upstairs to see the chapel with the stained glass. The small chapel where you enter is not the main event!

stunning.... The lead has been replaced and all the glass cleaned from centuries of grime. I was there on a cloudy morning, but it was still bright & awe inspiring. I can't wait to come back on a sunny morning.

Amazing stained glass. Fortunate to go to a recital here. After a bit of a trek and being herded a bit like cattle we eventually got into this wonderful building. The stained glass has to be seen to be believed - it is quite beautiful. The acoustics were excellent for the concert so if you have the opportunity try and go.
The Marvel of Gothic Art. Getting up and down the narrow stone stairs is difficult, but the rewards are a view of the most magnificent stained glass windows set in soaring arches.
Stunning. The stain glass work is stunning! It was closed for a few hours during the day so we had to come back later, but we were glad we did as it was beautiful.
Stunning and sacred space. Plan to visit early in the day before everyone is out touring. A truly amazing space that will take your breath away. No 1 on our to visit list in Paris.

Amazing Sainte Chapelle. The Sainte Chapelle is a great icon for the art. This monument was built by King Louis IX & completed in the year 1248. It has a great history. Beautifully painted and rose windows will captivate your heart.

One of the most beautiful places in Paris. One of the most beautiful places in Paris. If you like to visit different cathedrals and you are an absolute fan of stained-glass windows you will be impressed. This is definitely worth seeing!

Stained Glass Gem. You cannot pass this chapel. It is wonderful. The stained glass will take your breath away. We got there early to avoid long lines. The chapel has been restored in recent years and is even better than the last time we were there.
Beautiful church. Such a beautiful church. The stained glass windows were amazing. Lines weren't long. Definitely worth a visit.
Really Beautiful!. If you plan to see just one or two Cathedral's be sure this is on your list. It costs to go inside but the stained glass is worth it.

Magnificent stained glass windies. We visited this beautiful church yesterday & it's definitely a "must see" when visiting Paris.
The stained glass windows on the second floor are absolutely magnificent!

Old church in the heart of the city. It is located in the heart of the Ile de la cite, just next to the Conciergie. It has beutiful vitrages and it is certainly worth to see. It is part of the Museum pass, same as the nearby Conciergie. When exiting, you pass the Ministry of Justice building, which was the first kings residence.
Outstanding. The most powerful and amazing experience of silence in the middle of Paris. I would recommend to spend some time here.
A medieval masterpiece. A must-see! The most beautiful glasswork I've ever seen! It seems unreal and unbelievable, especially at first sight.

Beautiful stained glass. Beautiful chapel with amazing stained glass filling cathedral with blue / purple light. Chapel is within easy walking distance of Notre Dame but is a little hidden. 33 spiral stairs from gift shop entrance to the main chapel.

Magnificent church with evening concerts. Such exquisite architecture and a most amazing setting for classical music. We heard a string sextet; the music soars in these ancient acoustics. The vaulted ceilings, stone walls and stained glass: wow!

Finest collection of stained glass windows in the world - Don't miss!!. This church was completed in 1248 to house the relics of the crucifixion of Christ. It contains the finest collection of stained glass windows in the world. Not easy to find but directly across the street from Notre Dame cathedral.
Wow!!!. An amazing survival from the mediaeval palace of the kings of France, with the original stained glass recently and brilliantly restored. Open late on Wednesdays for a quieter visit.
Magnificent. The windows alone are worth visiting this site. Been there before and each time it just makes my jaw drop. Worth going out of your way to visit.

Concert in Sainte Chapelle. We live in Paris but heard from friends we must see the stained glass of Sainte Chapelle. We found they also have concerts some times so we waited and went during a concert last night. It was simply magical. Listening to eight musicians play Bach, Pachelbel and Vivaldi while the summer evening sun hit the stained glass. A recommendation for anyone!

Speechless When Entered the Upper Chapel. Sainte-Chapelle (聖禮拜堂, Holy Chapel) is a royal chapel on the Ile de la Cite (西堤島) in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, France. The Gothic styled chapel was the residence of the Kings of France until the 14th century. The Sainte-Chapelle was built from 1242 to 1248 in accordance of the wishes of King Louis IX to house the relics of the Passion of Christ. The Crown of Thorns (荊棘冠) is the most famous among these relics. Today, it is preserved in Notre Dame de Paris (巴黎聖母院). The recent restoration of the chapel began in 2008 and was completed in 2014 (the 800th anniversary of the birth of St. Louis). The restoration included the western rose window (consisted of cleaning the glass, the leading, and the metal structures of the windows) and the facades of the building and sculptures.We went there around 4 pm and found it is located within the walls of the Palais de Justice and that all visitors must go through an enforced police check. Once we went inside the Sainte Chapelle, we entered the lower chapel where the statue of Virgin Mary welcomed us. The lower chapel was originally the place of worship for the palace staff. The Statue of Louis IX in the far end center is the highlight of the lower chapel. The decor is amazing and allows visitors to imagine the area like when it was in the Middle Ages. The basilica styled layout with the semi-circular apse was simple and did not have many stained glasses because it was in the base of the chapel. The most extraordinary part of the chapel was the upper chapel. It was used only for the king, his close friends, and family. We were speechless when entered the upper chapel because it is almost covered by stained glass. We have never seen any other church like this with so many stained glasses. There are fifteen 13th century stained glass windows in the upper chapel, a treasure of the art of stained glass which made the Sainte-Chapelle so popular. Those 15 m (49.2 ft) stained glass windows fill the nave and apse and describe 1,113 scenes from the Old and New Testaments, recounting the history of the world until the arrival of the relics in Paris. When the lights came through the colorful stained glass windows, we felt peace and harmony. Besides the amazing windows, the statue of Saint Peter (total 12 larger-than-life-sized sculpted stone figures representing the 12 Apostles), the great shrine and the large rose window that dominates the western wall are worth spending your time to enjoy. We were lucky to visit Sainte-Chapelle after they completed the latest restoration in 2014.When we visited Sainte-Chapelle in last April (2016), we saw French military with machine guns patrolling near Sainte-Chapelle and Notre Dame de Paris. It reminded us to be sensitive to any unexpected situation and prepare ourselves to do the proper thing if it happens. It was the 3rd day we were in Paris and later we found the Parisian did not show any tense atmosphere. The full price is 10€ for adults. Paris Museum Passes are accepted, but there is no express gate in Sainte-Chapelle. I recommend everyone who comes to Paris should include this amazing chapel on their itinerary.
Pleasant surprise. I really had no idea what I was going to find here when I read the guidebooks. The place is amazing and incredible. A singular beauty in Paris, near Notre-Dame Catedral.

Beautiful Gothic Stained Glass Windows. Love this space. The towering stained glass windows mystical light transport you to another place and time amid bustling tourists trying to capture the magic that cannot be captured with a camera. I think this is really worth the 30-45 minute visit as it is located not to far from Notre Dame especially if you buy the Paris museum pass.

Small but overwhelming. Unique chapel, pretty much the opposite of Notre Dame. Beautiful windows, but so difficult to appreciate the individual detail. Wished we had scheduled a concert while we were in town to truly get the feel for Saint-Chapelle.

Absolutely Stunning. Walking in to the lower level of Sainte-Chapelle seems like any other church. However, once you make your way upstairs, you immediately realize that you are somewhere very special. I did not have any expectations going into Sainte-Chapelle. We were actually ducking in to avoid the rain. But I was definitely impressed. Do not miss this site in Paris.

An amazing jewel, hard to access. You have to deserve it. Before getting there you have to line for long to get through the safety check because this Chapel is inside the block of the Paris Court of Justice. It is a real narrow bottle-neck
De rigueur for tourists. Beautiful stained glass on the Ille de Citî, but there are other more intriguing sites. Took longer to get in than the actual visit.
Breathtaking. I'm not a cathedral aficionado, but I found Sainte-Chapelle truly breathtaking. The stained glass is worth the trip. We went on a weekday morning and didn't encounter too long a line.
A hidden gem!. We stumbled upon this Chapel on our way to Notre Dame. I am happy we went in. The lower level is amazing, but the Chapel is AMAZING! We couldn't believe our eyes when we went in.
Must visit. Most beautiful church in Paris. The stained glass windows are like nothing you will ever see anywhere else. Very intimate and beautiful!
Rainy season. lovely - take your time - the windows are worth the trip even for children to see - would have loved to have attended a concert there

Incredible Church. This church is tucked away near Notre Dame but it's well worth the visit. You enter on the lower level and that looks like a restoration in progress, this is where the regular people got to pray. Then you go up the stairs and see the rest of the church and you will be blown away. The amount and quality of the stained glass is mind blowing. This was the church where they kept the crown of thorns and where the King prayed. If you start going to all the things to see in Paris it would be to your advantage to get the Paris pass that allows entrance to a lot of attractions at a discounted price. It's a good way to avoid some of the long lines.

Stunning Stained Glass. We attended a chamber music concert here, so I can't comment on whatever else might be on tap with a full tour. However, listening to beautiful music beneath the stunning stained glass windows on all sides was an experience I will not soon forget.

Outstanding stained glass. Definitely worth seeing as these windows are beautiful and so many in such a small space. It only takes about 30 minutes so you can queue for longer than you visit, but it is worth it!
What a magnificent sight. Waw.please remember to climb the steps to this lovely chapelle to see the wonderful artistry of the glass

Breathtaking and glorious. Sainte Chapelle is a gem of a church with the most beautiful stained glass windows I've seen till now during my travels. The exterior is not that impressive but once you've gone inside and climbed to the upper level, a surprise awaits you. It's hard to describe the experience but I can guarantee that it's definitely worth the visit even if you have to wait in line. Try to go on a sunny day if possible as the shadows of the stained glass transform the interior into a jewel box. The entry is included with the Paris museum pass. Highly recommended

You find treasures every day.... Sainte-Chappelle is located just around the corner and a short walk from the more famous Notre Dame de Paris. It is actually located inside the grounds of an active courthouse, so don't be surprised when you have to pass through airport-level security to get inside. From the outside this little chappell is not much to look at and the major construction and jackhammering going on around thebuilding made me a little uncertain that I wanted to spend the entry fee to go inside. But my daughter had one place to see and this was it. So in we went...mind blown!The lower level was interesting but once we ascended the spiral staircase to the main sanctuary I fully understood the beauty of this very underrated place. In terms of, percentage of stained glass/sq. Ft. of wall, this little place had some of the big ones beat. Glass sparcles from floor to ceiling. Make sure you pic a sunny day and you will not be disappointed. Definitely worth seeing. Though it may be a little expensive. I recommend seeing this beautiful thing that very talented people built... With their hands...
Beautiful! Truly in awe!. This is impactful on so many levels. The detail of the stained glass is amazing! The size of the panels of glass are overwhelming in scope detail!

Gorgeous Stained Glass. We went to see this after Notre Dame, and although it wasn't a large it was in my mind even more beautiful. The stained glass is something everyone should see, and the history of it is incredibly interesting.

Small and perfectly formed. I had heard that Sainte-Chapelle was a gothic beauty, but I didn't realise what a tiny hidden jewel it is. It truly was fit for the kings it served as chapel to. The first look takes in the whole of the bottom floor, in glorious technicolor. I didn't expect it and it took my breath away. The golden fleurs de lis against the rich blues and reds and the wonderful stained glass are just stunning. Upstairs is reserved for the multitude of windows which tell a sequence of tales. I wished I could telescope myself up into the heights of the ceiling so I could see the top pictures better. The chapel is a must-see along with Notre Dame. Don't miss it.
Stunning. An incredibly beautiful step back in time. Detailed glass, mosaics, sculpture and the building itself were breathtaking.

Simply glorious. The apparently modest exterior and scale utterly belies what awaits inside. It is a stunning visual treat, with the heavenly windows submerging the interior in multicoloured waves of light, crested by the sumptuous yet refined ceilings.

Most Beautiful Stained Glass. There was a line to get in, but so worth the wait...you can't miss this...the stained glass is considered the most beautiful in the world and it did not disappoint, it was breath taking... I wish it had been a sunny day, but still beautiful. The glass is upstairs once you enter. Must see!

Must see. Very beautiful.. The artwork, stained glass on the upper floor is absolutely stunning. You enter and you see a beautiful red and blue pattern woven in gold on the ceiling.. You start to think .. Ok this is alright and wonder if 6€ or some such is a worthy deal to see a coloured ceiling when you've already been mesmerised by the dominant neighbour - the Notre dame. Then you see a rickety spirally staircase that leads to the upper floor and this is what totally blows your mind. You don't expect to see the most beautiful stained glass windows on the planet but you just did!

The stained glasses were amazing!. 8 minutes walk from Notre Dame. There are 2 lines at the entrance, one for Sainte Chapelle, the other one is for Palais de Justice. After security check, can buy tickets at the door, which cost 10 euros, not a big place, but the stained glasses were amazing!

Best stained glass winows anywhere. Best on a sunny or only slight overcast day, Sainte Chapelle's windows are breath-taking. Recently cleaned and restored, they were more magnificent on this visit than I remember from past visits. If you go to Paris, you might visit the Louvre, you might ride up into the Eiffel Tower, but you must visit Sainte-Chapelle.
Wow what a place. GO UPSTAIRS for that is the true wonder of this place. And since they have cleaned half of the windows, a definite must see.

My Favorite Thing in Paris Other than the Food. Amazing. Wonderful. Every time I go to Paris I come here. Every time it is better than I remember. I would recommend buying tickets in advance so you don't have to wait in line.

Go on a sunny day. This is a really, compared to many European churches, very small, but really packs a punch. The light coming through the floor to ceiling stained glass windows makes you think you have entered the pearly gates into heaven. It is popular with long lines, our musee pass helped shorten it some, which was appreciated. They have a small gift store on the main level, then you climb some stairs to get to the windows. This is close to many things in the area, plus some restaurants, so you can fill time here easily.

Breathtaking Windows!. Wow!! that was my first reaction when walking in to the upper chapel and seeing the windows. Pay the money and go see this incredible place, pictures and words cannot describe what it's like inside - you will not be disappointed.

Beautiful building. Beautiful building. Get the museum pass as this will help skip the queue and get you in for free - The costs of places builds up. I was so glad I looked on googlemaps and found this place - just stunning and totally worth an hour out of your day.

Most beautiful stained glass I have ever seen. . Sainte-Chapelle is a bit hidden compared to the immense Notre Dame. It's on the same island and make sure you don't miss it. It's located next to La Conciergerie. This chapel doesn't look like much from the outside, but the second floor is surrounded by a massive amount of breathtaking stained glass.

Awesome. Sainte_Chapelle is the place of the best light of Paris, the stained glass are amazing.
Architecturally it is one of the most well constructed spaces of religious architecture of Paris.
One of the places you can not miss in Paris.

Lovely Surprise. This small chapel has some of the best stained glass and fresco painting in the world. This is an awinspiring place to just sit and absorb the serenity of its beauty. I would return just to sit and contimplaint the meaning of life. We ended a very long day in big museums with a short visit before returning to our hotel. Absolutely beautiful!

Nice but expensive. Decorated with beautiful stained glasses all over the windows depicting 1000+ scenes from history. But we felt 10euros entrance fee per person is a bit over priced. Make sure you find a written journal on a placard describing scenes on the windows available in various languages almost near the exit. It was interesting to read about it.

Gorgeous. I have been to Paris several times, and for some reason had never stopped to visit the Sainte-Chapelle. On my last visit I realized how foolish I had been. It is breathtaking, absolutely and completely. The 16 panels of stained glass must be seen to be believed. One note: the stairs to the chapel are narrow and winding (but totally worth it)

Wow!. There are a few places in the world where you walk into a landmark and you just stand in awe - St Chapelle was one of those places for me. When my wife and stepped into the chapel and saw the stained glass for the first time, we just stood in wonder and stared watching the light radiate through the stunning windows. Looking closer, you realize that each pane is a work of art telling a story.We loved St Chapelle so much that we arranged to come back for a Sunday evening Vivaldi concert. The music was beautiful and given the subtle acoustics, the beautiful chapel and the steadily changing light filtering through the windows provided the perfect backdrop. A magical experience!

Amazing beauty. This is an awe inspiring place if you appreciate stain glass. I could have stayed for hours just admiring. The security line shuts down i believe between 12-1:30. We went through about 11:30, which may have made the chapel less crowded, as less people as we stayed longer. Security/bag check is through a state building, so chapel still open once you clear through security. Just mentioning as some state can be very crowded and we did not have that experience. If i had had time i would have gone back, we were there on a rainy day, would love to see on a sunny day too. Look for laminated cards that explain what you are seeing. We did not do the audio tour, though i would have liked to.

A beautiful church. First, buy the Paris Pass across the street at the Tabac store. This will definitely pay for itself with admission fees and shorted wait times. The church and the stain glass windows are beautiful. Make sure to go to the Conciergerie next door.

Breath-taking Stained Glass. A trip to Europe for me typically includes viewing so many churches and cathedrals that they blend in my memory. This one stands out for the most stunning stained glass art I've ever seen. It is fantastic. However, there is not much to see here beyond that. My husband and I purchased tickets for a classical music concert and that was definitely the way to go. For about 20 euro you can sit back and enjoy the beauty of the church with lovely music playing. The musicians were rather good and entertaining too. It is not a high-end music experience as they are certainly playing for the tourists, but well worth the money to see the cathedral and hear the music carrying through the room.

They have evening concerts in this amazing setting!. The stain glass windows form the walls of this amazing Paris jewel. We went for an evening concert and saw both the beauty of the windows in the early evening and enjoyed the setting for a Vivaldi concert.

Very recent visit. Visited Sainte Chapelle again last week after 6 years. Another fantastic experience listening to Vivaldi's Quattro Stagioni, Pachebel's Canon, and Albinoni's Adagio in the midst of the spectacular lead light windows of this historic icon. Make sure you book tickets online to avoid queues. Next time I go, I will do a daytime tour of the Chappelle to see its historic artworks and its history. Concert cost Euros25-45.

The Stained Glass. The chapel was a highlight of our 4-day trip. The Museum Pass covers the chapel, but you must go thru security first and that can take time. Be prepared to climb stairs. Once in the chapel, you will be amazed at the beauty inside. It is spectacular! Don't miss this vision of beauty.
A jewel close to Notre Dame. This former chapel of French Royalty is amazingly decorated and has beautiful stained glass windows.

Catch a Concert. One of the best ways to see this beautiful chapel is to buy a ticket for an early evening concert. Kind of a two-for-one. Concert tickets are sold across the street from the entrance at a little souvenir shop. Go early since the seating is open within each price-range. Tickets were 25, 30 and 40 euros.
Such glory. Everyone should put Sainte-Chapelle on their bucket list.It's mind blowing that mere men built this glory with theprimitive tools and methods they had back then.
Beautiful!. Impressive craftsmanship; not much more to say, but Trip Advisor requires that I write more so here are more words.

Stunning piece of history. Located in the Palais de Justice compound (with appropriate security) this place is a must-see, but make sure you go to the upstairs section as well as downstairs - the downstairs chapel is quite dark so the stairs to the upper chapel are not hugely obvious. Much of the building was destroyed in the revolution but it has been painstakingly restored and is stunning. The beautiful windows in the upper chapel depict scenes from the Bible from Genesis to the resurrection. And everything in the building is symbolic - you can pick up a leaflet on site which helps to explain the symbolism,

Small but well worth a visit.. Saint Chapelle was built to show off Louis IX's collection of relics. It is a staggeringly beautiful Gothic building with completely amazing stained glass windows. The audio guide is essential as the notices are few and far between (and in French). Not suitable for those with disabilities as a steep, narrow spiral staircase has to be negotiated.

Amazing Chapel . We have been into many chapels and churches in Europe but this one so far takes the cake for Architecture and lead lite stained glass windows worth the 10 euros entre fee. Buy your tickets on line before going and you will not have to queue, the Chapel does not look much for out side but be prepared to be Amazed.
Yo have to see it to believe it . No visit to Paris can be complete without going to the Sainte-Chapelle. With or without a guide it will be one of the most beautiful things you can see in the city.

Very very special. If you only visit one church in Paris, make it this one, the stained glass is spectacular. During this trip I also visited Sacre Couer and Notre Dame, both lovely but Sainte-Chapelle is very very special.

Small.. Yeah, after waiting 1 hour in line and then to get through security, it wasn't worth it for me. Free to get in with the Museum Pass and beautiful stained glass inside. Doesn't deserve to be #7 Thing to Do doe :)

Smaller than what I expected . From pictures and what people say about it. I expected something else. But it's still a nice place to visit. Don't visit it alone but include it in a schedule (maybe with notredame Cathedral as they are to close to each other). It was included in the Paris museum pass. We visited at 5:30 there were no lines. And we entered directly.

Stunning windows. We really enjoyed our evening concert at Sainte Chapelle, which was only partly marred by the overwhelming security measures taken to get us there. The concert was not too high-brow, violin repertoire that was really accessible and enjoyable. Recommend it for those who enjoy music but who aren't classical specialists.

stained glass history. when visiting make sure you get the audio tour the placee is nothing short of amazing the history and architecture are enough to visit for but the stained glass windows and story's incorporated are amazing

Evening concert at Sainte Chapelle. When I am traveling with people who have never been to Paris before, I always like to finish the stay with a classical concert given at Sainte Chapelle. It's a nice way to end the visit as it is so beautiful, solemn and classy--kind of like putting the icing on the cake. Tickets are easy to get ahead of time on line (I would suggest that in lieu of getting them in Paris...sometimes it's difficult to get them at the tabac across the street.
