Too beautiful for words. We had a private tour arranged through Viator and our guide was Agathe. She was excellent. Notre Dame cathedral, the Sainte Chapelle and the conciergerie. The Chapelle was really over the top. Ceiling to roof stained glass. Agathe told us the history and pointed out the stories told in the stained glass.

My favorite so far!. This place is stunning. It costs 10 Euros per adult and they let our 4 kids in free (17 and under). The climb upstairs is short--only 22 steps, though spiraling, but oh what beauty awaits you. Magnificence on all sides, breathtaking. A must see if you're in the Nortre Dame area.
WOW!. Beautiful views of all the stain glass windows. The church is much less crowded than Notre Dame and you may buy tickets in advance.
Stain Glass Wonder. Go slow, get the personal audio tour, and stand in awe of some serious stained glass...steep stairs but of limited duration. Be patient.

Stunning. We go to Paris usually in the fall and love Saint/Chappelle. The stained glass is incredible as well as the architecture. We were fortunate enough yo witness a short concert of chants-- extraordinaire.

Real life jewel box upstairs!. I had been looking forward to seeing Sainte Chapelle ever since I saw a picture online of the stained glass walls. That day was a bit rainy and cloudy but we actually lucked out with the weather because the line was only about 5-10 minutes long. The outside of the church is unassuming, not excessively huge with gargoyles perched at the top. When you first walk in, you're in a fairly small room and surrounded by stained glass walls. There's a little counter selling gifts and I was feeling pretty let down and unimpressed, especially since the tickets were 10 euros. But I noticed a little winding staircase to my right and got my hopes up and followed it up and lo and behold, there it was! The view when you step into the second room is heart-stopping. I'm sure it would have been even better on a sunny day but I was in absolute awe that it didn't even matter. The colors and details are to die for. Like everyone else has says, pictures do not do the Sainte Chapelle justice but make sure you still take them! Take a little video too because you can really get a 360 view of the stunning stained glass. One of the highlights of our trip to Paris!
Stunning. The stained glass here is UNREAL. You walk in there and you're just in awe. Make sure to start at the left--the glass tells a story you may have heard before...

Amazing Concert!. I attended an early evening concert at Saint Chapelle. It was amazing! I gasped when I first laid eyes on the stained glass windows. The whole experience was breathtaking. I had a moment while sitting there--"Here I am sitting in Paris listening to classical music surrounded by beauty. And Im here solo. I did it!!" I highly recommend attending a concert here--whether into classical music or not. The experience alone is magical.

Breathtakingly beautiful. This chapel is exquisite. If you have the chance, book a concert in the chapel - you can google search and several options will come up. Great way to experience the space with beautiful classical music in the background.

oh this is what spirituality looks like!. My favorite church in the world. Human sized which that was built for a king. So delicate with smoky light streaming through the multicolored windows.Travelers with kids can hunt for four little sculpted faces decorating the bottoms of columns upstairs.I recommend buying tickets online to beat the lines.. (You don't have to print them out, just show tickets on phone.)I have yet to do so myself but everyone I know in Paris seems to love the concerts available there.
Well worth a visit. Yes the church is small and there's a fee to enter. What you experience though, is a stunning and close up view of stained glass windows unlike any other.

Don't waste your money - Tourist Trap. This church did not have a sanctity of a church - it was just one big tourist trap. Yes it did have stained glass windows but they charged you to get in. I thought that the Christ's holy thorns were stored at this chapel (that is why I went) and I learned that they had been moved to Notre Dame (where you could visit for free). The church didn't have the lovely vibes of a sacred center - there were tons of tourists just taking pictures and guides talking to tour groups. If you don't have time, skip this attraction!

Amazing Windows but overpriced . As others have said the stain glass windows are fantastic, we visited on a cloudy day so perhaps did not see them at their best. We arrived at about 1600 so only queued for about 10 minutes so that was fine, however admission of 10€ seems a little steep, we were only inside for about 15 minutes so not good value.

Try to see it on a sunny day!. Stained glass windows to marvel over, better when the sun shines, we went twice (thank you museum pass!!) once in the morning and again in the late afternoon to see the sun through each set of windows. Our favorite place in Paris (except restaurants)

Climb up the stairs. You will never appreciate this place enough otherwise.. The best thing about the St. Chapelle is its location, but the grandeur of the building adds to the enchantment. Right now the soccer balls in the grass in anticipation of the European cup are a fun unexpected addition.
Impressive. Seeing the church from the outside does not prepare you for how impressive the stained glass work really is. Highly recommend seeing!

Beautiful Windows and architexture. Visited on a rainy day. Lines not bad at all. Entrance tickets are 10 euros per adult which is a bit high compared to other attractions but worth it. Windows are beautiful wished that the sun was out to appreciate its full beauty. Maybe next time. The main chapel upstairs is small and can feel claustrophobic and crowded. Probably would take about 45-60 mins to visit. Leave strollers and big bags out the staircase to go up is narrow and circular.

Visit and Take in a Concert. To be sure the church is beautiful but hearing Vivaldi's Four Seasons in the church is exceptional. Plan to spend an hour one evening here and just take in the surroundings while listening to classical music. Fantastic

Beautiful Stained Glass Masterpiece. Walking into Sainte-Chapelle you are greeted by walls of stained glass each telling a story. It is amazing to see the detail of these windows and what it took to restore them in all their glory! We did not plan on visiting but we were glad that our change in plans took us to this spectular place.

Impressive stained glass work. All has been said already, so here are our tips:- Buy tickets online to avoid the queues- Be there early if you can (as being do close to Notre-Dame, you might want to do this one after Notre-Dame).- On the first level, if you want a good shot of the Virgin, tag on to a group that is close to it and, when it moves away to go on the 2nd level, sneak in to take good shots On the 2nd floor, it's usually packed, but you're able to roam easily.- Make sure to step out on the 2nd floor as the doors are impressive.

Concert, worth it!. I attended an early evening concert at Sainte-Chapelle. I had visited the church a couple days earlier and was looking forward to the concert. It doesn't really matter where you sit, in the front or the back, unless you really want to see the musicians. I sat in the back so I could see all the amazing stained glass. Well worth it.

One of my favorite places in Paris. The exterior is in the process of being cleaned, and it will look marvelous.The interior of the Sainte-Chapelle has 2 floors. On the lower floor you find some stained glass windows but it's the upper level which will stunt you. The light coming through the recently cleaned windows, with it's intricate colors and visual information is something that you have to see.There is a video where the process of cleaning this windows is explained, and the 5 minutes that you will spend watching it is worthwhile. Take your time, don't rush and adminre this Royal Chapel.

Great site, not worth the admission.. This is a wonderful site, but not worth the admission price. The most notable feature of this site are the stained glass windows. Beautiful but, not worth the line.

Breathtaking stained glass. I caught my breath when I walked up to the second level of this chapel, and saw the incredible stained glass walls reaching heavenward! This is truly a place of beauty and art! If you appreciate architecture and beautiful churches, I highly recommend the visit
Incredible stain glass. We were very excited to see Saint Chapelle.the stain glass here is beautiful. Great history. Charge to enter but it is well worth the price. Do not miss this.
A wonderful slice of medieval Paris. Sainte-Chapelle is well worth visiting. The atmosphere is unique and it is a treat to be able to get so close to medieval stained glass. Don't miss it

Stunning. Amazing chapel of beautiful stained windows. It's up a short flight of stairs - rather poorly signposted - above the main church. Not to be missed.
Security and an entry fee but a short wait relative to most other sites.
Best vitro . The best vitro that I have ever seen, and If you are lucky, and outside is sunny you will have an amazing view ... Look closely all this art

Wonderful Sight. Arrived to find that there was no Paris Museum Pass access line through the security gate at the street. Once we made our way through the security screening checkpoint, we found a long line wrapping half-way around the side of the chapel. We then quickly discovered that they did accept the PMP and cut the line, walking right in with zero wait. Beautiful stained glass on the inside. There's a small (very small) winding staircase to get to the second level where the stained glass is, but it's not very long. PMP saved us about an hour wait.
Gorgeous. We were lucky to visit without having to wait in line. This is a beautiful church with amazing stained glass windows. Would recommend despite the 10 euro entry charge.
Nice, but not a must see. Nice stain glass, but it obviously pales in comparison to Notre Dame. Also, there is not much information available about it or it's history.

Stained Glass Heaven!. It seems like all of the churches in Europe are known for something special. For St. Chappelle it is the stained glass. The shear volume of the stained glass i overwhelming, but the stories contained therein are even more spectacular. We were able to book a tour an had a personal guide through Viator (highly recommended). I learned more from her as we studied the stories contained in the stained glass than a lifetime of staring on mown could have taught me.
Heavenly String Concert. We attended a 1 man violin concert that was absolutely phenomenal for 20e. Sun set through the stainglass.

Amazing stained glass windows! Gothic glory shining!. Even on an overcast day, this was well worth the visit. I never saw a Cathedral with a more beautiful room of stained glass windows which are practically floor to ceiling. King Louis IX built this room to store and display to display the crown of thorns on the altar. The staircase is narrow, because only the priest and the king accessed this room. The glory of gothic doesn't shine any brighter than in this cathedral.

The real beauty is upstairs!. I couldn't understand why we could get into Notre Dame free and this had a 10Euro charge. We walked into the main area on the ground floor and thought "Um...OK, it's nice but it's not THAT nice." Luckily my sister asked about a post card she saw but we hadn't seen in real life and they told us to go upstairs. THAT is the real Sainte Chapelle. It's GORGEOUS! Worth the trip and cost!
Very Beautiful Windows. The windows blew us away. They were very pretty and impressive. You wouldn't have guessed from looking on the outside.

Better than any museum in Paris. The scenery in this cathedral is better than anything in any museum in Paris. It is also much prettier than the gothic style Notre Dame, which is much more famous. This is a must do. No trip to Paris is complete without a visit here. Get the museum pass and make it worth your while.
Visit to Sainte-Chapelle. Sainte-Chapelle can't be missed. We got there late in the afternoon on a weekday and there was basically no wait to get in
Beautiful stained glass windows in small church. This church is stunning!! It is small, especially compared to Notre Dam. The latter is blocks away. This is nice, well kept, and is recommended.
Stained glass fairytale. Beautiful stained glass walls all around you, with 1100 Biblical themes and each wall panel is of a different design. Magical play of light when the sun shines through

Jewel box of stained glass. It's worth the wait on line, although you can get tickets online ahead. Don't make the mistake of one poor soul who wondered what all the fuss was about since the chapel had a low ceiling of blue with gold stars. She neglected to go up the winding staircase in the corner to emerge in this 13th century stained glass jewel box. Try to see it on a sunny day in the afternoon. Highly recommended.

Very cool intimate chapel. We toured st chapelle as part of our notre dame tour. It was very cool. The intimacy of the chapel was a contrast to both the cathedral as well as the royal chapel at Versailles.

Timing Is Everything - But Don't Miss The Concerts. This beautiful chapel is known for it's magnificent stained glass windows. They are truly remarkable, almost overwhelming. Unfortunately, we came at 5pm on a cloudy day, so the results were not as dramatic as they could have been.On the other hand, we had the good fortune of seeing an evening concert by a string quartet with vocalist one evening, and that environment was magical. The talent was exceptional, and the size of the chapel made the entire evening intimate.Don't miss a chance for the concert, but if you're coming for the stained glass, pick a sunny day.

Yes, those remarkable windows!!!. Those tall, Gothic stained-glass windows are the stars here, but don't expect a giant cathedral like Notre Dame. This is magnificent beauty in one room crammed with tourists all looking up. For many Parisians, this is their favorite church, and for very good reason: you've never seen such colors in your life. Give yourself a good 45-minutes to get into Sainte-Chapelle because the staff modulates how many people can be in the cathedral at any one time, so if you don't time your visit correctly, you could be waiting a while. My suggestion: late-afternoon an hour before it closes. You only need an hour here, really.

Enchanting, Uplifting, Marvelous. Visit the treasure chest cathedral that was designed as the place to receive the Holy Relic of the Crown of Thorns, that was said to have rested on Jesus's head on the cross. - Today housed in the more recently constructed Notre Dame Cathedral a few blocks away.

An evening of music in this remarkable space. On May 1, we had the opportunity to attend a performance by a string quartet in the chapel space. We had visited Sainte-Chappelle in 2013, but saw this as a wonderful opportunity to return. The program included Mozart's Requiem which was wonderful but even greater was by the end of the concert (approximately 20h) the setting sun was pouring through the rose window which the principal violinist pointed out at the end. It was a truly moving experience in this most remarkable space.

Other-worldly. Do not miss this. If you go to Paris and only do one thing, make it Sainte-Chapelle. You can take 100 pictures of it -- and no doubt you will -- but none of them will capture the feeling of standing in the middle of that chapel. They have concerts there as well. I haven't gotten to do that yet, but it's worth researching.

Outstanding. Photos of this place do not do it justice. The glass is simply magnificent. Be prepared to wait on a line to gain entrance. Sainte-Chapelle is smaller in person than it appears in photos so the attendants try to limit the amount of tourists inside at any one time. Good idea. Near Notre Dame so good to combine visits.

Beyond Beautiful. If you want to be taken back by the beauty of stain glass windows, Saint Chappelle is the place for you to visit. You will stand and ponder the craftsmanship. Words cannot express the awe you will feel. There is a fee to enter but it is well worth it.Dr. Marc, PS 63:7NOTE: Take time to read the other reviews that I’ve posted on TripAdvisor on Paris sites: Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, St, Etienne-Du-Monty, St. Sulpice Church, Au Petit Cafe and the Gardens of Luxembourg

Stained Glass extraordinary !. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Sainte-Chapelle. We didn't know that the stained glass had been under renovation for many years but glad it is over. They have done a great job in cleaning it from the past 150 years of dust, dirt and moisture. The light just streams into the church through the windows and the colors are beautiful. Well worth a visit.

One of the most expressive expressions of the Gothic Arquitecture. One of the most beautiful and impressive Gothic expressions of the XIII century. This is a place you can not miss at all. You have to be patient though, because the queues are discouraging. You may buy a combo ticket to visit this Chapel and Notre Dame towers and make the visit to these attractions cheaper
As breathtaking as always. A most beautiful alternative and/or add on to a visit to Notre Dame. Just around the corner. Stunning stained glass as far as the eye can see

The most beautiful stained glass I've ever seen!. Don't let the outside fool you. From the inside, it's jaw-dropping. We walked right in with the Museum Pass, no line, spent a few minutes inside taking photos and picking our jaws up off of the floor and then on to our next location. Located next to Conciergerie and a block away from Notre Dame so make it a combo!
Breathtaking!. We had never visited this gem, and were so happy to have done some went twice using our Paris Museum Pass! Highly recommend. No long lines either.
Beautiful stained glass. Small church, with a secret upstairs. Climb the spiral staircase to marvel the beautiful glass and ceilings.

"Wow" Plus.. We visited Ste.-Chapelle in 2013 when the scaffolding was still up over half of the interior. Re-visited this May having read that the Restoration of the glass was completed. Consecrated in 1248, you'll probably not find another church with this array of stained glass. Better than Notre Dame (1/4 mile away)."Wow! does not begin to describe this.

Stunning cathedral, renowned stained glass. One of the most beautiful cathedrals anywhere. Amazing stained-glass, particularly when it is a light day. I recommend a concert in this venue, which you can purchase tickets for in advance
Beautiful chapel to visit. Very narrow and curving stairs will take you up to the Chapel in Sainte-Chapelle where you can sit in peace and wonder at the sight of stained glass windows.

Beautiful church in a beautiful setting. Highly recommended!. Sainte-Chapelle is located away from lots of the other tourist sights in Paris. But, as with most things in Paris it is easily reached by the Metro. The station is a bit of a walk from the church but it is an interesting walk.There are a ton of shops and stores on the street up to the church. There are people in the street playing the shell game and separating the tourists from their Euros. Fun to watch but not fun to get taken in.There were many people just hanging out on the stairs enjoying the day. The Church is very nice to see and certainly worth a visit.
Amazing stained glass. Beautiful old church not far from Notre Dam. Probably the best stained glass you will see in Europe. Free to visit and definitely worth a look.

Magical experience. We had the privilege to attend an evening performance of Mozart music by string quartet. One cannot ask for a more serene and beautiful setting. The acoustics are outstanding and the experience is divine. The website for the tickets sums it up the best:"What could be more inspiring than a chamber music concert in the famed 'Holy Chapel', the Sainte Chapelle, in Paris? Located on the Île de la Cité in the center of the city, this gem of Gothic architecture is renowned for its stained glass and delicate wood and stone work. A concert at La Sainte Chapelle offers a unique and unforgettable experience."
Impressive!. A must see during your stay in Paris. It is an old historical church.The windows are beautiful, pure magic !

Takes Your Breath Away. Stunning stained glass venue that is well worth the price to see this array.. No picture can capture the stunning scene. Interesting video showing what the glass looked like before the 10 year renovation completed in 2014. A not to miss sight and so convenient to Notre Dame.

One of the most beautiful places. This chapel is amazing! There's literally stained glass windows everywhere and they are beautiful! The chapel is quite small, so it can get crowed when there's a lot of people.

Easily the most stunning attraction in Paris . This should be a must see for everyone going to Paris. A small winding staircase leads you up to a door and then the view that you see is amazing, outstanding, wonderful, indescribable. Definitely add this to your list of things to see. Buy tickets online before you go.

Stain glasses. You may use your museum pass to admit, but it won't allow you to the skip the queue. That's okay, because the lines go quick. It's just amazing how many stain glass windows are in there. Get your camera ready.

WOW!. This very old chapel is unbelievable! The stained glass windows are so intricate, it is just beautiful and humbling. I am glad we went here, such a quaint church compared to Notre Dame, but just as compelling.

Evening concert in chapel brought tears to my eyes. Most nights there are concerts in La Sainte Chapelle, which I highly recommend as a way of seeing the chapel. On a beautiful spring evening, we booked a dusk concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons and were moved to tears when we walked in, hearing violins and being awed by gorgeous floor to ceiling stained glass windows. All during the concert I just gazed and gazed at the colors and how the reds, greens, yellows and blues in the windows stood out as the sun went down. We felt enjoying the concert in the chapel, although a little pricey, was one of the highlights of our visit to Paris.

Get into the mood. They are cleaning the stained glass so the scaffolding is a bit distracting. We went there on an afternoon after having communion at Notre Dame Cathedral (by shear mistake) and as we came into the room, the Monks started singing their afternoon prayers. It was spectacular and sobering to hear. Talk about a "Wow" moment? God was with us this day.. . . . . . . .
Must see. There's nothing else to be said - this is a not to be missed experience. Do not rush it, take your time.
Worth the wait. Despite the rainy day, the stained glass was overwhelmingly impressive! We were lucky enough to get an unexpected guided tour which made the visit even more worthwhile.

Stunning stained glass. This Cathedral is astonishingly beautiful and worth visiting. I was surpised by how small it actually was, but was not disappointed. I recommend buying or borrowing a guide pamphlet that gives you a bit of context about the paintings. Each window tells a different story!

It is worth the wait. This wonderful example of gothic arcitechure is worth the hassel to get to and worth the wait in the ticket line. When you first was into the church, you will feel slightly underwhelmed- this is normal- go up the stairs and wait to be impressed! Make sure you buy the combo ticket, which will save you a couple of euros! Also, because most of the church in the upper section is stained glass- really impressive stained glass in fact, go on a sunny day to really feel the impact of its impressiveness!
Maybe the most beautiful church in Paris. the feeling there is one of amazingment. It's so beautiful it takes your breath away. It's a paid attraction but worth every cent.

must see, closed at 6 pm. Nice church you should visit when visiting Notre Damme. In some days there are Vivaldi or Bach concerts. Don't forget to go upstairs and read the plastic covered information available next to exit stairs of the second floor.

Stunning. Shame about the other visitors' noise!. Go as soon as it opens. It's a true delight but best seen with as few other visitors as possible. People seem to forget that this is a chapel and made too much noise.

Concert in this beautiful church is not to be missed. We attended a one hour Vivaldi concert (7 pm) and the beautiful music plus the light changing on the beautiful stained glass windows as the sun was setting was just beyond words. This was one of our favorite things we did in Paris.

Concert at Sainte-Chapelle. This cathedral is everything you've read and more. We saw a concert of the Four Seasons, Vivaldi there. The acoustics were superb. Listening to a concert below all the stained glass was a special part of the trip for us.

Beautiful place, but bad pretty ugly atmosphere. We took the combined ticket of entrance to the Sainte-Chapelle and entrance to the Conciergerie. Firstly, the Sainte-Chapelle had a small queue (tiny relative to other Paris attractions!). As I stepped inside it was a bit of a chock to be honest. This is still a religious building, but it felt more like I was at a tourist market! Even though there were signs to keep quiet (as most often there is in religious buildings of this sort), the noise level was rather overwhelming, as the amount of visitors was very high (definitely not a place for quiet reflection!), as well as the VERY strange decision to have the souvenir sales inside the chapel which obviously not only forces up the noise level but definitely takes away from the experience. Once you head up to the second floor things improve. I had a "woaw" moment as I come into the upstairs hall, as the windows are indeed breathtakingly beautiful. The building is spectacular. And also holds very important history being part of the early Paris. It is still very crowded up here ad the chapel is a small building, and you have to duck for selfie sticks. In the end, definitely worth a visit, but could have been a much nicer experience if management would have handled things differently.Tip: the beauty of the coloured windows rely on light so don't go when it's dark or a very dark grey day.

Astonishing . No picture can do it justice, genuinely one of the prettiest things I've ever seen. You go up a little windy staircase and emerge into the most beautiful room. If you're on the fence I really wouldn't skip it. Short queues as people don't think it'll be that good i dont think, and a lovely shop too.
Built entirely of glass (almost). The most amazing floor to ceiling stained glass walls, on the Isle de France. It makes you stare in wonder!

Breathtaking. I saw the photos and heard it was something to see but as a person who loves photography this place took my breath away. You can spend hours standing and gazing at the beauty around you. A must see when in Paris.

Mesmerizing . The gothic style itself is grandiose and heavy. It should shock and make vision small. Inferior to God and its representatives. This chapel feeling was totally new and unexpected for gothic architecture. It's almost completely made of stained-glass windows. It has very different feeling and must see for anyone who is architecture or gothic churches. Absolutely unique.
Huge columns! Magnificent monument!. This is just worth the visit! It's huge and magnificent. Art everywhere. Not only art but masterpieces. A delight for art lovers.

INSPIRATIONAL EXPERIENCE AT THIS PHENOMENAL CATHEDRAL!. Pictures in books and on the web don't do justice to the remarkable brilliance of Sainte Chapelle's magnificent stories told through these stained glass windows. In the lower level, there is a beautiful and glorious smaller church that is inspiring.......then when you climb the steps into the main church, it takes your breath away! Walk around and then sit down in a chair on the side and grab an explanation of each of the windows (in a stand at the back in various languages) and relive the stories depicted in these remarkable masterpieces! The church is smaller than I thought, but very impressive and beautiful!

Lovely stained glass window. Another wonderful place in Paris. We arrived there at about 2.15pm, just after it reopened after lunch. I'd heard the queue can be quite long but it was fine. We only waited about 10 minutes and to get in.This is another attraction you can get in for free if you're under 25 and part of the EU. Bonus!
Spectacular stained glass. Worth the entrance fee. I have never seen such epic stained glass. Chapel is in somewhat ugly surroundings but go in and be wowed.

"Must see" when in Paris. I have visited it several times in the past. Beautiful church. Never overcrowded to enjoy the beauty in full. Best time of visiting are sunny days between 11-14h, because the shinning light through glass windows is the most effective.During high season be prepared to wait in a long que to enter the sight, but have patience, it will pay off at the end! It is a"must see" sight in Paris.
The Most Beautiful Chapel on Earth. It doesn't get more spectacular than this. Every bit of wall is stained glass telling the entire story of the bible. It is truly magnificent.

I literally gasped. The first time I went to Sainte-Chapelle, I was looking down at the steps while climbing them. I had often read, in cheap novels, of people gasping when they saw something. Only a cliche, I thought--until I reached the second floor. I actually did gasp. It is beyond exquisite. One can also sit outside, to take a break, on actual medieval seats. If you're a history buff, this will give you chills.

It'll take your breath away. So from the outside it looks like nothing but once inside there is so much history and beauty. Go to the 2nd story and spend time looking at all the crazy colors in the stained glass. If possible take a fat tires your and you'll be Abel to see Norte dame and Saint chapellle

Amazing stain glass. This is a must see! Notre Dame is certainly spectacular but you simply can't miss the stain glass at Sainte-Chapelle. The line can be long so arrive early. Admission is included with the Paris Museum Pass which I recommend as well as you skip the ticket purchasing line and only have to deal with the security line.

Go for the concert!. Definitely worth a visit to this beautiful location. If you get a chance, book tickets to a concert for a surreal and unique experience and a great way to see the beautiful church.

The most beautiful church!. This has to be the most beautiful church I've ever been in. I keep returning to it and it never disappoints. I always find something new to gaze at in awe! This time, I bought tickets to a concert. If you do nothing else in Paris, get tickets to a concert here! It's a small church with amazing acoustic. We were treated to Pachebel's Canon and Vivaldi's Four Seasons. It was utterly transporting. I bought mine on Classictic.com. Tip: Get the cheaper tix! You don't want to be down front. You want to sit in the middle or further back so that you can take in the windows as the sun sets as you listen to beautiful music!

Beautiful venue for a concert . We attended a piano/violin/cello concert here. Fabulous acoustics and beautiful venue. The stained glass windows alone are worth the visit. The church rises above the Palais de Justice and you exit through the front doors of the Palais. Expect bags to be searched/X-rayed when you enter.

Fabulous!!!!. This was a wonderful experience. We had read that this was a very beautiful church. We lined up and it did not take very long to get in, although we did see people who had pre purchased tickets skip the line (probably the better way to go).We walked into the entrance level and actually wondered why this was so highly recommend, but when we took the spiral staircase upstairs, we were absolutely amazed at the beautiful stained glass windows. Too lofty and stunning to describe, you must experience yourself.
Mouthing droppingly stunning. One simply forgets how stunningly magnificent this place is. A must see for everyone who visits Paris. Use your museum pass and do with Notre Dame.
Exquisite windows. If you see nothing else in Paris, please see Sainte-Chapelle. The windows will take your breath away and tell a beautiful story. I go back there every time I am in Paris.
Prettiest stain glass windows anywhere in Paris!. You have to visit Sainte-Chapelle. It outshines Notre Dame! Well worth getting in line and paying the requisite charge!

Jaw dropping sight. We were recommended to visit here by friends. The lower level is a bit disappointing, especially as it houses a shop. However when you go upstairs to the main chapel, then it is jaw dropping. Amazing huge stain glass windows and all recently restored. Not widely known but highly recommended.
Beautiful, Don't miss!. Absolutely stunning inside. Skip going in Notre Dame and go inside here! Museum Pass will get you inside quicker too.

A hidden gem. We like to come here every time we visit Paris. It's a monument to the craftspeople of an ancient time, and to Christianity. It can be seen in a very short time. When you enter the bottom floor you think it can't get better, but then you take the rather claustrophobic spiral staircase to the upper sanctuary where the elite worshipped, and you are impressed even more. Take your time here...it's worth it.

Simply put - you must see this place!. Photos do not do Sainte-Chapelle justice. The stained glass of this beautiful cathedral is amazing. The colors are stunning and the intricacy is mind-blowing. Buy the combined ticket with the Concierge tour next door to by-pass the longer lines. The Concierge is an interesting building on its own, and you will then enter to Ste Chapelle via the Justice Ministry (which is a little confusing).

Must DO!!. This is so close to Notre Dame, and I think the stained glass windows are even more amazing than Notre Dame. So glad my family came here! Be prepared, there are somewhat steep steps (but not too many) to get to the upper floor, but it is well worth it!
A must see!. Very small line to get in. Went on a sunny morning and it was absolutely stunning! The glass has been recently restored.
Lovely stain glass windows. Beautiful windows and lovely ambience. The entrance fee of 10 euros is maybe a little high for what you do see in my opinion.
Beautiful, but expensive. A truly beautiful building, but it is a very limited venue and to charge the same as for say Musee D'Orsay is out of balance
Pictures don't do it justice. On a sunny day the light through the tall stained glass windows is beautiful, not to say divine. Well worth a visit.

Steps away from the Grotto . We were fortunate to stay at this excellent hotel a stones throw from the Grotto .
The rooms and service were excellent and we were well looked after by the wonderful receptionist Hendi, who was charming and extremely helpfull.
Dissapointed with the restaurant though.
Highly recomend this hotel to all those visiting Lourdes on a pilgrimage.

Worth visiting. A great place to visit. Make sure that you visit when there is a concert int he evening . A great experience. Avoid booking with dinner across the street. Not worth it. Visit a local place after the concert.
Paris. Very interesting story. Small chapel with very narrow spiral staircase but worth the fairly short climb. The stain glass is breath taking

Gorgeous!!! The prettiest church in Paris!!. This really is one of the prettiest churches in Paris!! It was originally built by Saint Louis to house the Crown of Thorns relic, but during the revolution it was damaged and it was moved. I don't think it's consecrated right now, but it was restored, and it is just gorgeous!! Make sure you see the second floor, that's the pretty one with all the stained glass. Look up pictures online!! Mostly they do concerts there now. Lots of religious music and maybe some classical or opera! Don't miss!!

Hidden Treasure. Worth the effort to find and tour. A visual feast of some of the most beautiful stain glass work on earthA quick one hour in and outWe went with friends and if it cost, we didn't pay. As it is a church, we left a donation for continuing restorationJust magnificent

Breathtaking!. This is the church to see in Paris! Words cannot express the shear beauty of the stained glass. You are engulfed in beauty everywhere you look. This truly one of the most beautiful churches in the world.

Stunning stained glass. I thought I knew what to expect based on photos. I was wrong. It was even more beautiful than I imagined. We went late in the day (around 5-6 pm) and it was a bit cloudy outside, and the stained glass was still stunning. Loved it. Sainte-Chappelle is also quick. You'll be in and out in under an hour.

Beautiful Stain Glass. The beauty of Sainte-Chapelle is its stained glass windows which are on the 2nd floor. The Cathedral is closed from 1:00-2:15 pm everyday, so plan accordingly. Also it is 10 euros per person to go in which we felt was a little high for something which you only view for 15-20 minutes.

Unbelievable…. Sainte Chapelle is a small Gothic chapel located quite close to Notre Dame. It is an old historical church. It is the place to see to get an impression of what is a Gothic structure.After a long spiral staircase you will lead to the main part of the attraction, the stunning stained glasses. Arranged across 15 windows, each 15 meters high, the stained glass panes depict scenes from the Old and New Testaments.During a sunny day the stained glass is incredible.The admission lines are long. We visited during last February and we waited in line almost one hour to get in.My recommendation is getting the ticket for both the Chapel and the Conciergerie (Prison).

Incredible. This place is probably the most incredible place I have ever seen, and we just sort of tripped into it! It's not on the top ten list of Paris sites, but I think it should be Number 1. When you step into this room, you literally stop and your mouth hits the floor from the beauty surrounding you. You just have to go! After being here, Notre Dame was a disappointment. Really! Don't miss this! I won't try to elaborate, first because words don't do it justice and second because I don't want to spoil that moment for you.
Stunning. The chapel was stunning. The only disappointment was the relic, Christ's Crown of Thorns was not there as we thought, but rather at Notre Dame.

Exquisite. Words simply cannot describe the beautiful of Sainte-Chapelle, especially the second level. It is best visited on a day when there is some sun so the stained glass glows. We have visited several times, and, without fail, walking out of the stairwell into the second level is a moving experience. A word of caution: young children will quickly lose interest.

Must see if you like gothic churches. Please choose a sunny day if you want to visit and go early ( like 9:30 or 10 o'clock). You won't regret it! The windows are beautiful and you won't see anything similar on this planet again!

Unimaginable Beauty. When you first enter the ground floor it is impressive but when you climb the stairs to the second floor the stain glass windows over whelm you. This is just so beautiful. Take the time to just sit and wonder what was done to create such beauty.

Breathtaking stained glass. These have to be the most breathtakingly beautiful stained glass windows in all of Paris! The colors are brilliant, lots of red and blue, and the images are very detailed. They are floor to ceiling, so you are surrounded by nothing but stained glass. Definitely take the circular staircase up to see the round window. You can visit Sainte-Chapelle and Notre Dame in the same trip as they are close together, and get a combination ticket for the Conciergerie too to save money. (Notre Dame is free.)
A must see ! . Built as a representation of the heaven.. Originally the floor was a white marble. Light filtering with a sunny day before 3pm is pure magic ! Enjoy

Without doubt the most spectacular church in Paris.. When you have queued up and passed through security and queued again to enter this church you wonder if it's going to be worth it but once you ascend the stone spiral staircase and enter the space you are immediately struck by what the medieval mind must have made of this exquisite and flawless expression of devotion. Do not go to Paris without seeing this most beautiful jewel.

Stunning. Beautiful light filled Holy Chapel built in Rayonnant Gothic style, famous for its high ceilings , numerous stained glass windows and rose window. Located at the western end of Ile de la Cité, it was built in the courtyard of the Palais de La Cité as a royal chapel to house Louis IX's sacred relics and for the private use of the residents of the Palace and a school of canons . Now it is open to the public for visits, guided tours and concerts. Only about a ten minute walk away from Notre Dame cathedral , it is worth visiting at the same time .

Beautiful. A must when visiting Paris, especially if you are already in the vicinity of Notre Dame. In hindsight, I wish we had bought a combination ticket and toured the Conciergerie, but we were on limited time and didn't know how long it would take to tour the Chapel. My only complaint is that they should have had the "stained glass handouts" at the entrance of the chapel, instead of at the exit. It would have been so much more helpful to have had it BEFORE touring the chapel instead of after. But, it was a wonderful experience. The stained glass is breathtaking.
Don't avoid the stairs. We visited today. The church is very old. Downstairs was ok. Upstairs, 40 steps on a circular staircase, is where you see the beautiful Windows. Breathtaking.

The most incredible stained glasses. This small chapelle is one of the most beautiful ones I have ever seen. Its incredible and colourful and stained glasses surround you, thus giving you an ethereal and emocionant experience, enhanced by their nearness.

Glad we did it. This was not really high on our list of things to do in Paris, but very glad we went. It was covered by the Museum Pass, and it didn't take long to experience. In short, it is clearly one of the most beautiful cathedrals due to its stained glass - even if that means nothing to you (didn't sound overly exciting to me), just go, say your "wow" and then move on. Worth the effort.

Simply breathtaking!. I have always wanted to visit Saint Chapelle, but despite visiting Paris several times prior never seem to get there for one reason or another. I was surprised that on our visit the queues were not long (which is one of the reasons I have not visited previously in Summer). The entry fee is 10.00 EUR (which also entitled us to entry into the Concergerie).My husband and I were part of a Context gothic architecture tour so we were explained the history of the building at length which was very interesting. I am simply obsessed with gothic architecture, so as well as listening to the tour guide, I was also trying to take a whole heap of photos.Sainte-Chappele has a ground level and the upper level - it's the upper level that is the known the world over for its amazing stain glass windows. The interior is just simply jaw dropping beautiful.I have to say I was extremely moved by the experience, and wanted to stay longer, but unfortunately being part of a tour we had to move on. I decided to return the next day, and fortunately my husband was also willing to return.We arrived earlier in the morning the next day and got in very easily, with hardly anyone around. We made our way up to the upper level and I simply sat (there are plenty of seats provided) and took the beauty of the building in for at least one hour, interspersed with getting up and taking at least 100 photos.The interior detail with the light filtering through the stained glass windows is just something that everyone must experience. The craftsmanship is just extraordinary!I can't recommend visiting Sainte-Chapelle enough, please visit when you have time to just sit and take in the beauty before your eyes. Too many tourists just come in take a few photos and leave within half an hour.For me this is simply one of the most beautiful buildings in the world!

It was good.... ...but I'm not Catholic so I felt a little awkward. Its just i find the art in there so fascinating and that's why I went but to be honest there was a lot of people there so if you have young children I suggest keeping a close eye on them.

Not to be Missed. Yes this is the place with the stained glass windows and yes they are as spectacular as everyone told you they would be. It would be worth it to time your visit when a concert is being given.

Stained glass heaven. As our Context tour guide Rebecca told us, Sainte-Chapelle really is the jewel of Gothic architecture in Paris. Despite being smaller than the Notre Dame Cathedral, the stained glass windows are exquisite and well worth the sometimes long security line check. We went right after their daily break from 1-2:15 PM.
GORGEOUS!. Well worth the visit. It's gorgeous! The colors are beautiful inside. There's fleur de lis painted all over the walls and ceilings.
Yes, go!. Amongst the top of my 1.5 day visit. Beautiful stain glass windows...so unique and gorgeous. Stand and sit in awe.

Beautiful and historic chapel in Paris. Wonderful place to visit and take some awesome photos while pondering the engineering and craftsmanship that made this chapel possible. For those of us that share a religious appreciation, it is a strong reminder of the role that religion played during this period in history and a great spiritual inspiration.

Don't miss this!. Incredible stain glass windows. Originally built to hold Christ's relics. The line looks daunting but it goes fast and it is just the security line then you enter the courtyard where the chapel is. If you have a museum pass you can go to the front of this second line at the chapels entrance. 2nd floor is where the most famous stain glass windows are located. Best to go on sunny day
A jewel!. Even on a rainy day one should experience the sensual colours that create a spiritual setting in this small chapel.

Nearly floor to ceiling stained glass.. Sainte Chapelle is only about two blocks from Notre Dame, so very easy to squeeze into your itinerary. Big security here, since it is right next to the Supreme Court building. But this is really something to see! When you walk in, don't be fooled, as what you are seeing is only the beginning. Take the stone spiral staircase in the corner to your left and when you come out at the top, it will take your breath away. The stained glass windows are probably 2 stories high and are really the walls of the church, not just the windows. SO beautiful!

Appreciate the Slills of the past Artisans. The stained glass windows are a wonder to see. I could not believe how these windows have such a variety of colours and detail. Given the Color and stability of the pigments available hundreds of years ago, the lasting images are incredible.Please note you have to go up a circular narrow stone staircase to get to the second floor. It is worth the climb.....About forty steps. Bring your camera. We nearly missed viewing, since there are some windows on the 1st floor. Unbelievable!! The talent artists and craftsmen had from the past. Short visit but you can stay as long as you wish.
Beautiful Stained Glass. Incredible stained glass. Very small pieces with lots of details. Each section tells stories. So much to see.
Inspirational lovely stained glass windows. A short walk from Notre Dame on the island (past a marvelous crepe shop...) to a large rectangular building. Worth the trip!

Unique but not impressive. This small rectangular chapel is about a long block from Norte Dame. I saw several signs for it. Because of its size, the line to get in will stall then move then stall, as they let people in as groups depending on people exiting. Ten euros to get in, or Paris museum pass. You enter into a gift shop, turn hard left at the door and climb up a spiral stone staircase, quite a few steps. The chapel itself is rather small. The uniquely tall stained glass is a wow for many, but if you've seen Chartres then this will not impress you, but the architecture of much glass and little stone might. Went late in the day and there was still quite a wait.

One of the highlights of our trip. My wife had heard about this chapel from a friend and told us not to miss it - she was right! It was a little tricky to find and we waited a while to get in, but I got chills as we entered the main cathedral holding the these amazing stained glass panels. No picture or verbal description can do justice describing these beautiful works of art. The level of craftsmanship to create these panels boggles the mind. It would have been a tragedy to miss this spectacular sight in Paris.

Must Visit. The stained glass are simply jaw dropping and the old artifacts and pieces of historic sculptures are a must see. The Justice building next too it is also a good visit for those interested.

Not worth the money. It was 10€ per person to go in and read a few plaques about what used to be there. The stained glass windows in the upper level were quite pretty but it would be difficult for older people to get up the stairs and it was not handicap accessible at all. It would have been nice to have bathrooms nearby as well.
Hidden Gem. It's a little hard to find, but it's worth the trouble. If you're thinking, "Yeah, yeah, yeah, another cathedral in Europe.", think again. It's unique and beautiful.

Wonderful concert!. We attended the 7pm concert at the end of April. The space is incredible and the concert was excellent. The line for security is long and the wait to enter the space is long, but it was all worth it. One of the most memorable experiences in Paris.
Do not miss. I was awestruck walking in to this church. It is spectacularly beautiful. The windows, the windows, the windows.......

Stunning after fresh renovation. I had been to Sainte-Chapelle 15 years ago but was a little disappointed as the stained glass was rather grimy and dim. However it has all been lovingly cleaned in 2015 and is gob-smacking to see, particularly on a bright day. As the glass begins at head height, it all can be seen clearly even in a crowd. You can easily spend an hour or so looking at the stories being told and clearly visible. Make this a must-see on your trip, a short walk form Notre Dame. When we visited on a Sunday we also enjoyed a nearby street market in Spring, filled with nursery flowers and caged birds for sale, making for beautiful photos.

A jewel box!. Even small children can appreciate the beauty of this small, intimate chapel. Even on a cloudy day the windows are simply stunning. We went with our duaghter (age 3) and nephew (age 4) and they enjoyed the colors and winding stone stairs while the adults enjoyed the history and stories behind each perfect window.

Worth the visit. This was a truely incredible experience, once we got into the main room of the chapel. The stairway to this is tucked away in a corner.It is not a big place and you cannot spend hours here, but if you want peaceful and beautiful mosaics this is the place to go.
A must see!!!. We purchased a combo ticket for Sainte Chapelle and the Conciergerie. Such a magical chapel with more stained glass than stone in the walls.

The Windows are amazing. Small place you can see it in an hour. Most amazing windows ever. Take the time to walk inside and get some great photos. The windows are magnificent. Make sure you look up and get some great architecture shots.

must see! so beautiful and moving. did not know quite how to find, have to wait in line for security but it is worth it. Very beautiful and amazing when you hear the history. Well worth searching for.

Astounding secret of Paris. When we went in it literally took my breath away. It's not easy to get in - not entirely clear where to queue, heavy security checks (but completely understandable given the nature of the complex) - but so worth it. The lower chapel was beautiful, but the upper chapel was magnificent. We spent a good 30 minutes perusing the detailed windows. There was ample information available to English and French speakers - I didn't notice what other languages they had. They are to be commended for the recent restoration, which is presented in a short video with information in French, English and Spanish. I thoroughly enjoyed the visit.

Stained glass windows are breathtaking. Chapelle is small compared to others but its a beautiful chapelle. Stained glass windows on first floor are amazing. No lifts hence have to keep strollers on ground floor.

Great Stained Glass!. Beautiful glass in both the upper and lower chapels. The ceiling in the lower chapel is very well done. The narrow spiral staircase to the upper chapel opens up to an amazing view. I was surprised at how small they were. The lines were short on the Monday we went.
Amazing. It is amazing but I am not sure if it is worth the high entrance fee, there are just twoo roms - but really wonderful!

Jaw-dropping. We visited just after going to the Conciergerie. Would really recommend it, it's a great way to spend an afternoon. My children aged 8 and 12 mention it as one of their highlights. The windows are breathtaking and the overall experience is one not to be missed.

Breathtaking. This chapel is a marvel of Medieval and Renaissance architecture. The haute chapel is just amazing especially when you don't see this sort of architecture back home. The staff were efficient but not warm.
Beautiful. Like being in a gorgeous technicolor glasshouse... flooded with light and different from the many gloomy churches of the age.

Impressive. The windows are glorious to see especially on a sunny day when the light is shining in. They helpfully provide a laminated guide to help you understand the story that each window is telling.

Amazing, a must see. My wife and I visited here on a recent vacation to London and Paris.Sainte chapelle (holy chrurch) Is an amazing sight to see and is often over looked by many visitors to Paris. The stained glass here is a spectacle that has to be seen. The church is not that large so it can be visited quickly and is just a few minutes walk to notre dame cathedral. The Paris museum pass has a very short seperate entrance line.Overall I highly recommend visiting this church especially in the area of notre dame cathedral.

One of my favorite places in France. It may not have the grandeur as the Notre Dame on the outside but when you walk in its awe inspiring. Try to catch a performance at night - we heard a stringed performance of Vilvaldi one evening and it made the environment even more unique. This was one of our favorite spots we visited on our entire tour.

Beautiful but neglected. Difficult to access, expensive and rather sad to see this exquisite building somewhat neglected and shabby. Also the relics of the cross and crown of thorns are no longer there and this has not been noted in the literature! Rather disappointing as a result so would not really recommend it unless one is very interested in architecture and stained glass windows.

Stunning.... This is probably the most enchanting church i ve ever visited. Amazingly vibrant stained glass Windows. Breathtakingly so. This is a convenient walk from Notre Dame and the queues are manageable. Definitely worth a visit.
My favorite church in Paris. The stained glass in this church is spectacular. And the history, as well as how the panels have withstood time and elements is so impressive. A must see!

I was mesmerized!. My absolute favourite place in the whole world! It is so unexpected...you walk into a fairly usual chapel and then walk up the tiny stairs and then wow....breathtaking! The stain glass is absolutely stunning ! One of my favourite things I've ever seen! Also tip , any EU citizen under 26years old gets in to lots of places including saint Chapelle for free once show your passport!
Amazing small chapel . Pictures do not do it justice! Its a short trip from Notre Dame Cathedral, make sure you see this one too. It feels like you are surrounded by stained glass.
Beautiful. Good to go on a sunny day to see the amazing effect of the vitrals. And also see a concert inside! Amazing.Small chapelle, but totally worth it

One of the highlights of our trip.. Photos cannot do it justice. It is overwhelming walking inside. The stained glass windows are 33m tall. Stunning. Even better with the classical music concerts at night, the combined experience is moving.

Dont miss this. Awesome stained glass you will forever remember. Short wait in line but well worth the wait. Near Notre Dame on the left bank very easy access by water taxi, bus or of corse walking which is lovely to do in Paris

WOW! Worth the time.. I studied Sainte-Chapelle in art history but for some reason never visited on prior trips to Paris. Today, we walked in the Upper Chapel and the first thing out of my mouth was, "Wow!" It was stunning. And, the more you looked at the workmanship the more you knew you were standing in a place that was truly inspired. How was it possible for stain glass masters to complete the work in 6-years? And, from a small scale to large scale design perspective it was stunning. Even more amazing is that they don't currently know who designed the chapel windows. Even the Lower Chapel was beautiful. The painting was rich and largely restored. If you appreciate master craftsmanship and design you will enjoy Sainte-Chapelle. Be aware that climbing steep stone steps is required to get to the upper chapel. The windows are obviously more brilliant on a sunny day but the chapels would also be nice on a rainy day in Paris.

So lovely. It has improved, too. This was my 3rd visit and I was lucky to benefit from recent cleaning and restoration of the stained glass panels. This is a beautiful site...very peaceful and restful to disappear here for a little while. It's a quick visit and not overwhelming. It's a must.
Worth seeing. It is a spectacular chapel. The lead light Windows are amazing. Can be seen in a 30 minute visit. Queues to enter are not too bad.

Hidden treasure near Notre Dame. La Sainte Chapelle is just a short walk from the famed Notre Dame de Paris and is not to be missed. This was the King's private chapel and has two levels. The ground floor was for the servants and workers and is rather ordinary. Be sure to take the spiral staircase to the upper level. This is the gem. The walls are almost entirely stained glass and tell the story of several old testament books and have been restored where necessary. Most of the glass is original from the mid 1200's. There are also concerts on the weekends. Entrance fee is €10 and the fee for both the entrance and concert is only a total €15.

Amazing stained glass. Came here in as were in the area but so glad we did the stained glass windows are amazing. Its definitely a place to say you have been. There are quite of other things around the area so I would suggest you get here early enough to cover them all off.

Don't miss it. I really enjoyed seeing the beautiful glass windows and it was one of the highlights of this trip. Each pane is a different story. It was very crowded and there was no where to rest really. Still well worth seeing.
Heavenly. A must-see destination. Notre Dame is lovely, Sainte Chapelle is breathtaking. Each of the thousands of panes of glass tells a biblical story. A true feast for the eyes.

Impressive Stain Glass. Really impressive stain glass that was restored a few years ago. The chapel is a little smaller than I envisioned but worth connecting Notre Dame visit with this chapel at the same time.

Stained Glass Overload. This whole chapel was built to house one item - the supposed crown of thorns. The wonder is the amount of stained glass they were able to cram into this chapel is amazing. Each window has numerous scenes from the Bible. It is an engineering marvel and a beautiful piece of art.

Take a seat and enjoy.. A must see on every visit to Paris. Something everyone should have the opportunity to see.Renovations/cleaning completed so now all windows are uncovered. Lovely, emotional and thought provoking. I enjoyed comparing windows to see the differences in the tracery, images and background patterns. Field glasses will enhance the experience allowing one to get a close up view of the details. The sit back and take in the scope of the space as the colors play across surfaces and the guests.

Absolutely beautiful. I got to see Sainte Chappelle on my last night in Paris and by chance it happened to be when an orchestral concert was on. The chapel was so beautiful with all it's stained glass windows and as you closed your eyes to listen to the music and take in the history of the chapel it was an unforgettable experience. Definitely a must to see but not good on a rainy day as no cover while waiting in queue.

Like A Sistine Chapel of Stained Glass. I had read many glowing recommendations for Sainte-Chappelle, but my visit exceeded all of my expectations. It is an exquisite jewel box of a church. The magnificence of the stained glass must be seen to be believed. My visit was in the evening light a few hours before sunset, and the glass in the stunning upper chapel was perfectly backlit. The lower chapel was fabulous as well. Don't forget to walk around the outside to see the magnificent exterior architectural details.

Lovely concert amid beautiful stained glass. We attended an evening concert at the beautiful Sainte-Chapelle. It consisted of two violinists, one viola, one harpsichord type instrument and a lovely metzo soprano. The music was mostly baroque with several versions of Ave Maria. Gorgeous! A perfect evening. Do miss this !!

Oh wow . This is one of the must go places in Paris. The most amazing stained glass windows you are ever likely to see. It's unbelievable. Take the time to look at the beautiful detail in this 1000 year old building. It will cost you 10 euros to get in but it's well worth the visit. Go there!

Breathtaking!. Oh, my. When your enter onto the first flour of the chapel (calling this a chapel is certainly an understatement), you are already blown away by its beauty, much different than the more famous cathedrals. And if the first floor isn't enough, when you emerge from the stone, spiral staircase to the second floor, be prepared for jaw-dropping artistry. Get a guide to the stained glass if you can. Lots to see but difficult to discern without an aid.
Beautiful Building. Unfortunately closed as we went on French Labour Day but beautiful from outside. Worth walking past to see at least
Amazing. Beautiful church, not very crowded like Notre Dame, but definitely worth the visit. Too bad the Audio guide rent lady was not there. We could have appreciated it more.
Sainte-Chapelle. Learned a lot. Beautiful stained glass windows. The relecs originally here have been moved to a special location in the Louvre.
Stain glass heaven - worth a visit. The star of the show are the stained glass reliefs in the upper chamber (you go up some narrow stairs). Quite stunning really.

Amazing stained glass windows. The main attraction here are the stained glass windows which depicts the books in the bible, which come to think of it required a lot of thought process to compress it in the windows around the church.The church itself is not huge or anything, but it is unique due to the unique stained glass window designs (not to mention featured in a Dan Brown novel)Also, it is walking distance only from another popular church - the Notre Dame.
Outstanding. Went to an evening concert of Vivaldi. The stained glass windows were breathtaking and the acoustics were perfect. A magical evening.
Beautiful!. One of the most stunning churches in Paris. The stained glass windows are stunning, as is the architecture.

Breathtakingly beautiful . All 66 books of the bible carved, painted, on every panel of the stain glass that filled this magnificent chapel. Took my time to soak in the atmosphere, the history and beauty.

Stained Glass. Absolutely the most gorgeous stained glass I have ever seen! You had to pay an entrance fee and the Church is not very large. I think we were inside for a total of 30 minutes maybe but it was worth it to see that glass.

Just amazing stained glass windows. . The windows here are amazing. The more you're familiar with your views stories the more you are likely to understand and appreciate the images.
When we went the line was very quick, just 5 minutes and was not very crowded.
Definitely worth your time.

Beautifully Breathtaking . I'd heard rumors that it was beautiful, but I wasn't prepared for the color and light that bathes you. A peacefulness comes over you and you can almost feel like you're standing there in the 13th century. Worth the climb in the tight spiral stone staircase.

Amazing 2nd level. The ground floor was interesting with a small gift shop on one side. However, don't miss going up the stairs to the 2nd level. You will see a truly exceptional collection of stained-glass windows. It was built in the 13th century by Louis IX. Apparently, only family members and close friends were allowed to go up the 2nd level by Louise IX. Sainte-Chapelle is lesser known but it is definitely amazing. A must see.

Just amazing. I had seen so many churches during the month in Paris, one more beautiful than the other so when I went to Saint Chapelle I thought ok one more. When I walked inside the bottom floor I was amazed but when I stepped on the second floor I was in awe. I this that each window told a story, the amazing Cobalt blue colors and the enormous round window through which you see a rainbow of light, all of it was overwhelming. Cannot leave Paris without visiting it.

Exquisite, especially for the classical music concerts. Went with my family for the classical music concert featuring Pachelbell's Canon and Vivaldi's Four Seasons. The setting is highly memorable. Kids under 10 are free for the music. Just go and enjoy!
Beautiful. The stained glass windows here are stunning.You must climb & descend a narrow winding staircase to enter the church.

Stunning Renovation. The Velux Foundation (yes, the roof light people) have enabled the stunning renovation of St Louis' chapel. It's situated in the Palais de Justice, so security is airport style. Entry is €15 a person for the chapel and audioguides are available for a supplement.Entry to the chapel itself is through the ground floor crypt which is interesting enough in itself, but it's only when you ascend the (tight) stone spiral staircase to the floor above that you reach the massive stained-glass windows.For those unable to climb the stairs, I did see someone in a wheelchair being allowed in through the main doors at this level - so there are definite access arrangements for the less able-bodied.

Serene, reflective and stunning beautiful. We chose to experience Sainte Chapelle by attending a chamber music concert early evening on our last night in Paris. One can visit far too many European churches and not remember what makes one different from another.Make Sainte Chapelle a special and memorable visit by booking one of its concerts.

Stunning!. When you enter on the ground floor your first impression, like mine, might be "meh", then you go up the stairs and you are blown away by the beauty of hundreds of stained glass windows. I saw this and then went to Notre Dame, which although grand, simply couldn't compare. Sainte-Chapelle is a lesser known attraction but absolutely stunning.

Gorgeous . You enter into the lower crypt which is beautiful and ancient. Entry into the main chapel is via a winding staircase and as you enter the chapel it is breathtaking. Surely the finest stained glass in the World. Amazing.

Possibly my favorite church in the world. It's small, it's not an engineering wonder like Notre Dam, it's not attached to some opulent palace. But Ste. Chapelle calls me back every time I land here for its jewel-like stained glass, the amazingly colorful woodwork, the majesty of its design, AND for the very welcome restoration completed in 2015. It's a less hectic stop, only takes about an hour unless you do audio or personal tour, and wait times generally are much shorter than other major Paris venues. TONIGHT we will return again for a one-hour mini concert to Vivaldis Four Seasons performed inside, thrilling! TICKETS to the chapel available there, 10€TICKETS to concerts, when available, across the street at the Cafe de Deux Pais I think the name was, 20, 30 or 40€ each depending on how close you sit to orchestra. Check internet first for dates.
Beautiful . If you want to mesmerized and genuinely in awe this is a wonderful place for that. It is said that they have precious Christian relics here and you won't doubt that when you arrive.
Gorgeous!. I wouldn't go here on a cloudy day because sun turns this beautiful 13 th century space into a dazzling display of color. Museum pass lets you skip the ticket line.
Get there early - amazing. A MUST for a visit to Paris no matter how many times you've been here. Buy tix online and get there half hour before opening when the line is the shortest.

Evening concerts - a great way to experience Sainte-Chapelle. You can book to see a one hour classical concert at Sainte-Chapelle. It's a really beautiful setting and a good thing to do if you have a spare early evening in Paris. The concert starts at 6PM so you get to see the sun back-lighting the stained glass.I paid Euro28 for a ticket in the back section but got a good view of the performance.

Skip the tour of Notre Dame and come here instead. I heard the stained glass windows of Ste. Chapelle were beautiful but when I stepped into the space, all I could say was "wow". As did everyone behind me. We visited on a cloudy day but the colors still popped. The glass was cleaned and restored in 2015 so we got to see them as if they were new. If you have time or inclination to visit only one church in Paris, make it this one. Concerts are also offered here periodically, I wish we were able to enjoy one during our trip.
Make a special trip to see it. You can't see this Church from the street as it is inside a government complex-Palais de Justice. It's worth the wait to get in.... It's impressive.

Sainte-Chapelle is worth-seeing. This small church is worth the wait in line. Famous for its dramatic stained-glass windows - they're amazing. Ste.Chapelle was built in the 13th century on the island called the Ille de la Cite.. The building that surrounds it was a royal palace up to the 14th c. We've not been inside the palace. There is a beautiful quiet small park on the island, just north of the palace, called place Dauphine. - Jim Red Maps
Sainte Chapelle CHurch. Another example of a beautiful church in Paris that everyone should take the time to visit and enjoy.

Majestic,Gates of heaven.. Built some 700 years ago, by King Louis IX, to house the relics of Passion of Christ, including the thorns of Jesus. The whole place is so amazing, the basement is even cooler .It is like a church/chapelle built on top of another church with different styles. Each detail is neatly preserved throuhout the years. Paris can be very crowded, lines are busy as often. We choose April as though it is colder to visit this time of the year, it is nicer not to fight with a lot of tourists.

A Spectacular Chapel. This chapel, and I say chapel because compared to the cathedral of Notre Dame it's much smaller but it is a beautiful sight from the inside. You will be hard pressed to see stained glass windows as bright and intricate. We were there on a cloudy day and it was still beautiful. Well worth an hour of your time.

All Of the Superlatives Are True !. My wife and I recently visited Sainte Chapelle for our first time. We joined a line outside the building with a small Sainte Chapelle and waited with other people for admittance. After awhile , many of us realized something, we were in the wrong line. Despite the sign , we were on a line waiting for the Palais of Justice and Sainte Chapelle was closed at the time for lunch. So please be aware of that if you get there around noon. We found a café near Notre Dame and then came back to queue up for a 2 pm entrance. Sainte Chapelle is not the stand alone impressive building that you can expect in many areas of the world. We walked into an area with a low ceiling and very impressive décor. After some time there , we climbed some steps and entered a room that literally took our breath away. The chapel area is roomy but not huge but the windows soar to the heaven. All we could do for awhile was walk around the room with our eyes aimed skyward. The light streams in through the stained glass, the colors dance and we felt mesmerized. There is almost too much to process. There are a number of chairs placed around the chapel and we sat for some time and just let our eyes wander. It's the type of experience that you could enjoy for a long time , which we did. Finally , we arose and left but thoroughly impressed with what we had seen.

Classical music concert at dusk on Saturdays. There is something just ethereal about sitting in Sainte-Chapelle and listening to Bach as the sun sets behind the magnificent stained glass windows! This is an experience you simply must try!
Stained Glass Windows a MUST to see. This is a very small chapel with the most impressive stained glass windows. About the best I've ever seen, except for the Cathedral at Chartres.

Beautiful Chapel. We went to a Vivaldi concert here one evening. It was very nice. The upper chapel is stunning with all the stained glass windows. I can imagine in the daylight with the sun shining through how incredibly beautiful it would be.

Quiet. It is quite a pretty place with plenty of stain glass can be seen too. When I was there, it is almost empty. A good place for those who wants to see stain glass and avoid the crowds. Is much smaller scale compared to Notre.

Spectacular!!. On entry to the cathedral the gold trim decoration is impressive but when you head upstairs to the main cathedral is where it really takes your breath away. The stained glass windows are not so much as windows as walls, beautifully restored and cleaned showing off their remarkable beauty. The rose at the end of the of the cathedral is particularly gorgeous. Well worth a visit!

Historic and Beautiful . It cannot be overstated how beautiful the stained glass is in this very old and historic place. It was smaller than I thought it might be and the old church itself is practically invisible from the street as it has become surrounded over the centuries by other structures. Still, this is a place that should be on your short list of stops in Paris.

It was not excellent 😐 . My mother sister and I went to Saint chapels last week. I am glad we did it but it wasn't great or fantastic sure it was beautiful but I mean not a lot to it of course I had 5minutes ago been at Norte dame. I don't think it's great for kids I think they would just be bored I review it as not great
best in town. a totally wonderful experience - the windows have just beencleaned and they are spectacular - well worth a visit

Fooled you!. So, I had read about these 15 meter tall stained glass windows. When we walked in, I was disappointed until I found the staircase leading up to the next floor....OMG...words just cannot describe the beauty. There is a movie that describes what went into the restoration and cleaning of these beautiful windows.
Most beautiful stained glass church. Not as famous as Notre Dame but a compact beauty you should not miss. History is as impressive as the upper church .

Overwhelmingly beautiful!. Don't go to Paris and not go to see this incredible experience. You enter via a claustrophobic little speak staircase and come into one of the most spectacularly beautiful churches I have ever seen. The windows surround you with beautifully detailed statues of the apostles standing guard around you. Everything is decorated, and when the sun comes through the windows which depict in them the whole Bible prove that this is truly the c cathedral of light. I found myself just standing there with my mouth open turning around and around to take it in again and again. It is a holy moment of beauty.

stunning. This small chapel is absolutely stunning, worth a stop. We did not have to wait very long in the security and ticket lines, and museum pass holders were walking straight in after security without any issue.

If you enjoy looking at Stained glass you might like this. We went to Sainte Chapelle with some friends on a chilly overcast December day , I wasn't sure what to expect , Sainte Chappele is steeped in history , it can be found in the center of Paris on Ile de la Cite , tucked in the courtyard of Palais de Justice.,( The nearest Metro station is Cite.).It was built for King Louis IX of France, who was very devout , as a chapel for the royal palace and also to house his collection of precious religious relics. Among these relics is reported to have been a piece of the True Cross. I was told that this was housed in the high alter . I am unsure if that piece of cross is still in the chapelle .There are 2 areas to see at Sainte-Chapelle , firstly the chapel downstairs , which on the day we saw it was dark and gently lit , but ,it was as I mentioned on an overcast cold December day that we were there. Downstairs is basically an empty room that has been sympathetically restored to show the original paintwork and an impressive vaulted ceiling , to many it may still look a bit tatty and a bit battered but much of this paintwork has been around for several hundred years so I am not surprised its had a good few knocks over its time .You can also see the pillars some of which seem to have been decorated with a raised paintwork and also a few examples of the stone work that was originally part of the Chapelle. The entry payment desk ( around 10 euros admission ) and the visitors shop are also situated within this lower part of the Chapelle. Not far from the entry desk there is a doorway that leads to some old stone steps that lead to another fairly empty room upstairs, DO go up these stairs as up at the top of them you turn the corner into the most magical part of the chapelle. , This is where all those stained glass windows are that you have I am sure read about. .Even knowing that they were there dis not prepare me for the spectacular sight , the stained glass is spectacular even on a cold and overcast day , I can only imagine how it will sparkle and throw some colour onto the floor on a wonderful sunny day. Look at the windows carefully , they all look a bit different, There are some simple long benches along the wall that you can sit on and study the wndows if you like.The alter is at the far end of the room opposite some enormous and strong doors with impressive old iron work that are never opened as they are simply in the wall of this tall building with nothing on the other side !
