Look at the central pillar of these doors as you will see two little angels sitting and guarding the door. .so basically like another review has pointed out its a empty room , but a room steeped in history that is in itself spectacular because of those windows, the high vaulted ceiling , some statues and the tiled decoration on the floors. There is also another stair case for your return downstairs.would i recommend a visit to Sainte Chapelle , yes I would ....But don't expect a fully functioning church , its just not that ...Iits a small fairly empty chapel . BUT it is a truly awe inspiring sight as you turn that corner at the top of the stairs and see those windows for the first time, I found it simply breathtaking.One more thing ... there is no lift to the upstairs ,this is a historic building and the and stone stairs are a bit worn , this will make the wonderful upstairs of the Chapelle sadly unsuitable for a wheel chair user to access and possibly difficult for someone who has trouble climbing the stairs,
Memorable. This is our must see every time we come here. No photo can do it justice. As a word of advice, come before noon for the light on the windows, and they do close for lunch.
Light on first floor is breathtaking. Nothing truly attractive from outside. The gem is the light on the first floor coming through stain glass.
Beautiful stained glass. Come in here just to walk to the top to see the authentic stained glass. Beautiful! This stop shouldn't take very long, so get in view the glass and be gone.

Unforgettable colourful spiritual spot. While visiting Paris you should not miss this jewell in the heart of Paris. Be ready to queue and for a mass of people inside. Believe me it is worth the effort. Tucked among buildings the chapel's glass walls are so coulourful and beautiful that you might loose your breath. You can also visit the "Conciergerie" on the same day.

Beautiful Must See!. When visiting the Notre Dame Cathedral make sure you see Sainte-Chapelle which is very close by. See it during the day and hopefully the sun is out and the stain glass looks spectacular!

The most beautiful chapel in the world. In the 13th century, our king Saint Louis built this chapel to exhibit and protect Jesus's crown he had just bought.The originality of this chapel is the unique beauty of its gigantic stained glass Windows. I very often pass in front of the chapel (recently and magnificently restored) and I can always see an enormous queue of visitors. Nobody can leave Paris without having seen this amazing jewel. It is situated in the center of Paris in the palace of justice, in the Cité island, dear Notre Dame.Now Jesus' crown is kept in Notre Dame and can be seen on the first Friday of each month. (& during the Lent)

What a surprise at the tip. Well worth getting both tickets to this and the conciergerie The lower chapel was very good but the surprise awaits you at the top of the spiral staircase. Try and go on a bright day and you will be overwhelmed by the colour and beauty of the upper chapel

Breathtaking church to visit. We loved Sainte-Chapelle. We arrived first thing in the morning and with our Museum Pass and walked right in. I was surprised to find it was smaller than I had imagined, but very beautiful and a wonderful experience. Highly recommend.
Stained Glass. A marvelous experience to look up and be enveloped by unbelievable stained glass. Be sure to learn how the stained glass is being preserved.
Stained Glass Joy. The most wonderful display of stained glass windows in a gothic styled building. Doesn't take very long to get around but shouldn't be missed

A beautiful surprise. I had heard of the wonderful stained glass in this little chapel but was unprepared for the awe inspiring first glimpse of the the soaring multicoloured intricate glass panels that surround you as you emerge from the staircase to the upper floor. Worth the price just to see this glorious room!

One of the world's most exquisite sights. St. Chapelle is unique. Best viewed on a sunny day it's a vertical jewell box of a building that's so exquisite it's impossible to fully remember how beautiful it is from one visit to the next. The chapel and the unicorn tapestries at the Museum of the Middle Ages are my personal favourites in Paris. They are both incomparable.
Impressive!. IT is a must! It is something unexpected and absolutely impressive. To be visited in a sunny day. There may be a queue but it goes pretty fast.

Breathtaking Visit. When you walk up the stairs to enter Sainte Chapelle you are taken back by the beauty of all the windows and general architecture. Can easily get overcrowded very easily. Would recommend a visit.

A travesty . Until this visit the biggest waste of my euros was on the public toilets. This is an overpriced desecrated alter that was at one time a chapel. We paid 20 euro after waiting on long line to enter into an overpriced gift shop and then see one big room with Windows where pews and the alter were removed. The Chartress cathedral (a short sncf train ride from paris) was free and a fully operating Catholic place that had much more elaborate Windows. I felt so ripped off of both time & money that I visited Notre Dame & Sacre Couer just after to get the bad taste out of my mouth.

Just Gorgeous. The Stained Glass at Sainte-Chapelle is just gorgeous. We were there on a grey day and it was beautiful, I can only imagine how it looks on a sunny day. Don't miss the floors in the upper chapel, quite lovely.
Breathtaking little chapel. Fantastic place, near Notre Dame. I attended an evening concert there, which was a lovely experience, surrounded by all the marvellous stained glass windows.

An unexpected delight. When we were planning our trip to Paris, Saint-Chapelle was not on our landmarks to visit list. We went to this church because one of the grandchildren were named after this Saint. We were delighted that we sought out this church because is it truly beautiful. Built to house the "Crown of Thorns" the walls of stainless glass windows are unlike anything that we have ever seen. They collectively tell the story of the passion of Christ. Please beware that there are a number of stairs to climb but there is a lift available for those with mobility challenges.

One of the highlights of our week in Paris. This is a truly amazing building. The stained glass windows are fantastic. We used the audio guide which gives you an idea of the stories behind each of the windows. For sheer wow, the Sainte Chapelle rates with the Eiffel Tower.A warning - if you enjoy looking at medieval stained glass you will have a sore neck by the end of your visit.Also visit on a sunny day if you can - the colours are amazing.

Interesting crypt downsyairs. I wouldn't put this spot on my must see list, however, I had the museum pass and too the opportunity to visit.Don't miss the crypt downstairs which houses over 77 famous tombs of important contributors to French society.Upstairs is cool to see but very cold and informal. I visited the pantheon in Rome and was curious to make the comparison as the building was inspired by that structure. Id only recommend it if you are really into French history, or in Latin quarter.
Absolutely Amazing!. The Stain Glass windows in the Sainte-Chapelle are unbelievable. The line was long but it moved fast and totally work the wait. Beauty in every direction!

Took my breath away. While the first floor of the chapel is quite lovely, the real attraction is the second floor. I literally gasped when I stepped inside and saw the soaring stained glass windows. Even though it was a cloudy day the windows are spectacular! I would suggest buying a skip the line ticket as the line was quite long. A must see in Paris.

great stained glass. having remembered this venue from school French lessons it was great to see it in reality. As it is contained within the palais de justice the outer appearance is maybe less spectacular but the stained glass of this medieval church is stunning - and the information supplied in English was good. some of the windows are rather far away to see the details described in the supporting information sheet.

Great for a concert!. I was lucky enough to be in Paris while Sainte-Chapelle was hosting a concert series of excellent classical music. The concert I attended was Bach's Goldberg Variations performed by a string trio (violin, viola, and cello). In this medieval setting, among the stained-glass (which we didn't get the full effect of on account of it being night), stone floors and high ceilings, I witnessed magic. You have to enter through a municipal building and grounds which doesn't do any favors to Sainte-Chapelle, but once you enter the chapel, it is a sight to behold. The contrast of dull municipality to medieval ornamentation is a sight to behold. Go. Do it. Next visit, I'll make sure to take a tour during the day to see the stained glass all lit up!

Book a concert. The Sainte Chapelle is a stunningly beautiful 11th century church in the gothic style purposely built for the Kings of France inside the Palais de la Cite which now houses the Ministry of Justice. It is completely surrounded by stain glass walls. You marvel at the construction techniques and fathom the cost when you consider the year that construction commenced 1242 and was completed just six years latter. This church is no longer open to the praying public. The Chapelle hosts nightly classical concerts. When you Google Sainte Chapelle their nightly concert schedule is posted. You will be directed where you can purchase tickets on line or you can be like us and be fortunate to notice the sign and hunt down tickets once inside. Be persistent in your search for the ticket booth because it is not part of the gift shop and is hard to find. Tickets are in three sections with VIP being the first 10 rows. VIP were the only tickets available but to me it would seem to be worth the extra €10 just to heighten your visual and sound experience. Seats are not assigned (First come first seated) so it is best to line up in the visitation hall early. You must pass through security with metal detectors and bag search to see this beautiful chapel.
Amazingly beautiful. Visited on a sunny day. The stained glass windows surrounding the chapel were breathtaking. We were expecting beauty and in real life the beauty of the chapel was awe inspiring.

Overwhelmingly Beautiful. Having seen this featured on a BBC arts programme was very keen to visit. Small but amazing. The stain glass filtering the light into the body of the building was unique and the sumptuous decorations covering every spare inch of this building makes this truly a real gem.
a hidden treasure. Although in the city centre, the Sainte Chapelle was for us uptill now a hidden treasure. It has beautiful very old stained glass windows.

Stained Glass. Small church (now just a museum) sharing street entrance/exit with courthouse. Beautiful stained glass windows up winding, narrow staircase. Nice explanation of the windows in multiple languages.Short walk from Notre Dame.They have concerts here many evenings, but we visited in the morning.

As gorgeous as it looks !. I absolutely loved Sainte-Chapelle. Our tour guide was very informative on the history of this gorgeous church. The stained glass is second to none here as it seems to envelop you. It was definitely a church built for a king and so very ornate. There is security to get into the church as it's attached to a functional court house. There is also a gift stand right inside on the 2nd floor. Our tour was a combo tour with Notre Dame and i liked that too, but i really thought Sainte-Chappelle was better. Great experience.

Stunning interior. Beautiful church from the outside nestled amongst old palace grounds and close to notre dame. The interior is jaw dropping. Intricately decorated and the stain glass windows in the upper chapel are out of this world. Visit during dylight for the full effect!

One of the most beautiful small churches. Make sure you see on a sunny or partly sunny day. The entire interior is stained glass so once you climb the steps to get in you are hit with a breathtaking experience.

Beautiful. A must visit, beautiful architecture and amazing stained glass windows each telling a story.Visited the chapel together with a tour of the dungeons where most prisoners and Marie Antoinette were kept during the Revolution.
Beautiful place. Preferred this over Notre Dame. The entry queue is long but well worth the wait. Breathtaking Chapel that really takes your breath away.
Breathtaking.. Beautiful stained glass. Not to be missed. Very close to Notre Dame. Short and sweet experience- going back for a concert on Friday night. Can't wait.

No words--just magnificent!. Sainte-Chapelle has the most gorgeous stained glass windows I've ever seen. My husband says this chapel is the most magnificent thing he's ever seen. The pictures cannot do justice to the exquisite artistry that is achieved here. If you must make a choice, skip Notre Dame ad head straight to Sainte Chappelle.

Sparkling Sainte-Chapelle. Stained glass windows that are unbelievably beautiful. Arrived at 10 am, no line to enter. Tape available for rent that explains the stories of the Windows. A must see place in paris. Fee is 10 euro.

Simply gorgeous!!. Loved this church! Was so nice as it wasn't packed with people like the Notre Dame. The stain-glass windows are in incredible condition considering their age.One down side is that there was a man begging outside for money and he opened the door to the church for us and insisted that he deserved money for doing so! Was odd!Otherwise, is definitely worth a look inside.

An amazing place. I was balled over by my visit to Sainte-Chapelle 40 years ago when I first saw it. This time around it was just as wonderful. We were lucky to be able to attend a small classical concert in the chapel and it was absolutely breathtaking. The glass panels were slowly darkening in the evening dusk and the acoustics are phenomenal. Can definitely recommend a visit and a concert!

Something unexpectedly beautifull, don't miss it. It' some of most important churches in France because it was place for holy relics, first and most important of all - Christ's Crown of Thorns, whic king of France Lui IX in XIII century bought from Baldvin - Latin emperor of Constantinople who was broke. Sainte- Chapelle was built as place for this relic and it's worthy of it! Crown was much more expensive than churhc itself! Sainte-Chapelle is a part of royal palace complex of medieval Paris - Ille de la Cite, it was some kind of private royal chapel. It's unusual that it consist of two floors and main atractions, stained glass windows, most of them originally from medieval times, is on the second flor and it can't be seen from ground floor.It must be seen on sunny days, because of artistic light from colorful windows. It's best if you visit Conciergerie which is next to Sainte Chapelle, Notre Dam, and flower market for a few hours. If you have Paris passport or museum pass you can skip the queue

Consider an evening concert here.. I didn't know, but if you check the schedule, there are frequent concerts at Sainte-Chappelle. For a few euros more, you can visit and experience the church in an entirely different way.Read the information cards provided (multiple languages available) and understand how to 'read' the windows. It is a beautiful beautiful space.
A step back in time. A beautiful church that originally was only used and built for the king. which is Incredibly elaborate setting.

Perfect visit during rainy day. We kept this visit for a rainy day. Plenty of cafes around to have breakfast and then head over to the Sainte-Chapelle.
Worth the wait in line, stunning views of glass windows and makes for amazing
life long lasting pictures.
Highly recommend this visit to anybody visiting Paris
Was memorable !
Great hidden jewel close to Notre Dame.. Great to see. The stained glass is amazing. Very close to Notre Dame. We usually see both along with the underground exhibit in front of Notre Dame.
Go!. This place is magical! Go on a sunny day and the colors will dazzle you. By all means, go to a concert in the evening. The peace you'll feel will encompass you.
Beautiful . What a treasure - definitely worth the queue. Lovely little gift shop with tapestry items and books. Included in Museum Pass
Be sure to see Vivaldi concert in evening!. Buy the cheapest tickets. Venue very small so only few feet separate the price sections. Great acoustics and wonderful view of windows!
Stunning. The stained glass on the upper level is amazing. Hire an audio tour to get the story behind the chapel and selected individual works.

Worth the visit with Paris Pass. If you are in the area it is worth stopping for a visit. We had a Paris pass, so we had free entrance and skip the line. We decide to make a trip since we were close by. The cathedral is pretty small but the stain glass is really something! One thing to keep in mind is the stairs are really small and full of people.
Chapel. There is nothing special in this building except a lot of stained glass windows, but it looks like most of these churches.

Amazing restoration. I visited the gorgeous Gothic Sainte-Chappelle, Palais de la Cite on April 16th, 2016. The magnificent stained glass windows have been expertly restored, and colors are incredible. Don't miss a visit to see this lovely gem.

Beautiful Church. Good place to visit. Don't miss the Conciergerie next door. Entrance to both covered by Paris Museum Pass. We went on 1st Sunday of the month, when admission is free, and had to wait in line an hour to enter. So maybe avoid that day.

Stunning Masterpiece, High Security.. Since this gorgeous cathedral is not exactly out in the open like it's Notre-Dame neighbor, it can seem inaccessible for travelers not familiar with the Paris-area, but don't be dismayed! The Sainte-Chapelle is inside the entrance to the Concierge, so if you get off at the Cité metro stop and head towards the Boulevard du Palais, you'll see a line of people waiting to be let inside. Past the stone walls of the Concierge entrance you will immediately see the Sainte-Chapelle. The first floor is just a taste at what's to be found up the winding, narrow staircase - the infamous stained glass windows. There are places around the room for you to sit in wonder, and they also provide an informational guide for free (in many different languages) that explain in detail which books of the Bible are represented in these masterful works of art. Though it is not free like Notre-Dame, it is worth a trip!
Uncredible!. Fantastic place! After the renovation every piece of glace is so clear and gives the idea of old glamour ans spirituality...

One of my favorite of the cathedrals in Europe. This is small but so unique in design and style and the huge stained windows are so impressive. Don't miss this one if you can! If you get the Paris Pass you can skip the line.

Breathtaking . A gothic masterpiece. The windows are breathtaking. A 'must see' in Paris!However, as with so many historic buildings in Paris, it's badly curated (especially for the English language) and doesn't feel loved. If anything, it feels exploited by a jumble sale of gifts in the lower chapel and the exterior is crumbling away. It makes you truly thankful and appreciative for the way Britain maintains it's historic buildings.

Worthwhile, particularly if you have Museum Pass!. This small chapel has the most stained glass per square foot I've ever seen - all intricately done. It is quite a sight when the room is all lit up by the sun. I don't know if I'd go out of my way to pay separately for this, but it is included in the Paris Museum Pass, which covers so many great museums and allows you to skip lines. So if you get the pass, make sure you stop here on your way by (near Notre Dame).

So Beautiful. This is the most beautiful church I have ever been inside. It was raining quite a bit during our stay, so we waited for a sunny day to go here. Magical when the sun came through the stained glass.
Amazing stain glass. I had seen Paris many times without entering this amazing chapel with unforgettable stained glass. It was all built by Saint Louis and it is really worth paying the 10 euros.
Stunning. A phenomenal, must-see experience. Best on a sunny day. Am disappointed to see there is now a charge for entry, but still one of my favorite experiences in Paris.

Must See. Top place to see in Paris!!! Love this church-BEAUTIFUL stain glass windows everywhere you turn. Pictures do not do this place place justice. Absolutely beautiful!! Love this place, cannot wait to go back!!

13th Century Gothic Splendor. It's hard to fathom, walking into a chapel that originated over 700 years ago! The stained glass is other - worldly. Great representation of Gothic architecture. It's worth the admission of 8 euros, but we had a museum pass in which it was included for free. Metro line 4 will take you right there! And it's open every day!
Worthwhile. A relatively small number of visitors means that there isn't a long wait to get in. It's definitely worth a visit, it's stunning and it takes time to take everything in.

What a setting for a concert. We saw a concert here on Easter Sunday – great music in fantastic surroundings, the change in lighting coming through the intricate stained glass as the sun was setting was something special.

Beautiful. I'd been recommended to go here by a friend.
It is worth it. The most amazing stained glass I've seen. Beautiful colours. Would recommend a quick visit. And but a postcard!

Fascinating restoration. Very impressive interior decoration with light shining through recently cleaned glass and framing.
As with all historical decoration pre-industrial age, you have to marvel at the workmanship and time that went into creating the legacy
stunning. Can not believe these building still standing from such a period, most amazing place, well work the look

Beautiful. Well worth a visit. Sainte-Chapelle is famous for its stained glass, but the floors, walls and ceiling are also beautiful. Just a stunning building. Hope to attend a concert on my next visit. It also has a nice little gift shop.
A snooze. While I was fascinated with the stained glass windows, my husband decided it was nap time. Well worth a trip and if you spouse needs a nap, here's your spot!
Concert at St. Chapelle. Attended concert that was excellent. Beautiful stained glass windows surround the chapel;; acoustics were superb.
An amazing place for a chamber music concert. We attended a concert here with excellent musicians and amazing acoustics. It really was a once in a lifetime experience.
Incredible.. One of the best things we did in our 8 day stay in Paris. Don't miss it. Wish we had a tour, but it was still great to see.

Stunning!. This is a must see on your visit to Paris. It is absolutely stunning. We bought tickets to a concert online in the USA before our trip. It really was one of the highlights of our trip. The church is stunning inside & out.

Worth the wait. Arrived here to find a rather long queue, that did not seem to be moving. We joined the queue praying that it was going to be worth it. And wow it so was, inside is absolutely beautiful. Words can not do justice to how amazing this place was. Any trip to Paris must find time in their schedule for this.

Buy a Ticket and Include the Conciergerie to Skip the Long Line. The Chapelle is a marvel to behold. Since the stained glass windows were meticulously cleaned several years ago, the experience is heightened even more. Being able to take the time to view the images based on biblical stories is well worth the time. Printed material is available to give you an overview, but unless you're a biblical expert, it might be worth the money to hire a private guide to explain it all. Here's a tip to avoid the (usually) long line to enter the Chapelle -- buy a combined ticket to view the Conciergerie as well. You can view the prison cells and a re-creation of the cell inhabited by Marie Antoniette. The Conciergerie tour is interesting and only costs a few euros more...but that way you get to skip the line into Sainte Chapelle, which, on a busy day, can save you an hour or more.
Stunning. What can absolute delight. The most beautiful example is stained glass thatvi have evercseen. Well worth a visit.

Absolutely beautiful but expensive.. Being under 25 and European citizens we managed to get in for free however for the cost the Sante-Chapelle is very small. The main hall is beautiful and if you go on a sunny day you can experience the full impact of the stained glass. However that is pretty much all there is to see.
Nice view inside. With 10 euros and 10 minutes you can see everything there is to see. The first floor is basically a souvenier shop. The stairs take you to the view shown in the photo.

Stained Glass Splendor!. This site is located on the same Ile de Cite as Notre Dame and was originally part of the old city royal palace area and church. It is a very popular destination and the lines can get long quickly so it would be worth your while getting there early even before it opens to beat the rush. Additionally, I felt early morning was the best time as well with the sun rising and it would pour through all the magnificent stained glass and you could truly appreciate the colors and just how incredibly amazing the nearly 360 degree view is from the inside. There are some small walking areas and small vignettes on the lower levels but the history is truly what it's all about and I feel the stained glass was notches above the famous Notre dame glass which is stunning in and of itself. Truly great pictures can be taken here and is just amazing again being somewhere with such age and history!

Stained Glass to die for!. Went early in the morning to avoid the crowds and got right in. This is a small church with stained glass that is breath taking. I roamed around on my own, in and out in 35 minutes. fun spiral steps to the 2nd floor. Really beautiful and very parision. a block from the flower market!

Stunning - beautifuk. This chapel is one of the most beautiful buildings you will ever step foot in. From an agnostic ex RC person that's something. The stain glass appears to be the walls held up by slender columns. It's amazing, stunning and best viewed on a sunny day. Don't leave Paris without going to see it.

Exceeded expectations - and we knew it would be good. We have walked by here so many times without going in. Good place to go on a Monday when most places are closed. It won't take long to visit - you can do in less than an hour.I figured it would be another nice church with stained glass - we've seen so many churches, how could this be any different. But was I ever wrong. This place is simply stunning.It's not all that big, so how good could it be? The first room you enter is really nice meeting my expectations of a church with really nice windows. Then we climbed the spiral staircase and were awestruck. It takes a while to take it all in. I won't say any more. Read the guidebooks to explain all the scenes. But make sure to go.I can't believe I never went here - I've been to Paris many times.

A stained glass lovers must see. Sainte Chapelle is one of those places that one can easily think would be ok to 'skip'---DON'T. If you have a Paris Museum Pass, you'll skip the queue which is always a plus. Once inside I can only tell you that you will be impressed. The stained glass is beautiful. You can't take a bad photo. It's history is pretty impressive and you can sit and reflect upon its beauty. There is a small gift shop at the bottom floor and you can take home a memento from Sainte Chapelle back home with you. Sainte Chapelle is very close to Notre Dame, a small outdoor market, and a plethora of cafes. Don't miss it...
Worth the wait. Wonderful experience. The restoration and cleaning of them stained glass is now complete and held us spellbound.

Gorgeous rich colors of stained glass. This is a highlight of everybody's trip to Paris, meaning that EVERYONE is visiting here! And it isn't a huge capacity place like Notre Dame. Get here early to beat the lines, otherwise you can wait a very very long time! I elected not to stand in line to wait for the opening but see the Conciergerie first. In the end the time I would have spent waiting for the opening I ended up waiting to get through the line. Each time we made a little progress in the line, they would let a tour group in, much to the dismay and frustration of the waiting crowd. And this was in early April, not even in the 'high' season. Everywhere in Paris now you have to go through security lines and this slows things down getting in. If you can purge yourself of the frustration of the line and the security, then you can truly enjoy the magnificent stained glass in the chapel! There is some information printed on rigid boards in various languages that you can use to identify the biblical scenes if you want, or you can just bathe in the beautiful light. Best to go on a day when the sun is out, maybe even better if there are some big puffy clouds in the sky, to best show off the beautiful glass.

Amazing stained glass windows!. A little confusing to find, but worth the wait and effort! After going through security, we waited a short while, then entered the lower part of the Chapel. Wasn't clear at first that you go upstairs to the 2nd level to see the magnificent stained glass windows. Watch the video that explains the painstaking cleaning that took place to bring the windows back to their full glory. Amazing!

Wow! Stunning. Spectacular.. We went to Sainte Chapelle after church on Easter Sunday. It was such a lovely way to celebrate. At first when we walked in on the first floor we were a bit curious why people said you have to see it. The first floor was beautiful and the displays were interesting, but it was all right.But then we went upstairs, and as we came through the door we were stunned. The beauty of the windows is truly breath taking. It was a cloudy day, but occasionally the sun would come out and the windows were spectacular. They have large cards in various languages explaining the windows. Very interesting and appreciated the windows even more knowing a bit of background.

WOW - Simply stunning!. On the same island in the Seine as Notre Dame, definitely take a stop in here! You'll wait in line for a bit (like the Notre Dame towers), but it's worth it! Like many Paris destinations, if you're studying abroad here and under the age of 25 you can get in free.My sister and I found the stained glass absolutely breathtaking. Each huge panel tells a Biblical story--Esther, Judges, the Crucifixion, etc--and it's amazing at how much detail can fit into each panel with it looking so fragile! We spent a good while just staring up at the windows and figuring out the stories. Simply beautiful and unique--different from all other chapels I've seen in Europe! Tip: Try and go on a sunny day, so you'll get good lighting inside the chapel (pictures come out better with a bit of sunshine!).

Very nice. Went to this beatiful church in the morning was not to busy, stained glass is very impressive, does not take to much time to see. Very nice place to see after The other great church just down the street. Highly recommend.

Spectacular stained glass. We had a long wait to get through security to visit this chapel. Found out it was next to a courthouse so the wait is usually long to get it. Once we entered and climbed the spiral staircase to the main church and saw the incredible stained glass, we forgot all about the long wait. It was breathtaking, especially when the sun shined through the glass.
Paris 2016!. Beautiful! Cold!! This is located within government buildings - be sure you do not get in the line for jury duty! HA! It's a Chapel on top of a chapel!!

Soaring stained glass windows!. Sainte-Chapelle is stunningly beautiful both inside and out. After taking in the glory of the main floor, be brave and climb the impossibly narrow, tall spiral staircase to the spectacular 2nd floor ! You will be treated to some of the most breathtaking stained glass anywhere. Impressive cathedral - worth the wait and admission price.
A holy place. It is certainly worth the wait in the queue to experience this huge beautiful room with all its windows painted - it must be seen.

St. Chapelle, Paris. This is not a çhurch per se but the holy chapel. It is twice as high as wide. It is not very big but houses one of the finest collections of stained glass windows in the world. From the first floor you climb the stairs to see the stain glass windows and you can sit there for as long as you want to admire them as they change depending on the location of the sun. There was a line up to get in but it goes fast especially if you find someone interesting behind you in line. There is lits to see in that area so a big plus to visit the Il de Cite.

Not many churches I would visit - but this one. There are tons of churches in Europe but this one in particular is worth visiting and taking in. I went early in the morning as they only let a few people in at a time. The painted windows are fascinating. I did not take a guided tour.

Beautiful stained glass windows!!. We had the museum pass so got in for "free" but there is no way to bypass the line because of "airport like" security. It was well worth the wait in line to see the magnificent Windows.

Stained glass in incredible!. I wasn't sure about visiting this Chapel but after going I would say that it is a must see. There is a bit of an expensive fee for it, I believe about 8 euros. But the interior of the Chapel is remarkable. Jaw dropping stained glass line the walls. Not too busy so you still get an intimate experience while visiting.

woooooow!!!!!. If you have to visit one place, only, in Paris, then this is it. I didn't expect it to be honest. Once you pass the security check and long queue (fortunately I had the museum pass and it was shorter. You enter the lower chapel. At first I thought, OK this is it? What's the big deal. BUT then you go up the stairs and suddenly you in a place of magic. It was a sunny day and the light was coming through the stained glass and OMG. It was pure magic. I just stood there looking at it. Go no second thought about it. Wait the long line if you have to. It is worth it.

Incredible Jewel. Not far from Notre Dame, this "chapel" isn't a cathedral, but it has many cathedral-esque qualities. They've recently completed a 7-year long cleaning and restoration of the stained glass, and it is fabulous. They do charge to get in, but it's worth every bit. It takes a little effort to find this, but again, it is well worth it. I bet you'll never see anything quite like this!

Stained Glass Masterpieces. Being an atheist I was a bit reluctant to wait in a long line in the rain to see a chapel, but lucky for me my partner persisted.It is surreal to stand in this chapel and be surrounded by some of the oldest and most incredible stained glass windows you will ever see.I am not a religious person but I can appreciate incredible mastery of this amazing cultural relic.Worth the visit even for the atheists.
Great historic site. Well worth a visit especially if the sun is shining. Long queue, recommend booking in advance. We waited for 50 minutes. Worth it.
A Sparkling Jewel Box. We were here first thing in the morning, so we had the upper level of the chapel to ourselves for several minutes. Such a beautiful place of peace.

Please don't miss!. Across the square from Notre Dame Cathedral and somewhat behind the Palais of Justice, you will find the Sainte-Chapelle, small church devoted to Christ's Crown of Thorns. Enter and climb one of the two small spiral stairs to either the left or right back. You will be awed and amazed by the stained glass windows soaring to the roof. If you can get tickets to the Vivaldi concerts in the evenings, try to attend. You will be able to enter as the Kings of France did, through the grand top floor doors. The sunset light floods the windows and the music is superb. This is one of Paris' best experiences! Do not miss it.

Amazing stained glass. Not included in the Paris pass but queues move fairly quick. They sometimes close the Sainte-Chapelle at lunchtime on weekdays for around an hour. We went at the weekend late morning, the stained glass inside is amazing!

A gem of Gothic style and Stunning stained glass. Built in seven years, an impressive feat, the Sainte Chapelle was intended to house precious Christian relics, including Christ's crown of thorns, acquired by Saint Louis. Having these sacred relics in his possession made the already powerful monarch head of western Christianity. Stunning stained glass.are arranged across 15 windows, each 15 meters high, the stained glass panels depict 1,113 scenes from the Old and New Testaments recounting the history of the world until the arrival of the relics in Paris.Continue your visit to the Conciergerie, a unique historical site alongside the Sainte-Chapelle in the Palais de la Cité, once a revolutionary tribunal and prison where Marie-Antoinette was held.

Breathtaking . If you appreciate stained glass, you must visit Sainte Chapelle. The windows soar above you and are breathtakingly beautiful. Wooden statues of the apostles are arranged around the room below the windows. A beautiful central altar offers an ornate focal point. Even the painted stone floors are lovely.You enter through a security check point and then into a lovely chapel and gift shop. To get to the main floor above, you must navigate very narrow, very winding stone stairway. I had to take the stairs one at a time, but the effort was well worth it. The windows are gorgeous.
See this. One of the most underrated sights of Paris. Great eye-candy as well as an historically important place. There was a continuous lecture (in French) being given on the day we visited.

Breathtaking!. What an extraordinary feat of engineering and artistic vision Sainte-Chapelle represents! Words cannot describe it and pictures do not capture the breathtaking beauty of this space, lovingly restored in recent years. A Paris must-see for people of all ages and faiths.
Out of this world architecture. The place is beautiful and breathtaking. You feel like you want to just stay there. Awesome awesome Paris!
Always a favorite. This church is a must see in Paris! The windows are incredibly beautiful. We were fortunate to visit on a sunny day. Not to be missed.

Beautiful. We visited Sainte-Chapelle on a Saturday afternoon so had to queue for entry but it was well worth it. The stained glass windows in the upper floor are absolitely stunning! There are laminated information cards in many languages available at the back of the room which are well worth a read as they describe the story of each of the panels and the closer you look at the detail the more you can appreciate the beauty.
Amazing Stained Glass Windows. We were completely in awe of the beautiful stained glass, which captured over 1,000 stories from the Bible.
Unbelievable Gem. St. Chapelle is gorgeous inside and out. Close to Notre Dame and historic, this church is a must-see!!!!!

The most glorious stained glass I have ever seen. If you love glass, a visit to Sainte-Chapelle is a requirement in Paris. This Gothic masterpiece from the 13th century houses stained glass masterpieces. Even if one is not a person of faith, one can be inspired by the artistry and craftsmanship required to produce by hand over 1,000 stories from The Bible. The purity of color and form are unparalleled Although Paris is notorious for rain, do try to go on a sunny day so that you can enjoy the intensity of the colors as the light streams into the Chapel interiors

Stunningly beautiful. stained glass. What incredible works of art. You definitely feel transformed in time when you visit the top room of the cathedral. It's stunningly beautiful and leaves a lingering impression.

Brilliant. I cannot understand all the naysayers on tripadvisor. As with any stained glass installation, much depends on the light and let's face it Paris gets cloudy and rainy. The illusion of size, the wash of colours, the history, and beauty of the details just blows me away every time I see this. Sure you go through security. Sure they have to do maintenance. Sure it costs some (about the same as a movie). That's a given. But come on. Don't conflate the Concierge with the chapel. Just visit the chapel on a sunny day and bathe in its beauty.
The number one location for stained glass!. Short walk from Notre Dame, cool to see where the Royal family had their private services. The stained glass has got to be the best in the city!

Breathtaking. It was not until my 3rd visit to paris that i visited Sainte-Chapelle... and I was totally awestruck upon entering the Chapel, it was so breathtaking. Do yourself a favour and do not miss this!!!!

Amazingly beautiful!. For me, this was the ONE place in Paris that I wanted to see, and it did not disappoint. The whole chapel is stunning! We went on a Saturday, about an hour before closing time, and practically walked right in.
Stunning. Beautiful beyond belief. Try to attend one of the concerts in the evening....it will move you to tears.
Beautiful!. Hit this on a bright sunny day and you will be absolutely dazzled! Not as great in clouds and rain. Worth the wait, but lines are short first thing in the morning.

Beautiful and breathtaking. This is a must see! It really is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. Why this place isn't as famous as Notre Dame is beyond me! If its a bright sunny day your eyes will be treated to a spectacle!

One of the most beautiful rooms on the planet.. The glass is second to none. In the evenings during summer you can buy tickets to twilight concerts inside the chapel (which is no longer consecrated and forms part of the Ministry of Justice). A Parisian must!

Incredible stained glass windows. The scaffolds are all finally down. The renovations are complete and the windows are just beautiful. We were there late afternoon and you could see the windows on one side perfectly. The other side was too dark to see much detail. I always think when I am there "I should have brought my binoculars" but I always forget. The detail on the windows is simply outstanding and it would be a good idea to remember binoculars to see things clearly, especially at the top of the windows.

Most incredible stain glass. 1,000 scenes of Bible. Truly remarkable! Only 1 block from Notre Dame, and easy to overlook. It was built by King Louis IV, and as a Christian it was a wonderful treasure to discover! At one point, King Louis had the relics of Christ, supposedly the crown of thorns.
Sainte-Chapelle. Although it was an overcast, rainy day, the stained glass windows were still absolutely breathtaking. A "must see" spot in Paris.
Majestic. This small chapel has the most beautiful glass that I have ever seen. It is hard to believe that mere humans created this wonder.

Underrated! Stunning cathedral. Sainte-Chapelle is a stunning gothic cathedral located in the Île de la Cité, in the shadow of the Notre Dame. It is definitely underrated, given that so many people travel there to see the Notre Dame, but miss out on this little treasure. My partner and I were able to use our Paris Museum Pass to get in and were stunned at how beautiful the bottom floor is - however, make sure you don't miss the second floor as so many people can. There are stairs in the corner of the cathedral leading to the second floor, which is wall-to-wall stained glass, stunning and unique! Definitely a must-see experience when in Paris!!

Do Not Overlook This Experience!!. One of the most extraordinary experiences of a lifetime. The surreal setting of the historic venue, the captivating art of stained glass windows that surround the audience, the superb acoustics and beauty of the string orchestra selections including Vivaldi's "Four Seasons" surpassed all expectations.

A beautiful chapel and musical experience. A group of friends visiting Paris and we pre booked a small concert for the evening in the Chappelle. It was a brilliant way to spend time viewing the stained glass and surroundings. Would highly redommended it

Stunning!. Our reaction when we went upstairs was: WOW! The detailing of the architectural style is beyond impressive! The roof lines are amazing! Indescribably beautiful stained glass, one of the most beautiful in the world!It's a must see if you come in Paris!

Forget Notre Dame - This is the Cathedral to See!. Absolutely spectacular and an amazing achievement. Best on a sunny day when the entire church is set aglow from the huge stained glass windows. Do not miss!!!

Best Stained Glass I have ever seen. Wow, this is a little jewel. The glass upstairs is overwhelmingly beautiful. The church is small and quant adding to its charm. I will say however that the price of admission is way too high.

Go for a concert. The place is not famous by nothing, the project is stunning, the colorful lights that come through the stained glass will make you more emotional or close to god. If you have the time and opportunity go to see one of the musical concerts in it, just makes your visit more complete.

Amazing. With the history of the building of this reliquary, one must consider that King Louis had the best architect, builders etc. So this is the highest level of Gothic architecture. My favourite place in Paris

Easter concert at magnificent Chapelle. We signed up for a concert on CLASSICTIC on Easter evening : The Sainte Chapelle is a treasure of French Gothic architecture and is the site of more than one hundred concerts each year. The proposed concerts includes the most famous works of classical music performed by artists and large ensembles known in the French classic scene. Before or after the concert, enjoy a delicious, typically Parisian meal at Brasserie "Les Deux Palais". The event was lovely with 4 piece musicians and eight vocalists.Afterwords the dinner was across the street and we found the meal to be nice, too big the proportions for us a bit dry the lamb salmon was good, nothing spectacular but very acceptable. The service at the restaurant was lovely. Get in line early for best seats and Enjoy.

A Must See!. This is my 3rd visit to Paris, but first time to St Chapelle. I recommend buying your ticket in advance, if possible, but the line moves quickly anyway. Indescribably beautiful stained glass, one of the most beautiful chapels in the world.

Stunning. Wow what a place to visit. A hidden gem. The stained glass windows in Saints-chapelle are amazing. All around you are these stunning Windows in a small chapel which makes a huge impact. It is well worth a trip. Do not miss is it as it is easy to do. Not to far from Notre dame in the "palais de justice"

Gorgeous. This church easily gets over looked and it is STUNNING. The stain glass is breathtaking and this is definitely a place you should want to visit. (The entrance is right next to the Paris courthouse so make sure you take the right entrance cause I saw a few people make that mistake)
A Must SEE. We attended a classical music concert in this breathtaking chapeland thoroughly enjoyed it. Try to fit this in when in Paris as an added bonus to visiting the chapel.

Beautiful!. We stopped by after our tour guide mentioned it was a gem of a place to visit. We were pleasantly surprised as we arrived just before it closed. The walk up the stairs takes your breath away, I am not religious however the beauty of the inside must be seen to be appreciated.

Beautiful!. We stopped by after our tour guide mentioned it was a gem of a place to visit. We were pleasantly surprised as we arrived just before it closed. The walk up the stairs takes your breath away, I am not religious however the beauty of the inside must be seen to be appreciated.

Stunning Stain Glass. This church is very close to Notre Dame so it can be done in the same time frame. When you enter you need to climb the circular staircase to the second floor. There you will find some amazing stain glass windows. There is seating along the sides so that you can sit and really look at the windows. They are narrow and tall and very beautiful. It is possible to book your arrival ahead of time and if you are going to Paris at a busy time of the year I would advise going on line and booking your tickets.

Don't miss Sainte-Chapelle on your next Paris trip!. Surreal is the word that comes in my mind when I visited Sainte-Chapelle -- the detailing of this gothic architectural style is beyond impressive!! The roof lines, vast windows!! Wow!!! I cannot wait to visit this place again!

Beautiful stained glass windows!. This was a little surprise stop on our way back to the airport. We joined a small group which was a great way to visit and to learn about the windows, not just see them. Ideally would have liked more time to visit the nearby area byut that will be for next time. Beautiful!

Vivaldi Concert. The church is beautiful to look at but even better if you buy tickets for a concert. Saw Vivali Strings and it was great. Try to buy tickets in advance as they do get sold out. Concerts are held twice per evening.

Better than Notre Dame. I don't think I have ever seen anything more beautiful. I'm not sure why the Saint-Chapelle is not as popular or as highly recommended as the Notre-Dame because it truly is a sight to behold. If you go to the Saint-Chapelle, don't make the mistake of not going upstairs.
Amazing little chapel . Wonderful stained glass creating an incredible experience from within the upper chapel. Friendly and helpful staff at security and ticketing and inside.

Amazing stained glass!. Much smaller than Notre Dame, and tucked out of the way. Gift shop in the 'crypt' section, with interesting ceiling and stonework. Then up the tiny stone spiral staircase and - wow! Step into the main chapel and the effect of the stained glass (newly restored, I think) is stunning. Choose a sunny day to visit for maximum impact.
Must see!. A jewel of a church, absolutely exquisite. The stained glass windows will take your breath away. Even on dark days it is a moving experience.
A jewel box. Try to go on a sunny day. The lower chambers are calm and pretty, but when you take the stairs up, your breath will be taken. I consider this a must-see in Paris.

Magical. Magical, beautiful place. I went there on a rainy day and really enjoyed the windows and generally inside. For all magic seekers. Really amazing.
Free for less than 26 years old.
Geat venue for concerts. We attended a chamber orchestra performance that was outstanding. The beauty of the setting, the acoustics and the quality of the performance made a perfect evening.

Stunning. My husband and I were fortunate enough to attend a concert last night at Saint Chapelle, and it really was a magical experience. Being able to sit in this gorgeous chapel for an hour, while listening to beautiful music and enjoying our surroundings was an experience we will not forget. If tickets are available to see a concert at Saint Chapelle, please do yourself a favor and go!
Absolutely stunning, must see!. Easily the most impressive thing we saw/did on our 4 day trip to Paris. Could have spent hours admiring all the beautiful windows! Highly recommended
Stunning!. Use the guides to look at different windows. Amazing views and color! There are narrow staircases and tends to be dark, but you'll love it!

Stunning Windows!. I literally added this on to our family's itinerary after learning it was so close to Notre Dame and was so happy that I did. Very small chapel but stunning windows make this stop a true treat. If you are lucky to see on a sunny day the light must be amazing. Worth a peek for sure--security here is tighter than most stops because of the close proximity to a high level court that neighbors it so the lines can get long---Paris pass gets you in but no front of the line access.

A church fit for a king. Inside the compound of the Palais de Justice is Sainte Chapelle. This once royal church has the most beautiful stained glass windows in Paris. There is a security inspection. You are entering the Palais de Justice. After security you proceed to the church. Entry is initially into the lower level of the church. It is quite beautiful and was used for worship by the lower classes. The upstairs is absolutely magnificent. Entry is by a small staircase adjacent to the door through which you entered. The stained glass windows present stories.

Good first step in Paris. Saint Chapelle is small, but amazing spiritual chapel. The stained glass is wonderful. I think if you are doing an overnight flight and looking for something small to do upon arrival, this is quiet, low key, but beautiful way to begin your trip. It gives you a quick intro to Isle St. Louis and is in the middle of everything.

A gem. Go early to miss the crowds and yes collect a brochure at entry level and skip up to the first floor - the Upper Chapel. The light reflects on the windows differently (even in the time we were there)....and don't forget to look at the floors - they too are interesting.

Unlike any other cathedral. I've been to many cathedrals and this is by far is one of my favorites due to the all surrounding beautifully stained glass windows. As such, do not visit here if it is cloudy or dark outside, but rather go only on sunny days. Expect to spend about 1 hour.

Heavenly Beautiful. Buy your ticket online and "skip the line". Don't wait in the cue! You might pay a little more, but it's worth it. Security is very tight, but I'd always rather be safe than sorry. If you cannot climb stairs, you won't be able to see the wonders that await you as you take that last step up the narrow winding stairway. The colors are beyond words - the beauty fills you visually and emotionally. A must see. This is a relatively quick in, up and out. This is NOT a two hour or more site despite what you might hear.

Well worth a visit. Been to Paris a few times and never visited Sainte-Chapelle until this last visit - well worth it! Very busy and had to queue but it was worth it to see the spectacular stained glass windows.

Even more beautiful since 2015 cleaning. This is this is the most breathtaking place to visit. Nothing prepares you for emerging from the top of the stairs into this beautiful glass work of art. Recently cleaned and restored the light shines through every delightful pane of glass.

Take time to SEE. The chapel made up for the condition of some of the gargoyles. My point of the title was that you should take time to look at the stained glass, the marble, the woodwork and the shrines. They really are extraordinaire, the detail and the craftsmanship that it took to build such a huge piece of art is incredible. And yes, I`m speaking of the building, the whole thing is a piece of art and history at the same time. But do slow down to really look at some of the details, you`ll be glad you did.

Dematerialized walls, stunning windows. Sainte-Chapelle was built by Louis IX, the only sainted king of France as a place to keep the crown of thorns, which he bought from his cousin Baldwin II. I don't think there is another church that can boast of more beautiful stained glass than Sainte-Chapelle. Recently restored, the windows tell the story of the Bible (Old and New Testaments) and well as the story of Louis IX and the obtaining of the crown. This is a "don't miss sight" in Paris. Located on the Île-de-la-Cité, the chapel is an easy walk from Notre Dame.

Impressive chapel built in Flamboyant Gothic Style. This chapel is linked with an interesting page of the France history. The stained glasses are superb and are worth to be seen. To complete the visit, don't forget the Conciergerie
Sainte Chapelle. Spectacular stained glass windows. Be prepared for queuing as its a popular attraction. The upstairs chapel is the best part.
extraordinary sainte Chapelle. It's very cold inside but this place is really a symbol of French and European culture. Wonderfull and colorfull windows.
Beautiful little church. Highly recommended if you don't mind the queues. Definitely worth it to see the stained glass windows and beautiful decoration. Plenty of good photo opportunities!

Incredible. At the first the waiting line seemed big but moved quite fast. Once you are inside don't spend too much time on the ground floor but take the stairs and go to the upper chapelle which is simply stunning. The staff does not allow too many people inside the chapelle at the same time so ok you may have to wait in the line before going in, but once you ll be inside it won't be too crowded.

Absolutely stunning !!!. After 7 years of renovation, we can see again the beautiful stained glass, radiant and colorfull. Of course the chapelle is small and the line is long to go inside, especially now! But it's worth it. I recommend to go in the morning, at the opening of the gates, 9:30-10, less people. You can take a combined tiket with the Conciergerie next door, worth it too, beautiful monument. It's 15€ for both.

Beautiful on a sunny day and on the museum pass. We waited about 20 mins to get in, after they'd opened in the afternoon. More sunlight means more brilliant the glass. You enter downstairs, where the gift shop is, but the real beauty is upstairs. The staircase is not well marked, so I saw people leave (disappointed) without heading upstairs.

Beautiful Stain Glass. The Church was small beautiful church. I thought the stain glass was amazing. I haven't seen so much stain glass. If you look closely it will tell a story. It was such amazing little church. I brought a small round stain glass for my daughter's window. Every time I look at it, it reminds me of that church.

Impressive. It is a very short visit, you will spend more time queing than inside but to be honest it is beautiful, the light inside is full of colors, it is worth to wait one hour outside. There is no shelter so bring an unbrella just in case.

Easy to skip, BUT DON'T MISS THIS. I've been to many many churches in Europe. I even lived in Paris and didn't not visit. I finally came back and went. It is the most beautiful I have ever been too. Don't forget to go upstairs or you will miss it.Line is long due to security, but definitely well worth the wait even though your time in the church might be short.We visited right after Notre dame and my kids were in awe

Expect to queue!. Fortunately, we visited the Concierge first and purchased a combined ticket. We were put off first by the length of the queue and came back at 1415hrs as it reopened to a queue just as long.The 'priority' lane was closed but I showed my tickets and asked if I had to wait but was allowed in straight away. Always worth asking!!Inside, the lower chapel is slightly underwhelming - nice, but perhaps not something I would queue for. Once we went upstairs to the Haut Chappelle it became clear why people want to visit. Magnificent stained glass windows culminating in a beautiful rose window. I'm glad that we didn't miss the opportunity to see this.
Impressive. . An awful lot of people, naturally, but breathtaking-especially if you're lucky and happen across a sunny day. I preferred it to the Sistine Chapel.

Long line, small church. I wanted to see this church because of Rick Steves Paris video....the line was about 1.5 hours, not eligible with Paris Pass and the church, while very beautiful, was small and definitely not worth the wait.

Beautiful Stained Glass Windows.. Think of all the money the king spent on building this to house his relics, it's stunning and a little bit hard to find. Cost was 10 euros for adults 8 euros for 18-26 year olds, free for my 16 year old.

A Must-See. Sainte-Chapelle is a small but gloriously beautiful small chapel on the grounds of the law courts of Paris, less than a five-minute walk from Notre-Dame cathedral (which is also a must-see). I always bring friends who are visiting Paris, or strongly suggest they go. You enter downstairs, which is nice, but dark, and people usually wonder what all the fuss is about. Then they go upstairs! To see the most magnificent stained glass windows imaginable. Really gorgeous. If you go on a sunny day, when the sun is south, it will stream through the windows and make colors in the air. Just wonderful. This visit won't take long because the chapel is very small. The line for tickets, however, can take an hour or even much longer, depending on the time of year. So here's a tip...next door is La Conciergerie, which was a prison during the time of the French Revolution. The line to get in is usually very short, if there's a line at all. Inside, they sell a combined ticket to the Conciergerie and Sainte Chapelle. So that's a great way to skip ahead and not have to stand on the long line for the chapel. And the Conciergerie is definitely worth a visit. They have recreated a room similar to the one where Marie-Antoinette was imprisoned. It's bleak and shows just how awful her last days were. And there are lists of names of people who were guillotined during the Revolution, some of whom we can all recognize. For students of French history, I would definitely recommend the Conciergerie and, as I said, getting the combo ticket is the way to go.

Beautiful Stained Glass. This is a small church but definitely worth looking at and exploring. The stained glass is breathtaking and each window tells a different story of the Bible. Great experience!

The jewel of Paris. The most beautiful stained glass windows in France, even more than Notre Dame de Paris or Cathedrale de Chartres.
Unfortunately, long queue for security reasons as this marvellous building is in the complex of the Paris courts of justice.
To be visited imperatively on a sunny day and preferably around noon to enjoy the brilliant of the colours.

Finished, Sainte-Chapelle is Brilliant.. I've been to Paris many times, and I've even been to Sainte-Chapelle while it was undergoing renovations. It was stunning then. But, now it is one of the most impressive 'tourist' sights in Paris. Astonishingly beautiful and the attention to detail committed by the Artisans who created it so many centuries ago, is breath taking. Yes, you must see the Eiffel tower. But, Sainte-Chappel is also a must, must, must, see.
You will not be disappointed!. The stained glass windows are breathtaking. It feels as though you are inside a kaleidoscope. Do not miss it!!!

One of the most incredibly beautiful bexperiences you can have. The first time I went to Sainte-Chapelle, I walked into the lower level and was totally unimpressed. Then we went upstairs, and I was blown away. We went back this year when visiting Paris, and I can't imagine visiting Paris without visiting Sainte-Chapelle. It is simply the most incredible church you will ever see. Period.
The one church not to miss. Beautiful 360 degree stained glass windows, often has music at night. Pretty special place, a quick walk from Notre Dame(another pretty cool place)
Visit in late afternoon. This is a small gem of a chapel that should not be missed. Attend a concert there in late afternoon when light is streaming through the windows. Beautiful.
Attended a cold but warming concert!. We attended a Sunday evening classical music concert. While the church was freezing, the music warmed us!
Worth a look. We thought this was definately worth a look although you should expect a wait to get in. We would suggest getting here early.

One of my favorite places. This is one of my favorite places in Paris. Once you get through security and enter the chapel, it looks nice, but once you go up the stairs (which are narrow, uneven and windy....so take your time), it is stunning!
Stained glass windows. Beautiful stained glass windows. It was quicker to get tickets for both Sainte-Chapelle and the Concierage first

Most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen!. This church may be small when compared to Notre Dame, but it houses the most intricate stained glass I've ever seen. Each panel tells a story from the Bible. I recommend going before sunset and staying a while so you can see the glass change when the sun starts descending. Amazing!

beautiful and hidden. I never knew this was here. So glad I found it. Beautiful church. It is hard to find in a courtyard by a government building. Wish they had better descriptions of the windows. Was there late in the day when the sun was streaming in but would be wonderful at any time.

Wow . This place has the wow factor - never seen anything like its grandeur really worth a trip. Good tip is to go to concierge next door first and buy your tickets for both attractions. Concierge is really interesting and the ticket means you queue jump into the chapel saving a good half an hour. Can't believe it's not more prominent on the guides

A gem of gothic architechture.. The queue looks long, but is quick. The visit is also quite quickly made. Inside the court house, this little chappel, originally built to house relics acquired by the French king, with restaured stained glass windows is one of the most beautiful little chappels in the world.
The "Jewel Box"...Magnificent!. This is a must-see...especially on a sunny day, when the stained glass can be seen in all its glory! Colors are exceptional.

WOW-Stunning stained glass windows. This is a cathedral of stained glass that is not to be missed whether you have an artistic or religious bent or not. The only drawback is that you cannot really see the upper part of the windows. I recommend going on a sunny day, but go, There are also cards in various languages that explain each panel.

#1 in Paris. This is my absolute favorite place in Paris. There are a few places you go in life that stop you in your tracks and drop your jaw and this is one of them. Ive been multiple times and never get over the sense of awe I have in this 800 yr old building. I have no idea how they did what they did but it is damn impressive. Schedule this visit on a sunny day if you have that option when setting your itinerary.
Interesting Chapel near the Notre Dame. After the Notre Dame, the Saint Chapelle pales in comparison.. Still worth a visit as it is near the Notre Dame..

Gorgeous!. You're visiting this to see the incredible stained glass windows. Expect a crowd in the chapel and a line to get in. Pick up one of the free information cards in the chapel to understand the stories told by the windows. Covered by the Paris Museum Pass. Easily appreciated in one hour.
Stained glass. The guide books recommended visiting but nothing could prepare me for this site. It is truly overwhelming, a must see.

Beautiful! Not to Be Missed!. I love, love, love Sainte-Chapelle. The stained glass windows upstairs are magnificent and beautiful beyond words. That provides such a juxtaposition with the more austere downstairs. Don't miss this gem.

Magnifique. The beauty of some rare man made structures reaches the sublime. The stained glass upper chapel at Saint Chapelle is such a place. It will take you longer to wait in line than it does to see it, and requires negotiating a steep staircase, but it is well worth the effort. Included on the Museum Pass or about $10 otherwise.
Breathtaking. This was my favorite thing in Paris. Much more impressive (to me) than Notre Dame. And if you can go on a sunny day, with sun shining in through all the glass it is amazing.
Evening Concert. We attended 7 pm concert that was magical. We were there in March so we saw the windows illuminated from outside and sat to do it!

Beautiful gothic church. This place deserves a visit as it is extremely beautiful and even left our teenagers in awe. There might be a small line to get in - of course this can be skipped if you have a museum pass. The impressive stained windows and the architectural elements are worth your time and there are little paper guides explaining everything you're seeing.
Ethereal beauty. This is my favorite place in Paris. It is gorgeous. And special. The light, the windows, the soaring columns. A real gem.

My Favorite Place in Paris. Perhaps it is unjust that so many Americans do not know about Sainte-Chapelle. You have to know it is there, or you would surely miss it. Yet, the shear majesty of the glass, the careful balance of the walls, and the beauty of the ceiling call upon our better nature as we admire this royal church, tucked behind a former palace. A secret place? No, but you feel that you enter a private sanctuary after assending the short, narrow stairway. The thrill never goes away. Happy trails....

Amazing - must see. This is a must see in Paris. I have been to many places around the world and this is one of my favorites. One of the largest collections of stain glass and it is stunningly beautiful especially on a sunny day. It rains in Paris in the afternoons so plan accordingly.

Beautiful!. I went here about 20 years ago. It is a stunning little cathedral. 20 years later, it was still beautiful, but a huge line to get in. And now there is a giftshop on the ground floor. This is definitely worth seeing, maybe getting their earlier you would beat the crowds.

Incredible stained glass. We went here on a cloudy day, and even then, the windows were amazing! But make sure you climb the stairs at the end of the first room. The windows upstairs are absolutely spectacular!
Exquisite. What a gem, breathtaking, the only drawback was tool many school children making a lot of noise, the guild is overly Catholic and lacking detail. But you should just let it work it magic.
Mosaics are Impresive. The Mosaic art work in this Church are amazing. There is not much to do and you can see everything in about 30 minutes but it´s worth it.

Bathed in Rainbow. I feel this is the Cathedrals lesser known cousin, smaller in stature but absolutely incredible. Plus the wait was minimal, infact we were in within a minute of arriving. The history behind the windows and building is awesome to listen too, and the work that has been undertaken on the stained panes is unbelievable!

All the beauty of stained glass...on steroids. Really beautiful and does not require a huge investment of time. We didn't find the audio guide worthwhile. Way too much info...unless you are a stained glass aficionado.
Simply stunning stained glass!. Must admit I only went for the stained glass and was not disappointed. The paintings on the ceiling were amazing.

Stunning church- you must go!. This church is absolutely amazing. I've spent a lot of time in Europe so at this point, I'm a little jaded as far as beautiful churches go, but this one never fails to take my breath away. The stained glass and architecture are to die for- it is definitely worth it to visit Sainte Chapelle!

Beautiful . I am happy that I finally made it here. First became aware of Sainte-Chapelle from a PBS show a number of years ago. I knew I would be disappointed if I didn't get here on my recent first trip to Paris. It wasn't easy - we came by one time and there was a long line, another when we had a dinner reservation and once when it was closed. Finally we got in and found it to be as awe inspiring as we had dreamed.I advise finding time to visit here. And I believe that the audio guide is worth the extra cost as it adds to your experience.
Amazing. don't let the first floor disappoint you: go to the second floor and feast your eyes like nowhere else.

Don't miss. Better than Notre-Dame in some ways. 1136 scenes from the bible represented in stained glass. Overwhelming and beautiful. Make sure to go to the second floor! Worth the $10€. Kids under 18 are free.
Saint Chapelle. Compare this with Notre Dame and it is simply amazing. Notre Dame took 200 hundred years to build. Sainte-Chapelle 5. My mind.... Poof! The most beautiful stained glass in the world.

Beautifully restored chapel!. The stairs are very steep! Luckily I asked one of the guides if there was an elevator for my 82 year old mother and they were so kind! A very kind young man took us to the court building next door and allowed us to use the elevator there and then walked us to the chapel. Amazing stained glass windows are not to be missed.

La musique superbe. An evening concert by 6 string players (plus harpsichord) was a memorable highlight. What passion and exquisite technique and musicianship by a top-rate ensemble. The setting with its centuries-old stained windows all added to the beauty of the evening.
Beautiful glass work, must see!. The stain glasses windows are sparking shining at sunny day. Just watch sunlights move around is one of the never forget once in the life time experience.

Evening classical concerts!. For music & history fans, you can combine these interests by attending daily evening classical concerts in the most beautiful setting. There is 7PM and 8:30PM perf,programs listed online and on sandwich boards by the entrance (where people line up to tour the Chapelle). You buy tickets at across street (follow sign to Souvenir shop) at priace 25/30/40 Euro's (or buy online). Note that there is NO HEAT in the chapel so must bundle up if on chilly days.Get there at least .5 hr early for security check Then enjoy a fantastic concert in the most stunning setting! (P.S. most Paris churches have evening concerts on weekends & you can choose based on convenience & programs).

Beautiful stained glass windows. The Location: Metro #4, Exit "Cite". Only a few minutes walk from the metro station. There is a sign right outside metro station. The Admission: 8.5 euro (included in museum pass)Built by Saint Louis in 1246 to house the relics of the Passion of Christ. The jewel of Gothic art is adorned with beautiful stained glass windows and remarkable sculpted decoration.Have to wait in line for security check. The church is pretty small so won't take too long to check it out. Nearby there are Notre-Dame and Conciergerie to check it out.

Stunning Church. I have been to Paris a few times and don't know quite how I missed this before. Just around the corner from Notre Dame this is a stunning Church on two distinct levels. A real highlight of the trip.

Great time in the Sainte-Chapelle. We were lucky enough to be in the neighbourhood at the right time when we saw a poster indicating a concert was about to take place in the "Sainte-Chapelle" (Holly Chapel). There were 5 violins, a cello and a harpsichord. The place is most inspiring and the music was awesome : it was Vivaldi 4 seasons this late afternoon by David . I recommend that to all visitor, the place is worth to be seen and offer an excellent acoustic.Take care of yourself and come soon to France my friends.I would have liked to publish this review with a link of the concert in it, but apparently it is seen as commercial by TripAdvisor - even if I don't have any interest in sharing the info, other than allowing visitors to be as enthousiastic as we were.Gwenaël
Beautiful. Amazing stained glass in the upper chapel. Conciergerie next door is interesting too. Avoid the first sunday of the month when it is free--we waited in line for almost ab hour.

Beautiful stained glass, the most vibrant colours!. This is tucked away in the grounds of the Palais Justice, so plenty of gendarme walking around, but they're all so friendly, saying hello to everyone.. When we arrived, there was a bit of a queue but it moves relatively quickly; I'd say we queued for a total of about 30 minutes and this was just after lunchtime. When we first arrived into the smaller chapel downstairs, what struck me was how colourful it was, despite there being few windows. The decoration is really quite beautiful, but it's when you climb the stairs to the upper chapel things get really interesting.The upper chapel is so bright and airy, and the stained glass is out of this world. We had a relatively sunny day, so the colours were really vibrant, all blues, reds and greens, and just made this whole place look like a box of precious jewels. There is scaffolding to one side of the chapel (not sure this is work on the chapel itself but rather the building beside it) so we could really only get the benefit of the sunny day on one side of the building, however this was more than enough... I've done my fair share of cathedrals and churches in France, and this is completely different to anything I've ever seen before. There's a guide you can pick up (quite a large heavy plastic sheet) outlining the stories told in each of the windows, but to be honest we didn't really use this. There's a couple of benched dotted around if anyone needs a rest after the stairs (which aren't too cumbersome but for older people or anyone who just needs a bit of a sit down, these are handy). All in all, we were done in about 20 minutes, but if you wanted to take some more time looking at the stories of the windows, then I guess it could take up to an hour. Location wise, this place is great for grabbing a bite to eat, either before or after, and is only a five minute walk to Notre Dame.
Go on a sunny day. If you can choose a sunny day that would be best. It's small but a real gem. Take your time and drink it all in.

Gorgeous! . This stunning cathedral's stained glass was a sight to behold! The history, rich and even though the relics of Christ are no longer kept here, it is fascinating to hear about. Much easier to see first thing in am as lines were non-existent compared to previous afternoon.

Amazing concert. We went to one of the occasional weekend concerts on a bitterly cold friday. Please make sure you are well wrapped up as the Chapelle is not heated. aside from the slight inconvenience of feeling colder throughout the concert, it is such an amazing experience i would go back in a flash. I believe different ensembles play at different times throughout the year and if our experience is typical than the musical ability is first class. In such a setting it is an unforgettable experience. Thank you Mr Braccini and the rest of the musicians for giving us such musical beauty. If you can go during the day and see the Chapelle itself it will add to the whole.

Beautiful and well worth the visit.. They close at 1:00 so go at 12:30 for smaller crowds. The stain glass windows are amazing. There is a line for when they reopen at 2:30. It is located inside the palais de justice.

Sainte Chapelle. good to do on a sunny day, museum free on first Sunday of the month. Very near is the Congierge which is also worth a visit, cell where Marie-Antoniette was held and interesting history as well.

Lovely on a sunny day. The chapel is hidden away from the road, which makes it quite peaceful. The stain glass windows are beautiful and very impressive on a sunny day. We went on a Saturday and there was a 30 minute queue to get in, but it was definitely worth visiting.

Amazing. This chapelle is a jewel of the time where Kings were in city island, before they moved to Le LouvreThere are two chapels The under one is very well decorated and paintedThe upper one has fantastic WindowsTo visit when there is sun is better

Most beautiful stained glass i have ever seen. this was by far the most beautiful stained glass my husband and I had seen. the inside of the cathedral is virtually all stained glass above the first level of carved wood. fortunately it was a sunny day. the colors were vibrant and the scenes intricate.

A Little Jewel. This little jewel of a chapel is simply divine in its location, architecture, history and spirit.
