We were lucky there was'nt much of a que, I visited Niotre Dame on the same day but for some reason preferred this church. The windows told a story if you went from one to other.

Concert in heaven. This is the most gorgeous chapel. Try to go in the evening when they have a concert, especially if it is Pavel. Unbelievable. (But leave plenty of time in advance for the security check!!)

Like no 'chapel' you've ever visited!. Didn't get to this treasure our first time to Paris. Grateful we did this time!! This is a magical chapel. Built by Louis XIV to house religious relic, it is mostly a lovely framework to house the most beautiful tall, delicate stained glass windows I have ever seen. I'll simply say it took my breath away and anyone who enjoys visiting churches/cathedrals should not miss this chapel. Fairly quick to visit hopefully at time away from lines. Allow some quiet time to simply stand in awe. Lovely...
beautiful. beautiful stained glass windows. Not sure it is worth the hour wait in the queue outside- also no body mentioned the steep spiral stair case going up- difficult for elderly
Beautiful but a long line to get in. Long wait, even with the museum pass, but well worth it. Beautiful stained glass! Even the outside is interesting.
Beautiful.... Stunning stained glass chapel that depicts scenes of the Bible. You must take your time and take it all in.
Bach in St.-Chappelle. Saw this by attending a wonderful evening concert. Bach. Stunning music. However, to see the windows at their best, go during the day.

Hidden Parisian gem. Our daughter is a history major and had told us this was an attraction not to miss. Just a few blocks from Notre Dame, she was right. Very interesting architecture but spectacular stained glass. Plan on waiting but the queue moves. If you have the time, don't miss this exceptional landmark.

Like high gothic architecture? Then you cannot miss this. If you can, try to go here on a sunny day. If you're into high gothic architecture, you can't miss this. It's amazing that so much of this glass has lasted throughout the centuries.

Saint Chappell concerts. Attended a baroque music concert tonight in the cathedral. If you enjoy this style of music put this on your must attend list. Simply delightful! Purchase tickets at the souvenir shop across the street from the cathedral entrance early in the day( cash only) . Best to show up 30 minutes early as seats are first come first serve. The church is exquisite inside but you will miss the incredible stained glass windows if you only go at night. Early morning is best to avoid extremely lengthy lines.
Absolutely stunning. Absolutely stunning. A must see on any trip to Paris. About a block from Notre Dame cathedral, so if you have the chance it is well worth the walk.

Stunning church. Friend told my wife that if we visit Paris we should visit this church so we did and what a supprise it was. The lead light and church were simply stunning. I did not expect to see this when I entered. Well worth a look. A word of warning, visitors have to go through metal detectors and bags are xrayed. Ensure you do not have any shape objects.
worth standing on line? only on a sunny day.. dark first floor is a great prelude to the glorious chapel. Worth standing on line? Only on a sunny day.

A Beautiful Stained Glass Wonder. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever been in. The stained glass windows are simply gorgeous. We saw the church on a rainy day and it was magnificent. I can only imagine what it looks like on a sunny day. Please go, it is worth it.

Attend the concert at Sainte-Chapelle and be overwhelmed with beauty in all forms. We always try to catch a concert at Sainte Chapelle when we are in Paris - it sets the right tone for the whole trip because it is such a fabulous location and the musicians are good. Vivaldi's Four Seasons was being performed by the MOST energetic group we have seen to date; they were as much fun to watch as their music was superb to hear.They certainly were happy to be performing together - it was almost like a dance! The surroundings are so spectacular that they must be viewed but one can close one's eyes and feel you are in heaven for the moment. AUSGEZEICHNET!!
World Class!. This is an absolute gem. The staff was helpful with my disabled friend. I would never miss this on a trip to Paris.
Lovely. One of the prettiest churches in Paris if not the best, it has many concerts so if you get chance visit when one is on the sound is spectacular

Absolutely must visit. We queued for about half an hour in the rain to get in, and it was COMPLETELY worth it. Absolutely stunning inside, like nothing I've ever seen before! Would thoroughly recommend while you're in Paris.

Outstanding, but the queues are enormous. Bought a combined ticket to this place and to the conciergerie online. Had to queue for around 40 minutes to get in, which was a bit upsetting, but once I got inside, I was amazed by its beauty. Also, thanks for the information provided on what is depicted on each of the windows. Best to visit when the weather is sunny.

Stained Glass Glory. We were lucky enough to not wait in line to see this treasure. Audio guide well worth it. In addition to unbelievably beautiful stained glass, the history of Sainte Chapelle's two-storied design makes it unique. So glad we didn't miss this in the midst of all Paris has to offer
Beautiful stained glass. Go on a sunny afternoon when the light is shining through the stained glass. Try and get a guided tour because the explanations of the individual panels is fascinating.

Sainte Chapelle san selfie stick. This is my most favorite place in Paris, although it is a small chapel, it puts the Notre Dame to shame, especially if you love stained glass. This is my second time here, I did notice a new addition, a sign at the ticket office which said "No Selfie Sticks", I can only imagine what must have happened. You can still take selfies, just leave your selfie stick at home!
Music at Sainte-Chapelle. My favorite memory of Paris will be hearing Vivaldi's Four Seasons in the beautiful Sainte-Chapelle, nothing can compare.
Beautiful!. Go late in the afternoon on a sunny day for the best colors! Be prepared for narrow, winding staircase.
Breathtaking. What a beautiful chapel to see, especially if the sun is shining. You have no idea what is inside until you walk up the stairs and then BAM

Magic chapel.. Metro station Cite or 5 minutes by walk from the cathedral Notre Dame. When you get inside you can look around and then on your right side beside the door are narrow stairs. And when you get up you will say - wow-wow-wow. The windows are magical. The windows will tell you the story about passion of Christ. Must see it.

Wow. Was not expecting this beauty but so glad we found it! The stained glass in this building is unbelievable - absolutely mind blowing. Once you enter the grounds, there is a second line to enter the Sainte-Chapelle but if you have a Paris Pass you can actually walk to the front of the line (I felt to nervous to do this initially but so many people were skippping the minute line that I jumped on board). A good one to see, particularly if you have just done Notre Dame and are in the area.

Absolutely Magical. Possibly the most beautiful man-made spot on the planet. Attending a classical music concert with my wife as the sun sets through these spectacular stained glass windows: Priceless!!

lesser traveled chapel in the shadow of Notre Dame.. Sainte-Chappelle is mind blowing in it's beauty. The upper chapel is incredible. Surrounded on all sides by stained glass and very little stone, this lesser known chapel eclipses Notre Dame in it's beautiful glass and is close by.

Concert in the small chapel was great. We went to the evening concert in the small chapel, great place for enjoying the music as well as the amazing windows. I didn't go on the tour, as I didn't have time, but enjoyed walking around the area. I
Stained Glass Masterpiece. What a brilliant sight to behold on a sunny day! It was well worth the 30 minute wait in line and the extensive security check.
Holy Chapel. What a beautiful chapel. The stained glass windows were breathtaking -- and so huge. We are glad we went.
Lines too long. I tried to go trice and on the second try I waited 30 min and only moved down 1/4 of the line. No quick entry with the Paris museum pass. Waste of time!

AMAZING SUN THROUGH THE COLURED STAINED GLASS. The most beautiful chapel ijn the world. You should go on a sunny day to enjoy the sun filtering through the stained coloured glasees, an amazing view. All the walls are coloured glass. Right in the center, beside Notre Dame.

Saint-Chapelle stained glass wonders. Saint-Chapelle is truly beautiful - you will not want to leave ! It has (I believe) the oldest surviving stained glass windows, which are very intricate and detailed.
gorgeous stain glass. This is a beautiful chapel with the most spectacular stain glass. There is a self guided tour. The wait to get in was not terribly long.
Amazing stain glass. this one you have to pay an admission fee to get in to see it but it is worth it. The stain glass windows are so amazing to see. better then notre dome.

Beautiful But Crowded. Saint Chappelle is absolutely beautiful. However, it was so crowded at 11:00 on a weekday, that it was difficult to truly appreciate it. We were able to use our Paris Museum Pass, however in this case, there was no separate line for pass holders. We had to wait in a rather long line that thankfully did move quickly.

Fantastic tour!. Had the good fortune to book a Fat Bike Tour of Saint Schapelle and Notre Dame. It was fabulous. Our guide, Stephanie, was incredibly knowledgeable and turned what could have been dry historically fact into living and breathing history with humour and respect. Can't recommend it highly enough.
Amazing stained glass. An amazing place worthy of a visit. No skip the line tickets here so get there early. Stained glass windows are well explained. The place is quiet and no selfie sticks allowed😊

Do Not Miss a Visit!! Absolutely Dazzling stain glass windows!. Could have spent hours here if I would have had the time. Just breathtaking stained glass windows!! Just loved it!! A must visit if you love stained glass windows, as I certainly do!

THE Rose Window and so much more. Went in the evening for a concert and the following day to see it in the sunlight. Awesome, in the true sense of the word. Stop in on your way too or from Notre Dame.
Don't miss this gem.. This chapel is stunning. When you see all of the beautiful stained glass, it will take your breathe away. If you can, get a tour.
Must see in Paris. The first floor is amazing! Breathtaking stained glass windows on the second floor! A place you must see when in Paris

Beautiful Stained glass chapel not to be missed. A beautiful chapel full of stained glass. It is easy to walk past and miss it as you can see the beauty of it from the street. Once you are inside it is like you are inside a jewel box. Absolutely stunning.
Amazing!. This is a must see in Paris. A short walk from Notre Dame it's worth the trip! The stained glass windows are breathtaking!

Excellent baroque concert in a remarkable setting. Regular concerts (sometimes two a night). Check the program to see what is being played - often just popular classics (Vivaldi's Four Seasons is a regular item). We were lucky to get to a concert featuring a harpsichordist, violinist and flautist (playing a range of recorders) playing various pieces by Teleman, Bach, and two versions on Ave Maria (Gounod and Caccini)

Absolutely stunning!. We had heard Sainte Chapelle was a must see, but it far exceeded our expectations! The lower chapel was small and had been used by the staff of the royals. The upper chapel was for the king and his guests. The stained glass was absolutely stunning! The stained glass windows depict the stories of the Bible from start to finish. Definitely a must see and more impressive than Notre Dame.

An amazing place. The stained glass windows are beautiful especially when you understand the particular themes. Try to get their early or later in the day, best when the sun is out. You have to go through security so leave your pocket knife in the hotel (or hide it outside somewhere, it worked).

Amazing stained glass windows. Located near the Notre Dame, about 2 minutes walk away, this small church has the most wonderful stained glass windows you'll ever see. There was no entry fee on the day I visited for some unknown reason but a small fee is usually charged.

One of my favourite places to visit. The queues can be brutal and the crowds insane but, hey, that's all part of the Paris experience. Once inside the upper Chapel is the most stunning I have ever seen.

Breathtaking. You'll find stained glass windows here that soar upward, taking your spirit with them. There is more beautiful, bright stained glass beauty per square inch of all than any church or cathedral. Period. We had the pleasure of attending a concert that same evening in the sanctuary. It was beyond words.

Jaw droppingly beautiful. The stained glass in this place is just breathtaking. Wecame here to listen to a classical music concert, and I found it hard to even concentrate on the music, because I just wanted to stare at the beautiful windows the entire time.
Total Magic. This chapel is absolutely magical. Stepping into the top floor is like stepping into a fairytale. Definitely worth the ticket entrance.

Stunning. Small but the prettiest chapel in the city of light.
Stained glass masterpiece. very crowded. History all over this place

Skippable. Sure, the stained glass gothic chapelle can be mesmerising for the first couple of minutes. But is it worth the hour long wait to enter? Nah. I wouldn't do it twice. Especially because there's so much else to see in this beautiful city.

Spectacular. We got there about 20 minutes before its afternoon opening and were close to the fornt of th eline. I am glad of that becuase it is a small chapel and fills quickly. The lower chapel is beautiful though in need of restoration. The stencilling is beautiful on the walls. Tucked into a corner is the spiral stone, narrow staircase to get to the real gem, the upper chapel. It is breathtaking, all stained glass. It is just gorgeous, awe inspiring. You really get to understand the relationship between the church and royalty of long ago.
Inspiring. This should be a top ten attraction, beautiful, inspiring and a calm out of the wonderful mayhem that is parisl

Amazing stain glass. If you'd like to see a room literally wrapped in stained glass you won't be disappointed. I'd suggest going at the end of the day for the best picture taking so you are there when they clear everyone out and can get a couple of shots without the crowds.

Enormous queues and the they closed at the middle of the day. It was supposed to be one of the highlights but we never made it. We made the line in the morning and by the time we arrive the told us the are closing for lunch. The line in the afternoon was so long that much to our regard we skip it. Paris pass is usesless you have no preference to go in.
Small but perfectly formed.. Quite a small church, but very impressive inside. Much more so than Notre-dame. It could do with restoring as some of the paintwork and tiles are wearing away.

Small church near Notre Dame that should not be missed. I had heard to make sure to visit Sainte-Chapelle. I had to go twice because the line was so long and my Paris Museum Pass did not get me in the initial line without waiting. It did get me in to the second line much faster. It was very moving and the stained glass windows and upstairs chapel were well worth the wait and two trips. The windows told the story of Christ so take time to study each one.

Sainte-Chapelle windows. This is a wonderful Church the stain glass windows and the ceiling is spectacular you enter on ground level, there is also an upper level so do not miss that it is not really marked just a little winding staircase on the left hand side on the chapel entry door and there is so much more to see and pictures of how the window are constructed a not to miss church when having a Paris holiday.

Wonderful Vivaldi concert. Went to a concert - Vivaldi era music by a septet led by a very active and talented violinist (Paul Rouger). Seats (chairs) not very comfortable but the concert was very good and the chapel was built 800 years ago and is a marvel of Gothic architecture.

Absolutely freaking amazing. For years my father told me that if I ever went to Paris I had to see Sainte-Chapelle. Now I know why. Words can not begin to describe how beautiful this church is. I can be crowded, but just take your time and enjoy this wonder of color and light and spirituality. In all honesty, it brought tears to my eyes. In honor of my father, I'm telling you... if you ever go to Paris be sure to see Sainte-Chapelle. Thank you, Dad.

Beautiful glass work. The glass work in this chapel is amazing, and in itself worth the visit. The walls shine with so many colours..It is truly spectacular, different from any other chapel I have visited so far. The ceiling is covered in golden stars, giving it a somewhat fairy tale feeling.
Stunning!. Beautiful Stain Glass. I have never seen so much beautiful stain glass in my life. This is beyoned unique and beautiful.
Not to be missed. Have visited cathedrals in several countries but the stained glass here may get most beautiful. Floor to ceiling, it surrounds you In a way others do not. Do not miss this.
Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit - glass windows are amazing - doesn't take long - not much else to see.Close to other interesting things. Easy to get to by Metro.

Breathtaking stained glass!!!. Had to wait in line, despite having a museum pass, but it was definitely worth it! it was like being in a room with gorgeous stained glass walls. It would be a strenuous climb for someone with arthritis or other impairments of that kind. It might be the most glorious example of stained glass windows anywhere!!!

Luminosity. This is one of my favorite places to go in Paris. As you enter the ground floor, there is a sense of darkness. This is where the peasants came to worship. As you climb the circular staircase to the second level, however, it is as if the heavens open up to you. The walls are all covered with amazing stain glass windows in vibrant hue depicting the Christian faith from the Garden of Eden to the Judgement Day.

A gem. Seeing this them was accidental. We saw a poster of a concert featuring the 4 seasons of Vivaldi at 7 that evening. We decided to attend. The concert was great! But the chapel was equally fascinating. Sooo beautiful! A gem literally I believe it is as old as Notre Dame Cathedral.

Too Beautiful for words. I almost cried the moment we walked up the tiny staircase into the upper chapel. The pure beauty of the room from the stained glass windows is mesmerizing. It is truly awe-inspiring and a room of beauty. I highly recommend making this a to-do on your trip to Paris.
A spiritual experience. One of the most beautiful churches in Paris, come to a concert at night, it's a fabulous sound and an everlasting memory for you later.

Awe Inspiring - go on a sunny day if possible. My second trip to see this and I'm just as impressed as I first was.Lines were not too bad late in the day (about 3PM) on a Saturday. We had a Paris Museum pass which didn't seem to matter even though there was a separate line for it (it was closed). Once inside however there was another line allowing us to bypass the ticket line. Go figure.Since the entrance is into the lower chamber be sure to climb the stairs in the back corner of the church to ascend to the top chamber where the windows are located.While I took a number of pictures I think with over 2000 photos already posted you get the drift of what this place is all about and posting them isn't necessary.Again, if you can make it while it's sunny it will be a better experience.We also visited the chapel in the Chateau at Vincennes, which is a smaller version of this chapel, and it does not compare in it's stained glass detail or colors to this chapel.Be sure to get a pamphlet which will describe how old this building is, and it's origins.

Vivaldi Concert. Ste Chapelle is a treasure and should not be missed. We attended the Vivaldi Concert one evening and really enjoyed it. It offered an interpretation of The Four Seasons quite different than any you have probably heard, but good musicality and very entertaining. BE AWARE, however, that you will be standing in line twice, for 30 minutes of so each, just to scramble for a seat. ALSO, there is only one toilet available for concert-goers. Not one rest room…one toilet! Imagine the frustration.

So beautiful and inspiring. Saint-Chapelle is one of my favorite places in Paris. Not so famous as the Eiffel Tower but for me a most to see. Outside the chapel you can just enjoy the gothic style of the construction but could think that maybe it was a mistake to go, but a soon as you enter to the first floor you are amazed by the beauty of the place. The best comes when you climb the stairs up to the second floor and you are surprised by the colorful windows, just breathtaking.

Spectacular. Nothing can compare to the thrill of coming up the steps from the lower church into the stained glass covered walls of the 2nd floor. Just wonderful! This is a must see and I'm sorry I missed it on my prior trips.

Sainte Chapelle-worth the queue. I awas there in June on a rainy day but my goodness how beautiful it is. They have spent seven years cleaning the wonderful stained glass windows. It is worth a visit regardless or the queuing. I went on a Monday at about 10am and it was not too bad. It is small but exquisite.

A bit disappointing. I can see that most reviewers were blown away by this ancient chapel ; and yes, the stained glass IS very beautiful. But we were disappointed to see that the whole of one side of this unexpectedly small space was taken up by the sale of souvenirs, postcards, etc. It all felt a bit tawdry, and it certainly lowered the general atmosphere of the place. Entry costs 8.50 euros, and we felt that at that price the souvenirs should have been sold in another part of the surrounding buildings, so as to enable visitors to have a full, unspoilt appreciation of the chapel.

Awesome!. I wasn't prepared for the beauty of this place. It is simply stunning. The photos cannot do it justice, which as a photographer I find hard to write. The queues are horrendous so go early and take an umbrella and food if necessary! Very well worth it. Get a combined ticket with the conciergerie.

Ethereal Light and Beautiful Architecture Make Sainte-Chapelle Worth Seeing. Sainte-Chapelle is well a visit. It is an ancient gothic church located near Notre Dame on the Ile de la Cite. The building is almost a miracle: slender ribs of grey stone support immense stained glass windows that almost glow when light hits them. It is a lovely sight. If you want to avoid the crowds and have a lot of time at the church, get tickets to see one of the evening string quartet concerts. The musicians are first-rate and the setting evening sun makes the windows especially beautiful. Tickets for the concerts can be purchased at the church; however, it's best to buy them in advance. You can also buy them online through classictic and print them out on your home printer.
A Must-See!. Amazing! This was one of the most beautiful places we visited. We had a Paris Museum Pass, which covered the admission cost, but did not allow for line skipping.

Sublime, beautiful, inspiring!. Visit when there is sunlight to stream through the windows. If you can find a moment off the popular schedule and get to visit in a peaceful way at your own pace you will be able to bask in the colours streaming from these amazing windows. It is worth queuing for if you are visiting but if you come frequently or live in the area try to avoid the round the corner queue of folk.Don't miss this treat.

The most beautiful church (Chapel) in Paris. In my opinion, this is far more beautiful than Notre Dame. It was the personal chapel of Sainte Louis. Make sure you go on a sunny day. The upper walls are entirely stained glass which makes this truly breathtaking.

Great View in the Dome. It was a beautiful church. We climbed the dome and the worker lady that we bought our tickets from was very rude to us because we were Americans. Worth a visit if you have more than a few days in Paris and the view of Paris was the best we saw.
The most beautiful church in Paris. Unbelievable most beautiful stained glass windows. Worth the wait in line. We had no idea what to expect and it was truly an OMG moment.

Absolutely the best stained glass windows ever. We visited here after Notre Dam and could not believe how beautiful the stained glass windows are in this old church. Well worth the time to see the colors and how many there are all around the interior.

Absolutely breathtaking. We decided to visit here because it was close to nitre dame cathedral and open 30 min before it so we had some time. I am so glad we did. In my opinion it was even more breathtaking! Possibly because we didn't look into the history or what we would find so it was a delightful surprise to us. Didn't take too long, may 30 min or so, and it was absolutely worth it, make some time to visit this little gem.

Beautiful!. This may sound terrible; but we preferred Sainte-Chapelle to Notre Dame! Smaller and more intimate, the stained glass is stunning and awe inspiring. Well worth the visit and we would love to return for an evening choral performance.
Wow. Shame its not so close to other attractions but its worth a while. We loved it ...Me and my wife love all the chapels but this one was special
excellent. worth paying 8.5 euros & though it is small church with 2 floors & within 30 minutes you will come out but yes it is superb
The most amazing windows!. Absolutely amazing stained glass windows. We just sat and tried to take it all in. I'm not sure what time of day we were there but had no problem getting in.

Stunning Gothic Church with Amazing Stained Glass!. We were fortunate to have a friend recommend this beautiful church to us. We went mid-morning and had a relatively long line-up through security and another to obtain a ticket. The stained glass and floor tile work is simply amazing. Don't miss out on seeing this exquisite church - if you don't have much time, skip the Notre Dame Cathedral and do this instead!
One of top attractions in Paris. I've been here several times, and it never ceases to amaze. Beautiful chapel with 2 stories. Right next to the Conciergerie.
Stunning!. Sainte Chapelle is simply stunning. The most beautiful strained-glass windows I have every seen. Well worth a visit and the wait to get in.

Uncomparable. I'd wager that you'll never see stained glass like this anywhere else in the world. You walk in and it's just dazzling -- especially when the sun comes out. Even on a cloudy day it's gorgeous. The architecture is very attractive and interesting. They were undergoing some repairs/renovations when we were there in March 2015. It didn't much hinder our visit.

Wow ! Wow ! Wow! Don't Bother with Notre Dame. This church was recommended to us and we were not sure what to expect. We queued up for about 20 minutes and when we entered the church it was ok and interesting but nothing to amaze but after having a good look around we went up the stairs and were blown away by the breath taking stained glass windows. They hit you as soon as you get to the top of the stairs and they are better than any of the hundreds of churches we have seen in the past all around the world. This is something we will never forget.

Gothic Masterpiece. This Gothic masterpiece is simply stunning and on no account to be missed. It seems miraculous that building can stand up, given that its wall seem to be made of stained glass. The windows themselves are full of fascinating detail. My tip is to bring a small pair of binoculars, if you have them.

Impressive. A smaller church not far from the Notre Dame Cathedral that boasts a gothic architecture and stained glass windows.The outside and downstairs bit wasn't much, however upstairs was stunningly beautiful. Its atmosphere is so calming and the way the sun shines through the glass windows add colour and makes the place even more serene.There was a fair length of queue when we went however if you've got the Museum Pass, then this can be bypassed quickly.

Incredible Stained Glass. The line to enter the chapel looks long from the street, but it moves quickly. The stained glass windows are on the second floor and incredible to see. Brave the line for an exceptional experience.
Fantastic. Incredibles glass paintings! By ticket in advance! The cues are long and very slow. The fast track/pre paid access is always clear..

Beautiful Stain Glass.. This is an excellent attraction and it is close to the Notre Dame Cathedral. Expect a slight wait in line to entry as many private tour groups attend this attraction. Beautiful stain glass and history.

Absolutely Gorgeous. We were disappointed that we got to the church and it is closed from 11:30 to 2:30. So we went to Notre Dame during that time. I suggest getting there at 9:30 or 10 when they open. Long long line at 2:30 to enter. Worth the wait just to see how beautiful this is. You can see it in less than an hour.

Worth seeing if you are in Paris for a week; beautiful stain glass. My wife and I saw this in conjunction with La Conciergerie, which saved us some money but only worth it if you are interested in seeing La Conciergerie which I know m wife would say now she could have done without. But St. Chappelle is worth seeing, I just would not put it on my list if I were only in Paris for 2-4 days. Were spent 7 days, so it was worth seeing it, it was very pretty inside.
Don't miss this beautiful church!. Beautiful, more intimate space. The loving fine craftsmanship in every detail of the building and art is incredible.
Try for a suny day for the best experience.. The line moved fast and once you are inside your self tour is also fast. Go on a sunny day to enjoy the stained glass to it's fulest.

Pure Joy. Attended a wonderful performance of Vivaldi.The stained glass windows are a marvel to behold.While listening to the music and glancing up at the windows your breath will be taken away. A must see if ever there was one.

Upstairs/Downstairs in Church?. This amazing example of gothic architecture in Paris is so stunning you must include it on your itinerary! Enter on the lower level, where the lower class prayed back in the day, before ascending the circular stone stairway to the much more spacious upper level, where royalty prayed. Ir's amazing!

only visit if free entree. There are other places, more interesting to see. We didn't spend much time in it. The glaswork was of course great but in 5' you saw the whole thing in fact except if you wanted to read the whole bible in it.

A jewel in Paris. Not far from Notre Dame, this 13th century church is not as well known but well worth seeing. We were recommended to go by a friend who has a daughter living in Paris and we had to queue for almost an hour on a hot day to get in. If she hadn't been so adamant that we must see it, we might have given up - but we are glad we didn't! The bottom level is lovely and then you go upstairs to view more beautiful stained glass windows. We paid extra on the ticket to also visit the nearby Conciergerie (formerly a prison, now a museum) where Marie Antoinette's cell was, and this was interesting to see.Best to go on a clear day I would think, to enjoy the stained glass windows more.

Gothic gem. The line to this venue is extremely long and slow to move. You might try and purchase the combo ticket to the Sainte Chapelle and La Conciergerie at the latter location, which is next door. There are hardly any lines here as people go to Chapelle instead of La Conciergerie first. Chapelle is a Gothic marvel and used to house the venerated relic of the crown of the thorns, which St. Louis brought to France. While at Notre Dame we were lucky to see the crown of thorns brought out to a special mass for veneration.

Breathtaking experience!. After a very narrow and steep climb, you enter the chapel and are surrounded by absolutely beautiful stain glass windows depicted scenes from the Bible! The first moment you see them takes your breath away, I enjoyed this small chapel every bit as much as Notre Dame.
Amazing stained glass windows. The most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. This is not on the popular tour lists but is very worth the visit.

sainte - chapelle. Beautiful stained glass windows just amazing. Well worth a visit and the lines move very quickly. A lot of the building was closed for refurbishment when I went, so I feel I missed out :o(

Vivaldi's Four Seasons. Lovely setting and music made this a very special concert. We ordered the tickets on line before our departure for Paris. I wish I had taken the time to listen to the music before the concert, I would have enjoyed more. The stained glass and the beautiful chaple are unforgettable.
Breathtaking. The title says it all!! The beauty of the stained glass is unparalleled. However, the long line of people waiting to enter even first thing in the morning was annoying.

Beautiful beyond words. We queued for about 30 minutes but the line moved steadily forward. After our bags were x-rayed and we walked through the metal detector, we purchased our tickets (€8.50 ea) and entered. WOW! The sun illuminated the windows and the religious motifs were clearly visible. The public with us were quiet as they surveyed the beautiful pictures.Then we ascended the narrow circular stone staircase to the chapel proper.WOW WOW WOW!!! The vast expanse of stained glass windows was simply beautiful beyond words. The carved figures were incredibly detailed and we felt our spirits touched in this sacred place.
Visiting churches,cathedrals. This is the most magnificent stained glass work. It is breathtaking. Do not miss this. You cannot book for this, but it is well worth waiting in line.

A truely beautiful experience. An incredible place, however if you don't like queuing purchase your tickets in advance, this goes for everything in Paris. You can wait for hours to view any landmark , I've never seen stained glass as good as this place.

Buy tickets for Conciergerie + Saint Chappelle and skip the line. There was a long line when we approached Saint-Chapelle so we decided to go to see Conciergerie first. There we bought a ticket for both: it was cheaper and we got to skip the really long line for buying tickets inside.The place is nice and the view was great. Had a great time.
Beautiful but small church. Its a small and a very old church with glass walls that are painted in various colors. Each wall has a different story to tell and its a beautiful church with two storeys.

amazing stained glass!!. the queue wasn't so long, so we decided to enter this chapel. we are under 26's EU citizens so we went in for free. church is amazing, I was so impressed with the stained glass, they were so detailed, down to the eyes, nose and mouth! amazing! one of my favourite attractions in Paris!

Beautiful Interior. This is a beautiful cathedral, the colour of the stained glass windows are outstanding.When you first enter the cathedral, you might think that it is quite a quaint building, well decorated, with a very low ceiling, which it is, but go up the small staircase near the entrance and you will be amazed at the fantastic chapel above, every wall is made of exquisite stained glass with a lot of blue used.This Chapel used to have religious relics, part of the cross and part of the crown of thorns, but they were moved to Notre Dame Church.

Beautiful chapel!. This is situated pretty close to the Notre Dame cathedral. So you can visit both of them on the same day. If you have the Paris museum pass, you can use the same to enter the chapel. It is a rather small chapel but beautifully done. I would definitely recommend a visit here.

Amazing Stain Glass. You have to go here and see this, the windows are so amazing. You go up some stairs and you will see. The ticket guy was funny too. First thing in the morning is best. Noon is the busiest.

Visit for the stained glass. I was surprised at the disrepair to this church when it has some of the most magnificent stained glass windows in it. Sainte-chapelle is undergoing renovation and probably will be for awhile, but it is still worth the trip to see the incredible paintings, carvings and, of course, the glass. The gift shop is good, too.
Look down and not just up. Long wait to get in but the stained glass, floors and gargoyles were worth it. Once inside, you can also cross into the Palais de Justice and walk the halls a bit.

Magnificent Stain Glass Windows. This chapel has some of the most magnificent stain glass windows that date back to the 15th century. We waited about 20 minutes to buy tickets which were about 8 euro. The stain glass color is very vibrant and so beautiful. Don't miss this site when in Paris.

My Favourite Attraction in Paris. I went into Sainte Chapelle with no idea what to expect. I was completely blown away by the magnificent stained glass. The sunlight was hitting the glass just right and it was simply spectacular. It was one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen.
The windows are just awesome. Tinted windows just bring the vow. A must do place in Paris. Plan to do it with concierge and not re dame

Beautiful tourist trap. We enjoyed very much this concert at the Sainte Chapelle. The place is very impressive, specially when the light is still coming through the windows.However the concert itself was a bit too much oriented to tourists - I'm OK with the easy selection of of music, but the performance was a bit cheesy for my liking, with the violist even performing a walk though the corridor... Dumb people not stopping recording and taking photos with their iPads and phones made things a bit worse, but we overall enjoyed the evening and don't regret having gone.
Absolutely stunning. One of the not-so-famous Paris masterpieces. My advice is to visit the Chapelle in a sunny day, to fully enjoy the wonderful and gigantic windows.A must see.
Valentines in Paris . Art at its finest, history, and beauty.Visit with time to sit and truly let your mind experience the splendor
Worth Queuing. This is worth queuing for, one of the best things to see in Paris, without a doubt. Try and pick a good day as the sun makes the light inside incredible.
Hidden away but delightful. Small but worth a visit if in area. Second floor not to be missed. Good takeaway sandwiches etc across the road.

Amazing.. U been there to see 4 season of vivaldi my love and it was amazing for me ( my girl sleep good)
Really clasic and amazing place!!!

BREATHTAKING LARGE ROOM FILLED WITH MANY TALL STAINED-GLASS WINDOWS. A MUST SEE.. Don't hesitate to climb up the winding stairs. At the top you will be breathless and the beauty you see. Probably the most beautiful and spectacular stained-glass windows. High windows, done in royal blues and reds. Amazing. Unlike anything else we have seen. A true Gothic chapel downstairs and brilliant light upstairs.
First stop in Paris!. Amazing Stained glass windows in this wonderful historic church. No lines and a must see during a tour of paris.
Awe inspiring!. This place gave me goose bumps. It is absolutely magnificent. More beautiful, though less imposing, than Notre Dame.

Go to the concerts!. We visited Sainte-Chapelle for one of the recent Vivaldi concerts. Beautiful! I went to the 7pm concert and arrived at about 6:15, which was a good idea because it was a full house. Awe inspiring beauty with beautiful music. Highly recommend.

Concert at Sainte-Chapelle. The experience for us was unbelievable! We searched on line before traveling and found the evening a string chamber was doing a concert with a soloist. The cost was very reasonable and we went early so we could enjoy the interior. We were in awe as we viewed the chapel and listened to the performance. We will never forget the experience.

An Amazing surprise!. We had been told that this chapel was a must-do.... At first we found it ho-hum and were about to leave when we noticed a flight of stairs. At the top we stood in absolute awe of the beauty of the stained glass windows. It is an absolute must!

Concert in Sainte Chapelle. We went to a recital concert last night, you need to allow time for security checks to get in. The chapel is a wonderful example of stain glass windows. Go to the early session, still daylight, to appreciate the glass.The concert was good, the acoustics were good. Only problem is people continually holding up their phone cameras in front of seating. Get the A seating, the plus champagne is questionable as the Restraunt across the road is a tourist one which wants you in and out as fast as possible.

Beautiful stained glass. Sainte-Chapelle is a lovely church. The stained glass is truly worth seeing. If you can do it on a sunny day, that's even better.
Note that the Paris Museum Pass includes the entrance to this church, and the long line is probably people waiting to purchase tickets (you can bypass this).

Kind of bland on the outside but amazingly beautiful inside. Truly an extraordinary building. Though nice but not exceptional outside, inside, it is extraordinarily beautiful. The stained glass is magnificent and the proportions almost perfect. It is quite near the Cathederal Notre-Dame but is often overlooked as it is in a section of government buildings and not standing alone where it is easily seen. Highly recommended, especially on a sunny day when the stained glass windows fill the already colorful interior with even more beautiful color.

My Favorite Chapel in Europe. This is a stunning chapel, located in the Palais de Justice in Paris. I am fortunate to say that this is my fourth visit in my life, and its' beauty continues to take my breath away just as much as the first time! It was a real pleasure to share it with my teenage son for his first time. It appears that there are hardly any walls, it seems as though it's all stained glass. The people who built it are geniuses, and the stained glass artists are as well!
Most impressive basilica I have seen in Europe!. Don't leave Paris without going to the Sainte Chapelle. The stained glass windows are enormous and absolutely perfect. It's a short but worthy visit!

Hidden treasure! . The church is located near the Notre Dame cathedral, but it is often overlooked! The church is only minutes away and eell worth the wait. The stain glassed windows are the best in sll of Paris. They are almost finished reconstruction of the windows. Looks great!

Amazing Grace.....Amazing Glass. Smaller church than its neighbour, Notre Dame, but so much more history.You enter in a back yard of the Palace of Justice and wonder what all the fuss is about, you line up for tickets...yes you pay to enter a church? Still wonder what the fuss is about as you enter the church and then realize you need to go up one level. Then the church's glory hits you....look up and all around...the stained glass is amazing.

The stained glass walls on the second floor make this worth visiting. I got there at 2:10pm on a Monday and had to queue for 50 minutes to get in. I had a museum pass which did not allow you to skip the queue but meant I did not have to line up in a second queue to pay to get in to Sainte - Chapelle. The church was quite small. There is a climb up a spiral staircase to the second floor (not wheelchair accessible) that is eay to do. The stained glass windows are beautiful and definately worth the wait to see them.
Nice place. amazing place that everybody has to c since he/she visits Paris. In the city center u dont need any transfer.
Nice History. Our local tour did not give us enough time to go inside, but outside is a lovely bit of old architecture.

Stained glass on steroids - beautiful.. Seeing this place is definitely worthwhile. Built as the finest royal chapel in France, it was done so to house the Passion of Christ. It's definitely beautiful inside and no pictures can truly depict how it looks in person. A definite must see. No need to get a guided tour on this one - seeing it is more than enough.
The most beautiful chapel in Paris. Notre Dame is interesting, but the inside of Sainte-Chapelle is truly awe-inspiring. It's like a jewel box inside. Don't miss it!
Don't miss it.. Prepare to be blown away with this venue. Use the audio guide. The queue moved quickly. Easy to get to.

Sainte-Chapelle. Don't miss it!. Sainte-Chapelle is just a block away from Notre Dame and an easy walk. Inside it is far superior to the more popular Notre Dame. I would not miss it. Best stained glass in the world.

Nice stain-glass windows. The Holy Chapel is nice but won't keep you around for long - unless you know French and are interested in the restoration of the chapel as there's an extensive video on this topic. Stain-glass windows are the main attraction.

Soaring stained glass windows. Incredible stain glass windows surround you in this church built to house the "crown of thorns." Easiest to go on the weekend as security is high, because the entrance is for the court. This entrance is covered by the Paris Museum Pass which help bypass the ticket line.
Take the time to visit. Stunning stained glass, view it from the doors at the far end, to take in all the light and colour at the same time...very special.

A MUST, do not miss it. Thanks again to Tripadvisor for educating me. I always google 'top 10 things to see' in any city before I visit and that is how I found out about Sainte-Chapelle. Its true most people flock to Notre Dame and totally by-pass Sainte-Chapelle. Its completely stunning, its almost entirely stained-glass windows and quite astounding to think it was built for the king and his family's exclusive use. Very decadent. A beautiful photo opportunity but be sure to also put the camera down and just sit for a while and take it in. Its really quite remarkable.

Don't miss this and get there EARLY. ooh la la. Almost didn't go to Sainte-Chapelle because I wasn't thrilled about the long line. Totally worth it though. Get there FIRST THING IN THE MORNING! We were there in May and waited about 40 minutes to get it. Thought it would be longer but the line moved quickly. Breathtaking and one of the top sights in Paris.

Beautiful & Amazing stained glass windows. Although It's a small church, it out shines the big churches with the amazing stained glass windows. Be sure to go on a sunny day to get the most out of the windows.
Stunning. We had to wait in line about an hour to get in, but it was worth it! The stained glass is like nothing I've ever seen before. This is definitely a must see.

Sainte-Chapelle Two Ways. We went to Sainte-Chapelle both during the day and at night. The daytime visit was awe-inspiring with the amazing stained glass windows in their full glory. Sainte-Chapelle is really just a stained glass display space and was designed to be that. Floor to ceiling glass with astounding beauty. Don't go on a rainy day. Our night visit was to hear a string concert. The acoustics of the cathedral put Notre Dame to shame. The high arched roof provides the perfect location for any concert -- you can hear the really quiet sections like the musicians are right next to you. This is a must see and hear activity.
wonderful glass, steep stairs. Incredible stained glass, but expect long line ups. 34 very steep stairs on circular staircase would make it hard for anyone with mobility problems.

photographs do not do it justice. I have long wanted to see Ste-Chappelle - but was worried by the stairs and wanted merely to sit and look. going to one of the frequent chamber music concerts was the answer. I was not disappointed by the building - it was everything i had dreamed it would be. It is the conception that is breathtaking - it is the medieval version of the modern architect's trick of reducing the scale of the walls of a building and maximising the acreage of glass - in this case filling the available space with stained glass. that so much of the glass has survived given where it is and what has happened around it is testimony to the efforts of many generations in protecting it. in itself, that is impressive. This was on my bucket list - it was a good choice.the chamber music was well performed - but was unchallenging.There is a lift.
A beautiful setting for wonderful music. it is not difficult to imagine yourself a century ago sitting I this beautiful chapel listening to beautiful music
Must see!!. Amazing old little church that was private chapel of King Philippe of France and was built in about 1259 and is still in amazing condition today. The lead light windows are spectacular!!!
Stained Glass!. Beautiful stained glass. The line looked long, but moved fast. You need an hour or so for this, easy to fit in to a day. Near Notre Dame so easy to do them same day.

Stains in glass. There is usually a long queue to enter this place. We waited for about an hour. Paris Pass does not give you a "go ahead" card. But it was worth the wait. Really loved the glass stained windows. Once you are inside it wont take much time. You can be done in about an hour.

Beautiful church. This church was stunning. It's much smaller than Notre Dame and tucked away in a central area between buildings. The walls and stained glass were stunning. Have the PARIS MUSEUM PASS made it easier to get in!

Well worth queing for. I was blown away by the immense beauty of this church. Photographs to not do justice to the splendor that is hidden within. Be warned unless you have a museum pass the queue is very slow (although please don't let it deter you). I would recommend going to the conciergerie which is just next door and purchasing a joint ticket from there, not only does it mean you save money but it also allows you to skip the queue!!!
Religious Experience. Very cool stained glass windows. Each window illustrates different bible scenes. Folks who have studied the bible can spend an entire day looking through the images.

Wow!. This is one of the few places where a Museum Pass doesn't whisk you to the front of the line, so count on a half hour wait for each line length from the door to the metal barrier.But it's worth the wait. The entrance is into the lower level, from which you go up into the chapel proper, and the stained glass is mind blowing (so go on a sunny day).

wow!. There have been only 3 other occasions where i became tearful in response to art - one being the medici chapel in florence - another san chapelle. walking in on a sunny day, i was totally stunned by the beauty of the church and it's amazing stained glass windows.

Beautiful stained windows when sun shines! Book ticket online.. One of the oldest Chapels in Paris - from XIII century. Beautiful stained windows - look especially wonderful when the sun is shining outside. Worth to read paper guide because then you know what to pay attention to. Or to wait for guided tour. The line outside(to security check-in) goes pretty quickly but be prepared for waiting inside even 1 hour to buy a ticket (worth checking if you can buy ticket online and skip this line). Visit inside 30 minutes is enough.
closer to God. Breathtakingly beautiful and serene - Louis XV certainly brought himself closer to God when he made commission

Beautiful stained glass windows. Wow. That's the only way to describe it. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but when you walk upstairs into the giant room with huge stained glass windows it takes your breath away. Definitely a must see in Paris.
Don't miss this one. stunning and worth the wait. Very memorable. Once you get in, they don't rush you through. It is a must see.

A beautiful concert in a spectacular location. We listened to a small group of musicians playing Vivaldi, Mozart and Bach in the beautiful Sainte Chapelle. On a tour we had taken this morning, we were advised that going to one of these concerts was highly recommended. We were advised that tickets could be purchased from the cafe across the street from the chapel and this was an easy process. This was an excellent way to spend an hour in beautiful Paris. I can highly recommend!

A very unique music experience. The sound whilst listening to a music event is tremendous. There are perhaps 30 attendees in this small chapel. Very UNIQUE experience. The stained glass windows are some of the oldest in the world.

Magnificent Stained Glass. Magnificent stained glass. This can be visited fairly quickly once you get inside. We were lucky enough to visit on a sunny day which really showed off the stained glass. Pick-up the guide board so you can follow along
A lovely visit. This is a gorgeous chapel and we were lucky enough to be in town whislt a Vivaldi concert was being perform ed in the chapel. What a perfect evening.

Amazing place. Stained-glass windows have just been removed and when the sun is shining, it 's just wonderful.
They tell the Bible and date back to the tenth century
Beautiful Jewel. The Sainte-Chapelle is one of the most beautiful medieval churches I've seen. The stain glass is so visually beautiful .

It will move you! DO NOT MISS IT!. Truly one of the most spectacular, breathtaking sites in Paris. Go on a sunny day and basque in the splendor of the gemstone colored lights that dance on the floor from the amazing stained glass.

Most beautiful place I have ever been. So unbelievably incredible. As soon as we entered the chapel part my jaw dropped, annoyingly photographs don't do it justice. A must see in Paris, and if you are and EU citizen under 25 its free!

WOW - Amazing on a Sunny Day.. A MUST see if in Paris. Not an overly large church but the windows are impressive. You can sit there for hours just staring upwards. Go early in the morning on a "sunny day" to avoid the crowds. The admission ticket can be combined with a ticket to the "Conciergerie" and is worth the price.

More impressive that I thought it would be.. While we have been to Notre Dame several times, we had not made it to Sante-Chapelle. I loved this church. Windows are gorgeous. We did have to wait in line a bit to get in but I am so glad we did.

Beautiful stained glass, short visit. The Sainte-Chapelle is absolutely beautiful. The stained glass is definitely worth seeing, but after the tour of this church won't take longer than 20 minutes. It costs about 8.50 euros to get in, probably because of all the upkeep they have to do.

Awe inspiring!. So glad we visited this amazingly beautiful church. Yes, there was a wait to get through security as the church is near the Paris court house. We did wait half an hour for security, but so worth the wait. We were able to jump the second line for tickets because we had a Paris Museum pass and this was covered. We did not get an audio guide, but had a Rick Steeves guide book that gave a lot of history to us. Originally built by the French King to house Christ's Crown of Thorns, this church is stunning with the best stained glass we have ever seen. A must do even with the wait!
Sainte-Chapelle. What a beautiful church! Since we arrived during a church service my friend was able to take communion. She felt very blessed to take part in that experience.
Be sure to visit both floors. A magnificent chapel and a must-see stop in Paris. It has two floors, so be sure to go upstairs to see all the amazing stained glass. Breathtaking.
breathtaking if there before the crownds. Get in line 30 minutes before it opens and once in, go immediately up the spiral staircase to the chapel. It is breathtaking to say the least.
Sightseeing in Paris. Maybe we got lucky with our wonderful tour guide but this was an exceptional experience. Beautiful, I would recommend a visit if you are in Paris.

This is a must see. This is a must see ..we were there today, a sunny Sunday morning with the stained glass windows at there very best. The church was built in the thirteenth century and is a superior historical building
One of the best attraction. Difficult to find the favourite attraction in this city but this is definetely one of the best! Definetely not to be missed! To be seen in the sun.
Incredible windows. I was expecting a larger church, but this really is all about the windows. Definitely worth a visit if you are interested in "reading" the windows.
Jewel of Paris. The jewel of Paris! A must see. Even with construction, still worthwhile. History is fascinating! Just do it.

Entering a jewel. I will never forget visiting the Sainte Chapelle forty years ago, as a young woman. Somehow, I arrived at the end of visiting hours when the sun was low, and I was the only one there! Still, the windows were gently aglow. It was astonishingly beautiful, like being in the center of a perfect jewel, and even though I knew I only had short time-- the guard needed to go home-- I was allowed a few moments to sit and contemplate its exquisite beauty and history and even find some peace for my own soul. I watched the light die down, and left in complete serenity. Its aura remains, I'm sure..

Well Worth Visiting. Beautiful chapel with wonderful stained glass windows. We loved it.Almost missed the best part, the upstairs chapel which is up a spiral staircase. What a surprise to find an ever better array of windows than downstairs.
Brilliant jewel in the shadow of Notre Dame. The most amazing stained glass in Paris. This is not as highly publicized as other places, but this was my top spot in the entire city.
Must see. Beautiful Church that counts on french history, an absolute must ni a visit of paris... Don't miss it!
Fabulous. Such a beautiful little chapel. Stained glass is absolutely amazing. Don't miss - likely to be your favorite stop in Paris.

Breathtaking!. This is definitely a must-see place, even if you are a non-religious person. I was in awe the moment I walked in. The stained glass work is simply amazing, and sheer magnitude of work that was put into this chapel will astound you.

Yes, yes, yes!. Of all sights in Paris this is probably the one I enjoy the most. It's free but son't let this deceive you - it is truly worth it. When you see the chapel you can't stop wondering how this fabulous piece of architecture is still standing. This is, by far, the most extraordinary thing to see in Paris.

Wonderful. Worth the wait. Don't miss it.. Walls of stained glass breathtaking even when you are on cathedral overload!! Be sure to look for plastic cards that describe all the glass. Available in many languagees.
Queue too long.. This place, like the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral. Musee D'Orsay are all ticket entry and all have queues. A most important Tip - buy tickets on line before you start out.

Stunning chapel!. This is an outstanding experience not to be missed. Worth the summer queues. Nothing can prepare you for the magnificence of these windows and the visual impact when you first enter the main hall.so glad we went.

A Beautiful Church with Wonderful History!. First thing to say is try to go early in the morning. This church features the oldest stained glass in all of Europe. During the morning is when the glass really illuminates. Wonderful history of French legend St. Louis. Also neighboring sights to this visit make this trip that much more essential. This is history!
Stunning. This is a must see. It is so worth it. I did not expect to see the beautiful stain glass. Every panel tells a different storey.

Stunning stained glass. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. It was almost overwhelming. Spend some time looking closely to see the stories in the stained glass. Imagine what it took to build it at the time and how the peasants must have felt when they entered. As a historian I know this was used to keep everyone in line, but it is still magnificent to behold.
Well worth a trip!. Use your Musee pass to skip the lines! The most breath taking views of stain glass "walls" that I have ever seen. The gates upon exiting...so grand and ornate.

Amazing stained glass. This chapel was not on my preferred list of things to do while in Paris, however, I was with a group and they were going there so I went also. Wow is this place magnificent. I liked it better than Notre Dame. And, if was built in only 6 years, not 200.
See to Believe. Unbelievable that this structure is over 800 years. The painted glass gives a great feel. The upper level ceiling height is unbelievable.

Gorgeous stained glass windows. Gorgeous. It's a small church with basically two rooms you get to see, and one of the two has spectacular - really spectacular - stained glass windows all around. It doesn't take long to see, and it's definitely worth it.

Stunning stained glass windows. The stained glass windows in this building are remarkable. The size of them are incredible and they are so beautiful. Saint Chapelle is only 5 mins from Notre Dame so don't miss it.

One of the world's most beautiful churches. This must be one of the most beautiful churches in the world. The walls are practically all stained glass. The only downside to a visit here is the long line to enter. However, they have wonderful classical music concerts here in the evening, and those give an enjoyable experience as well as enter to the church within waiting.

Should not be missed in a Paris visit. In a city where history and character abound, the stained glass exhibited by this chapel is unbeatable. We sat in quiet contemplation taking in the amazing detail and considering the skill to produce such a wonder.

Need to see Sainte-Chapelle. The stained glass is very impressive and any visit to Paris should include Sainte-Chapelle. Many people visit and the line forms early before the 9:30am opening and continues through the day. Visitors with the Paris Museum Pass still need to be in the line.
JEWELRY BOX. The room at the top of the stairs is like a jewelry box. It's simply breathing taking and a must see. You really don't need to spend a long time here...

No long lines. Beautiful stained glass. As an alternative to the lines at Notre Dame visit here then stop in to the Pali as of justice. Only will take you 45 minutes so while you are on the Isle don't skip it. Look upstairs at the picture stories engraved on the wall like Noah's arch and Adam and eve. Covered by the Paris Pass.
Unassuming,y holy!. It really is THE Parisian church. A must to visit. Light a candle and offer a prayer! You'll love the stained glass. It's history is awe inspiring and quintessentially Parisian.

Huge stained-glass windows. There is a long line for the security-check, because this chapel is inside the courthouse.
But once inside, the lines at the ticket-office usually aren't that long.
Make sure to go to the 2nd floor = because ONLY THERE you are able to see the really giant stained-glass windows!
I was told that they are to 'bout 90% original!!
Amazing!!!

Visually stunning. I've visited Paris afew times, but often skip Sainte Chapelle due to the long queues. This year, I went early to avoid the crowds.The beauty of the chapel is breathtaking! Definitely worth the wait. To get there, take the metro and alight at Cité. There is a security scan before visitors are allowed into the site. Avoid bringing sharps as they will be confiscated at the security check-point. Get the audioguide or read more about the chapel before visiting. You'll appreciate the visit even more.

Remarkable Vivaldi Concert. We had a chance to visit Sainte-Chapelle during the day. The light from the sun passing through the stunning display of stained glass makes this chapel very unique. During our visit we purchased tickets to an evening Vivaldi Concert inside the chapel. As the sun sets the strings of the quartet come to life. Playing classical masterpiece tunes of Vivaldi in the dim-lit 13th century private chapel of Louis IX; a very memorable experience to say the least. An absolute must!Note: There is usually about 1 hour wait to get in and through security. Unlike other site I would say the line move relatively slow here.Paris pass does not give you front of the line access.

A stunning curtain of stained glass. The walls are soaring curtains of beautiful, intricate stained glass that leave you wondering how the ceiling can still be standing on top of walls that seem to be made entirely of glass. It is an architectural masterpiece. So very much worth the trip. The Paris Museum Pass gives you express entry in addition to saving you money.
Stained glass beauty. Stained glass was beautiful, lines to get in...not so beautiful. Soaring interior and stunning on a sunny day.

Give yourself a lot of time. This was one of the most beautiful churches I saw in Paris, a city which is all about beautiful churches!!! The stain glass windows each depict a biblical story, and you could spend years there, and probably not see all the detail in this little piece of heaven!!!
So, this is the Medieval period?!. Absolutely amazing! They did all this so many centuries ago. It will make you re-think what you think of when you think "Middle Ages". Wow!

Amazing, stunning, inspiring!!. I have lived in Paris and visited many times.. but it took me a few years to visit the Sainte Chapelle. It is stunning. Read the history prior to your visit- the stained glass renovation has recently been finished, and since more than 70% is still original- it is a real masterpiece. The queues can get long, so go early. Pay attention that the queues are for security only: so if people 'with tickets' try to cut the queue, send them to the back of the line! This has happened to me on several occasions.. Sometimes guided tours push their way ahead, which is very annoying. But despite the entrance sagas, I think the Sainte Chapelle is one of the top 5 most important and impressive sights in Paris.

Concert at Saint Chapelle. We went to this marvellous church in the early evening for a Handel-Albinoni and Vivaldi' FOUR SEASONS concert. No need to be religious, but a something to be experienced!!!

Incredible stained glass!. Incredible display of stained glass windows. Floor to ceiling in this small chapel. Line to get in was a bummer. Museum pass allows free admission, but still have to wait in the general ticket line. Be prepared to climb up an enclosed spiral staircase - not for the claustrophobic or physically challenged.

breathtaking stained glass. This chapel was built by, Saint Louis (Louis IX) in just 4 years in order to host his recently purchased passion relics. The higher level, the high chapel, is a breathtaking example of rayonant gothic architecture. After many years the renovations have finally been completed and I can only recommend the visit while you are on Ile de la Cite.The line can be lengthy, but there is a combined ticket that you can buy at the Conciergerie that enables you to skip the line.
Must see.. On a sunny day only! You'll imagine yourself back in time. The concerts in the evenings are worth the effort, too. The music is decent and it sets a stage.

Sight and sound in Ste.Chapelle. Sainte Chapelle is a jewel box. If you can combine that with one of the frequent concerts offered there, I know anyone with eyes and ears would enjoy such an experience immensely.

A must as part of a Paris trip. Have visited several times and am always delighted by the chapel and especially the windows. This time I also attended a concert, booked online in advance, so could appreciate the acoustics as well. An excellent experience.
Beautiful!!!. The most beautiful stained glass. Wonderful little church. Go on a bright sunny day to really see it lit up.

A hidden gem close to the Notre Dame.. Very cozy and beautiful small place.The Stained glass is so impressive there! If you are under 26 and from EU you must visit this place because for you it's for free. We had to wait in a queue but it was not too long so this place is definitely worth it.
Beautiful, but a tiny place. I spent more time waiting on line for this attraction than I spent inside it. It has beautiful stained glass, but I expected much more based on the reviews I read.

Breathtaking stained glass room. Stained glass room after you climb up a few stairs is overwhelmingly beautiful, especially that first look. There are a few places to sit inside too if you need a break or just want to take it in. We went on a Saturday around 11:30 am. There was a small Line in front of the building to get in. If you have the museum pass you can bypass this line, but we only stood in it for 10 mins. Then after you get inside you'll have to stand in another line to get it. That one took about 30 mins. Once in you can stay as long as you like.

Stunning. Whatever you do in Paris, don't miss visiting Sainte Chapelle. It is absolutely stunning. I couldn't believe such beauty could have survived the two world wars but this did. Don't miss it, it is beyond beautiful and well worth visiting

Memorable evening of string quartet concert!. Keep an eye out for concert posters as you walk through Paris. Saw one for this concert in midafternoon of same day we went. Wonderful acoustics for a beautiful concert of Mozart, Albinoni, etc. A soprano also provided some vocal pieces. Tickets 30€.

Can't see the forest for the trees. St. Louis' private chapel, built to house his personal collection of relics, is a beautiful structure with fascinating narratives in glass built in the Gothic Rayonnant style at the height of its popularity. The bas église was extremely interesting and the only place I've seen a "dry sink" (where unused consecrated wine from the sacrament of Eucharist was disposed of) still in situ. The problem, predictably, with such a magnificent monument, is the number of people crammed into the structure. It was nearly impossible to take good pictures (I had specific windows I wanted to photograph) or just to stand quietly and take in the majesty of the space. My advice to anyone would be to ask around and find out the least popular times for tourists and go then. We waited in the pouring rain for twenty five minutes to get inside, and I would trade seeing the inside of St. Louis reliquary structure for anything, but I do wish I could have experienced the space without the carnivalesque atmosphere. On a completely touristy note, the gift shop (in the bas église) is fantastic.

Stained Glass Galore. This is a completely different experience than Notre Dame. This church is far smaller, and it's all about the stained glass, which is exceptional, I have never seen anything come close. There is an English handout explaining the Biblical significance of each panel of glass, honestly I have a fair amount of knowledge of the biblical stories, and they were hard to makes out due to the detail and magnitude of each panel. Thus, you may find it best to just enjoy the beauty, rather than straining to find a specific biblical depiction. There are also great statues of the apostles ringing the chapel. The fact that this church was built so quickly and in the 11 th century is in stark contrast to its neighbor, Notre Dame. The area in which this church is located is interesting because it is on the island in the middle of the Seine which is an interesting vibrant neighborhood with restaurants, people watching, and nice views of the Seine.
Don't miss this gem just a block away from Notre Dame.. Stunning stained glass windows. An amazing display of medieval art and architecture in central Paris.

Just Breathtaking. This was the most amazing place I visited in Paris! I loved the rich stained-glass widows and the stories they represent. I would definitely return (hopefully at a time when there were fewer people) and view the panels in more detail. Binoculars would help since the windows reach the ceiling!
Concert in Sainte Chappelle. Went here for Bach opera concert. Beautiful stain glassed windows; good acoustics, a bit trifling in the heat.
You can't imagine what it is inside. Incredible the inside of this building. Simply amazing. The windows, the colors, everything. It deserves a visit in Paris.

Astonishing. One place you MUST go in Paris. I've seen many churches and chapels across Europe, but this was the most beautiful I have ever seen. It's small, but really worth visiting. The ceiling is amazing.
Great. Beutiful stained glass. Definititely worth the visit. Very close to NotreDamn cathedral. I hightly recommend.

Magnificent. A beautiful cathedral with breathtaking artistry. The sheer volume of the floor to ceiling stained glass windows are incredible. This is worth the visit if you have an hour to view this gorgeous structure.

Ste-Chapelle is not to be missed. The fully cleaned and restored windows are one of the treasures of Paris. Take binoculars or a telephoto lens to appreciate all the detail (and angel providing clothes for the expelled Adam and Eve, as one small example). The stone carvings on the balcony are also worth your time.

Amazing Stained Glass, Worth Your Time with Paris Museum Pass. Admittedly, I didn't know much about this church before visiting. If you have the Paris Museum Pass and can skip the line it's absolutely worth it. The stain glass is stunning. I recommend downloading the Rick Steve's Historic Paris City Walk audio tour for background as you view the church.

Beautiful but Skip the Concert at Night. Love this church of stain glass so abundant that I wonder how the roof is supported. Thought it would be a lovely setting for a concert. Unfortunately on a hot humid night there wasn't even a hint of a fan or movement of air. Instead of a sextet of musicians, there was an alpha male whose behavior was manicky and five supporting musicians. They raced through the concert. The leader turned pages for other musicians, engaged with other musicians as I've seen rock stars do and at one point almost lost his violin due to robust bowing. After the applause, we were ushered out to see the next suckers lined up for a concert. I really felt ripped off.
Stunningly Beautiful!. Beautiful but skip the audio tour and just read about the history and the windows first. Been there many times and still love it.

Dynamic Contrast Between Light & Dark. “Absolutely stunning” seems like such an over-used phrase. However, it really is the best way to describe this attraction. We arrived for our visit to find a somewhat-daunting line of people waiting to get in. As noted by other reviewers, the line moved fairly quickly. It seemed like they allowed around 20 people to enter every 5 minutes. It took us 35 minutes to get in, which was not so bad, given that the area where the line forms was shaded by tall trees and it was nice, sunny morning. Also, there was plenty of activity on the street that afforded some enjoyable people-watching. This served distraction enough to make the wait seem shorter than it actually was. Once through the main gate there is another, shorter line that we waited in to get into the actual chapel. One enters the church on the first floor into a fairly dark room with a low ceiling. It almost feels claustrophobic at first. It’s as though this part of the experience serves as a contrast to what is experienced when one climbs the dark staircase to the second floor. That’s where the light comes in. There is a sense of heaviness being lifted away as one enters this floor. Yes, it does seem like the walls are entirely made of glass, and yes, it is phenomenal. Photos I have seen do not allow one to experience the sensation of being in the actual space. There is a certain patina to the entire interior. This is especially true on the first floor, where the color of the wall decorations seems muted and rather dark in tone. It has the distinct feeling of gilded, medieval ornamentation, which I enjoy. It was worthwhile to browse around for a second time this aspect of the atmosphere when returning to the ground floor. The entire experience was “absolutely stunning.” An interesting contrast between light and dark…
Nice concerts. I had the chance of attend a really nice concert in this wonderfull church!! Dont miss it!! There are always concerts

The most beautiful stained glass. There has been always a long queue to Sainte-Chapelle, but this time we happened to be there on wednesday evening. We got in with out any queueing. The guided tour was excellent and was included to the ticket.
Breathtaking . Absolutely beautiful - make sure to go on a bright day otherwise the colours will not be as vivid. About 30 seconds from the Notre Dame so well worth a visit up to the Latin Quarter

Quick visit to St Chappelle. Very close to Notre Dame , walking distance and on the way to Louvre. The chapel is gothic style and spent some quick time around this place. The stained glass makes the whole atmosphere very special.

The Rose of Sainte Chapelle. during our trip to Paris we went back to Sainte Chaoelle several times to take in all of the beauty. The story in the stained glass drew you in and the beauty took your breath away.
Breathtaking . I only discovered this magical place on my second visit to Paris. It really is beautifully breathtaking the stained glass windows will not be a letdown. An absolute must see.

Awestruck. We arrived fairly early to avoid the lines, but still encountered about a 30 minute wait in the security line. When entering the chapel, I wondered what the big deal was. When entering, you see an area with some pretty stain glass windows and some booths to purchase books and souvenirs. It was pretty, but I didn't think that was worth the wait. Then, we saw the sign for the steps upstairs. We walked up those stairs and when I saw the sight of the "real" attraction, it nearly took my breath away. The windows are so beautiful that it is hard to take it all in.Worth the wait to see it. If you only have time for 2 or 3 things while in Paris, I would say that Sainte Chapelle should be one of them.
color windows!. must-see church in paris with splendid color windows. it's not very huge but definitely worth a visit

My favorite monument in Paris. I consider Sainte-Chapelle the most beautiful monument in Paris even if it is well hidden and most tourists skip it in their rush to see Notre Dame Cathedral. The stained glasses in all the windows (dozens of them - no other cathedral or church has that many!) have just been renovated.It is awsome, do not miss it!

Unlike any other church ever seen. Magical. Go when it is sunny outside to benefit from the stained glass, which is really what amkes this place special. There are.classical music concerts in teh evening too, at decent value, that i would like to try next time.
Not to Be Missed.. Where to go if you have only one thing to see in Paris, and the sun is shining. The stained glass windows in a small space are beyond beautiful.

Over rated. The stained glass is unique, but the figures are so small that it's pretty hard to study any but the lower-level panes. Lots of history, but you will wait in line longer than seeing this site.

Absolutely AMAZING. As i was researching Paris, I came across the chance to attend a string quartet concert in this beautiful chapel, after hours.It was totally WORTH IT. When you arrive, it almost looks like you aren't looking at anything that great.
