The outside had a queue for people to stand in and some signs and when you went into the courtyard, the building was really cool to look at but it left you wondering what you were getting yourself into. However, once they guided you into the chapel, it was immediately obvious what you were missing. The stained glass was absolutely breathtaking. For the concert, they had setup rows of seating and we opted for the VIP tickets so we had the option of the first few rows. While it is not the proper thing to do, we got the option to sit in the front row and did so. The people behind us moved (I'm tall and a big girl, so sue me) but if you tell an American they can sit up front, they're taking it. It was breathtaking being inside of the chapel but when the musicians started to play, it was my favorite thing to do in Paris, hands down.They played for almost a whole hour and you could tell they had great chemistry. On the backdrop of this stunning chapel, it was a great experience. Go, enjoy the music, take in the history and be as in awe as I was. It is still my favorite experience and I look forward to going again one day.

The stained glass windows are spectacular!. The museum pass saved us standing in a ticket line but the security lines were long and slow. The wait was worth it! Note- there is a very steep spiral staircase leading up to the chapel- once there you won't be disappointed. Try to schedule your time early in the morning or closer to sundown for the most dramatic effects coming from the windows. Pay close attention to the detail on the walls and pillars- quite beautiful and don't forget to step outside on the balcony to view the details around the entrance.

One of the most awesome Chapelle.. I missed this in my first Paris visit in 2013, so this time i gave the first priority to visit and see this most most awesome architecture. There was a queue, not long but 15 mins or so. we were there in the morning. beautiful stained glass interior and you will go WOW once u entered.

must do for paris visit!. an absolutely must do while in paris, so worth the que!!! (30 minutes for us.) what a spectacular renovation, breathtakingly beautiful. loved every moment in this beautiful chapel.

Slightly Disappointed. It's a really beautiful Gothic church and the stained glass in the upstairs room is exquisite.Much shorter queues than Notre Dame however as with other attractions in Paris (and also being on the same site as the palais de justice) visitors have to go through a security checkpoint which slows the queue down.The only downside is the price of admission which is currently 8.50 Euros.
wow. beautiful stained glass...long queue but well worth the wait. You walk in and it does not seem to be that much but wow when you go upstairs

Stunning, despite the queue. The stained glass windows are as fantastic as others have said. Shame we had to queue for over an hour in torrential rain to see them. Surely given the space inside the main entrance there could be a better and covered queuing area? Anyhow, once in it's all forgotten, though to get to upper floor you go up 30 stairs on a quite narrow spiral staircase which some larger people were not enjoying - didn't see any signs that gave a warning of that. Astonishing detail in the windows and there's audio guides and brief multiple language leaflets that tell you what each window is showing.Staff on duty try to get the crowds and the tour guides to keep quiet and respect the surroundings of what is a church, but it's a losing battle from what we could see!
Stained Glass Spectacular. Loved this chapel with its stained-glass windows from 800 years ago. Utterly amazing place to visit. A must see!

Beauty in a Small Package!. When I visited in the Summer of 2012 there was so much construction going on that it was not really worth the price of admission. That's not to say that the glass is not exquisite, because it is very lovely. It's just that the space is so small that it reminded me of my first visit to the Mona Lisa…and if you've seen her, you know what I'm talking about.

jewelbox of a church. We tend to forget that all of these churches were painted when first built so to see these vaults and cross vaults done in royal blue with gold leaf accents impresses on the visitor the emotional impact on entrance for worshipers in those long ago days. The upper church of La Chapelle is almost entirely glass--one wonders how the church stays upright with such delicate walls. The Cathedral of Chartres gets all the hype for its stained glass windows but La Chapelle has more impact on me because it has such an overwhelming feeling of delicate, almost fragile, beauty unmatched by any other church in Christendom. No other medieval church I have seen (and I have seen a lot) conveys such ethereal beauty. Highly reccommend a visit and it's easy to do with Notre Dame because it is literally across the street from that hallowed church.

Amazing stained glass windows. We had to queue a lot twice: to access the enclosure (security control) and to buy tickets but it was so worth when going upstairs and discovering those paintings on the glass. It is amazing, I have never seen something similar.The worst part is that, in my opinion, it is too expensive: 8.5€ for a very short visit. If you plan to go to Notre Dame (for free), you may decide to skip Sainte Chapelle. It all depends on how much you love art and how much money you want to spend. Behind the altar in Notre Dame there are some windows which look familiar.Anyway, I would still pay again to visit Sainte Chapelle (despite I was amazed when I realized I had to pay, since most churches in Paris are available freely.
Beautiful!!!. Such a beauty! Well worth the line and security check! I am 70 years old and so glad I climbed the stairs.

A must-see!. This will not take a chunk of time out of your day and is well worth the visit. It looks unassuming on the outside and you must climb a claustrophobic set of spiral stairs but when you get to the top....Wow!! You will be bathed in beautiful light.
Best Stained Glass in Europe.. Now that all the windows have been laser cleaned, what used to be simply gorgeous is now eye popping.

A Must See. Sainte Chapelle is perhaps the most beautiful chapel/ place of worship-in the whole World.
There seem to be no walls - just beautiful windows everywhere, and the Oriel window occupies almost all of the west wall!!

Come for the windows, stay for the concert.. Sainte-Chapelle is a marvel of light and color. Walking into the chapel on a sunny day is like being bathed in a glowing, purple wonderland, and you cannot help but wonder how medieval architects and artisans could have built something so awe-inspiring. The best way to experience Sainte-Chapelle, though, is to buy a ticket for one of the concerts they offer during the summer months. I attended an evening concert, and had the singular joy of listening to Vivaldi on a centuries-old violin (pianoforte and recorder), while basking in the warm purple glow of the chapel windows. Not only was the music delightful, it was a pleasure to experience the chapel at leisure, when it wasn't choked with tourists. Highly recommended.

Gorgeous. You go to Paris and I'm sure you're going to stop at Notre Dame…Sainte-Chapelle is pretty much right around the corner on a beautiful street so WHY WOULD YOU NOT GO? To those 88 people who rated it as "terrible," there's something wrong with you.It's an absolute gorgeous church and it would be a shame to miss it.Advice:Buy tickets in advance if you can b/c the long was rather long and slow. :(

Don't Miss this!!! Absolutely Incredible!!!. We had the pleasure of stopping here on our guided tour. I am typically not a huge fan of visiting lots of religious sites but this one is special and definitely worth a look. Make sure you go inside and go upstairs to see the absolutely stunning stained glass work! It is truly remarkable and one of my favorite things in Paris.

Best small chapel in Europe!. You have to go look for this chapel. It's in a court yard surrounded by a building. This little Gothic style chapel is so light and lacy.. the Stain glass is absolutely incredible!Grab an audible tour, it will really be worth it. So much packed into a small space. Kids will like this too because it's small enough for them to absorb. Don't get me wrong it is a soaring space. Not to crowded even in mid Aug. Small shop in the lower level.

Incredible .. The most overwhelmingly beautiful stained glass and high ceilings- I would recommend sainte Chapelle over other cathedrals (eg Notre Dame). The colour and light was stunning- took my breath away.

Beautiful stained glass windows. There was a huge line to get in, which almost deterred us from going, but thankfully it moved quickly. The stained glass windows are absolutely worth going to see. It helps to either a) read up on your biblical history or b) go with someone that knows the stories, so they can interpret what's happening in each of the windows.

music concert in Chapelle. the SaIinte-Chapelle is absolutly worth of visisting, but... the crouds of tourists around the year. you can stay in the queue couple of hours, so I visited it for one music concert, so I could enjoy the fantastic gothic Chapelle with amazing stained glass windows and to have a pleasure from the wonderfull classic music with superb acustic

Up the steps, but worth a visit!. There was a line to get in even with our Paris Pass, but it is a beautiful church. Much smaller than I imagined--the windows are outstanding, and it must have been recently renovated.
Go in the afternoon. The stained glass is why you go so you want there to be light. Best in the afternoon. Incredibly lovely.
Add this to your to do list. Don't miss this hidden gem, you will not be disappointed. One of the staples of art history 101, but often overlooked by the general public. Very close to Notre Dame.

An absolute masterpiece. Sometimes TripAdvisor leaves one shaking ones head in complete befuddlement - how can 88 people have rated Sainte-Chappelle as 'terrible'? Even to the non-religious amongst us it is clearly a masterpiece of the high gothic period. Intimate, as a royal chapel should be, but enormous in the way that only a room higher than it is long or wide can be. The stained glass and the other decorations, including in the lower chapel, are quite magnificent. Suspending ones disbelief at the flamboyance, the colour and light, of the whole concoction and assessing the high chapel as a piece of architecture the question that comes to mind is: what is actually holding the roof up given that the windows seem to occupy 90 percent of the walls? Notre Dame might have been built to impress the peasants, but Sainte Chappelle was built for a King. Go and see it - you won't be disappointed.
DO NOT MISS. The photos do not make this place justice, you have to see it for yourself. The queues aren't very long and you don't need to spend hours there, so do it!
Truly worth a visit.... Beautiful stained glass work, impossible not to enjoy! Our ticket included the conciergerie, not sure I would recommend this to others

Stunning stained glass. Amazing stained glass rising to the vast arched roof is quite stunning. Catch the sunlight through the glass and it comes to life. A definite attraction on the Paris must see circuit.Down side on our visit was the 30+ minute queue just to get through security, then another queue to get in the chapel itself. As we didn't have a pre-purchased ticket, we had to wait another 20 minutes for to buy tickets with only one, rather slow, window being available. However, one you are in, it is quite an experience!
Worthwhile- Go See!. The stained glass is stunning. Lines were not as long to get into this attraction like other top Paris attractions.

The Light of Heaven. Sainte-Chapelle is a gothic masterpiece. It was recommended as an "attraction" to visit when I traveled to Paris while in college 35 years ago. I return to Sainte-Chapelle each time I return to Paris...and, it's Paris' gift to me...waiting since the 14th century! Many words can be written, but the words pale by comparison when you experience this gem, sitting quietly alongside the Palais du Justice on Isle de la Cite. Neither the largest cathedral in Paris, nor the most famous....but certainly worth the ticket price, and the wait in line, if there is one. The best rule of thumb...try to see Sainte-Chapelle on a sunny day! Walking in downstairs and you'll see vivid colors in the low-vaulted ceilings...but, this feels almost dungeon-esque. Then ascend the hand-cut stone steps to the second level. It's like opening the door in Dorothy's house, and walking out into the Land of Oz! The beauty is hard to put into words...incredible...absolutely stunning...pick an adjective, and it probably fits. Each stained glass window is different, and tells a different story from the bible. There are multi-language booklets that walk you through the scenes. Spend some time, take some pictures, and enjoy.
Beautiful. Magical windows that shouldn't be missed. There are also chairs so you can sit down and enjoy the atmosphere.
Stained glass windows. Beautiful artwork. I visited with a Museum pass but there were no fast lanes.. I hope they can make one.

Breathtaking!. If your in Paris, you just have to see the Stained Glass Windows of Sainte-Chapele! It get busy but then most places worth seeing are crowded. Even the floor is interesting, the way the sun light shines through the glass is beautiful!
Stained glass windows. Incredible stained glass. Can't bypass security line with Museum Pass. Binoculars helped to see some of the detail in the higher up windows.
Beautiful church. Beautiful stained glass surrounds you in this church. It was very crowded and tripods are not allowed. Worth a visit.

Stunning display of stained glass. Stunning display of medieval stained glass. The whole building is alive with coloured light and window crowded with intricate detail. Picking out Bible stories and looking for well known reference among the hundreds of images is fascinating and could take a lifetime. If only the tourists could be silent this place would have the sense of awe that its creators and earliest visitors would have enjoyed.

Small but spectacular.. A visit to Sainte-Chapelle is a must. While the line starts forming early and seems to stretch around the block, the visit is worth the wait. When you first walk in, you may wonder what all the excitement is about. Climb the stairs to the chapel and witness the most beautiful stain-glass art you are likely to see anywhere in the world.

Prepare to be awed. This very unique chapel is a favorite historic and religious site. Stained glass that is mostly centuries old surrounds you when you arrive on the main, 2nd floor. Magical! The structure is very fragile, so only a few visitors can be inside at one time. Children should be coached about the total necessity to be quiet and still. Prepare to be in awe.

Sainte-Chapelle: take time to see this!. Beautiful cathedral with out the long lines. The stained glass windows were unforgettable. One could sit or walk slowly around the church without feeling pressured. It was amazing.

Impossible to describe. Day or night, this is an amazing experience which is impossible to describe. It has to be seen and not just once! Its beauty and its spirit are hard to match, the unique experience, even in a city full of exceptional places.

A treasure. The Sainte Chapelle is hidden on the grounds of the Palais de Justice which is located on the Ile de la Cite. Try to go there when the day is light and sunny because the sun shining through the stained glass windows creates a stunning effect. Go there early in order to avoid the biggest crowds. But even a long wait makes it worth while.

This Jewel, this extraordinary building will blow you away. This Jewel, this extraordinary building will blow you away. You enter through the Palais de Justice on Boulevard du Palais, near the Palais de la Cité, on the Île de la Cité. There will be a queue and there is a bag security check like airports have (don’t carry a Swiss army knife, you may not get it back).Sainte Chapelle was a royal, medieval, 13C, Gothic chapel. The entrance is into the lower chapel which was for the common folk – nice enough (oldest fresco in Paris is on the left side wall near the front over the door). Up the steps (back, left) and wow. The thin, colourful columns and the ceiling (that you may not even notice) are amazing but the floor-to-ceiling stained windows on all four walls are something else. The building is long and narrow but not large. A camera with a long lens and a steady hand will reveal hundreds of detailed scenes of the Bible; Old Testament (side and rear walls) and the New Testament (front wall). (Avoid flash as it will flatten colour, photograph the windows with good sun back lighting.) Take your time and soak it up. It is a holy building so silence is required.

A jewel box. Spectacularly beautiful chapel. It's hard to describe how exquisite and refined this glorious building is. It's location is a bit discreet which adds to it's charm. Perhaps I sound like a philistine but I actually prefer the stained glass windows here to Notre-Dame. I also lived a few modest classical music concerts in the evening. Well-done, small treasures with young artists in a magnificent jewel box

Stunning!. Do NOT miss this beautiful Chapel. The lower chapel's stained glass is beautiful but when to take the stairs to the upper chapel you will literally gasp at the beauty and abundance of the stained glass. I knew the photos on my camera would not do it justice and I actually bought an illustrated book they sold for 12 euro.

Lots of stained glass!. Very pretty, Even if you have a pass you must still wait in line to get in. We waited probably an hour and a half. Well worth the wait if you like to look at stained glass and churches! Aug there seems to be a quiet month.

Stunning. This is a must see when you are in Paris. The most amazing stained glass windows I have ever seen. Don't be put off by the queues outside, people move through the church fairly quickly, so you wont be waiting for hours. It truly is worth a visit.

Beautiful concert in a beautiful setting.. We were told by a local that we must see Sainte-Chapelle. We booked tickets to a classical music concert there on a Sunday night. It was absolutely breathtaking! I've never seen stained glass like the windows in Sainte-Chappelle. Always check when the concerts are on - it's so worth experiencing it.

Amazing!. Just go and enjoy this master piece! Simply amazing! Not sure if you can pre-book but of you go late, you will have to wait. Go early avoid the lines!
@instabuilt

Not to be Missed - EVER. I never miss a visit to Ste-Chapelle when in Paris. The incredible stained glass and painted, gilt walls are one-of-a-kind and the history of the venue is very interesting. If at all possible, attend a performance of classical music when in Paris at Ste-Chapelle. The performances are held in the upper chapel. Acoustics are stellar, music is chosen to fit the space, all performances are intimate and all seats are good so buy the least expensive tickets since there's no significant benefit in spending more for seats closer to the performers. BTW - the chairs are hard seated folding ones and I suggest bringing a pillow or an extra sweater to sit on to save the derriere. Excellent location for pre-orpost performance meals or drinks. Lively area at night.
Amazing stain glass. Not all the information was provided in English, but hey that's my fault maybe for not knowing French , I thought a little expensive at 8.50 euro ,
Amazing. You have to visit this Chapelle - it is amazing. A must see while in Paris. Get there early to try to beat the queues - it is definitely worth it.
Very beautiful. Nake sure to buy your musem card somewhere else in advance. Lines for tickets are very long. If you have a pass you get in much faster.

The Jewel of Paris. You will never see such beauty. Its like being inside the worlds largest jewel box and you feel the opulence and grandeur of a time long gone. Its worth queuing up for as its an astounding chapel. Just go you will not be disappointed !!!
Stained glass wonder - do not miss!. Not busy, open late(r than most), and absolutely stunning. It's hidden in a courtyard behind the Palace of Justice but totally worth the search.

Not the most beautiful church in Paris, but still gorgeous. And definitely worth the stop! The stained glass in the nave is absolutely incredible and a visit to Paris wouldn't be complete without seeing the rose window

Windows spectacular!. This church is not to be missed! The stained glass windows are just spectacular. Grab a card in the back and read about each window. We went on a Sunday morning and there was no line.
Painted glass has different effect that attracts you... Painted glass is very beautiful and is a historical place. The artistic touch is very nice and it helps maintained the history.

Stunning. I was fortunate to visit Sainte-Chapelle as a musical venue. It was a stunning visual, musical, and spiritual experience. The efforts of restoration did not in any way detract from the beauty and reverence of Sainte-Chapelle. The concert was Vivaldi's Four Seasons. I will never forget the beauty of that evening. I found the security and venue staff professional and curteous. The weather was wonderful that evening, so waiting for the doors to open was not an issue. It was simply an amazing experience.

A hidden gem.. We had the good fortune to attend a summer concert last week in Sainte-Chapelle. We listened to Vivaldi's Four Seasons and Pachelbel's Canon in D performed by a group that could only be described as classical rock stars! Extraordinary music in an extraordinary environment! What could be better than that?

Incredible stained glass. A trip to Paris would really be incomplete without stopping here. The stained glass reaches to the sky and is simply tremendous. If you can go on a sunny day, to truly appreciate it's beauty, that would be my recommendation. We saw a stringed quartet perform there one evening, so be sure to see if such a thing is going on when you are visiting. It was inexpensive and marvelous to see and appreciate music in such a wonderful setting.

A gem in Paris.. Very beautiful gem in a big city. It was recommended by a friend and it lived up to expectations. amazing windows, fascinating history and stunning architecture. Best to buy tickets online. Easy walk from Notre Dame.

The Power and the Glory. There are a handful of cathedrals in Europe that make the elite list of monuments that stand apart from the many. Chartres, Leon, to name a couple. Sainte Chapelle is a first among equals in this regard.Intimate yet majestic, inspiring yet charming, delicate yet insistent, this church is a must visit when you are in Paris.But I have a suggestion: see if there is an evening concert scheduled in the chapel while you are in Paris, and have and experience that is sublime and the transcendent. When music fills the lofty airs of this amazing space, you suddenly understand something about why so many worked so long and with such care on this rare gem of a gothic cathedral.

The concert in the church was the highlight of our trip.. We visited the Eiffel Tower, and Notre Dame, as well as dozens of other Paris sites, but this church was by far the most beautiful with all it's stained glass windows. We we fortunate to be able to attend an early evening concert inside the church as the sun was setting. Listening to classical music while the setting sun bathed the stain glass in golden light is something I will never forget. Absolutely breathe taking. If you have a chance to take in a classical concert in this church, do it. Not only will you be able to see the side of the church with way less people after the regular crowds go home, you'll also be able to listen to classical music in a lovely setting.

Absolutely Outstanding Church. it is well worth the wait in the security line to see this church and its wonderful stained glass panels. NOT to be missed. You will be taken away by the grandeur of this gothis church
Breathtaking!. Beautiful! Be sure to buy the audio tour, gives ALOT of history on this lovely building. And give yourself time to just sit and take in all of the stained glass.

Stained Glass Paradise. I have never seen such beauty displayed in stained glass. Upon entrance, grab a free brochure before going up the stairs. Each vertical panel of stained glass holds pictures depicting events in each book of the Bible. Starting with Genesis, it wraps around the room and ends above the doors in a circular glass monument to the Apocalypse. It is truly a magnificent reminder of the beauty man is capable of when funds are unlimited. Make sure to step out on the balcony for some of the earliest depictions of God creating the earth, animals and man carved into the stone. Sainte-Chapelle is located in the Palais de Justice so security is very tight, leading to long lines that move slowly. The Museum Pass that covers the entry fee does NOT let you skip the line. In fact we were told no one can skip the line. Plan accordingly but do not miss.

Just WOW.. This is not my first review on Paris' attractions, and written a lot of words like beautiful, breathtaking and like, and about Sainte-Chapelle, well... just WOW.THOSE windows when you climb up, you will find that you will not find any words to describe.Worth the queuing! (The only Paris sight for which I wanted queuing.)
Absolutely Gorgeos. I was recommended to see Sainte-Chapelle by a friend. I would receommend this over Notre Dame Cathedral. The leadlight is just beautiful and the best I have ever seen.

You have to see this beautiful chappel. It is a small beautiful chapel that you must visit, try to do as early as you can, so you wont have to wait and try to do it in a sunny day. Its vitrines are huge and beautiful.You wont take long time but is worth a visit

Go there-But you need to read this TIP!!!!!. Vert impressive stained glass and well worth seeing. If you follow my reviews I have been in Paris for a month. I will give one or key tips per attraction I have visited and then vote yes or no-indicated by my stars rating-hope you find these tips helpful.TIP--The line outside the building is only the beginning. It is a screening line for you bags-once you get through be prepared to wait a hour to get in the church itself. The line outside is no indication of the line pass the door. THIS IS THE IDEAL PLACE TO USE YOUR MUSEUM PASS IT WILL NOT GET YOU BY THE 1ST LINE BUT WILL ONCE INSIDE--JUST GO TO THE FRONA AND RIGHT AND BYPASS ALL THAT ARE WAITING TO BUY TICKETS!!!!!!!!
Pure gothic style. A jewel!. This is the jewel of Paris. Pure gothic style. Small but superb!. Glass windows (most of them original) are amazing. You can´t miss it.
Four seasons concert was spectacular . We went to a string quartet performance of Vivaldi's four seasons at Sainte-Chapelle, and it was AMAZING. By far the best part of our trip to Paris.

Gorgeous artwork. The artwork in this chapel is outstanding. In fact, it is better than Notre Dame. There was a line of people waiting to get in from early in the morning, so I imagine it gets really busy by noon.

Stunning!. This is a must see! It is absolutely stunning. Besides the City Pass, you can also buy your tickets online before you go. We were able to bypass everyone and go directly in. Be sure to bring your camera!

Such a surpirse, the whole bible in stain glass in this hidden gem.. In all the tour books and guides, I have barely heard of this Chapelle and what a surprise. It is housed within the guard quarters which were used to house Marie Antoinette and other Royals till they were brought to be beheaded before the Convention. When entering the compound, look for the Chapelle and make sure to climb the small stairway for a room with breath taking stain glass windows that start from one side of the room with the story of creation and wraps around the rest of the room with the entire bible story.

Stunning surprise. From the outside Sainte-Chapelle looks quite unassuming but what a stunning surprise once you get inside! We arrived early and the queue was not too long but it was well worth the wait. The windows are truly a work of art - highly recommended.

Beautiful Sights and Sounds. I booked on-line tickets in advance for a Mozart concert in Sainte Chapelle. You can either buy general seating for 34 euros/person, which was good enough for us, or more expensive assigned seating right at the front of the Cathedral. You can also purchase tickets about a half hour before the concert, and everyone waits in line whether you have advance tickets or not. It was an awesome experience to hear the string ensemble play Eine Kleine Nachtmusik while surrounded by the most beautiful floor to ceiling stained glass that I have ever seen. It was quite mesmerizing as the sunset gleamed through the colorful stained glass!

Overrated based on the length of the wait. Even with the Museum Pass, there was a 70 minute wait to get through security. The Chapel itself is small and there wasn't much there. The stained glass was nice but not at all worth how long it took to get in.

amazing place to visit. OMG! I saw this online and had to pay a visit, the que was nuts at around 1.5 hours but it was very worth the wait, amazing place simply amazing very serene and I would line up again to see this a second time, but glad we didn't have the children with us that would have been a bit much for them,

Attend a concert here for an amazing experience. We had the privilege of attending a concert here in the evening and we were blown away with this amazing building. The lead lights are incredible. The structure seems to be so fine that it appears that the roof floats. The sound quality inside was great - an awesome place to listen to classical music. If you can book a concert here as it's an amazing experience.We went past several times after attending the concert and always found the queues to be very long. If you can't attend a concert in the evening, like all popular Paris tourist attractions, go early! Concert bookings can be made online via the Sainte-Chapelle website

Just like Exeter College chapel - or other way round. Beautiful upper chapel which being cleaned so windows great - especially on sunny day. Go early, preferably with museum ticket to get past the queue and beat the amazingly long queue about 12 noon.

Words and photos cannot do justice. I have visited before, and my memory wasn't disappointed. This is so beautiful that I cannot begin to describe it. The only ugly thing was the proliferation of selfie sticks. It's worth the long queue.
A must see!. Absolutely breathtaking. Get the City Pass to bypass the line. You won't be disappointed, so bring your camera! Go early to avoid the crowds.

Chamber music at Sainte-Chapelle. We had to great fortune to attend an evening chamber music concert while visiting Sainte-Chapelle. It was almost an out of body experience; the last of the day's light coming in through the windows, sitting with about 40 others listening to a lively string quartet. Beautiful first evening in Paris!

Pro tips at this must do site. Have a Paris Museum Pass, but know that you'll still have to wait for security like everyone else, and this can take a while. You only get to skip ahead to the front of the ticket line once through security. Accordingly, if you're there on a hot summer day, go early.Once you make it through all that, if you're not feeling warm and fuzzy from the amazingness of Sainte-Chapelle...I won't finish the thought.This is the kind of place that even on a crowded day in late June I could feel a serene awe and lose myself for a while. I think I spent 90 minutes looking around and would have spent more if I didn't have such a crowded agenda. There are placards discreetly placed near the exit; they can help you read the windows, but I found it pretty confusing. I'd do some advance research and print out paper that you can easily use. I think that would have really enhanced my visit and is something I'll plan better next time.Message me privately if you'd like to see a photo sphere that I created...

The most beautiful church in Paris. My guidebook described Sainte Chappelle as the most beautiful church in Paris and it lived up to the hype. I was impressed with the crypt( which is where you enter) but when I went upstairs and saw the chapel it took my breath away. Such beautiful stained glass and so much of it. I have visited Paris many times but this was my first visit to Sainte Chapelle and it won't be my last

Rude security guards belittled me. I had been recommended to visit this landmark, but it was rather difficult to find and arrived after closing. The guards were so unnecessarily rude and dismissive of me, that it ruined my experience completely.There was a Vivaldi concert about to start inside.I would have happily paid to attend, what a lovely thing that would have been.But they looked me up and down and said ' private performance, very expensive' as if I was a philistine who couldn't afford or appreciate a concert. It was 25 Euros, which I would have gladly paid, but they made me feel so uncomfortable and unwelcome.

Le Concert - See and Feel It's Joy - Glorious Spritiual Experience. We were advised that to experience Sainte-Chapelle with the least amount of effort we should book a concert. This is because it is in the French Administrative Complex that houses the Supreme Court, so lines are long and slow due to security. I booked VIP tickets (first come first serve for the first few rows). I did not know what would be performed, just that we needed to be there by 6:15 for 7:00 pm concert and that it would last about an hour. I thought our 11 year old son could handle an hour and if not, it was his problem since Mom deserved this. Oh my goodness gracious. I was unprepared for the magnitude of our enjoyment. First, do get there by 6:00ish since they will start moving the line on time - around 6:15 and you want to sit close if possible to see the extraordinary musicians. Our concert was Folies Barouques with violin, flute and harpsichord. It included Bach, Vivaldi, Gounod and others and two versions of Ave Maria. We could see the violinists and flutists fingers and witness up close their amazing expertise. The concert is timed so that just as they finish the sun streams through the stained glass windows. I kept telling myself that I was going to savor the moment so that later when ever in trying, boring or difficult situations, meetings etc. I would remember that time and transport myself back to that church. It was glorious. It was one of the most spiritual experiences of my life and a highlight for me of our wonderful journey to England and France. Practical tip: go to restroom prior since only one in complex and far from concert. I purchased tickets online but you may also buy them across the street in the back of the elegant café on the corner. After the concert I would suggest taking a walk to the Seine, turn left and walk onto Ile Saint Louis for dinner and ice cream them back by Notre Dame by that time lit up since dark. Very safe. Catch a cab to your hotel from Notre Dame. A grand evening was had by us all, including our 11 year old son.

Simply breathtaking. We've visited Sainte-Chapelle twice in a year and both times it has taken my breath away. You enter on the ground level, which is impressive enough with its painted, vaulted ceiling, but then you go up stairs to the chapel itself and you catch your breath as you see the glorious medieval stained glass, reaching almost from floor to ceiling, 360 degrees around you. Absolutely stunning.
Awesome. Absolutely beautiful! An amazing church with walls of stained glass windows telling different stories from the bible. Really mind blowing! A must see in Paris!

Lovely!!! Take a concert there if you can!!!. The place is a Gem! This little place amazes everyone by the lovely and abundant amount of colored windows on almost all of its walls. I was lucky enough to visit it while attending a classic music concert. Can only recommend!!!!!!!
Beautiful Stained Glass. The stained glass is definitely once of the most beautiful one i have ever seen. I spent hours just to explore each of them.
For Those Who Appreciate Stained Glass. You will be in awe of the beautiful stained glass windows throughout. You should visit here at least once in your life.
Worth the effort!. The stained glass windows in this chapel have to be seen to be believed. Go to one of the concerts there in July and the light is magnificent.

One of the great spiritual places of the world!. SO worth the wait! Enter a truly sacred space of glorious art. The light through the west windows in the afternoon would lift any soul! Concerts here are magnificent by candlelight! Tricky stairs for elderly or disabled, but worth the challenge. We visit every time we come to Paris!
A gem in Paris. The stained glass walls are breathtaking. And don't forget to step outside and look up - fantastic gargoyles on this little in Paris.

Outstanding stain glass work and truly a magnificent chapel.. My favorite in Paris.The glass work is magnificent.Go early inb the AM to see the sun start shining through the stain glass work.Bring a good set of lenses for distance as one can see far more with magnification

A Sunny Day Must-See. Though some people don't consider this an important stop when paring down their tourist attraction list in Paris, for those of you who are looking for shorter, simple visits that take your breath away, this is the place.After entering through security (a quick line), you'll wind up a tiny circular staircase that opens up into the most majestic display of stained glass in Paris. From the story of Creation through to the Resurrection, the beauty of the glass on a sunny day will render you completely speechless. Allow yourself an hour or two, and don't miss the little shop before you go.

Very Impressive little Church, Beautiful Stained Glass Windows. Located about a block from Notre Dame this little church should not be missed. We passed by many times hoping to find a short line, but it regularly seemed to have a 30 minute line all day long. The Museum Pass will not let you skip the line either, but it does cover the cost of seeing the church. The church consists of a lower chapel and an upper chapel. The lower chapel features a statue of the Virgin Mary, the sanctuary's patron saint and you will also find a small gift shop dominating one side of the wall. Stairs on each side of the main entrance lead up to the Upper Chapel. The Upper Chapel is what everyone comes to see here and it is surrounded by 15 stained glass windows depicting 1,113 scenes from the Bible. Each window depicts a book from the Bible and the most prominent of these windows depicts the Passion of Christ. There is an additional window between the two stairways depicting the Apocalypse. Honestly I had a hard time making out exactly what these pictures were trying to depict, but they were beautiful nonetheless. We came in the late afternoon, but if you come in the morning I have heard that the light hitting the windows is glorious. There were ample pamphlets in English explaining the general themes of the church/windows. This is a very beautiful intimate little church and it is a must see.
The quene is v long but a beautifullllll chapelle. The chapelle is vvv beautifl once u step in. The glass windows are breathtaking I Liked it much more than notre dame

Listening to Vivaldi.... Long queues for this attraction so booked for concert - 25 euros- and had a wonderful experience listening to vivaldi's Four Seasons and other violin music whilst in the most beautiful chapel. Can't recommend enough.

Breathtaking!. We stopped in at Sainte Chapelle only because it was part of a museum pass we had purchased & we were in the neighborhood. The line to get in was short too. Once inside, we were awestruck by the beauty of the stained glass, and mesmorized by the Biblical stories illustrated in the colorful glass. We visited in the late afternoon which was the ideal time to see the light illuminate the colors in the glass thus bringing the stories to life. We had downloaded Rick Steve's Guide on to our phones to guide us through Sainte Chapell which was perfect. The staircase upstairs is a bit narrow and steep which might be difficult for some to maneuver. If you are able to climb the stairs, this is a must see sight in Paris!
Worth the wait. This is a feast to be seen the sun was bright and the stain glass windows where seen at there best. It was worth the 20 mins wait to get in.

Buy the skip the line ticket and get the audio guide. Had to go in August which I have never done before and will never do again.Anyhow, this is a small chapel but exquisite>The audio guide is VERY long and detailed so I listened to the overview but when we went to a panel by stained glass panel discussion,I skipped to the last 2 and still enjoyed it

Be sure not to miss this stained glass masterpiece!. So many people glance at Sainte-Chapelle and walk by without going inside. Make sure you do go inside and spend an hour or two marveling at the glass. The colors and the patterns will leave you speechless. This site is covered by the Museum Pass.

Stained glass heaven. Absolutely love love all the stained glass there. We used our iphones to do a panoramic which came out looking great. The line to get in looked long from the street but it is really just getting through security. You exit through a government gate ( I think it was the department of justice) so you have to go through a metal detector first. Once you are past that, the line was quite short. We used our museum pass and walked right in. The pictures just don't do it justice. Only viewing it yourself will truly allow you to appreciate its beauty. It does have a nice gift shop as well. Save room on your memory card. You will need it. Enjoy

Absolutely stunning. You have to queue up for quite a time in the middle of the day in summer ( about 1 hour) but again, well worth the wait. It is a magnificent building and not to be missed. It is only a few minutes walk from Notre Dame.

The surprise is on the top floor. It is located INSIDE a military installation. Really strange location, but I guess that's where it originally was and they didn't move it. We started our Paris Museum Pass here at St. Chapelle. Just bought it at the door, no hassle and no problems. Truthfully the first floor was just OK - it turns out it was for the servants to worship, but the upper floor is GORGEOUS, and that's why people come here to visit. All of the stained glasses and just a feast for the eyes.Definitely come by and see for yourself.

Stunning although line was long. Absolutely stunning although the two lines (security and entrance) took a long time. Make sure you go during a sunny day and the stained glass will be absolutely gorgeous!

Colorful Sainte-Chapelle. We visited Sainte-Chapelle on a whim when we discovered we were at a restaurant right around the corner. The stained glass is unrivaled - more colorful and pictorial than any we'd seen throughout Paris. The tile work on the floors is equally fascinating and the outside is almost as ornate as the inside. Check out the fenced area along side the exterior and you'll see gargoyles and ornamental stone work that must have fallen or been removed from the building, providing a close-up look at these architectural details.

Beautiful, worth going for a classic music concert. This is one of the most beautiful church in Paris. I've been there to listen to a concert it was magic and emotional. I can only recommend to book, concerts are not expensive.
Be prepared to wait. Very very beautiful and a must see when in Paris. My husband and I waited a good 45 minutes in a queue just to get through security but it was well worth it

Heavenly. No photo captures the absolute magic of the windows of Saint Chapelle. Make sure you get the Paris Museum Pass to skip the huge line. You'll enter into the lower chapel, wander, enjoy, take deep breaths and then... Go up the dark stone stairway, and then... Breathe in the light! Even our jaded teenager made the audible sigh, "wow!" We just stood in the light and discussed the stories told in the glass and stone.
Amazing stained glasses. This place is so beautiful. I have been to many churches but I have never seen stained glass as beautiful as a Sainte-Chapelle's

Skip the lineup and enjoy. We were lucky to overhear a staff member tell a couple to buy their ticket at the Conciergerie which includes access to Ste Chapelle as well. Since the lineup to buy tickets at Ste Chapelle was huge, we did the same. Bought our dual tickets at the Conciergerie, just north of the ticket line for Ste Chapelle. When you come back to Ste Chapelle, you go to the express area ( red box with a staff member in red) and show him your ticket. In you go, bypass the line. Don't ask the guards, they give you the wrong info and tell you to stand in line to buy a ticket.Ste Chappelle is stunning, the lower chapel is a bit small and dark but the upper Chapel is breathtaking. Experience of a lifetime.

7 PM Concert superb time to see it.. Evening concerts here have become a tradition and there's no better way to enjoy this beautiful building. The Vivaldi violin series, performed by professionals from the Paris Orchestra, is wonderful at 7 PM while summer sunlight still streams through the stained glass. Tickets may be easily purchased online and there are 3 or 4 price ranges. You can also buy them by standing in line during the day but this could be lengthy depending on the tourists.

A Paris Gem. I only went to Saine Chapelle because a fried told me about it. Close to Notre Dame, you can do both in one visit. This is a really unique place absolutely filled with history and not to be missed. But be prepared to queue and flat shoes are essential for a steep narrow staircase.

Plan in advance for this popular museum. The Louvre is huge. You definitely need to plan out what to see in advance. And buy a museum pass in advance to avoid the extremely long lines. It would have been more enjoyable if not packed like sardines by the Mona Lisa. It was like being on a NYC subway during rush hour.
Best Church to Visit. I always pass right by Notre Dame and head to this lovely secluded church. The architecture is divine. Must visit!

beautiful. I can honestly say that this is the most beautiful church in Paris. Do not pass up the opportunity to visit if you are in the city! It is right by Notre Dame, but i think that ND is slightly over rated compared to Sainte-Chapelle.

I liked it, my husband thought it was so so. This is located in an awkward spot, so we had trouble finding it initially. It's medieval architecture and to me was very impressive, but since my husband wasn't quite as impressed, I gave it an average rating. It is small, not a lot to see, but the stained glass is slightly more impressive than Notre Dame. It's just more of it in a smaller space. If you have time, visit, if not, you can do it on another visit to Paris.

Something to look at. I'm not one for much history. I am religious, But to me, this was just another church to look at. The stained glass windows were pretty cool as they told a story and trying to interpret it was interesting, but in general it was just another church with (yes, beautiful) stained glass windows

Stunning stained glass windows. Beautiful and historical chapel opposite Notre Dame. You can take a tour through the building or you can buy a ticket for one of the evening concerts in the chapel. Classical music played by a string quartet in one of the most beautiful chapels imaginable. What more can you ask for?

stunning stunning stained glass. you first go to the lower chapel, where you're already impressed with the rich blue ceiling. but the best surprise, most breathtaking and worth-the-queue sight is the upper chapel. you enter the chapel from a spiral staircase where you're immediately struck dumb with awe at the most beautiful, elaborate, colourful, huge, tall stained glass covering wall to wall of the entire church. it is simply amazing and utterly awe-inspiring.tip: the church is located next to the Palace of Justice, so be prepared to queue outside to pass the security checkpoint. the church denies entry at 5:30 sharp during summer even if you get past security by 5:30, so make sure you get past security by 5:20 so you have enough time to go buy tickets to enter!
Exploring. First time we have been able to enter this church. Very interesting. Had a meal nearby at the Cafe de la Mairie. Is the church going to have further cleaning and repair?
Awesome Church. This was a great experience and a must do. My only complaint is the security check point. Try to go to the shorter line to see the other building because both lead to the same place.

Stained Glass Beyond Belief!. This beautiful edifice was our very first sightseeing adventure on our first day in Paris and it was a highlight. Make sure to go upstairs to see the unending walls of stained glass windows, depicting Bible stories and events high into the air. Can't imagine how this was made so many years ago.

Stunning!. I bought tickets for this from parisinfo.com and even from looking at photos, I am already amazed. I had to see it in person. My husband and I went there early and there was no queue yet, but it was amazing how the queue just got longer and longer. The stained glass windows. Oh my goodness. It was love at first sight! You are just surrounded by beautifully stained walls. Photos don't do justice. It is more amazing in person. There is not much to do in there apart from admire the stained walls. I think we were only there for 10 - 15 minutes. They do have a gift shop. It is also so close to Notre Dame and the ticket is very affordable, so I highly recommend this place.

Incredibly Beautiful. This was one of my favorite attractions in Paris. The beauty of the stained glass was beyond words. I highly recommend getting a head set to understand more about the history, glass, & sculptures. I really appreciated that you are allowed to stay as long as you want. They don't try to rush you through like some places do.

Under rated site - Amazing Glass. Brilliant atmosphereShould be in everyone's Top 5 things to do in Paris!Good day or bad day, it will take your breath away when you climb the stairs and view it for the first timeEven the 2nd and 10th times!

the most beautiful stain glass windows. La sainte chapelle is a stunning building gracefully built under Saint Louis (13th century) with the most beautiful stain glass windows to host the holy crown of thorns. It is fairly small and so very impressive. Try to go early with the morning light. It is worth queuing before the opening time. There are sheets explaining the stories told by the stain glass windows. The entry ticket can be combined with La Conciergerie. Bestregardsfromfar

Incredible stained-glass windows . This is the oldest royal chapel of the French kings. The upper chapel is just walls of intricate and colourful stained-glass! Absolutely breathtaking. The chapel is small, so only a limited number of people can go inside. Go early to avoid long queues.

What stained glass is really all about.... Sainte Chapelle is the best think I saw in Paris... I'd call it the apex of Gothic Architecture. It has grand stained glass windows that creates a red-purple light inside. It's simply magical.

Awesome Stained Glass. Sainte-Chapelle was smaller than I was expecting but is quite beautiful. It has some of the most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. The line will be long to get into here after the afternoon break (when it closes for a little while), so I suggest getting there earlier in the day.

Breathtaking. We have wanted to visit Saint Chapelle on previous visits to Paris but the queues have always defeated us. This time we got there earlier (about 11 o'clock) and had to queue for about 30 mins. You enter the downstairs room first and this is pretty but marred a little by the compulsory souvenir stands, which are inside. However, as you step into the upstairs room the beautiful stained glass windows take your breath away.There are chairs around the room so you can sit and admire the windows and watch the colours and patterns fill the room as the sun shines.Later in the week we came back at night to watch a classical music concert in the upper room, which was spectacular.

Skip Notre Dame and go to Ste. Chappelle. Ste. Chappelle is often overlooked in favor of the much more famous Notre Dame which is only a block away. Which isn't to say there are not lines; there are and because of its location security is high. It's hidden in a courtyard of the Ministry of Justice (courts and police) and although there are signs, it is not readily visible from the street, except the tops of the spires. My wife and I have gone virtually every trip to Paris. A tour of the Concierge can be combined with Ste. Chappelle. The stained glass windows are incredible. Probably the most beautiful I have seen anywhere and combined with the dark blue ceiling and the painted stars is awe inspiring. And the lower chapel is also beautiful.
Amazing. The line was quite long, but moved quickly. Once inside, the stained glass is aweinspiring. It is nearly impossible to take it all in.
Pretty Windows!. Quite a lot of climbing to do here. But what I really loved most about Sainte Chapelle were the pretty windows and elaborate tiles!

Pretty windows, but that's pretty much it. Saint-Chapelle, while it does has rather nice looking stained glass windows, doesn't offer much else. You climb up, see the windows, and that's pretty much it. We only went in because we'd just done the museum next door, and had bought the Museum Pass. With the pass in hand: lovely sight! Well that's that, let's move on.Without a pass: *after paying and queuing under the hot sun, and climbing up* well yes, it's pretty alright, but is there anything else to see? Nothing? Bah.

A phenomenal place. Went to a concert there for a second time. The chapel is magnificent, completely renewed, all the stained glass, just finished. WOW! The billing for the Vivaldi might lead you to expect an orchestra, not a four instrument ensemble. They were not remarkable, more just okay. Nevertheless, it is a privilege to be in Sainte Chapelle, especially after the renovation which involved the painstaking replacement of all the pieces of stained glass and hearing music in that setting is so wonderful.

Very sore toe!. Dangerous steps, one of which speared my toe and by the time I arrived in the Chapel I had a shoe full of blood. The attendants were very kind but absolutely clueless about first aid - thankfully some American tourists came to our rescue.

Sharp colour contrast chapel. It tooks a long time to join the queue because the chapel is just next to the court of justice, so high standard of security. This is the most colourful chapel I have seen in this trip, very sharp colour contrast windows and pills. worth to having a visit.
Beautiful Stained Glass. Sainte-Chapelle is the most beautiful example of artistry in glass! Try to get a ticket to one of the concerts held there each week.

Buy your museum pass ahead of time and don't miss Saint Chappell!. It is beautiful beyond imagining! And the best time is late afternoon when the sun streams through the stained glass - all recently refurbished. That is when the lines are longest too; buy your museum pass BEFORE before arriving and you'll cruise right in. Get the audiotape to add context to the breath-taking beauty. You don't need to be religious or knowledgeable about churches; you may be surprised by how long you (and your teenage sons) will want to stay!
Dazzled. Absolutely amazing. Classical music was superb and we were dazzled by the stained glass atmosphere. There was a short line that moved quickly once the doors opened for our scheduled time.

An interesting hour... My neighbor is an architect and before we left for Paris he told me that Saint Chapelle is "the most perfect room in Europe."Not sure about that - but it IS worth seeing - spectacular inside while the sun is shining - they DO let you take photos inside - which come out amazing and are cool to show to friends. You have to go through metal detector security check - but the line moves along well - and children under 18 are free. You won't need more than an hour inside at most, but it is worth a visit, They even have some benches outside on the balcony of the main (upper) chapel to rest on which is always good for tired tourist foot syndrome.Be sure to check out the little Brasserie right across from the entrance - we had a nice break there for dessert.ONE NOTE - the WC was free at Saint Chapelle - by my son and I agreed it was by far the most disgusting we saw in Europe on 3 trips to the continent - don't plan on sitting down for sure!
Gorgeous space. Totally awe inspiring space. We went for an evening concert of Vivaldi. The performance was a bit tourist-oriented, but was very good. Would highly recommend.
Long queue. The line seemed to be very long, I didn't go there. It's inside the Palais de Justice complex and has therefore extra security.
a must see!!!. the queue was worth it!!!! better to be there in the morning openning time, guess the queue would be shorter, but roughly 30mins. the stained windows were just magnificent!!!!
June 2014. Unbelievable church. The stained glass is incredible. Difficult to describe the beauty! Put this on your list.

Beautiful space. You will have to queue to see this, but if you like stained glass and beautifully decorating buildings this one is worth it. There is no furniture inside and the relics are no longer here either (at Notre Dame now) but the stained glass has recently been restored and tells the Bible stories well. The upper (more worthwhile) space is only accessible by spiral staircases.

Best stained glass windows in Paris. This is one of best sights in Paris. Make sure to map out where it is as it is not visible from the street although there are smaller signs and can walk from Notra Dame. 2nd floor was private chapel for the Emperor and is most magnificent. Floor to ceiling 2 story high walls are all stained glasses around the entire chapel. Usually there is a line formed on the street but it moves fast, there is entrance fee.
Stunning!. Visiting Ste Chapelle was the highlight of our Paris trip. I got goose bumps while gazing up at the stained glass panels. I could have spent hours if there had better seating for visitors.
Spectacular sight.. Mind blowing 5 story high stained glass windows all around. An amazing sight (on a sunny day, probably almost as good on a cloudy day, but we were lucky to have the sun).
Worth it to see the glass. The stained glass I'd definitely worth a visit. I prefer it over Notre Dame. Included in the museum pass.

Better Than Notre Dame. See my review of Notre Dame. I spent 10 minutes inside the Dame and 45 minutes in Sainte Chappelle. The stained glass windows are breathtaking. I have never seen a more beautiful church.

Breathtaking dance of light and color. This is the 4th time I have been there. And every time I visit Paris in the future it will be my pilgrimage. No where on earth can one see such beautiful stained glass. Make sure to go on a bright sunshiny day for the full effect.

Picked over Notre Dame. If you have time for only one of the island churches - pick Sainte-Chapelle over Notre Dame, especially if church history and the Bible are of particular interest. Practically the lines are shorter. The stained glass was beyond my comprehension. My only regret was not purchasing the full volume gift book of all the windows to study them at home. The handheld tour guide is a must to really 'get' what is on display and to undertand the role of the people and the church then - and now.

A stained glass extravaganza. This was a nice brief stop on our jaunt through Paris. The stained glass windows in Sainte-Chapelle are very pretty, and the sheer number of them is kind of hard to imagine until you're inside. Well worth the stop.

Most Glorious Light!. This small Gothic cathedral has the most beautiful stained glass windows...the walls are lined with them. It was constructed by King Louis IX to house the Crown of Thorns. There are 6,500 square feet of stained glass, most of it original from the 13th century. It's glorious. A highlight of a Parisian visit!

Sainte-Chapelle - Best Glass n the world. Worth the trip and close to Notre Dame. Amazing stained glass that really tells a story. Watch out for signs leading to Sainte-Chapelle following will lead to a needless walk arond the block.

Breathtaking. My son was a little reluctant to visit yet another church. After waiting an hour in the queue we finally made it to the main church hall downstairs which was something to behold . After admiring this for 15minutes we were ready to leave when we noticed a small stone staircase in one corner leading to another floor upstairs. Upon getting there my son was genuinely speechless seeing the most outstanding stain glass windows that we have ever witnessed. If you visit the Notre Dame cathedral, a visit to St Chappelle is mandatory or else you will miss one of the truly beautiful sights in Paris!

Stained Glass Wonderland. Not much from the outside, since it is buried within historic government buildings, but the interior is the best in Paris. Amazing stained glass. Good value with a combined ticket with the Conceirgerie, which is also fun to see.

Beautiful - don't miss. Short walk from Notre Dame cathedral . Beautiful stained glass windows. We thought them to be nicer than Notre Dame. Lines are long and they will allow only a certain number of people at a time, so you have to come back later.

What a beautiful church. Quite near Notre Dame is this absolutely special smallish church -- very old. I have been to Paris several times but had not been there. I am so very happy my granddaughter wanted to see it. It is worth the time -- the line moved quickly, too.
Colourful. If you go to Paris do not skip the Sainte-Chapelle. Located close to the Notre Dame the stained glass work in this chapelle is like nothing you have seen before.
Stunning Stain Glass. This church is right behind the Notre Dame church, we enjoyed the art of stain glass all over the church.
A gem. Worth the line-up.. A gem. Worth the line-up. Not like anything I've seen anywhere else. Just sit and look for a while and you may notice things not in the guidebooks.

Magical, even mystical.. Sainte-Chapelle was truly magical. It's been a long time since I was blown away by a church that was not a massive cathedral, but this gorgeous place had everyone driven to silence and wonder. Absolutely worth the walk, free with our Paris Pass, but we donated anyway for the upkeep of this beauty, as it is showing the signs of the many years. (Sad to see amputated stone gargoyles on the ground outside).
Make time for Sainte-Chapelle. The stained glass is truly exceptional. I could have spent a long time examining each window, but time did not permit. Simply lovely.

Incredible . The queues look a bit daunting when you arrive but it moved quickly and was well worth the half and hour wait. This amazing gem has the most beautiful architecture and stained glass windows.

Gorgeous stained glass and stone carvings. This little church is an amazing gem, with hundreds of intricate stained-glass windows. Every surface is decorated in this church, including pristine carvings outside the doors, and animal tiles on the church floor. Unfortunately we had to stand in a long line out front to get in, but it was worth it. You will go through a security check at the city offices before you can proceed to the church.
Ste. Chapelle. Worth a visit even if you aren't religious. The large stained-glass windows surround you and are artwork which tell stories.

Absolutely Beautiful . This was my favorite place in Paris; It was absolutely beautiful. We almost didn't go and when we did, we almost didn't go upstairs. The line was really long though, not as long as the Louvre or the Eiffel Tower, but it took longer.

Beautiful church. Sainte-Chapelle is a beautiful church with amazing 66 ft stained glass windows. There's more glass than stone in the walls, showing off Gothic architecture so well. It's amazing that the windows weren't lost in WWII. Many of them have been refurbished and (current to this writing) the latest stage of restoration is complete, revealing some real beauty. There's a long line, one you can't skip with a Paris museum pass, so be patient. Ours moved quickly enough. I can't see how you'd get much out of the chapel and it's history unless you get an audio guide. While one is available for iPhone, their 'free Wifi' wasn't working this afternoon. (Perhaps try ahead?) I couldn't listen to every window explanation - there are so many and some are hard to see as the choir area is roped off. If you're going to the Ile to see Notre Dame, add this to your time there. I'd estimate about 1 1/2 hours to include line and self-guided/audio guided tour. While I didn't specifically see 'stroller parking,' I did see a stroller parked neatly inside the lower chapel while there was a toddler upstairs, so I assume the staff helped the family park it there.

Worth a visit. LONG line to get through security. The guide books say that you can get you tickets at the Concierge first and then simply go to Sainte-Chapelle. Of course, you can buy your tickets at the Concierge for both sites, but you still have to go through security to enter Sainte-Chapelle. That lines is ling and slow - about an hour wait. With that said, The chapel is worth it, but the Concierge is not.

Simply Stunning… Best Stained Glass anywhere!. Had not been here for 20yrs and it had just been renovated… I had truly forgotten how absolutely stunning the stained glass and the painted ceilings of stars on the blue background really were…There is a narrow winding staircase to get up to the main area and to exit so if you suffer from claustrophobia and it is crowded you may find that part tricky…Definitely get there soon after opening at 9.30 as by 11 the queues are invariably much longer (but not like Louvre or Notre Dame)

A little gem. Sainte-Chapelle is a stunning gothic church within easy walking distance of Notre Dame. The colors inside the chapel are amazing, and the stained glass is gorgeous. This interesting chapel was built for Louis IX, and it has an upper level (where he and his family worshipped) and a lower level, both attached to part of what was formerly the royal palace. Interestingly, although it is still used as a church, the buildings surrounding it are no longer a palace. Rather, part of the court system is here, and you may see judges wandering around in robes. Nice little gift shop.
Lovey place. This is an impressive place due to the way it was built, more for the lovers type of trip and architectural richness
Come early!. Come early because we spent sometime waiting to enter. It's beautiful. Worth visiting. Don't forget to see the clock!
Amazing Chapelle. So, nice and great looks like small church, but when you go up by stairs believe me will surprise of what you will see :)

Worth the wait. Looked at the line several times. Finally one day got on line during the lunch break, still long but perhaps not quite as bad. So very beautiful. Well worth it. Covered by the Museum Pass.

Skip the line to see this spectacular Gothic chapel!. I see a red door and I want it painted...green! Red as in a long line and green as in go! My apologies to Mick and Keith, but I want to help my fellow travelers avoid a long wait for what will be a very memorable experience. Firstly, this tip will ONLY work if you already have an entry ticket as in the Paris Museum Pass (well worth the purchase, by the way). Facing the chapel you will see next door on the right the Palais de Justice. Walk north along Boulevard du Palais until you reach Quai de l'Horloge. Turn left and continue to Rue de Harlay. Take another left and continue to the back entrance to the Palais de Justice. Walk up the steps and go in passing through the metal detector. Walk straight through and out the front doors. On your right will be Sainte-Chapelle. You've just avoided the long line. Now go in the chapel and enjoy the kaleidoscope of color shining through the stained glass walls. That's right..walls! These aren't windows. They are essentially walls. The light show will be all the more spectacular if you're fortunate enough to make it there on a sunny day. No matter what it's well worth the visit.
Wonderful stained glass. Beautiful little church. The stained glass windows are trully a work of art, It is is very peaceful place.

Stunning Stained Glass. An absolute must if in Paris. The stained glass is spectacular! Take advantage of the museum pass and skip the line. (Note, you'll have to wait with everyone else to get through security, but with the museum pass you can by pass the line to get into the facility.) Take the time to check out the first floor and then be prepared to be stunned when you reach the upper floor.

Astounding surprise. We passed the Palais de Justice several times and could not understand the lines out front. Finally, the last day of our visit, we braved the line to find out. Amazing. The windows, particularly in the upper chapel, took my breath away.

Beautiful stained glass. The skyscraper of stained glass - it was jaw dropping, stunning. Another monument in Paris that did not disappoint. Be aware - if you arrive even and hour before closing, then may not let you in. We got there a 1/2 hour before and they closed for the day. But I have heard even one hour. Go early or come later on a day that they are open late (Wednesday) and you will avaoid the big crowds. You won't regret it - it's not as big at Notre Dame, FYI.

Lovely view and beautiful church. Well worth the climb to the top of Montmatre to see this amazing church and appreciate the view. Be warned, there are lots of people trying to sell you their wares or a can of beer (not sure why this is done here but obviously there are some who keep these people in business). Was told this is a haven for pickpockets so watch your belongings - there is lots of activity and buskers etc... so its easy to get distracted.

Words cannot describe the beauty. I studied this church in my art-history class in college and the images always stuck with me. What I didn't know was that it is completely surrounded by the Palais de Justice. When we walked in the main door, I thought we were in the wrong place and then we spotted the doorway leading upstairs. One spiral staircase later we stepped into the most beautiful places that I think I have ever been. Words cannot describe the emotions that well up as you step in and the sunlight shines through the stained glass. I wish it would have been less crowded so that I could sit back and enjoy the view in the quiet, but tourist season is heavy in July. This is a place I would return to every time I came to Paris.

Spectacular!. This is something you should definitely visit when you're in Paris. A little treasure right in the heart of the city. You'll be amazed by the spectacular walls of coloured glass. if you can, do it when it's sunny because the sunlight makes it even more beautiful. Yes, there may be a long line (we waited for about 40 minutes) but it's really worth it. The line seems to go slowly and there are times you don't seem to be moving any closer at all but that's because they only let a limited group of people in and because the security check is really strict. That's why even with the Museum Pass you have to wait in line. Once inside you need to take a small spiral stair to the next level and all you have to do there is enjoy the spectacular stained glass windows.
Gorgeous Stain Glass. This is worth visiting just to see the stained glass. AMAZING! Really over powers you when you visit, just beautiful! Did not have to wait too long to get in.

A truly stunning visit. I first visited the Sainte Chapelle as a student over 50 years ago and remember being blown away by it. Having read about the restoration which has taken several years, decided to re-visit and was not disappointed. The stained glass windows in the upper floor are just as magnificent as I remembered. We queued for over an hour - the problem is that they only allow around 20 people in at a time and there were several large groups arriving while we were in the queue. Once you're in, no-one hassles you to leave so you can spend as long as you like wandering round. We didn't hire an audio guide which, with hindsight, would have been a good idea. Very narrow stairs up and down to the first floor so not good if you have mobility problems. The ground floor was much better than I remembered with really vivid colours. Well worth a visit and not too expensive at 8.50 euros.

A better way to see Sainte-Chapelle.. Skip the long lines and go to an evening concert. The 7:00 one is the best on a SUNNY day, so you can admire the light coming in the stained glass windows. Sit in back to look at the windows and enjoy the music.

Architectural Jewel Box - Must See!. This is a must-visit for Paris. If you are in Paris in July, arrive early in the morning as the lines can be long. If you have already purchased a Paris Museum pass, you can go directly in to the Church entrance after you have passed security of the government building. The lines winding around the building are to buy an entry ticket. You will never forget the stained glass that awaits you Inside the chapel! It was designed as an architectual jewel box and it does not disappoint. You can also go see musical concerts inside the chapel which take place throughout the year. Check with your hotel about these.

Beautiful cathedral with a lot of history.. Liked Sainte-Chapelle even more than Notre Dame. Stained glass is incredibly beautiful and very old. Only 2 blocks from Notre Dame and a MUST if you are visiting Paris. Awe-inspiring!

Spectacular!. The expressions on peoples' faces as they enter the upper chapel of Sainte-Chapelle tell it all -- the sight is beyond spectacular, particularly on a sunny day! Although some time may be spent lining up to get in, the time devoted to visiting this site can be short if one is trying to squeeze a number of sites into a day, or long if one has time to contemplate its beauty -- either way, it is a spectacular site.

Amazing stained glass display. Just the amount of time and effort that went into the building of the stained glass window panes is unfathomable!! But the most impressive piece of the whole trip is that each pain is a story from the bible!! And then to top that, this church actually held relics from Jesus's crucifixion!! Brought tears to our eyes!!
Lovely place. We went on a walking tour and the tour guide recommended visiting Sainte-Chapelle. We loved this place, it has a real wow factor.
Worth a short visit. Small, but beautiful Chapel very near Notre Dame. Use your Museum Pass here. The stained glass is incredible.
My Spiritual Place for 40 years.. My Little Chapel that is unbelievable. The windows are amazing. There was a line to get in upon my arrival but it moved pretty fast.

Truly Amazing!!!!. This is by far one of the best preserved monuments. The stained glass windows of the church are truly amazing, breath taking!!!There is an entry ticket of 8.5 euros. As you enter the ground floor there are couple of souvenir shops and just a glimpse of wht are going to see on the first floor. So just head towards the staircase that will take to the first floor and here just get amazed!!! Every window, in fact every inch is richly colored and decorated.There are 15 windows each depicting a story.To look at these beautiful colored glasses is indeed treat for eyes!!Also, the church is centrally located, very close to Notre Dam. Nearest metro station is Cite.

Stained glass windows at their finest.. It is said that Sainte-Chapelle has the single finest set of stained glass windows in the world. I would not argue this point. This is the Chapel where Marie Antoinette said her last prayers prior to being led out to a cart to be transported to the guillotine where she was beheaded. This was a tragic end for someone surrounded by so much beauty.

Stunning. This used to be a hidden treasure. Expect a long wait. If you do have a museum pass, you'll still have to line up outside for security but do get to jump the horrendous ticket line. It's worth the wait - the most stunning stained glass you will see

Absolutely beautiful church with rich stained glass windows. I thought this church was more seuatiful than Notre Dame. It is much smaller with less impressive architecture and unless you read the guide book I am not sure you would partcularly find it apart from the queues outside because the main building is not visible from the roadside. However the stained glass in the upstairs chapel is incredibly vibrant - just stunning. Downstairs there are rich blues and dark red hues and golds. Amazing. Well worth a visit in my opinion. I really found this church quite special.

To be Seen to be Believed!. The stained glass windows are to be seen since no photograph can ever do justice to the magnificent colors, the changing light as the sun moves and the height of these panels, each of which tells a story from the Bible, starting with Adam and Eve. We didn't, but I suspect the audio guide would be very helpful since the panels are sometimes hard to figure out.

Definitely has the wow factor. There's a bit of a queue and it's quite odd as you're entering through the same security as the court house. It's a fairly small building and you're not really sure what to expect. Then we saw the spiral stair case and climbed up, as we reached the top we all gasped. It's really spectacular and most unusual. I won't spoil the gasp moment!
A hidden gem. Make sure to go to the second floor of the chapel via the winding staircase. The stained glass will amaze you!

Gorgeous stained glass windows. We made a quick stop here, around 5pm. Like others, when I walked in, my first reaction was "this is it?" However, you need to make your way upstairs to see the gorgeous stained glass window. There was a huge line up when I arrived around 5pm but because of the Paris museum Pass, we were able to skip most of the line - i love the pass! If you have lots of time in Paris, I would recommend stopping by here. If you only have 3-4 day I would suggest visiting the museums first. While I would line up for D'Orsay, if I didn't have the pass, I would not have lined up in the regular line up. We spent a total of 30mins inside, which I felt was enough for me.

Extraordinary stained glass windows !. Small , but worth the visit especialy the second floor with stained glass windows depicting bible scenes. Two lines first one on the street to acces the metal detector ( same court as the Justice and some Gendarmerie) and the second line in the court to buy tickets and enter.

Chapelle windows restoration complete and glorious!. Yay, they had finished the restoration and all of the gorgeous windows were there to see in their full glory! I recommend the audio tour because so much information can be learned about each window.
