I visit it every time I am in Paris and when people ask me, "Where should I go in Paris," I always INSIST they visit this this site. No one is every disappointed. Go on a sunny day if possible. The walls will glisten like jewels as you stand in awe of the beauty and the story-telling that is there.

Stained Glass Windows in Incredible Colors. I'm not that into stained glass, however the windows in Sainte-Chappelle are magnificent. I visited on an overcast day and even though the light coming through the windows wasn't very strong, the color was jaw-dropping. This is a gem of a church.A word of warning: the church is inside a compound in which the French Justice Department is housed, so all visitors (and defendants!) go through security, which may take a while.

Truly spiritual. The "Bijou de Paris" is aptly named: the stained glass windows surround one completely in this Gothic chapel built by Saint Louis for the Crown of Thorns. The security line (because it's on the grounds of the French Supreme Court equivalent) and the entry fee are well worth this glimpse of medieval splendor.

Breath taking. A lot of queueing ; then you enter the lower chapel, beautiful but you wouldn't guess why so many people, including yourself, were queueing. And the you climb to the upper chapel... stupendous! One of the jewels of Paris, indeed

The Jewel of the island. La Sainte Chapelle is a jewel. If you love blue and gold, it's your place. And if you have the chance to be at a concert at eve, your souvenir will be au rendez-vous. Never forget to try to book the different events of your program, before your arrival. Even the visit of the Eiffel tower...
Stunning stained glass. The stained glass on the upper floor is beyond stunning. Go on a sunny day! Be prepared to wait in line, but you will be rewarded.

Stunning windows. The queue to get into this chapel is very long but can be avoided by buying a pass to both museums. The stained glass windows in Sainte Chapelle are jaw droppingly stunning. There are 15 of them (although on this occasion half were covered over being cleaned/repaired) and are not to be missed. Having been to Paris a few times as a tourist we had never chosen to visit here before but can thoroughly recommend it as another 'must see' location in this fabulous city

Being restored.. Sainte-Chappelle is undergoing a much needed cleaning. A large section of the wall was covered so the perspective was limited and the glass colors seemed muted, perhaps caused by the light being blocked. Narrow stairs to viewing area may present a challenge for those with walking difficulties. Still an amazing place!
Amazing!. Amazing! Do not miss. You will never regret seeing the amazing windows. Stairs might be challenging for people with mobility issues. Take you time. Go back for the concert.

Hard to find ..but a hidden jewel. You must enter through some closed gates. This little hidden gem has some of the most magnificent stained glass windows in all of paris. Located across from Notre Dam cathedral you must enter near the Palais du Justice.

A jewel beyond jewels. My favorite site in Paris - or anywhere. I could spend hour after hour in the Sainte-Chapelle.
Compare to Yosemite in terms of visceral impact and power.

See a live concert there if you can. We got to see a string quintet with a clavichord do the Vivaldi's Four Seasons and it was just beautiful. Be sure to check out programs happening at the church and get in on it.

Awe inspiring. Everyone visits Notre-Dame but too many miss (and it is well hidden) this incredible church. Older than Notre Dame, it was build for King Louis IX in the 13th century as a private church for the monarchy. It has the most incredible stained glass windows that I've ever seen. I've been many times and I am awed by the beauty and history every time.

Most Beautiful Church. Period.. Although I'd read about Ste. Chapelle and had folks tell me about it, it's like the Grand Canyon: You've got to experience it. One section was being restored when I was there, and it STILL knocked my socks off.

so worth it!. It's not that easy to get to, you must wait in a long line even if you do have a museum pass, there is scaffolding and construction acitivity, but as you ascend the spiral stairs and enter the space it is so worth your trouble. If they are offering evening concerts, try to fit that experience in. Not as lovely colorwise as it is with sunlight, but equally moving.

Breathtaking.. This is a don't-miss spot in Paris. The stained glass will take your breath away. They were doing construction on part of it but it didn't take away from the wonder. The parts they have cleaned up are vibrant and beautiful.

Surprised by this beautiful gem. I accidentally wondered across this gem of church. I wasn't sure what this attraction was about, until I entered the chapel! The stain glass is like no others I've seen!

Great historical place. I have chance to watch classical music here. It's very good experience to listen "Pachelbel's canon" in Chapel with soft and smooth echo sound. For the classical music lover, I recommend this place

beautiful but covered. This church has some incredible stained glass - it's known for it, but almost half of the interior is covered. They did a good job hiding the work being done, but it still hides a lot of the glass. Regardless, try to go when it's sunny to really get the full effect of the glass. I would recommend seeing this church through other means (if possible). For example, I visited it to see a concert of classical music with a quartet of violins. It was a great concert and i was able to see the church with a very short queue.
Beautiful Chapel- All the stained glass is amazing!. This chapel was beautiful. A little hidden gem. We were able to return at night to go to a concert and that was also amazing.

Really beautiful. From the outside, Sainte-Chapelle doesn't look particularly exciting, and does suffer from a slow moving queue for security checks. However, any waiting is well worth it, as the interior is breath-taking. It can best be described as being like two churches on top of each other! The bottom floor chapel has a highly ornate ceiling and is totally beautiful. Go up the small stairway in the corner, and emerge into the second chapel with the most gorgeous stained glass windows. There is restoration work going on, which prevents viewing of an area of the windows, but comparing the 'restored', with the 'still-to-be -restored' shows what a wonderful restoration job has been done so far. Of all the chapels we visited in Paris, we loved this one the most.

Was very cool, the stained glass and the stories and history and something else. We enjoyed it and glad we did it. The stain glass is spectacular. Our friends had raved about it (said it was better than Notre-Dame...I'd disagree) so our expectations were quite how. I would do it for sure if you are in Paris. Take your time to figure out the history and stories on each pane of glass. The roof is also spectacular.
Go there. Small but gorgeous gothic cathedral whose second storey feels like one giant stain glass window. A wonder of the world.

A Delightful Find. We stumbled across this beautiful little gem near Notre Dame and I am so glad we did. The downstairs chapel has some lovely paintings all over the walls, but the stained glass windows in the upstairs chapel (to be found at the top of a small flight of stairs in the corner) was breathtaking.

Amazing stained glass. Sainte-Chapelle is located right in the centre of Paris and is a short walk from Notre Dame and The Louvre. The striking stained glass windows are superb and the rich, blue interior is both interesting and beautiful. A must-see religious building when in Paris.
Better during a sunny day!. This chapel is wonderful, even during a raining day..keep it for a sunny day, the glass wall would do their best!

Beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous stained-glass windows. Would have given it a 5 if there hadn't been restoration going on. Had 1/6 of the windows covered up so didn't achieve the full effect of how beautiful this church can be. Definitely worth adding to your list of places to see. Admission covered in the Museum Pass (and you can bypass the ticket line)!!

Long line for a short visit.. There's really not much to see on the lower level, all the action is on the upper level where royalty would attend. The stained glass in the upper level is absolutely amazing. Word of warning though: We were there at the beginning of August and while the south and east sides were amazing, the north side was covered as they were renovating. Still worth a look, even if you can only see 2/3 of it. I'd love to go back some day and see it when it's finished.

Glowing windows. Went to a lovely chamber concert here. Booked on line very simply, but it's quite a palaver to get into your seat - high security and a decent walk to the chapel. Be there a good hour before the concert starts. The interior of the church is undergoing renovations, but despite that, it's beautiful and contemplating the glorious windows while listening to Vivaldi, Handel and Albioni was a real treat!
Nice church but not worth the fee. Saw this on TripAdvisor and decided to enter despite the lines and the 7 Euro entrance fee. It is just a pretty chapel with not much to do inside.

Best view of the city. This is a great place to start your trip to Paris. We hiked up ( and I do mean hiked its a LOT of steps ) but that gets you in shape for all the walking you do in Paris. The views of the city are fantastic and you get a sense of where all the attractions are in relation to each other.

Decent concerts, but be prepared for a long wait. My wife and I have been to a number of concerts at the Sainte Chapelle over the years and all of them have been quite serviceable. In the past the advantages have been the opportunity to watch the sun set through the rose window and the joy of being able to walk straight in (after passing briefly through security) and look around without the need to queue. However, on our latest visit we turned up 40 minutes prior to commencement (as instructed) then waited half an hour in a stationery queue outside the venue for no discernible reason. On the plus side, I think the current renovations are being undertaken very sympathetically and didn't diminish my enjoyment of the experience. A spectacular venue, but the unnecessary wait was very annoying.

The most amazing sight in Paris. We visited first thing in the morning on a sunny day, and the stained glass was magic. It was also not crowded so we could gape as long as we wanted. Not to be missed, even on a short trip!

Most Beautiful Church in Paris. The Sainte-Chapelle is by far the most beautiful church in Paris; in fact, it is probably the most beautiful church I've seen anywere in Europe. Walking up the spiral staircase and being hit with the spectacular view of stained glass windows totally surrounding me was an experience I'll never forget. The stone in both the upper and lower chapels is also painted with rich colors, so you get a feel for how the church looked originally. While the security check to get into the restricted government complex surrounding the chapel can be a bit long and annoying, it is more than worth the headache to view this gem!

Worth seeing!. This little chapel, with its beautiful stained glass windows, is well worth seeing. Part of it was being restored during our visit - next time it would be great to see the whole chapel with no scaffolding but it's great that this lovely building is being restored for future generations to enjoy

Sainte-Chapelle. The first floor doesn't give away the magnificence of the second floor. You will be awestruck as you climb the narrow steps and reach the 2nd floor. It is a must see, one of the most beautiful sites in Paris.

a showcase of stained glass. probably eclipsed by Notre Dame which is close by, it is none the less not to be missed with it's towering windows of beautiful stained glass. You will defintely get a good overview of what goes into returning stained glass to it's original spendor as well as the histrory of Sainte-Chapelle.
Sainte-Chapelle. Absolutely beautiful, but wished I would have had the time to research this place ahead of time as the kids would have gotten more out of it.
Beautiful. An upper and a lower chapel, both very different. The lower, all painted in glorious medieval colours and designs. The upper, all stained glass windows soaring upwards. Breathtaking.

jewel box. A beautiful jewel box of a chapel, move quickly to the second floor, as the first floor is by comparison rather ordinary. Unfortunately several stained glass windows were being renovated, but it is still a very worthwhile site to see

Nice, but not on my Top 10 list. I was expecting to enjoy Saint-Chapelle more than I did. The line to get in and security checks took about 30 minutes. Once we got in, getting to the stained glass sanctuary didn't take long. Construction was being done on one side, which took away from my photos, but my husband still enjoyed following along and learning about each of the panes and the stories behind them. Overall it was nice, but not amazing. It wouldn't be on the top of my list if it was my first trip in Paris. But is worth seeing if you have time.

I wouldn;t waste my time there. We went there after standing in a long long line. There isn;t much to see once you get in, it's basically an old church with one or two rooms to look in. If this church doesn;t have a special meaning for you, I'd say skip it.

Gothic beauty, Wonderful acoustics. Our first visit to Paris and our first site on our trip was Sainte-Chapelle - a 12th century gothic chapel with the most amazing stain-glass windows...and beautiful sculptured entrance. It does not compare to Notre-Dame de Paris in size or exterior architecture or interior furnishings and sculpture, but its windows are superb and close enough to enjoy the detail and bathe in the beautiful light. We loved the detail of the exterior carvings of the entrance and door - then returned for a stringed quintet concert of Vivaldi and Bach in the evening - highlight of our trip, and would recommend it over any bus tour of Paris.

Vivaldi Concert. We were able to get tickets to a Vivaldi concert held at Sainte Chappelle. The cathedral itself is very old, and looks it, but they are in the process of restoring it. Try to go on a bright, sunny day, since that brings out the beauty of the glass. Look for concerts going on there - the acoustics are perfect, and the beautiful music combined with the history and beauty of the cathedral made for a wonderful experience.

Nice Church. After reading about this it was a bit disappointment that you can't really see the outside of it. Having been to Notre Dame prior to this visit it can be a little disappointing. The other downside is tour groups pushing in the line as they have no entrance for groups.
The view of Paris. One must visit this if you want to see a panoramic view of Visit. Really a must visit, if you are in Paris.
Great stain glass windows!. This small church hidden away near Notre dame has the most fabulous stain glass windows that have to be seen to be believed

Overrated?. Nice stained glass windows, but still not quite sure what all of the fuss is about. Had the longest wait of any place I visited in Paris, even with Museum Pass, and just nothing that excited me. I wouldn't put it on the top of my list for places to visit, but worthwhile if you have the time.

Beautiful church in the center of Paris. This is one of the older churches in Paris with magnificent fresco in the lower part and stunning glasswork in the upper part. Not too big so perfect for kids. The Conciergerie next to it is also worth the visit.

Worth seeing. Had to stand in line for about a half hour. It was worth waiting. Beautiful stained glass.For older people... be carefull for the small stairs you have to take. Not very good light.Also a good tip... when you visit Sainte-Chapelle, take a duo ticket for the Concergerie. Price : 12,00 euros.I know... Paris is expensive, but this is something you should have seen.
A piece of art. The best Church i visited in Paris, more beautiful than Notre Dame and Sacre Coeur. However, it is not free (EUR 8 per ticket).

Over priced compared to other attractions. I thought the entrance fee of 8.50 euros was very poor value for money compared to some of the other attractions in Paris. It was a nice little chapel but the emphasis is on little. it did have some really nice stained glass and I understand money is needed for renovation but if you are on a budget there are better ways to spend your money. There are other churches in Paris that are free to get into (including Notre Dame if you don't go up the bell tower).

Renovation work presently taking place spoils the visit. Located within the main police station, unfortunately at the time of our visit a whole side of the room is boarded off for renovation work which spoils the visit.
Beautiful. The only disappointment is that several of the stained glass windows are being restored. It was still very beautiful, and worth the wait to get in.

Do a concert. We went to a concert here at 7pm, of course being summer it was still light and we were able to see the stained glass windows. The chapel is rather small so doesn't take a great deal of time to see.My only criticism about the concert is that all of the explanations of the pieces played were in French with no written or verbal information in any other language.

One of the highlights of our visit. Absolutely not to be missed. Stunning stained glass, truly inspiring. If you go during high season, however, buy a museum pass to avoid the line. We waited for 45 minutes to get in, while Museum Pass owners zipped by. The museum pass can also be used at D'Orsay and Louvre, so it pays for itself.
13th century stained glass -- wow!. The stained glass windows are breathtaking and awe inspiring. Lines are long due to the security check, but once through that you are inside in just a few minutes.

Amazing. It is a chappel located in the actual justice palace, fee entrance: 8.50 euros for adults, during this time you need to expect long ques before enter and security check.it is a short visit no more than 45 minutes but the waiting line to enter could be for at least 30 minutes or more. ( august)Vitrals with different stories about catholic religion well conserved.stairs form base level to one upper floor not dificult to access unless mandatory wheelchair use.

Beautiful!. Unfortunately, they were renovating 1/2 of the church. So, half of the stained glass was not visible. But, what is visible is overwhelming. This is a quick tour that you can do in less than one hour. It's something to make sure you see.

So easy to overlook with Notre Dame nearby but don't!. This church will take your breath away. While not as large and dominant as its neighbour Notre Dame the stain glass windows are a sight to behold - simply breathtaking - get the audio guide.

Experienced the church with a concert. This is a beautiful church and there are frequently concerts held inside. We were lucky enough to see a poster for a Vivaldi concert while we were in Paris so were able to enjoy the chapel while listening to a string ensemble. It was a fabulous experience! The tickets are sold at the brasserie across the street so check there if you are interested in some culture with your culture.

Do a concert at Sainte-Chapelle. The chapel is beautiful (impressive stained glass windows literally surrounds you) but we really enjoyed attending an evening classical music concert by David Braccini and Classik Ensemble. A special treat, especially if you enjoy live classical music. They played nearly nonstop for almost 2 hours.

What a Beauty. Only now becoming more known, it is a must see. There was a slight line up but no longer than 30 minute waits at most (for everyone no matter if you have a pass or not- 1 line). The chapel area where you first enter (area with the gift shop) was nothing very special but once you go upstairs you really see what all the hype is about. Roof to floor, colourful stained glass from left to right. A little restoration going on but doesn't deter from much. Check it out!

Magnificent stained glass, amazing concert experience. We planned to attend a concert there as the idea of hearing live classical in a church filled with tall stained glass sounded great. It was. The church is old, being renovated, but that did not detract from the windows or the great sound of the music in that room. We heard baroque music but I'd go back for the Vivaldi pieces next time.
Windows, windows. What beauty and colors. Use paris pass to avoid long lines. Be sure and go up and down stairs. Main chapel very crowded

Stunning!. Worth doing while in the area of Notre-Dame. It's included in the Paris Pass but you still have to queue. When we entered the chapel, I wasn't overly impressed. But then, we went upstairs and I gasped at the spectacular view! The many long stained glass windows cover all the walls which makes for a breathtaking display. The chapel is small so it's a quick but worthwhile visit!
Huge and maginificent. You have to go here to see the magnificent, breathtaking stained glass windows. Take your time and really absorb all their beauty. This is gothic architecture at its finest!

Be sure to go upstairs. Allow enough time to read the information about the Chapelle. I was told not to miss the second floor and am glad I saw it! Beautiful. We did this as part of our two day museum pass.

An orgy of stained glass.. This is a small place but it is very easy to loose track of time taking in all of the stained glass. Do not forget to look at the floor and ceiling as neither will disappoint.
Not much of a queue but security tight, for obvious reasons, and more exit signs would help.
Totally unexpected!. Simply magnificent! A must see. I would have totally missed this had not my son told me about it. The stained glass left me breathless!

Breathtaking stained glass windows. This is the church with the architectural majesty befitting a royal house of workshop. The circular stained glass windows are unbelievable. If you can manage to be there on Good Friday when the crown of thorns is exhibited, you would be very blessed!

Beautiful church with amazing staind glass windows.. We enjoyed the chapel, as the staind glass windows are huge and encompass almost the entire chapel. It is quite a sight to see, however, half of the chapel is currently being restored. Having said that and the long lines to get into it, I would skip unless there was a short line to wait.

Disappointing and expensive. This church is so overrated. First, it's very small and it happened to be under renovation which they fail to tell you. You walk into something that looks like an office building or government office, go through security, then out to an open patio. There isn't much to see. Before I travelled I read about the stained glass window of this church and that it was a must see. Well, I don't agree. I saw it and it's nothing spectacular, especially after seeing Notre Dame. By the way, Notre Dame is free and Sainte Chapelle was something like $17 Euros per person. Not worth it for me. And most importantly, they should let visitors know about the renovation, so we have an option to enter anyway or not.
Beautiful Chapel. Although presently under renovation, much of the beautiful stained glass can still be fully appreciated. Don't miss a quick look here.

Very beautiful Cathedral. The best part of the Cathedral was going upstairs and seeing all the stain glass and architecture. Later in the day there is usually no lines and it doesn't take that long to get through the cathedral.

Stained glass. HUGE stained glass windows... small church, maybe we missed something? But we were in and out in about 15 mins after waiting in line for 30 mins,..Still very impressive. Apparently, the "crown of thorns" is there, I was hoping to see it, but it's not on display! (figures)
OK. Ok the glass is amazing, but how much glass can one person see in Paris . Not worth the wait or the money.
A surprise. The line up to Sainte-Chapelle is for the security check as the church is in the Police Precinct on the isle. Wait and see as it is the best leadlight you will ever see. Magnificient!

Stained glasses. People usually visit this place for the stained glasses, and they won't be disappointed. I loved the gift shop located downstairs; full of interesting souvenirs, such as toys of joan of arc, richard heart of lion and other famous characters of French history.

Stunning. We went early; we were in the queue by 9 for a 9:30 opening. The windows are just amazing, but the whole visit took less than an hour, so we were glad we had not stood in the long queues that form in the afternoon

If you have the musuem pass, it's worth a stop. The church itself is very small, but the stained glass is amazing. In some ways I found it more beautiful than Notre Dame. I only spent about 10 minutes inside the church because there is much to see. However, it was included on the musuem pass and very close to Notre Dame, so worth a quick stop. No real line when I stopped by.
Cost benefit not there. Well at E14, it cost roughly E1 per minute to see the beautiful stained glass windows. Nice and truly huge, but not enough else there.

The mother load of shining beauty. This is for me, the most jaw-dropping miniscular church in Paris. Come on a sunny day to fully appreciate the effect of natural light in the building. Its remarkable....almost enough to keep my tear ducts moist. at the Duck in through the Palais de Justice and be amazed by the soaring sight of flying buttresses,which does it for me,anytime. Yet, its the fleu-de-Lis ornamentation that takes your breath away. But wait....there is more.... For sheer poetry,climb the narrow spiral staircase and gaze at the most beautiful gothic Chapelle Haute. The 15 stained-glass windows seem to glow with red,wine and blue colors and its hard not to acknowledge spirituality seeping into your heart.. The walls are made of glass and make the anthology of scenes from 'Eden to the Apocalypse' outstanding,not withstanding the lovely rose window. Book yourself in for a concert,because the acoustics are remarkable and the pleasure immeasurable.

Amazing Stained Glass. This cathedral is absolutely beautiful. More gorgeous than Notre Dame, though not quite as large. The stained glass will take your breath away. Can't wait to return to Paris and see this again.

Rose window is worth the visit. We had the Paris Museum Pass and were able to bypass the lines and go directly into the church. Some parts of it is under contruction (August 2013) inside. Still, we saw plenty of stained glass. It's worth the visit!
Concert admist breathtaking stained glass. If you can catch the evening concerts - just 1 hour- it is truly amazing. I heard Vivaldi, four Seasons- perfection!

Worth it to hear Vivaldi. Go to the evening concert at Sainte-Chapelle and take it all in. I love the acoustics although there is renovation going on and part of the Chapel is covered. There's enough stained glass unexposed and wonderful music to make it a memorable evening. I wouldn't bother paying for the more expensive seats though....

Great 2nd Floor!. There's a little surprise when you go to the 2nd floor - the decorated glass is amazing - wait till the sun shine, and see the view .. really nice church.
You can skip the queue with the Museum pass!

The Most Beautiful Stained Glass Windows -- Ever. An unexpected treasure. Thank goodness for the Museum Pass, or we wouldn't have seen this place. The stained glass windows are amazing! If you have a choice between Notre Dame and Saint Chappelle, choose Saint Chappelle!!

Beautiful stained glass, for a price.. I thought this church was beautiful, but it really was only a 15/20 minute kind of visit and cost about €9. Also, there was a worker there hushing people the whole time, but it's not a working church anymore, so I found that confusing.
However, the stained glass was amazing so it was all worth it.
Well worth the visit.. This is a seller attraction and should be near the top of the list of important sites. The new slide show of the biblical scenes in the stained glass windows is very well done.

Great stained glass windows. While the stained glass windows but there are many other free alternatives that are present in churches. Perhaps not a great family attraction but if you are into stained glass and prepared to read thru the information cards then you will get value from the visit. The narrow stairs were a little difficult for some to negotiate. Admission was slow even with the Paris Museum Pass as they did not allow you to skip the queue like at other attractions. However, in saying that we noticed that those visiting the court entered via another adjacent security entrance without delay and came out into the same courtyard area. (Perhaps there is a shortcut and way of cutting 20 minutes off the waiting time although we did not try it.)

Amazing. Amazing glass work, They were renovating 5 of the panels, which spoiled the effect. However they had some very interesting videos and posters on how they were doing the renovation, which made up for it.

The most beautiful windows. I find French history facsinating and was thrilled to visit Sainte Chapelle which for so long has been associated with the French Royal family. Built in 13th Century it is impressive and contains superb stained glass windows - these were being renovated at the time of our visit however this did not distract from the experience, from the huge windows to the highly painted walls and the blue and gold painted ceiling. Hint - if you go to the Consierge and have a joint ticket you do not need to que and can go straight to the entrance.

Breathtaking. just one suggestion : GO! you will regret not doing so. It is the most amazing little church ever!as soon as you enter you see the part of the church who was used by the normal people (what an amazing work of art! ) while climbing those little stairs you will reach the magnificent part used by the nobles and king with its majestics windows. It is absolutely a beautiful place and a must see when in Paris.

Spectacular stained glass windows. I was a bit worried as to whether this would be worth visiting or not. You can't see the actual place from the outside until you go in and, whilst it looks good, it doesn't give away how amazing it is inside. The stained glass windows are incredible and worth the price of the admission, even though they are being restored. Only 4 stars from me because we were in and out in about 30 mins.

Try St-Severin as a free alternative. Had to queue twice - once to get through security and then again to pay. During the long wait in the Palace de Justice Car Park there was at least some entertainment watching a delivery man reversing into the long snaking queue of people waiting to pay.Once inside the stained glass is spectacular but at least 3 (possibly 4) of the windows are closed off for restoration work - unfortunately the ticket price isn't reduced accordingly.Think we spent more time queuing than in the attraction. Customer service could be improved in the shop - a helpful sign advising they don't sell stamps might be a useful clue of consumer demand.We also called into the St-Severin church - just as spectacular - no queue - and free - although there are donation boxes.

While a fairly small church, I find it more interesting that Notre Dame. The stained glass is mostly original and hundreds of years old. Spend some time looking at the panes and seeing the stores they convey. We attended a concert in Saint Chapelle and seeing the changing light of the setting sun through its glorious windows while hearing wonderful classic music was one of the highlights of our time in Paris.

Absolutely worth the visit--despite construction. One of my favourite attractions in Paris. One of the finest examples of High Gothic architecture anywhere.Unfortunately, a large section of the stained glass is being restored. While there is still a lot to see, you won't get the full effect because the flow of light is unusually restricted.Lower chapel is still beautiful, but it was better before they put it all those merchandising kiosks.Still worth the visit, especially if you pair it with La Conciergerie next door.

Notre Dame Is Great But This Is Better. Inside of this remarkable Church are 15 huge stained glass windows that are several stories tall and made in the 13th century. Both the lower floor, which is amazing, and the second floor where the windows are located are a remarkable testament to Gothic architecture and craftsmanship. A must see.

Don't miss this chapel. A beautiful space beautiful stain glass windows climb the small circular stairs to the beautiful chapel. Go on the balcony and look at the carved tiles on the walls they tell different stories like building the Ark and Adam & Eve. A Gem!

Unbelievable stain glass. We visited in July with our kids. This was the first museum we visited and we decided to buy our museum pass here. The wait was short compared to other attractions. It was very surprising how large the stain glass panels were. Pictures don't do it justice. Make sure to also walk outside to the "porch" area on the top level. There were some details on the wall, nice area to rest.

Nice stained glass - under construction. The stained glass is really impressive! You have to get the audio guide or you'll just be there 5 minutes. The guide explains the art, but sometimes you can't really see what they're referring to. If you like stained glass definitely come. For most it's just good.

Stained glass, oh my!. Definitely enjoy the lower chapel, it is wonderful, but as you climb the winding stairs and enter the upper chapel, your breath is taken away. Do not miss this. Go early to avoid crowds. Just pinch yourself to remember it is real!

Beautiful, intimate chapel -- be sure to make this a stop. When you round the corner after climbing the short flight of stairs to the second floor, you will find yourself momentarily breathless at the beautiful stained glass. Try to go on a bright sunny day so you can enjoy the rich colors and the patterns that the reflected light makes. There are cards in all languages with detailed descriptions of what is happening in each window (I tried hard but I couldn't quite make out all the intricate details that the cards described). If you have the time, listening to a tour guide would make this a much richer experience.

Not often visited but MAKE THE TIME. Currently still under renovation until 2014, one can still enjoy these exquisite stained glass windows documenting the texts from the Bible (remember to start on the left bottom and work in an up/down/clockwise direction). The skill that went into creating this environment is to be lauded even today.

A true medieval gem!. I am not sure how in my many visits to Paris, I had managed to always find a massive line to be able to enter. Well we finally managed to make it inside and it was absolutely worth it! The architecture is gorgeous and the stained glass is absolutely breathtaking. I would very likely rank it my favorite church in Paris. If you get a chance, read-up a bit on the history of the Saint Chapelle, the treasures once housed there will help you put everything in perspective.I HIGHLY recommend you include it in your plans when you visit Paris.

Charming Colorful Chapel. Not to be missed, even as part of it is under renovation. We've been twice. Make sure to see the bottom AND top levels. ... the bottom is a little jewel box, the top is a cathedral of brilliant blue and red-dominated stained glass surrounding you on 3 sides, that will take your breath away. Get tickets ahead, and avoid lines, go EARLY to avoid busy season crowds. You do have to climb 25 or so cramped circular stairs to get to the 2nd level with the stunning stained glass.

Stunning Church - Not worth 8.50pp!. The church is absolutely stunning inside with gorgeous red and blue walls and huge colourful stain glass windows. We spent about 15 minutes in there so was not worth 8.50 each and half of the main hall was scaffolded.

wow. another beautiful cathedral in paris. this was our first stop, and we were rewarded with a beautiful reward...the architecture on the outside is stunning and the inside will blow you away.... bought the museum pass so we bypassed the line....

Top shelf restoration. Amazing and painstaking restoration of the stain glass. Incredible workmanship and what a transition from old to rejuvenated. One has to admire the commitment of money and resource to such a project.Highly recommendedDavid of NZ

Spoilt by renovations. This is an exquisite monument, but it's very tired and so it's being renovated, which means that you can't enjoy the beauty. Wait until it's finished (not sure when). Also there are very few English information boards (or too few for the english speaking visitors).
Most amazing stained glass windows. This is a precious chapel in Paris and not to be missed. The stained glass it just so beautiful and the little chapelle is wonderful.

Hidden gem. Security queue was not good and the museum pass does not help bypass this. Remember to not stand in the second queue if you do have a pass though. The church itself is difficult to photograph from outside as it is crammed between other buildings. The highlights are the incredible stained glass windows inside though.

A Magical Evening. Rather than simply touring the exquisite Sainte-Chapelle during the day, we booked the twilight classical music performance concert in the chapel. It was truly magical.....a string quartet playing chamber music while the twilight sun shown through the stained glass of Sainte-Chapelle. Depending on which of the three seating areas one chooses, the concert costs between 30 and 45 euros per ticket....but it is well worth the experience.

A must see!!. Sainte- Chapelle was by far our favourite site in Paris. As soon as we saw all the stain glass upstairs our breaths were taken away. The only downside was that our museum pass didn't allow us to skip the line, so we had to wait a hour to get in, however the wait was definitely worth it! Can't wait to go back and see it again when all the construction is finished!
String Quartet at Sunset. The classical music filling the chapel and sun illuminating the stained glass created an almost dreamlike atmosphere. Don't miss this.

Amazing Stained Glass Windows. We have seen a lot of European cathedrals - if you like stained glass, this is the place to go. They were amazing & simply gorgeous. Worth a stop by, only a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame.

Beautiful stained glass work. Visited this place in Sept 2012 it was under construction then:-( we visited on weekend at 9:30am there was long queue and you have to buy tickets for entry. Once inside stained glass windows and work is mesmerizing there is small winding staircase on side of entrance which leads you upstairs. There is nothing much to explore once you have seen the windows, ceiling…it took us in total to 30 to 40 min to be done with everything. But in my opinion its close by to many important places so it worth it to see this Sainte Chapelle .( note :- the travel time in metro is quite a lot because it’s a huge city so plan your visits accordingly and anyplace you visit you have to walk so please choose comfortable footwear, sept it was really hot carry bottle of water all time, Finding restrooms in paris is not easy and be prepared they won’t be clean, easiest way to find one is go to Mc D, or Starbuck mostly it would be in the basement)
Must see in Paris!. Beautiful stained glass and excellent place for getting a feel for Paris history. Would consider this a must see in Paris.

Spectacular stained glass. Located not far from Notre Dame, this is worth including for the stunning stained glass of the chapel. There are cafes nearby for a break in between seeing this and Notre Dame. Do try to squeeze this one in- does not take long except that having Paris Museum Pass does not prevent wait in line here. Fortunately lines were not long. Some restoration work being done on one wall, but does not diminish overall effect.

A Jewel. This is one of the most important sights on Paris. A jewel of the middle ages that will blow you away even if you have no religion. Stained glass windows of brilliant colour shooting up to the heavens in a very small space which highlights the genius of unknown artisans. To think that this was made in what is called the Dark Ages! Go!

A wonderful surprise. This hidden gem is absolutely spectacular if you are into medieval gothic degin and stained glass windows. We visited in a thunderstorm and it was fantastic, I imagine in full sun the coulours would be amazing. It's like a sceeen from a Disney movie.

Sainte-Chapelle is really nice. Well,Sainte-Chapelle is really nice,even beautiful,but somehow(I do not know why)I expected more.Stained glass windows are really something to see.We waited 45 minutes to get there,because it is very popular place for tourists,and if you have enough time,you should visit it.Conciergerie is also there.
Beautiful chapel, great concert venue. Gorgeous windows and perect acoustics. Keep your eye out for the frequent evening concerts. We bought affordable same-day tix across the street in a gift shop.

Nice but better places to see. There is a great deal of history at this location, beautiful stained windows and lots of tourists. I would recommend a visit to the church...St-Gervais/St-Protais in the Marais section for more stained glass windows of equal beauty.
Stunningly beautiful. Breathtakingly beautiful church with a midnight blue ceiling covered in gold stars and truly gorgeous stained class windows.
Short tour, but great. Spend 15 minutes and see the most spectacular stained glass windows in the world. The Chapelle is undergoing restoration but is still worth the time.

Stunning. I have been many years trying to get into this, but refusing to queue. Possibly the Tour de France being on meant the queues not too bad, so we paid the steep entrance fee and enjoyed a ten minute feast for the eyes.
A jewel!. Beautiful chapel hidden with a gothic look behind the Conciergerie (another mythic place to visit). Like a secret to be whispered..

Most beautiful stained glass in Paris. It's best to go on a sunny day, but that's when the crowds and the lines to get in will be longest. Get there early - In the summer, it opens at 9:30a. If you get there and find the lines too long, go to the Conciergerie just a block away towards the north bank of the river and purchase a "jumelé" ticket for both sites. There's usually no line to get in, and the visit is worthwhile. You'll get to see the cell where Marie Antoinette was held and the private chapel they built for her while she was there. Then take your ticket for Sainte Chapelle and "jump the line" by going in on the left side of the entrance. You can also use this entrance if you have a museum pass, but I don't recommend getting the pass unless you're willing to do 3+ museums a day during your stay.When you enter on the ground floor, take a few moments to look at the small chapel and small stained glass windows on this level. Skip the gift shop - you can do that on the way out. Then trudge up the circular staircase into the main chapel and be prepared to be awed. Malcolm Miller who is the resident expert guide at Chartres (not to be missed if you have time to do a day trip out of Paris) told us that because most people were illiterate, the churches and cathedrals all told the story of the bible in their glass. Big places like Chartres Cathedral and even smaller ones like Sainte Chapelle have enough windows to be able to let you "read" the entire biblical story. They are the "libraries" of their time.Grab one of the explanatory placards on the way in and spend as much time as you like gazing at the art and the story in the glass. If you want to try to grab a photo or two of the glass, set your camera to *under* expose by one or two f-stops. Use a normal exposure to shoot the length of the chapel.

Ounce for ounce, the most beautiful church in Paris. No church compares in beauty, ounce for ounce, to Sainte-Chapelle. I say ounce for ounce because it's really a very small church. Despite that, the wait usually isn't prohibitively long. Definitely worth it.

exquisite stained-glass windows @ Sainte Chapelle. Compared to all the other famed cathedral and churches in Rome, Florence, Paris and Warsaw, the Sainte Chapelle's stained glass windows still strikes me as the most impressive and exquisite!However, when we visited on the 4th July 2013, almost half of the 15 panels of window were closed off for cleaning and restoration. (Still, the admission fee was full-priced, Euro 8.50)But even then, the light pouring through the remaining window was impressive. However, my fiancee was most dissappointed and annoyed because he felt deceived. Having been there some years back when all the windows were unobstructed and seen the stunning effects, he wanted to share with me the same wonderment of such light play. It was a shame I never got to experience the same. How is it that Sainte Chapelle do not post updates about restoration work so foreign visitors like us are informed beforehand so we can prioritize selection of sites to visit.

Impressive. I'm not a religious person, so buildings like this have no significance to me. But, I can appreciate what they mean to others and the skills involved building them. The stained glass really is impressive, don't think I've ever seen anything like it before. Great for photography.If you've bought a combined ticket at Conciergerie, you can skip the much bigger queues here.

A real life claidescope. Imagine being placed inside a claidescope on a sunny day and you have Sainte Chappelle! This little gem is not to be missed on a sunny day when the windows will sparkle for you! Start downstairs and work your way up the winding stone stairway to the upper level for one of the most amazing sights in Paris. A small gift shop on the lower floor sells wonderful postcards of the windows if your camera doesn't! Not to be missed and best on a sunny day!

Well worth a visit. A ticket to here and the Conciergerie next door is 12.50 euros. Is a little expensive for what it is, but this is a lovely little church set on two floors. The ground floor is lovely, but the stained glass windows upstairs are marvellous, not to be missed, but will only take about 40 minutes to visit this church at the most. Some steep, circular, narrow steps to get upstairs and down again so not really suitable if you have mobility problems.

a must see. this is one of the best sites in Paris. I believe it outdoes Notre Dame. The chapel is amazing and you are in awe when you stand in the center and let the light filter through the stain glass. You will be speechless.

The most beautiful windows. Bought tickets to hear the Vivaldi - Four Seasons concert. The best concert I've ever heard in one of the most beautiful churches I've ever been in. Beware if you go during the summer because it is very warm inside due to all of the windows.

C'est beau. My second visit to this church. Windows are being restored presently so don't get the full effect of the surround experience of the stained glass. Queue to get in for airline security check. Would like more information about sanctuary area.

Stunning Stain Glass. The title doesn't begin to do the chappel justice, walking up the steps and coming thru the door to the hall is surreal. The sheer magnitude of stain glass and the detail has to be seen to be believed. History buffs will adore this chapel but even if you aren't the beauty will take your breath away!!!

Breathtaking!. When you walk up the stairs into the cathedral, you will be speechless! Visiting is well worth it, just to see the reactions of other people's faces. Beautiful stained glass that is a definite must see! Beware, the line can be somewhat long (not anything close to Notre Dame), but worth it.
So beautiful!. You must visit Sainte-Chappelle. It is so gorgeous - a real gem. It was smaller than I imagined it, but truly so impressive and beautiful. Well worth a visit!

Beautiful. We saw a Vivaldi concert in Sainte-Chapelle. It was a great way to see the stained glass. We didn't know if advance however that it was being re-finished, and the one whole wall of scaffolding was kind of distracting and a bummer. We may not have spent the money on the concert it we had known ahead of time. Still it is a must see on anyone's list visiting Paris.

Absolutely breathtaking!. When you enter Sainte-Chapelle, it isn't much to look at from inside or out. I was honestly about to leave when I noticed people going up a small staircase, so decided to follow them. Glad I did, otherwise I would have missed out on seeing the beautiful stained glass windows of the main chapel. Absolutely breathtaking, and one of the things I love most about Paris - the little hidden gems tucked away.The chapel is on the Ile de la Cite, on the same properly as the Palais de Justice. Because of this, there is extra security and a bit of a wait in line. There is no cost with the Paris Museum Pass, but this is the only attraction I found where the pass didn't allow us to skip the line. Worth the wait though!

Beautiful, Beautiful, Beautiful!. If you are not too exhausted going to a concert in Sainte-Chapelle is not to be missed! the chamber music in the stained glass chapel is the perfect touch for a memorable trip to Paris! The concerts are not long and the Chapel is centrally located so it is easy to get there before or after dinner.

WOW!. Had never heard of this place, but cannot imagine why not. It is breathtakingly beautiful. Walked around this small cathedral for over an hour just in awe. There is one bad thing, there is construction on some of the glass and you cannot see it all. I will most certainly be back once it is finished.

Amazing stained glass windows. The detail on the stained glass windows would take your breath away. They were so intricate and beautifully preserved. The place was under renovation but the wall paintings were still quite stunning. Don't miss this place.Tip: Paris Museum Pass will let you skip the queue - go straight to the entrance. We bypassed 50-100 people in the queue. When we came back out 30 minutes later, some of these original people were still waiting!

Magnificigant!. this is the 2nd sight you MUST see after the Eiffle tower.
The stained glass is the best in the city, country and maybe the continent.

Small cathedral but worth it. This was one of the smallest cathedrals we visited while in London and Paris, but it was in my top two favorite (St Paul's in London being #1) . Won't take you long to tour but the stain glass windows are beautiful. Try to go when it is sunny outside so you can truly appreciate the beauty of the windows.
a must see in Paris. do whatever you have to do to go. the floor to ceiling stained glass windows are incredible. just love
Well worth the visit. Even under renovation, this little chapel is well worth a visit. It looks like a normal chapel from the ground floor but when you go to the first floor, it is amazing

very nice. Magnificent Gothic building. Very beautiful rose windows in it. Perhaps the world's most beautiful church building. Definitely worth a visit. Admission is free for under 18 years of age. Between 13-14 hours each day locked.
Beautiful church. Even it has the most beautiful glass windows works in Paris and maybe in the world, it is very small and summer tourist crowds make it difficult to have a good observation.

A Hidden Gem. We didn't know about this chapel until we was that it was included in the Paris Museum Pass. We entered with a small wait (maybe 5-10 minutes through security). At first, I was disappointed, until I realized that I was actually in the lower level and hadn't yet climbed the stairs to the chapel. Once in the chapel, I saw what all the fuss is about. This little chapel has 15 massive stained glass windows that have just gone through renovation - they completely surround the space. If you have some extra time in Paris, it is worth checking this out.

Lovely - but way overpriced. We queued for 20 minutes, paid an outrageous €11 each, for something that you need only 15 minutes to see everything! Yes, the windows are lovely and worth seeing, but it's small and very crowded, and €11 is way too much. If you do go head straight upstairs where the windows are, as there is not much to see downstairs. Disappointing.
Give your self time!. A less visited gem in the city. Take extra time for security though, the Chapel is on the courthouse grounds so security is tight. The stain glass is beautiful!

A must see in Paris. We weren't expecting much but can I say wow! This is a must see in Paris - the windows are breathtaking. The colors are fantastic. We could have stayed hours just looking at the windows!

go late in the day for fewer crowds. The line was short when we went in the last hour of the day, but it was down the block earlier. This is a beautiful jewel of a place! Just gorgeous. Not very large. My friend heard a classical concert there one night and loved it.

Possibly the most beautiful sight in Paris. My partner wanted to visit here, and I didn't know what to expect, but it is stunning. The level of detail is quite remarkable, and in full sunlight this must be something even more special.
I can't say much more, but definitely try and fit it in if you want spectacle, without traipsing round ANOTHER gallery or museum!

Amazing stained glass and beautiful building. Another Paris must-see. The stained glass in this building is very wonderful. There are renovations going on, but we saw most everything and it is just awesome to see something so old and so beautiful.

Vivaldi et al concert in renovated surroundings. Having queued to see the interior by day, the opportunity to book a visit combined with string music ensemble instead by night was too tempting given the programme of music. It appears frequent concerts are arranged and well publicized. Plenty of restaurants in surrounding area of Notre Dame and the Palais de Justice/Law courts on the left bank make for a complete evening.

Amazing and awe inspiring!. The top floor chapel is magificent and well worth the spiral staircase up. It is hidden in the French Court buiding so you must go through a metal detector line. Then once inside walk through a small coutyard to get to the church. If you have a museum pass you may bypass the ticket line and walk right in to the lower chapel. The lower chapel was for the servants and is painted nicely, that is where the gift shop is too. To the left of the entrance is the staircase up to the upper chapel. I do not understand how anyone would not be awed by these walls of stained glass artistry. The chapel is undergoing renovation right now so two sections of windows were behind blinds but this is still worth a visit even during the renovations. I only wish they had more seats to sit and view the sun shine through the biblical stories.
Most gorgeous stained glass ever!. This is a must in Paris. The stained glass is the most beautiful I have ever seen. The contrast to the lower chapel was also interesting.

Exquisite collection of stained glass. The stained glass collection on the second floor of the Sainte-Chapelle is just breath-takingly pretty. As expected, much restoration work is needed to keep them in their pristine state. Hence, the price (E8.50) of the admission ticket. It is conveniently located just opposite the Cathedrale Notre-Dame and across from the latin quartier. The nearest metro stations would be Cite or St Michel. The line for the ticket may seem long. But that is due to the security check at the entrance. After which, you can proceed to the ticket counter just outside the chapel. They sell souvenirs on the 1st floor.

Just go! Wow.. Such a gem - so often overlooked in the bigger 'monument' tours, but this MUST be on your to see list - the stained glass is truly breathtaking (make sure you see upstairs - and sunny days are best).

Vivaldi at Sainte-Chapelle. Across the street from the entrance to the Sainte Chapelle there is a corner cafe. Go there and ask about tickets for the Vivaldi's Four Seasons performance. If there happens to be one on that evening, then you are in luck. Tickets cost from 20 to 40 euro each, depending on where you sit, with more expensive seats closer to the front. Concessions for students and childern are also available. There is a first-class string quartet, plus harpsichord, playing the full Four Seasons in all their splendour. Coupled with the incredible stained glass atmosphere inside the Chapel, this concert was definitely worth the money, truly a highlight of our family's week in Paris. Unforgettable!!!

Breathtaking stained glass!. Small chapel with 2 levels, top level is the most impressive! The stained glass is incredible and it is on the Paris museum pass so again skip to the front of the line! Teens under 18 are free (as at most museums). Definitely worth the stop!

Breathtaking. Was here for a classical concert and I was in awe the entire time. This church is beyond lovely and the stained glass is jaw dropping. Just steps away from Norte Dame, this is a must see. You will be surrounded by beauty in this place. The church is in the process of being restored o you will want to confirm that it is open.
Amazing Place. Situated in the grounds of the present day law courts this chapel built by King Louis IX of France in around 1250 and has some of the best stained glass windows you will ever see

more impressive than Notre Dame. stained glass unbelievable a must see. Rick Steeves profiled on his video. Not a big fan of his, but he got this right, along with Hotel Bosquet, Rue de MArs, and a lot others. Must see

Under renovation. We were disappointed in Sainte-Chapelle since about 1/4 of it was covered up and under renovation. I realize that maintenance is necessary, but it would be nice if they reduced the cost of admission when that is the case. The cost was 8.50 euros each ( just over $11.00 USD) for about 10 minutes of viewing.The chapel is much smaller than I imagined. The stained glass windows that we saw were very beautiful. It would probably be very enjoyable if more was visible, less people, and less admission fee. Can't deny it's beauty, however.

Breathtaking. So beautiful! Be sure to go on a sunny day so you can fully experience the gorgeous light streaming in the stained glass windows (which account for 75% of the exterior walls). Do not miss!

Beautiful windows, but.... Expensive short visit and about 40% of windows covered and being restored. Nice, but frankly a ripoff. Notre Dame has magnificent windows, free entry and the queue does move quite quickly.

Gorgeous Stainglass. The church doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you are inside and upstairs the windows are simply gorgeous and a bit overwhelming. Take you time looking at each window and each scene.

Enjoy an Evening Concert Here!. There isn't a more beautiful setting than St. Chapelle for an evening concert. The stained glass is amazing (even with the scaffolding, which was a bit annoying) and the acoustics are wonderful here. It's a great opportunity to catch a glimpse of this special place and to hear some great classical music in an intimate and beautiful setting. A step back in time. Love it!

Amazing windows but nothing else... Really amazing stained glass windows but there's nothing else to see. Still worth the visit though. You could never see anything like it elsewhere so just go for the windows.
Fantastic. Although part of it is being refurbished, the stain glass is spectacular! There is information on how stain glass is made that is fascinating.

Awesome. Despite having the Museum Pass you are not allowed to bypass the line. So we waited almost an hour in a line that ended just in front of the Palace of Justice gate. Worth the wait in my opinion. You enter a lower chamber at first which in itself is pretty but then you climb the small stairs up and enter the chapel itself. Because the chapel is actually small and the stained glass windows so tall and take up most of the walls, it seems all the more that amazing. Saying it is gorgeous doesn't do it justice. It was probably the most beautiful thing I saw in my 4 days in Paris (including all the art I saw).

Nice stain glass but expensive. We went because of the stain glass, but it was pricey for something that can be seen in 15 minutes or so. Lines were not too bad but I am not sure I would make this a must see in Paris.

breathtaking windows. I have been to Paris many times and never visited this chapel. I really think this is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen in my life. The colors and the stained glass are unparalleled. Don’t miss this.

Beautiful!. You have to look in order to find the entrance to Sainte -Chappelle which is enclosed within the Ministry of Justice building. Just look for the line on the sidewalk. Everyone has to wait in the security line even those with the Paris Museum Pass. The stained glass is incredible!

Breathtaking. Literally breathtaking. I got to the top of that spiral staircase and stepped into the upper chapel and gaped. It is spectacular, unbelievable, amazing. Is it worth queuing up for ages to get in? YES!!! However, try to get there as early as possible. I recommend just before they open on a Sunday morning, which worked for me.By the way - that long queue outside is to get through the security checks. If you have a museum pass, tough, you still have to go through security. Once past that, however, your pass will help you skip the queue for tickets.

look around the corner. If you visit notre dame across from there is this wonderfull little chapelle quite stunning and well worth a visit the paintings on the walls are so colourful people tend to overlook it but go and you won't be dissapionted
So beautiful. An architectural gem with all the stained glass windows. If you like music try and get to one of the concerts. Listening to beautiful music in such a fantastic setting is very special.

Stunning. This cathedral is located very near Notre Dame. It is small but is incredible with its HUGE walls of stained glass windows. We did the audio guide but would not recommend it. It mostly described each stain glass window and it was impossible to find what they were talking about. The windows are made up of so many panels it is confusing. Better to just go in, and soak up the beauty. We went around 2 or 3 PM, no line, no crowds.
Largest stained glass. It's got the world's largest piece of stained glass which forms 75% of the surface area of the church. It's next to the Conciergerie and Notre-Dame so you can't miss this!

Beautiful sights and sounds. My husband and I attended a concert here and it was magnificent. Beautiful stained glass all around and wonderful youthful musicians playing Vivaldi. This is a medieval building, so asto things like airconditioning or heating- there is none and there should not be! If you attend a concert here just dress so you may adjust to the temp. Sainte Chapelle is not to be missed.
You should not miss this. For the famous huge colorful glass, and wonderful ceiling, you should not miss this one. And it's very close the Notre Dame

Always beautiful! Toujours belle!. I have been to Ste. Chapelle probably five times in the last 10 years and I am always blown away by its beauty. No church of any size that I have seen in Europe can match its breath-taking stained glass windows. It is important to arrive about 15 minutes before opening time to get in before the long lines start. Be advised that you must go through security to get in to the area because it is within a government area.
Absolutely beautiful. Sainte-Chapelle is a breathtaking experience, made even better by attending a sunset concert of music with a string quartet plus soprano doing classical music.
Stained-glass is phenomenal. You don't want to miss the entire Bible depicted in beautiful stained glass. Try for a Sunny day. You will be amazed. There's a bit of a wait but it's worth it.

Awesome. I paid for my ticket and walked in to the room just off the entrance. I thought it was pretty but not worth the entrance fee. I then followed everyone upstairs. You walk through the doorway and WOW. You have to see to appreciate.

Beautiful stained glass. When you enter there are about 50 narrow stairs to the left to go up but it's worth it because the stained glass is beautiful. Have the Rick Steves book if you can because it explains the scenes. The patio has a beautiful sculpture to look at as well.

Stunning interior and concert performance. Sainte-Chapelle is a beautiful chapel and quite different to the often stark Gothic churches seen all over France. Intricately painted all over in bright reds, blues and golds, it's more like a palace. We also attended a terrific performance of Vivaldi's Four Seasons by an excellent ensemble of professional musicians one night, a special experience in this setting. Tickets were available at the Chapelle.

Absolutely stunning!. Beautiful ancient chapel. Not to be missed. The entire bible is depicted on the stained glass windows. Amazing! Be sure to read the literature while you're there to get a better understanding of the history and meaning behind everything there.

windows of colors. when we walked in after a rather short wait and full inspection by police!, I thought "OK it is nice but not deserving all that fuss" there were small stained glass windows and yes the place was couple of hundred years old.we were almost missed the small doorway in the corner which led us to the real wonder. really surprising when you come out of tiny entrance to the magnificent hall full of colors and light. all those tiny pieces of glass brought together.btw there is another place nearby not that much publicized. it is Conciergerie just next door to Saint Chapelle. it is part of the old palace and an old prison which held famous Marie Antoinette before her execution.

amazing stained glasses. This chapel is known for its amazing stained glasses. Bring a binocular because they are too tall! There are free sheet guides for visitors that has information about each stained glass.

such beautiful stained glass. Well worth the visit- if you go on a weekday earlier in morning- there is virtually no wait at all. Loved the stained glass- only a very small part was covered for restoration. The glass panels illustrate every book in the Bible. Took some beautiful pictures here. If you like stained glass, this is the place. Also, be sure to get the laminated guides inside that will explain each window

If it is sunny outside - stop what you're doing and go!. We have been to Sainte-Chapelle on two other occasions and it unfortunately was not sunny both times, which makes a beautiful sight of the stain glass windows into a spectacular sight of the stain glass windows. We just went again on our most recent trip and it was sunny! I am so glad we went, since it was like seeing it for the first time.
Amazing. A must see in Paris. It is breathtaking to see a church that is completely covered in stain glass windows on three sides.

Stained Glass Glory. The upper chapel is reached by climbing a small dark spiral staircase. When you arrive at the top and see the windows, it seems as if the stone structure has melted away leaving only the gorgeous stained glass windows. We arrived in the upper chapel just as the sun appeared and the light shining through the stained glass was literally heavenly. Definitely worth the wait to get through the security lineup.

Stained glass windows. We queued up probably half and hour before opening and were 13th and 14th in line. Fascinating to watch people in front come out the police security check and the look on their faces is sometimes "Huh? I'm in the middle of a courtyard, where is the chapel???". There was soon I guess a couple of hundred people in there, but plenty of room for all.The ground level where the staff went to church is quite elegant in its own right, but the reason you re there is to climb the narrow winding staircase - me with my walking stick - to what I once saw described as "like being inside a jewel". I think thats going a bit far, but it certainly is spectacular. Some of the panes are a bit dark where the sun doesn't reach, and naturally some panes were screened off for cleaning. The bench seating along one side is a good idea, allowing you to rest your neck for a while looking up at the same time. All but the lowest are too high to actually see the story they tell.Don't miss the outside balcony - some really interesting statuary at eye level.Good value on the Museum pass, so much else to see within 100m (Conciergie next door, flower market around the corner, Notre Dame and Crypt just down the road, several nice picnic spos on the Isle).

A fascinating mystic experience. Even if you are not religious you are taken aback by the stained glass, the beauty of the sanctuary and the ambiance. a good camera will help you remember the exquisite environment for years to come. It is not the majestic Notre Dame but it has a special flavor of its own.
Awe inspiring as always. Don't let the length of the line deter you--it moves quickly and the space you will visit is unique in the world. Spectacular glass.

A small chapel and so beautiful. Worth a visit. In its own way, is more impressive than NotreDame! The sheer volume of stained glass windows is amazing! The effect of visiting the downstairs first and then entering the king's section of the chapel is memorable.

So worth the visit.. If you are going to make the trip to see the Notre Dame,it would be sinful to not make the visit to Sainte Chapelle as well! It is only a 1 block walk away from Notre Dame and so worthwhile.The chapel on the ground floor was beautiful and deceiving of what was in store as you climb the narrow winding stairs to the second floor.The stained glass windows that you see at the top of the stairs immediately catch your eye and makes one gasp in its beauty.
One of the most beautiful churches in Europe. I try to visit Sainte-Chapelle every time I go to Paris. The stained glass windows are among the most beautiful things I have seen in my life.
Try to enjoy a concert here. It's worth the effort to plan ahead to buy concert tickets. The chapel is small enough that it is a nice counter balance to the majesty that is Notre Dame

Vivaldi concert at Sainte-Chapelle Magical. The music and the setting were both inspiring. I think every ticket had been sold for the 7 pm concert on Sunday, June 23, and everyone who shared that experience was certainly blessed.
Exquisite. You may think when you enter on the ground level, that this is the chapel. Oh no! Up the winding stone staircase, and it takes your breath away. So worth the climb!

Windows very pretty.. The windows were good, not as good as we were told, but oh, those gargoyles!!!! The building is covered with many, many gargoyles all looking down at you. It was a fascinating experience!

Recital at Sainte-Chapelle. A wonderful recital in a beautiful place. Unfortunately the left wall was covered with plasterboard as maintenance was being done - nevertheless an amazing display of stained glass windows and ornate woodwork.

Don't Miss. This doesn't take at all long to see and the stained glass is amazing. Be sure to go on a sunny day however, I can't imagine what the windows would have looked like without sun. Be prepared for a lot of winding staircases--that's where my shin splints started!

Pretty!. A bit too expensive really at 8 euros just to look at some stained glass windows. But they are very lovely stained glass windows - better than the average church stained glass windows. But at the end of the day they are church stained glass windows with bible paintings/themes just like in every church you've ever been in. These ones are probably older and prettier though.

Don't miss out. When you walk in you are surrounded by amazing stained glass windows. From the pictures I thought it would be a much wider church but when you get in there it actually is quite small which adds to the intimacy. Be sure to visit on a sunny day when you can fully enjoy the glass windows as the sun shines through.

Great views. The church is really beautiful, but just siting there outside to enjoy the view is a Must. Have a coffee in front of Saint Chapelle, and then go up and stay there for a while. Take a wine to see Paris get dark.....
Is the Rodin worth your time?. We did the Musee. While there's info & works, they didn't impress me that much, Musee D'Orsee had Rodin works that satisfied my needs.

Beautiful stained glass windows. Incredible stained glass windows that go on forever toward the heavens! One of the must-see churches in all of Paris- the Crown of Thorns altar is also incredible. More bang for your travels than even Notre Dame- go after a Paris downpour or early/late in day to avoid the inevitable crowds. Steep, winding stairs to take you to the next viewing level-you need to watch your step! Even the inlaid patterns on the main chapel floors are and incredible visual feast. In an area not expected: at the center of the Palais of Justice and Conciergerie.
Cool glass. The chapelle was unique, but a little pricey for what you got. Glad I got to see it but not a required stop, given the other nearby sites.

Paris' hidden gem.. This extraordinary building is tucked away but still easy to find. It is simply the most ethereally beautiful and elegant building in Paris. Not huge, not grand, not majestic, just sublime. Do not miss.

So beautiful!. We almost missed the beauty upstairs because the stairs leading to it were so small! So glad we didn't! It was so beautiful I cried - totally embarrassing my teens. Definitely worth a visit!

My favorite thing we saw in Paris!. Go see this! You walk up a tiny winding staircase, and then VIOLA, one of the most gorgeous rooms I have ever seen. They are restoring some of the windows (2013) so there may be a section covered up for a while, but it is still spectacular. Well worth the wait in line to go see it.

SPECTACULAR COLOR. This is a tiny chapel with the most incredible stained glass windows! Essentially the upper walls of all four walls of the chapel are intricate stained glass stories of religious events. You can easily visit this structure if you are also visiting Notre Dame. I am a 'non-believer' and was awed by the beauty and the spirituality of the artisans who designed and created this beautiful jewel of a chapel.

Inspirational. One of the most beautiful sights in Pais. The line moved quickly and once inside you climb narrow stairs and we heard each person let out the same "ahhh!" as they entered the cathedral and viewed the splendor of artisans who were indeed inspired by God...very moving experience only surpassed by the cathedral at Chartres.
The prettiest church in Europe. Standing under the stained glass windows you feel as though you are in a jewel box, absolutely spectacular.

Stained glass galore. If you're going to Paris for a week or less, get the Paris museum pass. With that, we were able to get in to Sainte-Chapelle and it was certainly worth the stop! Such a beautiful chapel.
Amazing!. My husband, daughter and I visited Sainte Chapelle on a recommendation of a friend of my daughter. The stained glass was worth making the visit. You have to see it to believe it.
Amazing stain glass. Since I had the museum pass I got to skip a huge line. The stain glass was amazing and so were the intricate carvings.

Amazing stained glass. If in Paris, you have to go to Sainte Chapelle. This beautiful jaw dropping building has some of the most beautiful wall to wall stained glass in the world. y are close to finishing a several year renovation and I really liked seeing the difference between the restored glass and the unrestored glass.
Breathtaking. Even with renovations going on, the space is truly awe inspiring. Shorter lines than Notre Dame and a much more spectacular.
Go on a sunny day. In order to fully enjoy the vitreous, go on a sunny day. Grab a card (for free) by the door that explains each one of the colored glass compositions.
Very beautiful stained glass windows. Amazingly beautiful stained glass windows on the second floor of Sainte-Chapelle. However, the stairs are narrow so walk carefully upstairs.
Stunning original stain glass windows. Loved the beautiful colored light created by the wall to wall stain glass windows. Worth the wait line

see this on a sunny day. This is a late Medieval masterpiece, a small, almost entirely stained glass building. But unfortunately I saw it on a rainy day and expecting it to glow with color, it was a little disappointing and very crowded with dripping wet tourists with cameras and cell phones.There are some lovely architectural details in gold-leaf at the altar, however. Also, there is a small but reasonably priced gift shop.

Do not miss this!. You will never see more spectacular stained glass anywhere! It is stunning how much glass there is in Sainte Chapelle. It is not an especially large church, but you will probably hear the most gasps from visitors here than any other place. There is a long, narrow spiral staircase to get in the church as well as another similar staircase to exit.

little Gem. Sainte-Chapelle is impressive and worth a look. The second floor is almost completely surrounded in stained glass. It is small and if you are not into studying each panel it will only take an hour or so.
Gorgeous!. A less discovered jewel. Truly amazing stained glass windows. Not visited enough by tourists. You walk in without knowing what is in store and come out amazed!!!

A must see on any trip to Paris. I thought the entrance to Sainte-Chapelle was the room in which you enter. It was still interesting an historic. However, don't miss the stairs up to the actual chappelle. The room took my breath away. It is absolutely gorgeous with the stained glass walls. Even having one wall in refurbishment, it was still very stunning and a definite must see.

Magnificent glass stained windows from13th century. The church is within the palace of justice compound and one must enter through security control. We waited around 15 minutes to buy a ticket. Upstairs one can find the amazing window each depicting a story out of the bible. One can also learn how the windows were originally made and how they do get preserved. The seem also to have concerts there which must be fantastic.

Sheer artistry in stained glass and stone. It is hard to believe that the soaring beauty seen here is all in stone and stained glass which all seems to defy gravity. This is one of the most famous Gothic structures anywhere and is truly a high point of the art of stone and glass, allied in the most extraordinary way.As advised by others, a Museum Pass is the way to go for this and other sites in Paris. It enables one to avoid queues at most destinations and represents great value. One tip for first-time visitors: select what you want to see and aim for two sites a day. If you don't have time to see all the sites you want, save them up for the next time.
