Heavenly. The upper level of this church is unlike any other. Amazing. The stained glass is spectacular. One small portion was being restored, which meant a large white curtain was up, but the remainder was amazing. You simply can't miss this chapel when in France. Some unique items in the gift shop too, which was nice.

Beautiful, sunny or not.. We were hoping for a sunny day to go to Saint-Chapelle but didn't get one. Instead it was overcast. That did not stop the beauty of Saint-Chapelle. Simply gorgeous! We went on a Sunday afternoon and did not have any line.

Magical Chapelle - a must go to. Friends of ours highly recommended that we visit . The windows are outstanding. It is truly magical and the light from the sun shining through the stained glass is amazing. This is well worth a visit. Be prepared for long lines but the wait is worth it.
Concert venue. Only saw it at night whilst attending a concert. Impressive windows but didn't do them justice because dark outnside
Beautifully different. The line was extremely long. The outside structure was nothing extravagant. The inside was very French. It was delightfully different.
stained glass. If you want to see a chapel with 3 walls almost entirely made of stained glass then you ust visit this place.

Oh, the beauty. If there is one place of spiritual nature to see in Paris, it is Sainte-Chapelle. When the sun is streaming through the stained glass, it is almost over whelming. Be aware, that right now, windows 4 (I think) though 9 are being repaired and under shrouds - but it is still more than worth the effort to see this magnificent space.

Heaven on earth. This is one of the most wonderful churches of the world. The lower floor is imposing, but when you get to the upper floor, you feel exactly what their builders and designers expected, in the Middle Ages: as being in heaven. The stained-glasses figure among the better achieved ones ever, the effect simply transports you to a different world, a world of transcendence and spirituality. Take your time, sit down. Relax. Not a visit to be done in a hurry. Entrance may be a somewhat tedious and take a lot of time, because there is a restriction in the number of people in there at the same time. Attention: as the SC is inside the Court building, you will not be allowed to enter with any metallic thing (even forks are prohibited).
Jaw dropping. Climb the spiral stairs to emerge into a chapel that is a blaze of colour and glorious decoration. The chapel leaves Notre Dame de Isle de Paris for DEAD.

The most beautiful stained glass in Paris. Even with a museum pass (an absolute must!) the line to clear security here is long, so plan on spending some extra time waiting. However, it's worth the wait. The Sainte-Chapelle has the most beautiful stained glass in Paris! You won't spend more than half an hour inside gazing, but it won't be comparable to anything you've yet seen. Especially if you have a Museum Pass, make sure to include this. It doesn't take tons of time (except in line) and it's breathtaking. Also, it is a very close walk to Notre Dame and many other sights.

Evening Concerts are a Gift from the Heavens. I've been to four evening concerts and each one was a very special, magical experience.... especially the ones where the setting sun was shining through the fabulous stained glass windows. You can buy tickets at the bistro across from Sainte-Chapelle. Be sure to check the schedule there as well as I made plans while still in the States but when I arrived and was going to buy tickets in October my first concert was cancelled. Luckily other concerts still fit into our schedule for that trip.
Beautiful.. It was worth the wait in line. The narrow stairs were a workout for my old legs but it was well worth the visit.

world heritage site. I feel it odd to be rating a building which is clearly a gift to humanity. The stained class here is the key, so try to visit on a sunny day. Worth the wait in line. It is small in scale so plan to spend some time inside to truly absorb the energy of a place unlike any other in Paris.

Amazing. This is definately worth a visit, the oldest chapel in Paris. The stained glass windows are stunning. If you are 18-25 years old and EU citizen you will get in for free. The chapel is next to Palais de Justice.

Beautiful Site. Beautiful stained glass. This is a must see in Paris. I recommend the guided tour. Get the musuem pass because it gives you access to museums all over Paris. I visited November 2011, but this review page does not allow me to choose that date.

Don't Miss - Gorgeous. I went in December and there was basically no line to get in, which was great. The church is FANTASTIC and I loved it. I have been to many countries in Europe and visited many churches, but this ranks up there as one of my very favorites. I am so glad I didn't pass it up. If you like stained glass, you will love this church. I was also pleasantly surprised by the lower level, which I didn't expect and found that remarkable, as well. The painted blue ceiling with gold fleur-de-lys was gorgeous. There is also a nice gift shop in the lower level.

Hidden Gem. Sainte-Chapelle is very well hidden but well worth the effort of finding it. Located next to the Conciergerie where Marie Antoinette spent her final days, you have to go through some security before being allowed into the courtyard. The stained glass windows are unparalleled.
Splendid!. This national treasure was disassembled during the Nazi occupation of Paris in WWII. It's inspirational even if you are not religious.

Stunning place. The main attraction in this 13th Century chapel are the stunning stained glass windows, which are currently undergoing a restoration programmed. There is an informative video presentation on the restoration which is fascinating, and another detailing the content of the various windows. It is not a big attraction and will only take a maximum of an hour to visit but is well worth popping in.

Never to be forgotten!. The experience of seeing the stained glass of St Chapelle is unforgettable. The history... The beauty... It is breathtaking. It's a quick sight to see & if u miss it you really missed something special.

Decent but security screening is time consuming. Pros- incredible stained glass on the upper floorNeutral- renovations on the second floor cover up some of the stained glass- ground floor is a bit ordinary and rundownCons- long line ups due to airport-like security screening- still expect a one hour or more line up at a quiet time- may not be worth your while if visiting Paris for only 3 days or less and for the first time

Amazing. If there was one place I would recommend that you don't miss when visiting Paris it would be this hidden gem. Recommended to us by a friend I wasn't expecting anything great but wow was I surprised.
go when sun is shining!. Morning sun pours through the stained glass windows. Go upstairs where the real action is. Close to notre dame. Buy the museum pass to avoid the lines.
Lovely!. Lovely place to visit in Paris if you have time. I am more of an outdoors person, but still cool to see!
A gem. The most amazing stained glass windows you will ever see! An amazing restoration project. The upstairs can only be accessed by a narrow winding staircase.

renovation.. went to a concert here. 2 negatives, major renovations until 2014. and of course, in the winter, an evening concert doesn't allow the windows to shine.....have been before and have always thought it was like being inside a jewelry box. it sparkles!

Stunning, even under construction. One entire wall of the Sainte-Chapelle was undergoing renovation when I visited in October 2012. So while I didn't get the entire, 360-degree experience of the windows, I got enough to know what I would be missing. Gorgeous!
Spectacular!. Well worth the effort to find. The stained glass windows are outstanding. Can be quite busy due to security checks but well worth the wait.

not everybody knows it but.... it is so small, but unique in the world, I wasn't disappointed, because i knew it was much smaller thant the Notre-dame cathedralI'm interested in stainglass and I can't believe this was built on 13th century, with the metal chaining that was used extensively only centuries after...the place is like a huge jewel you're in, don't go too late to enjoy the light coming through, the colors are so intense
Words can't describe. Stunning stained glass. At the time of our trip all the stained glass was in the process of being cleaned. It was about 85% complete in July 2012. Very beautiful. Very moving.

Ah the windows, the windows the windows.. Nothing like it anywhere we have visited and that spans over 40 countries and hundreds of cities. You should not visit just once- see it at different times, different conidtions (un and shade). And then go back again.

Stained glass beyond compare~. Don't let the front or the first floor fool you. While beautiful in their own way, venture upstairs and be overwhelmed by the amazing beauty of the many stained glass windows. This attraction doesn't take long but is close to the Louve and is worth every minute.
Nice, but not spectacular. This was impressive, but I think you need to be very interested in biblical history and stories to fully appreciate the stained glass.
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church. Worth the visit and time to see it. It will not take that long so take the time to stop in.

St. Chapelle. We were told to see this but were getting tired of churches until we saw a postcard. Only a couple blocks from Notre Dame. Costs to enter and long line since it's a small church but SO beautiful inside. Make sure you go upstairs. That's where all the stained glass walls are. We had to tell some people to go up
Worth a visit!. Magnificent church with its panels of stained glass. The restoration is truly breathtaking - especially when the sun filters through.
A great place to visit. Its a lovely and interesting church to visit, its got a great historic value and the architectural rythm is unique
A must see. Sainte Chapelle, a must see, sadly they are doing work on church so your unable to get full effect of windows. Make sure to go when it's a sunny day and sun coming in from the sides.

Beautiful Stain Glass. Each time I have gone to Paris, this is the one place that I make sure to visit. It is a simply stunning atmosphere, particularly when it is sunny. Many individuals will simply sit down on the stone floor and look up, marveling at the stories told in the stain glass. The interior was undergoing restorations when my husband and I visited, but it did not take away from the environment. I was happy to see that visitors were still respectful and spoke in hushed tones. A must see.

Lovely Experience. A wonderful experience and the classical musicians were excellent. We heard Vivaldi and it was very atmospheric in the setting. We went in November however and it got very cold after sitting for a while so do wrap up warm!

Beautiful chapel, a must-see. We visited the Notre Dame first and I loved the contrast between the two buildings. The Notre Dame, whilst huge, is decorated in quite a "simple" way inside. It's mainly the size of the building that's impressive. Whilst Sainte Chapelle is a lot smaller, the stained glass is exquisite and gives a very "rich" impression. It's beautiful and definitely worth the visit. Entrance is free for under 26-year olds (It was my 26th birthday that day but they let me in for free). Still worth the price though if you have to pay. Very steep spiral staircase to go to the upper level. Go on a sunny day to really see the beauty of the stained glass windows. Some windows are currently being restored so can't be seen.

Not to be missed. It's so easy to tire of sight-seeing and trapsing through another church. Let me leave you in no doubt that this place is special and litterally like being inside a jewel box - even queuing for nearly an hour it was still more than worthwhile. Get prepaid tickets to reduce waiting times

go early to avoid lines. beautiful stain glass and nice gift shop, it does get crowded so recommend start your day here. Also recommend Rick Steves audio guide to help u see each panel thru "clearer" eyes.

amazing church. This church is so amazing. The history and stained glass are beautiful and rich. Its a bit hidden from the street so you wont just walk by and see the church itself. A few others have been built around it and it is shielded from view. It costs 8.5 euro to get in which seems a little much to me since going inside the main Notre Dame is free but oh well. Seeing the stained glass from the 1200's is humbling and worth it.

Differently Beautiful Church. Not your average Gothic Church. Fantastically arched, and decorated. Interior going through restoration. Does not have the grand scale of Notre Dame but this is a MUST SEE! There are evening concerts that sell out early.

Oh my - all the colours!. Stunning colours and details in the glass designs. I could have stayed for hours taking it all in. They were doing renos when we were there so a number of the windows were covered. Incredible to see in person, especially when the sun is shining in but even when it wasn't. The pamphlets provide good info on the origins and story line which was helpful and added to the enjoyment.

Amazing church. This place is amazing. A must see in Paris, the line was not long and when you enter the church inside is breathtaking. Not as many steps as Notre Dame and close to a lot of places to see.

Beautiful stained class windows. We went into Sainte-Chapelle to view the beautiful glass windows from a suggestion from a friend. The windows were lovely and it was such a beautiful church. It was a bit crowded but it did not matter as we were all looking up at the windows high up.

under construction. They are doing some extensive renovation. The glass that hasn't been cleaned is extremely dirty. Everything is very dusty. Much of the art has been removed (for cleaning/restoration I presume).

Stained glass~. Under renovation, but still most impressive. A little dark, but that just showcases the windows even more. We got in just before closing so didn't have a lot of time. Still....worthwhile.

Like a Jewel. Very small church, but so rich! The windows are amazing, especially if it is a sunny day. It is really worth to visit it. And if you are scared about long time consuming museum, do not worry. This will take something like 30m.

Under renovation. In November 2012, this church was under renovation. It seemed some of the church was closed off for our tour and I feel that the entrance fee was not worth the experience (as many of the churches have free access into the main portion such as Notre Dame and Sacré Cœur. Don't get me wrong, the stained glass was beautiful and worth seeing, I just wish the price was reduced to reflect the limited access.
Jewel box. Like being in a jewel box when the sun shone down through the magnificent stained glass windows. A little hard to find but you can always ask a local to point you in the right direction.

So much more than I expected!. I didn't realize what exactly I was waiting in line to see, this made for a splendid surprise when I did arrive inside Sainte-Chapelle. It is by far the most beautiful chapel I have ever been in. I would highly recommend. Make sure that you arrive plenty early, it seems that they close over lunch.

Always closed for no reason. Have tried to visit and see the supposedly amazing stained glass but for 3 years in a row it was closed, once because it was raining, once because it was snowing and just this time for no apparent reason- just a sign saying closed.

A place of light and colour. My favourite place in Paris.The upper floor has a stained glass dome so even on a dull day the room is filled with light and colour.The ground floor for is alive with paintings in primary colours and gold.In my experience the queues move quickly so be patient don't miss this amazing experience

Impressive. It is so small but very impressive. You don't need too much time there and the Museum Pass gets you in. Challenge your Bible knowlege because as you see each square its telling a story. Look for scenses from the Revelation Book. Hope you enjoy.
Lovely site. Your entry fee pays for the upkeep & restoration of this beautiful stained glass chapel. Dont miss it!

amazing. awe-inspiring stained glass windows. be sure to go upstairs - we saw several people enter, check out the ground floor, then leave. The ground floor is ok; but climb the narrow curvy stairs and emerge into a chapel full of colored light as the sun shines through the stained glass windows. Amazing that they were created without the use of modern technology.

Stained Glass at a whole new level. This small church frequented by some French king, the only one to reach Sainthood in the Catholic church is a gem I might have missed because the linup looked so long. Inside however we were treated to the most amazing bible I have ever seen. It was all done in stained glass window panels 30 feet high. So many pictures, 1000's I think, were combined to tell the stories of the books of the bible. It would take days to look at each one but imagining what went into its production was truely awesome. Tough place for people with mobility problems.

If you want to feel close to God............. Tis tiny chapel tucked away inside the law courts building and very easily missed is my favourite piece of Paris in terms of churches. The stained glass is utterly compelling, and i can say little more than just go,because words cannot do justice to the beauty within. Just make sure you go up the steps into the chapel proper. I paid for a vivaldi concert through classictics and went back at night. It was mesmerising in its sublime beauty. 8 musicians playing the four seasons from start to finish in a chapel of such significance. Nearly make me weep for the joy it brought my family.
Take a look. Loved it. The stained lass windows were awe-inspiring. Took a little time to get through security as was located inside Dept on Justice precinct, but well worth it.
Needs restoration but still beautiful. Although it needs a lot of restoration the stained glass work on the second floor is amazing. The colours are rich and abundant. Worth the wait in line!
Absolutely Amazing. A small church compared to the likes of Notre Dame, but the full glass stained windows and magnificently painted vaulted ceiling are totally awe inspiring. A must to visit.
House of Glass. The Stained Glass Windows were remarkable. Probably 50 feet high and beautiful. Interesting the peasants never got to see them, just the nobility.
St.-Chapelle, worths 8.50 Euro?. Not worth 8.5 Euro for 20 minutes of visit. St.-Chapelle is compact and the stained glass is extensive but it does not warrant a destination.
Unbelievable. If visitors to Paris do not visit this magnificent place then they are missing one of the most spectacular and moving sights in the world. This place is far better than Notre Dame.

smaller than you may be expecting. As many, many others have said, this is a jewel of a chapel, wonderfully special. Just before we went my friends told me about how small it was and I was glad because it's a place I had been wanting to visit for ages and in my mind, based on photos, I had thought it would be imposing. Instead it was intimate. Because of this intimacy, it was possible to imagine the king worshipping there in private. It's well worth a visit, especially if it's a sunny day and the stained glass can really glow. It was impossible to capture the "reality" of the place" in photos, so I'm included my impression with these swirling photos. As others have mentioned, it's under renovation, but isn't everything.

Slightly disappointing. Can imagine it normally is spectacular. Was advised to go there by a friend as they thought so, however it is under restoration at the moment and after going through all the security checks to get in and then having to pay it was a little disappointing.

Beautiful but be aggressive. I used my museum pass at Sainte Chapelle. I will talk about the church itself in a moment but the lineups are VERY long here and very deceiving. You line up on the street just to get into the complex and then continue to line up to actually get into the building. There is no separate line anywhere for museum pass holders although they are supposed to be able to skip the queue. I took my chances and went to the front of the first line and a nice pair of ladies let me go ahead of them when they saw my pass. I thanked them and told them that if I was not entitled to go ahead I would go back to the end of the line. We continued on to the second line (again no separate area for pass holders) and a woman came out and shouted for pass holders to go with her. About 6 of us stepped out of line and followed her right into the church. I saved myself at least an hour of waiting in the rain. Once inside I found out that to have an audioguide you must buy a ticket from the booth outside....I asked if I needed to wait in the ticket buying line and I was told to just go to the front of the line and pay and bring back my receipt. I did and it went very quickly. While I was very happy to not have to wait, it was very awkward to keep jumping in front of people in line who had been waiting a long time to use the benefits of my pass. It would be better if they had a separate line for pass holders.All of that being said, it is a wonderful building. It is absolutely majestic. The windows are amazing and much more intensely colored than any others I saw in Paris (in MANY churches). The history of it is also very interesting particularly if you make the trip to Chateau Vincennes and visit the Sainte Chapelle there. It is not a huge place but it has a wonderful feeling to it.There are concerts here occasionally, they sell about 200 tickets and the concerts are held in the upper chapel. If you just want to get a peek this is a way to see half of the building and see a show at the same time, minimal waiting in line required. I used the web site www.classictic.com and was able to print out a ticket at home. My second visit to Sainte Chapelle was for a concert of Vivaldi - Four Seasons, Handel - Serabande and Albinoni - Adagio. The acoustics were wonderful and the venue was perfect.
Beautiful windows. Extraordinary glass in the main chapel. Better than more well known European catederals. You are allowed to take pictures with flash which helps bring back the memories.

Not to be missed!. I could spend hours in Sainte-Chapelle and wish that I had. The stained glass is extraordinary, many were sitting in provided chairs with books describing the images. I want to do that, and you will, too.

Stunning. This is a small cathedral but the top to bottom stained glass windows are matched by none. One half of the cathedral was under renovation when we were there which was a shame. We will be back when renovations are over to get the full experience of being surrounded by the gorgeous windows.

This jewel-box of a church casts a spell... Have been several times for concerts. No matter how good the musicians have been, it is always difficult to keep one's attention on them and not let it wander around the red, blue and gold space that encloses all in a magical, other-worldly aura. If you are there during the day, the sun-light lighting up the stained-glass windows casts shadows and spells. Go there, sit as long as you can, just absorb the beauty and give thanks that this little gem has survived wars and turmoil in its long history.

Indescribable masterpiece of stone and glass. St-Chapelle was still being restored during my visit, so some few pieces of its amazing glasswork could not be seen.That said, it is one of the finest masterwork of both architecture and glasswork I've seen, a rich pool of history and culture in the heart of the Cité island.I had little time to truly enjoy the visit, one should save 2h or more if you want to deep dive into the windows individual facts and details. Did not try the audio guide, so no opinion was formed 'bout that.Getting into the building was slightly unconfortable, as you'll have to pass through heavy security first.

Breathtakingly Beautiful, worth the queues!. This is one of those places that has such incredible beauty, the images stay in your mind forever. The queues are epic so make sure you get there early but it's so worth the wait!I've been lucky enough to see some amazing churches, cathedrals and chapels in my time but this one really stood out for me.Do it!

Amazing stained glass. You'll find this site not far from the Cite metro station (Line 4). Although you start queuing at the pavement next to the street, the actual entrance to the Chapelle is further into the compound. Once you're in there, be ready to look up for the rest of the visit. There are panels of stories high stained glass that tells stories. If you want to know the details of the story, get the audio guide at the entrance. Else, just take in the sight of pieces after pieces of beautiful stained glass.

What a hidden gem!. If you are a stained glass person, then this is the place for you. Maximum glass, minimal building. This royal chapel was built for the king and is spectacular. The upper chapel was for him and the lower for everyone else. But even the lower chapel has beautiful decoration and painting, and its share of windows. Unlike a cathedral, this chapel was not constricted by gravity and literally has walls of glass. It is stunning. A must, must see. When I told friends that we were going to Paris, they said "You have to see Sainte-Chapelle." Boy, were they correct. Well worth the admission price. The next time I am in Paris, I will see this again.

Not a must, only if you have time. Not as amazing as expected, and nt much to see if you are not into chapels and architecture.a little overpriced for a place you dont have more that 30 min to spend in

Breathtaking Sainte-Chapelle. This was my fourth visit to Sainte-Chapelle. I'll always marvel at the awesome stained glass, especially on the second floor chapel. I love the carved angels, the mosaic floors, beautiful ceiling....and of course, the vivid stained glass. It doesn't need to be a sunny day to enjoy, just nice even daylight and the glass glows!

Slightly hidden. If you have some spare time whilst you are in Paris it's worth a visit but if you don't have enough time for some of the other attractions i wouldn't bother going here. The only thing which is really nice about this church is the stained glass windows which tell a story.

A little version of "Notre Dame" with 1/4 of the crowds. A beautiful old church, on par with Notre Dame in terms of it's beauty and only 1/4 of the crowds. Not in as good condition (some of the paintings are barely visible due to the grime) and the homeless man at the door asking for money was a slight turn off - however definitely worth a visit (and why not - it's FREE).

Beautiful. This is a one of a kind chapel. Floor to ceiling stain glass is spectacular. It is a small place and a little hard to find and get inside but it is well worth it. Get a pamphlet or take a tour or read about the stories in the stain glass windows. Amazing.

Tight security. Many years ago when I studied art history in college, I should have visited Ste. Chappelle. The historical details of the extensive stained glass are now lost in the cobwebs of my brain, but it was still beautiful to see. Unfortunately you have to go through TSA level security, which takes some time. It's also tight quarters inside, and our guide had been the victim of a pickpocket on a recent tour, so watch your wallet (as always).

For exuberant high Gothic, hard to beat. The stained glass is truly amazing - made me wish I had brought binoculars to get a better up-close look at it. Be aware that they are renovating part of the interior. About 1/4 of the upper chapel was out of sight behind canvas when we were there. An interesting video explained the process they are following.
The stain glass was incredible!. Since its telling a story, take the time to read about the stain glass before you go in so you can understand how to view all the windows.

Bible story in 1,013 windows. Amazing to see so much stained glass in one place, all telling a story from the Bible. It's a building that the walls are only to keep the windows from falling out. Fantastic views.
inspiring. awesome (in every sense of the word) place to attend a chamber music concert. Go at sundown to watch the light change....

Worth the wait to get in. Getting into this place is a bit of a hassle as it shares its entrance with the Palais de Justice and the security is as rigorous (and slow) as at any airport. However you can pass your time in the queue people-watching the folks in the parallel line for the courts and speculate what crimes their relatives have been charged with !Once inside the Chapel the visual experience is amazing. The colours of the stained glass are vibrant - even on a cloudy November day. It must be even more fantastic when the sun is shining. The quality of the medieval workmanship is outstanding. If you have the time you can study the detail of the biblical stories in each of the windows. There are interpretive boards available in a range of languages . Careful you don't get a stiff neck as there is a lot of looking up at a sharp angle.

Beautiful!. The whole Bible is transcribed into gorgeous stained glass windows. Really take your time to examine the upper level, grab one of the laminated pages in the corner with a detailed description of each pane, watch the video on all the intricate work that goes into making stained glass windows like these. It will really increase the "wow" factor. One helpful note - there were two queues to get into the Sainte-Chapelle area: one for the church and one for the Palace of Justice. The Palace line was markedly shorter, but came out into the same square as the longer line for the church. Note that this was not in peak season and might be somehow different in the summer, but if the lines are very uneven, hop in the Palace line and it will still get you to the church.Also - this is free with a museum pass.

Beautiful stained glass windows!. Before I left NZ I booked tickets to a recital at Saint-Chapelle, which was excellent. It was lovely to sit and view the beautiful interior while listening to fabulous classical music. I would recommend this as an excellent way of soaking up the beauty of this place.

Amazing stained glass windows. I am really glad we went to see this church. The only drawback was the restoration had a portion covered, but most of it was viewable. It is very unique and not just another big old cathedral.

Must do a Sunday concert!. This beautiful chapel is undergoing huge restorations until 2014. But, it is still a must see! I highly highly highly recommend that you purchase tickets to a Sunday evening concert. The minute the violin started playing I had chills, and at one point I actually was crying during the music it was so breathtaking. The acoustics of the chapel make it a must once-in-a-lifetime experience!

Best Stained Glass. I thought the stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle was the best in Paris. The blues are incredible. But wow, what a wait in line for security. The museum pass gets you out of the ticket line once inside but you still have to wait in the long security line. If you have limited time in Paris skip it and don't waist the time in the line. We waited 45 minutes on a Monday in November. The restrooms are also presently closed in the courtyard.

Stained Glass Extravaganza. Try to see this when the sun is shining but anytime will do. The second floor of the chapel contains large & high stained glass windows of beautifuls designs and the altar contains relics from the cross of crucifiction and crown of thorns of Christ.
A must see. The mosaic glass rivels any. Simply breathtaking. The Saint Chappelle is situated in one of the islands and is not far from the Notre Dame de Paris Basilica

A "must see". As with all the famous attractions queueing is unavoidable. When we went several windows were being restored. It's difficult to make out much in the way of detail, unlike the windows at Bourges or Chartres. If you have mobility problems beware of the steep spiral staircase. It'a a little grubbier and less gleaming than the guide books show, but a very special place none the less
When it is fully restored.... Unfortunately there id a large section being restored but still enough to be stunning, The other star will be when it is fully restored.

A magnificent church. We were luck and did not have to queue. There were only a few visitors (probably because it was lunchtime?) The stained glass is magnificent. Also while there it is well worth the while to visit the Palais de Justice with which it shares the entrance and security check.
go to a concert if you can. not only visit this place, but go to a concert if you can. Absolutely marvelous. Be sure to go at daylight, when you can see the vitrals.
Concerts. Whilst the Chapelle is wonderful being able to attend various evening concerts held there only adds to the overall enjoyment of the visit.

Amazing hidden gem. We avoided long queues with the Paris Pass. Searched of course on the way in but the atmospheric stained glass chapel both upstairs and downstairs was one of the highlights of the trip.

Unearthly Beauty. The Sainte-Chapelle is one of the National Monuments of France. It occupies a special history and is important in the study of Art History. It is a chapel that held important religious relics, including, at one time, Christ's Crown of the Thorns. It was designed in the Rayonnant style, a form of French Gothic Architecture, in the 13th century, when the goal of Gothic Art was to extend farther into a kind of lightness, to reach higher to God, if you will, and to create an artistic manifestation of this quest for the spiritual, through exquisite and refined architectural details and beautiful stained glass windows that illustrated the Bible for the public. The "walls" of glass of the Sainte-Chapelle are a superb example. By now, anyone traveling anywhere, should expect lines and security when entering well-known, and important historic and cultural attractions. We in the United States are used to it in Washington, DC and New York City for example. France, England and other parts of Europe are no different. If you are pressed for time and are trying to cram most of Paris into a 3 to 4 day visit, this may not be an attraction to view on a visit first. It may be better kept for a return trip when you want to do more than just scratch the surface or see "highlights." It is a magnificent and inspirational architectural masterpiece of the Middle Ages, and the stained glass windows, well, they will just about knock your socks off!

Amazing Stained Glass. Sainte Chapelle can be visited quickly, and is worth a look. It is not your typical church/cathedral, as it is colorfully and elaborately painted. The stained glass is phenomenal. Be aware that much of the building is being renovated, so many pieces are missing.

Surprisingly beautiful, but glad I went in for free. I really liked the physical space, and the experience of seeing a building mid-restoration/cleaning. I disliked the line to have my bag scanned. I went in for free via my Paris Museum Pass, which I really recommend. You may not recoup the cost in terms of entrance fees, but you don't waste half of your vacation standing on lines.

Stunning glass. The experience of sitting in the Sainte Chapelle and taking in the stunning stained glass is an expereince that lasts.The complicated security procedures to get in are a pain but that is life these days.

Very impressive. Sainte-Chapelle was not on our list of things to visit while in paris.We were walking past and the line was not too long ,so decided to venture in.What we saw was the most stunning display of painted leadlight we have seen. The crazygroup all agree that it was one of the most interesting sights to see in Paris , it has the wow factor.

beautiful. go on a day when there is a choir singing. Its inside a government grounds so dont be alarmed when you go through a metal detector. Its worth it a truly beautiful tiny chapel, not to be missed.
Worth the wait. We waited on line in the rain to see this amazing chapel. It was simply beautiful. The stained glass was from the floor to the ceiling. Wish we had time to attend a concert there.

INCREDIBLE. My husband complained as we stood in line saying this wasn't worth the wait (we only stood in line 15 minutes). When we got inside, his jaw dropped. . .all he could say was WOW! Didn't say another word the entire time we were there. ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS!

a amazing heaven. That was a big huge space to looking and walking around for those arts and history spots. And I listen to one of friends suggestion to bring the mirror to look the arts on top of your heads. so that was a big success action.

Perfect on a sunny day. The day before yesterday was a sunny day, perfect for visiting Sainte Chapelle. Its stained glass windows on the south side are under such conditions exceptionally impressive. You can and you have to change your position inside the upper chappel many times to catch its glorious beauty. The occasional clouds that dim the sun even add to the whole impression.As a movie goer, on my way out, I took an oportunity to have myself photographed on the stairs of the Palace of Justice. It's been part of the scenary in many French cult movies.

A little bit disappointing. First of all, I had seen some pictures from the church before my visit to paris and I was quite impressed about them. While there I was a bit disappointed because I imagines the church to be very different from what it was. It's beatiful but quite small (hence the chapelle on its name).It's worth the visit but only if you have time to see other more important places in Paris

Spectacular stained glass. There's much to admire in a venue which probably suffers from proximity to Notre Dame. Some of the windows are currently under renovation but it's still an impressive place to visit.
Beautiful. Definitely worth the visit, just make sure you get ready to line up or even go to the jail first and buy a joint ticket.

A True Jewel Box. We loved it so much we went back for a concert of Ave Maria. Try to go on a sunny day and there is restoration in progress. If you go to a concert, buy the cheapest ticket. It is a small venue.

Hidden place for uninformed tourists. A beautiful place to discover. A friend of mine recommended it to me and it was great to see the ceilings and vitreaux. Not usually included in traditional tours, I strongly recommend to go and see for yourself. Walking distance from Notre Dame

Magical. Don't miss visiting during the day. At night, the classical concerts are wonderful. Try to arrange for your tickets ahead of time, if possible. Vivaldi's Four Seasons and a late dinner -- it doesn't get much better.
yes it is a jewel. This is called the jewel box of Paris and for good reason. It is worth the wait in line and security.
A jewel box wonder. There was a long line to get in...but I don't blame people! There was scaffolding on the building. I am always glad to see these beautiful places being well taken care of.

Must-do in Paris, magical place. One of the -sometimes forgotten- highlights in Paris. In my opinion this is, from the inside, more impressive than the Notre Dame. It's the summit of the so-called 'radiant' gothic style, and gives you a stunning look into the architectural capacities of the 13th century medieval chuch builders. The famous saint/king Louis IX built it as a depository for the many relics he imported after his disastrous crusade to the Holy Land in the late 13th century. It's actually one big ornamented case in stained-glass, every inch is beautifully decorated in gothic style. It gives me a magic feeling knowing all the late medieval French kings had their prayers here. There were restorations going on (almost always, unfortunately), but these were nicely hidden and didn't ruin the atmosphere. Only the crowd of tourists may have been distracting and sometimes annoying. As students we didn't have to pay. Terrific experience!

Must see on a sunny day. The stained glass is spectacular on a sunny day. Much of the windows are currently being restored, so are covered. New system for entry shares security with the La Conciergerie, so line waits my be very long.

Its all about the glass..... The first thing that strikes you about this Chapel is its location. Within the grounds of the Palais du Justice or the Department of Justice. Careful to not join the wrong queue or you might wind up in a French Court! The chapel is just so beautiful, the stained glass windows are really a highlight.
Beautiful. This is a nice visit if time allows. It is not very big and a visit can be made in under an hour if there is no line. Hidden jewel in Paris.

Undergoing Restoration. The concerts are still wonderful, the place so beautiful, particularly as the sun sets on the myriad of stained glass windows. I could sit there for hours even without the music. More stained glass windows than any other building in the world - and it's not that big.
A little disappointing. While Sainte Chapelle was lovely, it was very small. Not at all like it looks in travel books. There was a long wait and I would rather have spent the time elsewhere.

Not worth it. Lined up for ages on the road just to get past security, then another line to pay over the odds to get in, It was lovely in the upper part of the chapel, but i personally could've missed it out and still felt i got the full Paris experience.
Just beautiful!. A breathtaking cathedral in Paris. The stained glass windows were so beautiful , you just stare in awe when you are there. Amazing place and a must see!

A gem of a site to visit. This little chapel is a surprising gem of stained glass and wonderful representation of the art. Sainte-Chapelle belongs to the group of museums and sites that participate in the Paris Museum Pass. If your are planning on visiting more than two Paris museums the pass would be worthwhile. It also gets you access to the "Ticket Holder" line, which is much quicker than waiting to purchase a ticket.

Came to see four seasons by Vivaldi classical concert . Very impressive building.unfortunately work going on in there at the moment so one wall blocked off and also most of the stain glass is very dusty which also affects the impact somewhat
Go on a sunny day!. This little chapel is well worth standing in line to enter if the sun is out. The stained glass is amazing & the atmosphere silences almost every tourist. A place to meditate
Amazing Stained Glass. Very cool chapel near Notre Dame. The stained glass is amazing. Well worth a side trip you must go through the Palais Justice to get in.

Beautiful windows. You could gaze all day and not see all the windows in detail. Beauiful light comes through. It says its the best display of stained glass in the world. Just a wonderful old church with so much history. Not far from Notre Dame Cathedral. May be long lines to go in at times though.

Well Worth the Wait.. This historic church has become a "must see" site in Paris, primarily because of the tremendously beautiful stained galss windows.A word of warning....there is very high security at this location, so leave anything that could be questioned and confiscated at your hotel.Also, the entry lines move very slowly because of the security. We arrived at 8:45 and the building opens at 9:00. There were 100 people already in front of us. But the delay was a blessing because it was a rainy and dark morning, but by the time we reached the church itself it had become brighter outside, and one needs to see the windows when it is bright outside.

Louis IX's Private Chapel. A must see while in Paris. Small but breathtaking the Church is co-located with the Ministery of Justice. There is extra security here. Be aware that bags are Xrayed and there is a metal detector.

Breathtaking. It's a little tricky to find but it's an easy walk from Notre Dame. Absolutely stunning. I had less than a day on a business trip to do tourist stuff and this was a very worthwhile stop.

Wonderful!. This church is so pretty, it is a MUST go. At first you get to the first floor and think it is pretty, but then you go to the second floor and see all the windows and art and you drop your jaw! Take time to see every detail and frame of the rose window.My kids were tired, otherwise I could spend couple hours admiring the beauty of it.

Very beautiful chapel. This is a beautiful chapel and worth visiting. We went at opening time when the queue for the security check was only about 15 minutes and there was no queue for buying the tickets. Although it is very impressive, it is quite small and the time taken to see it compared to the queue time is not very good. However you can also wander into the Courts of Justice and the hallway there is very grand. You can get a joint ticket with the conciergie but unfortunately this is closed until next year. The steps up to the chapel are windy and steep so they are not suitable for anyone who finds walking difficult.

Amazing stained glass. Absolutely wonderful decoration, both paint and glass. Worth visiting.However, despite going early, the place was very busy so the religious ambience was lost. Also, the gift stall was very intrusive being in the body of the, very small, chapel at ground floor level.
Stained Glass Beauty. When I walked up the stairs and saw the second floor of Sainte-Chapelle, its beauty took my breath away. The stained glass is amazing. A must-see.

The best in Paris. If you have one day or night in Paris, this is the one place to visit. It was built in the 13th C. in less than 10 years as a giant reliquary for the Crown of Thorns, supposedly brought back from Crusade by King/Saint Louis IX. But go on a sunny day so the upstairs dazzles you with a seemingly endless wall of glass. You have to go through the Palais de Justice to get there, or get a joint ticket with the Conciergerie or Musée Pass, but it's well worth any line and far superior (as Gothic) to Notre Dame.

Best light show in Paris. I guess we got lucky. Short line up for security check, and the line to get into the actual church was moving along steadily. Sun was shining brightly and it was quite hot. I had read about Sainte-Chapelle and put it high on my must do for Paris list. My wife had never heard of it, but once inside she now rates it as one of the best views in Europe.Lower chapel is interesting, with many ornate carvings, the obligatory shop, and a very unusual and colourful roof support system. But it's upstairs that took our breath away. A lofty, airy space that seems to be all glass. With the sun shining the large stained glass windows came alive. Unfortunately about six panels on the left side were under wraps being renovated, but the overall effect was still stunning. An information board gave details of the renovation process: how they were restoring the glass to its former glory. Once these renovations are complete this place will be truly magnificent.As it was, it still held a magical quality, and you couldn't help but be truly awed. If there's a more beautiful church in Europe, we didn't see it; and we visited quite a few. This place is a must do while in Paris.

A Must See in Paris. Nothing else like it. Remember to go to the second floor. The line on the street is for the security check. The line at the chapel is for tickets, if you have the museum pass, you can skip that line, but not the one for the security check.

Breathtaking stained glass and Gothic architecture. This Gothic chapel was built in record time to house Christ's crown of thorns (now in the crypt at Notre Dame). Hidden behind the law courts, Sainte-Chapelle is worth the wait if you have to queue to visit it. Particularly striking: the stained glass windows and acoustics. If you're lucky, you'll be able to go to a candle-lit concert in the chapel.
absolutely stunning stained glass. Some of the windows are being restored but they were on the shaded side of the chapel. Make sure you go upstairs to the upper chapel
hummm. what can i say about la sainte chapelle? long wait, very long wait! When you get in most of the vitrails are under renovation but the price is not !

One of Best Cathedrals in Paris. Went to Notre Dame first, what a mistake. This cathedral was far more stunning. If we had one chance to see just one cathedral in Paris, it would be Sainte-Chapelle. Even though the sun never came out during our week in Paris, the stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle showed far better than the stained glass in Notre Dame.
Music of the spirit. A concert at Saint chapelle was a highight of our Paris visit. Performances are regular and can be booked online.

One of the truly outstanding sights in Paris. Try if possible to reserve tickets ahead for one of the nightly music concerts here--magic! Or at least try to see the late afternoon sunrays as they come through that stained glass. **Btw, we just had an experience at Ste. Chappelle involving arbitrarily early closing hours (i.e. 1:00)--beware.

Impressive Church. Be prepared to wait in line to enter Sainte-chapelle as security is tight and takes some time to go through the metal detectors. If a tour arrives while you are in line, they get to immediately go to the front of the line and the waiting gets even longer. We went early in the morning and only had one tour arrive so were inside in less than 30 minutes. There was some extensive repairs going on inside the church, so a big area was partitioned off and hidden, which was disappointing. The stained glass is spectacular! The wait in line is worth it!
Glory in glass!. If you only visit one place in Paris, make it here.The building is amazing, the glass fantastic. Such earthly beauty!

Wow!. When you first enter the upper chapel, be prepared to be well and truly dumbstruck! Best seen on a sunny afternoon, to get the full benefit of the light shining through the stained glass windows. Only just a short walk from Notre Dame, but if you have to choose between the two, see this one first.

Loved this place!. This is well worth the trip, even if you have to wait in line. The colors and the windows are amazing. You can see that they need cleaning which they are working on, but it is still wonderful to see. Be sure to read the history of the chapel and the crown of thorns. I also went to a concert there in the evening. It was wonderful. I would recommend doing that too. Then you can walk to Notre Dame and see the flower shops, too.
Magnifique. The stained glass windows are definitely the high light to this attraction. A little pricey for the length of stay.

Amazing stained glass. The line when you first get here, if to go through security to get into the "Palais du Justice". Once you get through the airport style security, there is very little if any line to enter Sainte Chapelle iteself. Other than the glass, there isn't much to see, so might not be worth the wait for some people. Once you are through security though, you have 3 buildings to see in reality; Sainte-Chapelle, Concergerie, and Palais du Justice. They are also in the process of restoring some of the glass, so different sections are closed off as they move along.

Art, Arter, Artest!. Wow! What a piece of art. The Glass paintings are just mind boggling. Even the colours used throughout and most importantly, the walls where paint has given way are kept as is... it adds to the feel of the place. The only thing they could plan for better is that queue for security outside on the road. It was raining for a good hour and without an umbrella it was a nightmare. At least when it rains can they not make some arrangement that people do not get wet?

Stunning windows. This was my favorite singe site in Paris. Most old churches and cathedrals are dark, consisting of walls with some stained glass windows. Sainte-Chapelle is pure light, consisting of stained glass windows with some walls. You won't believe it until you see it.
fabulous concert at sainte-chapelle. What a setting to hear the 4 seasons beautifully performed. The church is beautiful and the stain glass windows amazing

One of a kind. You can never imagine the beauty hidding inside if you watch the chapel from the outside. Once you go inside you can't stop staring ath the thousand stained glass figures. The light comming in from the glass make the place look like it's out of this world. The only thing is that the ticket is pricy for such a small space but well...Paris is pricy anyway. Don't miss it though since it's one of a kind and nowhere else to be found in the world

Breathtaking. The review i read in my book did not begin to describe how beautiful this little Chapel is - if you visit Notre Dame - take the extra time to visit Saint Chappellle - it is just as impressive as Notre Dame but in a different way.
Stained Glass. Beautiful glass and the refurbishment process itself is a work of art. Still some areas being refurbished. When completed it will be magnificent.

You will be impressed no matter what. I know nothing about stained glass, have no idea of how hard it is to make and therefore do not think of it as being impressive. But once you enter the top chamber of the Sainte-Chapelle, I would bet that any person seeing it would be completely mesmerized by the sight. It was one of the most awe-inspiring things I have seen in my life. This is something one has to see if in Paris. I would recommend getting the museum pass that saves a great amount of time in the lines (especially in Summer).

small chapel which hosts great concerts. have been here the second time in 2 years and loved it again. great historic chapel - part of it is under construction. Location for classic concerts - if you can buy tickets in the first 8 rows for a real close experience and arrive early to see the church as well. ticket can be purchased easily on the internet and printed well in advance. since you need to go through security arrive half an hour in advance. Can be reached by metro with short walk. people come dressed in little black to jeans - tourists. the only drawback, sometimes during those amazing concerts you can here the metro/traffic which is not romantic, but does not keep me away from coming back.

Info. It is worth visiting, but the conciergery was closed by the time i visited. It is beautiful to be inside, mainly for catholics who likes to see the history of Christ, the apocalipse vitrals etc.

Stunning. Let me start by saying, I love medieval churches so I was predispossed to like it.... but I was amazed. When you climb up the stairs from the lower (servants') chapel to the upper it's like climbing up to heaven. The light streams in and the ceiling soars. This is the most beautiful church I have ever been in.

Wall to wall glass. We waited about an hour, first through the security check, don't know why that's even there, then in the ticket queue to find ourselves in a dark cellar housing a gift shop, but when we climbed the narrow stairs in the corner, oh wow what a sight! The most intensive concentration of stained glass I have ever seen. When the restoration is complete, this tiny church will be a true sight to behold.

What a gem. Definitely worth seeing but make sure you find and climb the stairs to the second floor. The tourists that only go to the first level miss the beauty of Sainte-Chapelle. We were not sure we wanted to wait in line (July--tourist season) but were so glad we did.

My absolute MUST stop when in Paris. I visit Sainte Chapelle's breathtakingly spectacular stained glass windows every time I am in Paris, even braving the line in the rain. The line, by the way is caused by a supremely inefficient security check bottleneck, not by crowding at the ticket window. This is not a place to be missed by any visitor to Paris.
Don't leave this off your list. The most amazing stained glass you will ever see. The initial chapel you enter is quite dark, but then you climb the stairs and "wow".
Four Seasons concert. I attended the Vivaldi 4 seasons concert, it was grand...the site is so beautiful...it is a must to see, especailly at sunset..put on the list to do in Paris...
couldn't get in. I went last week on the sainte chapelle, but it s difficult to give a mark, i ve waited more than 1 hour so i gave it up, lot of people seemed not too happy

WALL TO WALL STAINED GLASS. when the renovation and cleaning of the stained glass in this magnificent church is completed, this will be a five-star attraction...even now, with several of the main panels covered, it's still worth a visit. this church, located within the walls of the palace of justice, on ile de la cite, between the branches of the seine river, was the private worship place for louis the IXth, also known as 'st. louis.' photography IS permitted. this is pretty much a 'don't miss,' especially given its location near the louvre museum, and notre dame.
Beautiful Chapel. This is a beautiful Chapel. The stained glass is stunning. I think this chapel is a must see when in Paris.

Gothic at its best. Even better with a concert.. We attended a Friday night concert with a string quartet. They played well and for us beraly French speaking visitors, it was enjoyable to guess what piece they introduced. Bach, Mozart, Elgar come across in a different way in the local tongue. BUT back to the chapel: its a little gem with the beautiful stained glass paintings and the blue and gold interior wall decoration. Adding to that, one can only marvel that the chapel survived the destruction of the revolution and the Paris commune, where so many religious buidings were vandalized. Definitely one of the things to see while in Paris.

Restoration of stained glass proceeding. We first visited here 13 years ago, on a bright day in late spring, and the sun shone through the amazing medieval glass. Today the sky was dreary grey, so we missed the magic sparkle, but were pleased to see that the restoration of the storm-damaged glass is proceeding. It will be slow, as it needs to be thoroughly and expertly done, and 10million Euros later it should be splendid again.The lengthy security checks at the entrance, shared with the Justice department, were not required back then (as I recall); that must be one of the thousands of inconveniences around the world post-9/11.Of course, the great restoration of the 19th century saved this treasure for Paris and the world, and to restore the glass as well as is humanly possible will be one of the more important artisan achievements of this century.
Jewel box. The Sainte-Chapelle is a jewelbox, supposedly built to house sacred artifacts. I can't say if that is true, but going into the enormous windows of stained glass is like color therapy.
Awe inspiring. The stained glass windows at this chapel are an amazing example of color and artistic style. A must see on your Paris list.
Skip a day visit and go to a concert at night. If you have a chance, go to a chamber music concert at night here. It will be something you will never forget
what a fun. amazing is this church and worth waiting in line for. pleasure to take pictures and go bac in time!! go to upper chapelle also

Stained glass windows!. I did not really know what to expect going in here. It is included with the Paris Museum Pass and is right down the street from Notre Dame, so why not? Well, either I haven't been to enough cathedrals or Sainte-Chapelle has the most stained glass windows ever. It was a little cloudy that day, so it was a little bit muted. I can only imagine that on a very sunny day, the colors are spectacular. Go ahead and give it a try, you may be pleasantly surprised.

So peaceful. So old and so peaceful, and so much to read about and learn. We stayed for a long time, and went to a gospel concert there. It was awesome! So, if you need a wee respite from the busy streets, go in for a rest.
worth seeing. A wonderful sight, but beware parts are under repair. There can be long queues, but plenty of room once insid.

Not well known, but beautiful. A small landmark on one of the islands, this smaller but beautiful landmark is a good place to visit in the heart of Paris. The chapel, while undergoing extensive renovations, is a beautiful example of the early history of Paris.

Stunning.. We went on a rainy day and don't know if that had anything to do with their being a long line. It was also a Saturday, so that too was probably a factor for the line. It was worth the wait though. Absolutely stunning stained glass! Part was under renovation and covered up, but that did not take away from the beauty of this place. If you are going to Notre Dame, visit here first. Definitely worth it. As I said, absolutely stunning!!

World's greatest vitraux (stained glass windows). Don't know how many times I've gone to the Conciergerie to see these windows. Goodness, the line was long. It was worth it. Heart-stopping. The best sight in Paris.

A must see when in Paris!. I love visiting Sainte-Chapelle whenever I am in Paris. This is a beautiful gothic style church. As you walk in, you arrive at the lower level that is nice but this is not the place to see, as you move through and to the upper lever you know that you are truly in an amazing place. No matter how many times I visit it, the stain glass always takes my breath away. Definitely a must see when in Paris. Do not miss this!

A wall of glass. This must be the most breath-taking chapel on the planet. Every wall is a curtain of stunning stained glass - and get ready for a quasi-religious experience when shafts of sunlight illuminate the deep blues, reds and greens of the windows. They also hold evening musical performances here that are very intimate.

Gorgeous church.. Some work was being done to one or more of the panels while we were there, but it didn't really take away from the beauty of this place. Timeless stained-glass and also an excellent video was being shown of some of the restoration work.

Beautiful stained glass windows. The Sainte-Chapelle is a much smaller church compared to Notre Dame, however it has some amazing stain glass windows! The fee to get in is a little steep, but worth it in my opinion. The lower portion of the Cathedral is small, but up a narrow circular stairwell, you find yourself in a upstairs room filled with colored light streaming in through fantastically tall stained glass windows.The line can be long to get in, so prepare to spend at least a half hour waiting to enter. You must alse enter a pre-line security checkpoint where bags are searched.

Wonderful evening. If you have a chance, buy tickets to a concert here. The acoustics are just marvelous and the setting is incredible. We arrived for our concert while light outside and as the sun was setting the windows around us flickered and changed by the second. It was an amazing sight and paired with the music was an experience we will never forget.
Fabulous. Take time to "read" the stories in the windows. That's why they were made. The experience will take you back.

Amazing stained glass windows. Make sure you go upstairs! We walked in and saw the main floor and thought that was it until I realized that the windows were not as impressive as I was told. Then it hit me to ask about another floor. The staircase is tucked away in a dark corner, so it is easy to miss.

Amazing vitrage, but not worth the detour. While the church is nice and the vitrages - simply astonishing, the queues, relatively high prices and the annoying location may not be worth it due to the naturally short visit there.

Wonderful, although under continuous renovation. One of the most beutiful churches I have ever visited. If possible, watch a concert there. They take place almost every day. Tickets cost around 30 euros and are available at fnac stores.
Toured St. Chapelle, Very Close To ND Cathedral. Beautiful stained glass windows, but you must go through security. Had a bottle of wine in our day packs, so we split up our 2 couples.

Another must to visit. A beautiful place to be visited in a sunnyday - thus you catch the beautiful lights coming through the stained glasses. These are actually under restoration and you can see a movie about the delicate art of restoration inside the chapel.

My Favorite Paris Attraction. I always go to this church in Paris and take my friends to see it also. This past trip was no exception. Nearly half of one side is being refurbished so we could not see it, it seems that this church has undergone refurbishment for as long as I can remember.Still, seeing the stained glass is great and always memorable. There used to be more places to sit and just marvel at the glass, not as much any more.A not to be missed attraction which will take your breath away.

Marvelous stained glasses. Sainte-Chapelle is one of the most beautiful church I have ever seen. The lower floor may trick anyone at a first glance. However the hidden gem and the breathtaking part is to come right after climbing some steps up to the upper floor. Any stained-glasses lover would die for a glimpse of them.Depicting the whole Bible stories, it really worths the visit. Just take a seat and gaze into the glasses and let time pass.Warning 1: They have been doing restoration works which means some windows are covered nowadays.Warning 2: Come early or stand in a huge line. Or, cleverer, buy your tickets in advance, jump the queue and save lots of time!
Beautiful stained glass windows. We stood in line in pouring rain for about 1/2 hour, but we were blown away by the floor to ceiling stained glass windows in the upper chapel. Beautiful!

Beautiful Church!! Well worth the visit. This a beautiful church that I have been to several times. The stained glass windows are literally the walls of the church. They are made up of the thousands of octagonal small windows that tell the stories of the old and new testament. Bring your camera and hope for a sunny day!!
Sit and wonder at the stained glass. The stained glass tells the biblical story from Genesis on. The sheer size and scope of the glass is worth the visit.

Beautiful, but under construction. I was very excited about seeing this cathedral, so I was slightly disappointed when we arrived and half of the stained glass windows in the sanctuary were covered with scaffolding. I understand that maintenance and cleaning must be done, so I wasn't too upset and did my best to enjoy the absolutely breathtaking windows that we could see.
Wow. The most gorgeous stain glass windows I have ever seen. I thought it was a little pricey to get in, but you should do it @ least once.
chuech. it has some of the most beautiful stained glass in the world. well worth waiting in the line. the whole church is a work of art.

Didnt meet expectations. Yes and I hate to say this but expecting be beautiful interior I had seen on line was greatly disappointed that almost half of the windows were covered for repairs. I did not see this mentioned anywhere during three months of research. Even with a museum pass we had to stand in a long line even on a cool and wet day.Confusing because there was another small line at the entry going into another door. When I asked the police motioned for me to move on. Im sure on a sunny day when all windows are visible its stunning. Just poor timing which is one element of travel.

It is all about the stained glass. It is all about the stained glass, which are really big. However, they are the same types of stained glass Windows that you will see in all churches in France. I would not come back.

Pretty, but disappointing. I found this underwhelming, though it would probably be much prettier on a bright sunny day with light streaming in the stained glass. We had a museum pass so we went in, but don't feel it would have been worth the entry price of 8.5 euros.

Wonderful sights and sounds.. We were fortunate to attend a string concert in the Chapel - Bach and Mozart. We attended an evening concert and had the sun shining through the stained glass windows. Very beautiful setting to listen to the very accomplished players.
Amazing stain glass. When you first go in you are in a less than impressive chappelle..but go upstairs and prepare to be WOWED. I bet it is spectacular when the sun is shinning...

Next to Heaven. Wow! How beautiful. The stained glass windows are just amazing and there is a video display of how stained glass is made. There are explanations of the windows in English which was very helpful. This cathedral is the best example of Gothic Architecture in the world.

Beautiful setting for an evening recital. While in Paris, friends and I enjoyed an evening recital of Vivaldi's Four Seasons at the serene Sainted Chapelle. Definitely a great way to enjoy the magnificent windows!
Watch the sun go down here. The view from the steps at the Sainte Chapelle at night is breath taking, the church itself is worth a look in too.
Go to the Vivaldi music night!. So worth it to go to hear a concert here in the most beautiful chapel in Paris! We went and were so glad we did!

Beautiful stained glass. For those with a Museum Pass (highly recommended) this stop is a good one. I am not sure if I would have paid full fare, but with the pass it was worth the time. Having the pass usually allows you to cut the lines, but this one did not allow that on the first line. People line up to pass through security (this line cannot be jumped) but once inside, a second line can be jumped with the pass.Once inside, ascend some spiral stairs to the upper level and enjoy the wonderful stained glass. There are information boards as you enter the room that explain the pictures in the glass. Final note, they are doing some refurbishement on one panel of the glass, so it is covered by boards and not visable. Not a huge deal but figured I would point it out.

Breathtaking Stained Glass. The stained glass windows in Sainte-Chapelle are simply not to be believed. I've been half a dozen times and never cease to be awed. Definitely should be on your list of "musts."

Sainte Chapelle. A beautiful place! Be sure to leave all sharp or weapon type items in your hotel. Security is pretty strict. The stained glass windows are a marvel. There are sheets in various languages that tell you the history of the place and about the stained glass windows. This is part of the Paris Museum Pass. You do not have to stand in the ticket line.

Hidden Gem. Past it about 3times while we where in Paris our 12days. Finally decided to go in and glad we did. The stained window and their history is amazing. Make time for this place you won't regret it.
The veiw. The veiw of Paris also the ceiling in the Chapelle was breeth taking ,there was a concert on the day we where there it was quiet special

Exquisite!. I love to visit late in the afternoon when the sun filters through the stain glass windows. Spectacular. The stain glass windows are beautiful and each window tells a different story. Exquisite!
Beautiful. Really beautiful church, the windows really are worth the visit and the entrance fee. Queued for just 30 minutes to get in.

WOW!. Everyone had told us that you have to go here because of the stain glass windows, but nothing they said can compare to the experience you get when the sun hits the glass. The room fills with colors and you feel so serene being surrounded by it all. Worth the wait!
Interesting alternative to Notre Dame. A small but beautiful church tucked away in the Police station yard! Only there for an hour but definately worth it.

Magnificent Sainte-Chapelle. Avoid the crowds & go to one of the concerts where you can sit & be transported by the beauty and also the music. The earlier concerts have the advantage of the late afternoon sun streaming through the windows, though the evening performances have a magic of their own too.
Must-see. Go during mid day and feel like you're in a jewel box. A kaleidoscope of colors immerse people in a very unique experience and a triumph of centuries-old architecture.
Sister trip. We ran across this by accident but a great one with Free admission. The views were magnificent!!! The place is awesome.
Worth the wait. Sainte-Chapelle was one of the only tourist attractions my wife and I had not visited in Paris on previous trips. It is a very beautiful church, and was well worth going to.

My favorite site in Paris. Go upstairs and stare in awe at the most beautiful site. It is such a lovely not so touristy feeling chapel. It really makes it easy to imagine the different levels of interest different classes enjoyed. And do not miss the Conciergerie. A very important historical monument!!

Don't visit Paris without going to la Ste-Chapelle. This is an unbelievably beautiful chapel. It is by far my favorite place to visit in Paris - and I've now been to it 3 times, and it never disappoints. Just spectacular stained glass and soaring architecture. Don't miss it; it is worth the inevitable wait on line outside.

Sainte Chapelle. We attended an evening concert in Sainte-Chapelle and it was magnificent. I think it is the most beautiful place in Paris. The acoustics are other-worldly. We booked on-line at home through ClassicTix, a vey cool website. Our concert started early enough that we were able to enjoy the light and the dined glass windows. So much less crowded than during the day.

I'd recommend a visit to this church. We were very happy that we added this church to our sightseeing list. It is a very beautiful church. Smaller and much more intimate then the large churches we visited. The stained glass is remarkable and, I feel, surpassed any other we saw on our trip. The line to get into this church didn’t take that long but once we got inside we found ourselves lingering awhile, trying to take in its special charm. I’d highly recommend it.
Worth the effort. It is a bit of trip and climb to see, but well worth the effort. A beautiful church with a spectacular view of the city. The neighborhood around it is charming

Incredible Stained Glass. When you walk in on the lower level it is a nice common looking chapel. However, when you head up the spiral stairs you are greeted by the most amazing stained glass I have ever seen. It is overwhelming!

Unexpected & must see beauty. Didn't really know anything about this in advance, which made the discovery even better. The most beautiful stained glass display and stories Take the staris up to the top, not any signs so you don't immediately realise this is where to go. It was being renovated when we visited but don't let that put you off, the sun streaming in through the walls of windows was stunning.

Beautiful stained glass.. Second time visiting. The stained glass was spectacular. There was some construction on one side, which was a bit disruptive. There were 2 small lineups to enter, one for the security and another to buy the tickets. But not too long of a wait.

A lovely basilica. I feel we have lost a great artisan skill in North America when I see such beautiful works af art such as this one. When the sun shone through the stained glass windows of blues and lavenders etc. it became ethereal to see.
A unique chapel. Other than standing in line for forty minutes to get in, the chapel was unique and fascinating. They would benefit by taking some classes in crowd management!
Fabulous. Pricey (8.50 euro) to get in, but this chapel is pretty amazing, with two stories of highly decorated walls and windows.
Be sure to see. Fantastic stained glass windows - be sure to come here if you cant get to Chartres. Museum Pass helps with the line

Beautiful venue, well worth the money. We purchased our advance tickets via Classictic.com. We have been using this on-line company both in Paris and Venice extensively and can highly recommend it. The carre d'or (the best category) tickets were more than affordable, 44 euro per person. The official start of the show is 7 PM, the Classictic.com advises to arrive early, at 6:15 PM. We would take it even a notch early, especially if the intention is to get best seats available in your section/category. The lines are quite long, one has to move through almost the entire Palais de Justice to reach the La Chapelle. The interior is fabulous, and so are the acoustics; the musician were doing a very good job. We would sincerely recommend the venue to our fellow TripAdvisor travelers and suggest it as a great and enlightening addition to your Paris plans. Especially for the money spent. Especially in Paris.

Nice.... Well,Sainte-Chapelle is really nice,even beautiful,but somehow(I do not know why)I expected more.Stained glass windows are really something to see.We waited 45 minutes to get there,because it is very popular place for tourists,and if you have enough time,you should visit it.Conciergerie is also there.
my favourite chapel in Paris. Lovely, excuisite, sacred space... painted windows make you feel like in heaven. Absolute must. Do not miss it...

Story telling in stain glass windows. This was the first time I went inside to see the stain glass windows. Best to do your homework ahead of time to know what you are looking at. Depending on the time of day, certain windows are easier to see as the light changes.

Renovation under way. Visiting S-C right now is a great idea as during the renovation, you get a feel for the old while seeing the new. It's a must see stop in Paris but aim to see it in the sun; otherwise the glory will be lost.

Good...but..... As far as churches go, this one is nice, but it's got some construction going on nearby which does detract a bit. It's worth the trip, but with Notre Dame so close that's the place you have to go, make this one an option.

A sacred space for counting your blessings and blessings those you love. On the Isle de la Cite and worth the trip from anywhere. The stained glass windows are overpowering with their spiritually uplifting power but what really makes this place is the simplicity of the architecture which makes the building appear to vanish and only the windows are apparent. Captivating. Say a prayer for me and for all those who travel while you are in this wonderful and totally unique space.

Spectacular!. Loved this spectacular chapel. Here's a tip: get there early, before 10am, and you will likely see a shorter line. Another tip: when you get there, go right upstairs...that's where the most spectacular stained glass windows are. Enjoy!

Imagine ecstasy. Light streaming through the stained glass windows in Sainted Chappelle is as close to an ecstatic vision as one can imagine. You will climb up the dark narrow stairway leading into the chapel and suddenly your eye will fill with the most glorious light. Takes your breathe away.

Awesome!. Stained glass windows are worth the wait in line to see. Although half the room was under restoration I felt like this was still worth seeing. Will be even better once restoration work on stained glass is complete.

Crazy beautiful stained glass, best I have ever seen. I was hesitant to visit this church initially. I had been on a one month tour of Europe, and I was getting a bit tired of seeing a countless parade of churches. I'm so happy I didn't miss this one. The stained glass was absolutely breathtaking.
