Sainte Chapelle has a wonderful painted ceiling in the lower chapel and then the 13th century magnificent stained glass in the upper chapel reached by a narrow winding stone staircase (but thnkfully not too many steps). The chapel is very popular so it is best to arrive before opening at 9:30 AM to avoid long lines. The chapel is within the Palais de Justice complex so there are queues to go through security and no separate entry for Paris Museum Pass Holders. The stained glass is under restoration (since at least 2008) so some parts will be covered by scaffolding. In December 2009 half of the stained glass in the apse around the high altar was covered and, on our visit in May 2012, restoration had shifted to several panels in the nave to the left of the apse.
beautiful. Sainte-Chapelle is beautiful, but not worth more than a few minutes walk through. If your time is limited, spend it somewhere else.
def worth a visit. loved it! Tip - after enjoying the museum take a walk along the Seine river walk to Pont Alexandre - lovely views as you stroll
weekly musical performances. A musical performance here was the highlight of our Paris vacation! VIP tickets allow you to sit in the first rows.
A Must See. We were speechless when we saw the beautiful windows but go on a sunny day.

Magnificent windows!. This is a museum that we had to pay to get in and there was a long line, but it moved along. Inside are the most beautiful stained glass windows. There are information sheets in many languages in the rooms to help explain about the windows. There are many stained glass windows in Europe, but these are truly exceptional! So glad that we stopped there for a visit.

Worth the Visit. The stained glass is amazing and in and of itself is well worth the visit. Take a close look at frescoes on the wall and the carvings on the doors. I also suggest reading up a little to understand the history of this church.As for the line, it took us no more than 10 minutes, it moves quickly.

Stunning and well-worth a visit. I went on Thursday at around 11am. After exiting from Cite metro station, i could already see a long line formed next to a building. I was a bit worried that it would be a long wait like others have suggested. The are actually two entrances right next to each other for security. One indicated for the Justice building another for visiting Sainte-Chapelle. I used the shorter line for entering the Justice building and it turns out that both lines end up at the same area anyways. I used the museum pass next to skip the ticket line and there was no line at all. Overall it took me 15 mins to get in. And yes it was definitely stunning. They have English placards explaining each of the windows and how the stained glass was made. It was organized and interesting to see. Some of the windows are currently under restoration and covered up.

Music at Saint Chapelle. Look out for summer concerts ( usually evening) at St Chapelle. These sessions do it great justice - for its acoustics are excellent.If you cant make a concert, it just aint the same.
Light, Light, Light!. Unbelievable small cathedral (compared to others in Paris) that has the most beautiful light coming through it's stained glass.

awe inspiring stained glass. Time your visit security can cause very long lines. I had to use wheel chair and this is one of the sights that accomodates wheelchair but only mon-fri - not on holiday or weekends. it is undergoing restoration and was very interesting to see how they do this as well as see the difference between restored and non restored panes. Very uplifting to see this
Moving.... It was breathtakingly beautiful. It is easy to get in ... no long lines or crowds ... and lovely to see.
Gorgeous stained glass. For cathedral/chapel afficionados, this is a must-see.
Overwhelming!. Check it out on the web and you will see why....the windows are truly a wonder!
Stunning. I visited Sainte Chapelle and thought it was one of the most amazing places I have visited . Well worth the 35 min queue in poring rain 2 get in.
Beautiful Stained Glass. The ceiling and all the wonderful stained glass was amazing. The decorative pictures on the floors were also interesting to see.
Long wait. The chapel is a marvel but the long wait and the stuffiness inside took away from it's charm. One visit was enough.

Stunning stained glass!. The colour and light of these towering stained glass windows in awesome. Went during the day. Amazing. Went to a Vivaldi Four Seasons concert at night, and overwhelmed by the beauty of the music and the chapel, found a few little tears sprouting from my eyesA
Not sure what all the fuss was about. Spoilt by a non-moving queue. Not worth the 12 Euro 50 entrance fee and currently being extensively renovated.

The best stained glass in Paris. Whenever we have guests from out of town, this is always on our "must show them" list. Most of the stained glass is from the 13th century. As of this writing, they're in the midst of a major refurbishment of all the glass, so some of the windows may be covered. Note that there are often long lines to get in here, especially on sunny days when the windows are at their best. One trick is to go to the Conciergerie and buy a "jumelle" ticket to see both attractions. Tour the Conciergerie first (where Marie Antoinette was held before being taken off to lose her head), then take your ticket for Sainte-Chapelle and go in the much shorter line on the left reserved for people who have tickets and passes. You'll have to go through security first (because the chapel is on the grounds of the Palais de Justice - the supreme courts), so be prepared to open your bags and empty your pockets.

A Must-See. STUNNINGLY beautiful. Get there early and miss the worst of the queues. Its only a small chapel so you dont really want to wait all day because it only takes 30mins to go round slowly. Its in my top 3 things to see in paris... could even be number one...
Great stained glass windows. Remember to walk upstairs- that is where all the stained glass is. If you like stained glass, this it the place
Ancient; enchanting. It was like feeling to go back in centurys: the colors of the windows are very very beautifull.

A must see. What I liked was the story behind this church. And the most beautiful stained glass windows ever seen. The wait to pass security was at least 1 hour (even with a Musee Pass) you have to pass security first than go through with your pass.
Concert at Sainte-Chapell. It was very nice to listen to pleasant music in such a beautiful surrounding.
Beautiful church. Very quaint church near St Germain Blvd. Oodles of beauty and history. Free entry.

POPULAR MUST. Long ago, there were few lines queueing for the stunning chapelle. Now lines go around the block. And happily so. The chapelle is not so enormous you can't imagine life as it was in it's heyday. A stunner.
Exquisite. One of the most beautiful spots in Paris. Disregard the religious hype and head up (via a narrow winding starcase) to the main upper chapelle. You won'd see glass like this anywhere else.
Wow - the color of red wine. lovely hidden church with amazing stained glass storytelling
EVENING VIVALDI CONCERT. The Beauty of the building and the excellence and energy of the musicians were a treat!
Don't miss this jewel of a chapel. This chapel has extraordinary stained glass windows.
Terrible queues. The glass was impressive but not sure it was worth the 45 min wait in the rain. The security check point was ridiculously slow. They probably got one person through every 2 minutes.

Awesome Chapel and Mosaic work. You'll love the windows that start on the left of the chapel with the beginning of the Bible and carry on through the whole church. This is a beautiful spot either right after sunrise when the light is first entering or late afternoon when the sun is about to fade off the windows.

Gorgeous...get the Paris Pass to make your entrance quickly!. My husband and I visited Sainte-Chapelle and didn't have to wait in the LONG line with tourists from buses, cruise ships, etc because we had purchased the Paris Pass which allowed us to use a separate entrance. The inside of the chapel with all of the windows is truly amazing, there are so many beautiful windows with the history of the Bible captured throughout. I had been told by many that this was a beautiful place and it certainly did not disappoint!

intimate yet awesome. I imagined the chapel to be bigger, but when i stepped into that small, intimate chapel lined with wonderful, old, stained glass windows, I felt awed. The chapel felt more personal and more beautiful as you slowly turned around to try and see the images in the windows and wonder at the stories they tell :)worth falling in line for :)
Beautiful. Sainte-Chapelle was absolutely beautiful well worth a visit. The leadlight was beautiful.
Great Visit. Saw it twice on the Museum Pass - the stain glass impresses but the story about the restoration is even more of a gem.
Absolutely Beautiful!. This was one of our favorite places we visited! The Stained glass is breathtaking. Really cool history.

Crowded and poor value.. After waiting in line 25 minutes I was slightly disappointed in paying 8.50 each. The stained glass windows are magnificent but not worth the time for short visits to Paris. Norte Dame was much better.
Sainte-Chapelle. The most fantastic windows ever. Free the first Sunday of each month.

Beautiful but very long lines. Go early or enter through the police side of building. Beause the building is shared by the police academy/museum, it requires every visitor to go through security check which is the reason for long lines. Try to use the front entrance through police side, sometimes they will let people through this area. Worth the wait though to see stained glass catherdral.
A glass chapel. The stained glass windows are simply spectacular. Don't miss seeing this beautiful medieval chapel.
The glass. Glass was beautiful, but for waiting and the lines we went through I would miss this one for another attraction in paris.

Beautiful Stained Glass. The stained glass in this church is absolutely beautiful. The glass is in the process of being restored and the difference is remarkable. A must visit stop in any trip to Paris.

Fabulous. My friend and I went to a concert in the Sainte-Chappelle on a recent trip to Paris. The baroque music was such a great compliment to the wonderful Gothic arches and spectacular stained glass interior of the chapel. The glass was undergoing some cleaning and restoration when we were there in late April, but the 90% that was restored was fantastic. I can't wait to see the completely cleaned.
lovely. If you go to paris you have to go there. It´s so beautiful!!

Gorgeous stained glass, eons of history.. Missed this the first time we visited because the line was so long. This time we got the PMP and loved it. It's currently undergoing restoration, but still very much worth the the visit.

Scaffolding is distracting. The chapel is beautiful, however they are currently renovating one of the main panels of stained-glass. Also, be aware that there are two lines to enter. One out on the street used to pull people to the event and another longer line inside...
You aint seen nothing Yet. You must find this fine gem and see it in the sun light.I have never seen anything like this in all my travels.
Dazzling, awe inspiring. My favorite church in the world. Hope to hear a concert there.
Beautiful. Make sure you go on a sunny day to take advantage of the beauty of the stained glass windows.

Concerts great. Saw two concerts at Sainte-Chapelle. Spectacular setting with great musical quality. Odd to see the seats for the king and queen -- directly above the altar! No wonder they eventually lost their heads.
Beautiful. Well worth the wait to see the stained glass windows and building.
Stunningly Gorgeous. Beyond beautiful. The intricacy of the stained glass windows that soar seemingly into the heavens that are so massive yet delicate. The concerts they offer are NOT to be missed.
Beautiful Stained Glass!. bring your camera and go a few minutes before 5. There was no line and the chapel wasn't crowded.
WOW is what you will hear here!. this is the most beautiful place I have ever seen! So many huge stained glass windows along with the age of them makes this a must see!
Beautiful to see.... Not as well-visited as Notre Dame, but just as breathtaking!
Magic. What an amazing place...well worth a visit. the upper level on a fine sunny day is stunning...how clever these stained glas artists were.

Exquisite stained glass and acoustics. Go just before sunset for the most effect. Concerts held here are usually baroque and you may find them a peak lifetime experience; musicans are excellent and the sound is transporting.

Concert. Don't miss one of the evening concerts. If you get a chance to see Paul Rouger and the others performing the music of Vivaldi, Massenet, etc., it's fantastic. Paying a few extra euros for one of the VIP seats (first 8 rows) is definitely worth the money.

stained glass masterpiece. Sainte-Chapelle was on of our "must-sees" and it is spectacular, especially the stained glass windows which are eally like none other. However, there was significant construction/renovation underway and scaffolding diminshed nearly one half of the upstairs windows, which was a shame but ouldn't be helped. hopefully it will be done soon.
Long Lines. Beautiful but ongoing repair. Was worth the wait if you read the description available in several languages but not suitable for young children.
most beautiful stained glass windows. They are in the process cleaning and releading the windows, about half done. See if you can catch a sunny day.
take your binoculars!. The stained glass windows are very interesting, but they are very high, so we needed to use our binoculars to enjoy the details.
Great place for a concert. We attended a concert by Les Solistes Francais of Vivaldi's Four Seasons. The acoustics were great and the setting sublime. The tour during the day is fascinating.
Great. Really pretty and worth a stop. They have been renovating several of the stained glass for a few years so it will be 2014 before you see it in its full glory
Exquisite, a jewel box.... Indeed it was built to resemble an actual reliquary. Absolutely gorgeous stained glass windows. Transporting. Put it on your itinerary for a day on the Ile-de-la-Cite.

Small and Cramped. Not worth the Eur 8/10 price. we had a museum card which allows you to break the line at all other places (but not here!). The Chapelle itself is a small place with stained glass art-work; nothing majestic about it. there are other good places to spend your 45 minutes in Paris, especially if you are on a short trip.
Gorgeous. My favorite church in Paris. Gorgeous stained glass that is currently being restored. Amazing to see the difference between what has already been restored and what they are working on.

Amazing. This is certainly worth standing in line for. After approximately 40 minute line up and going through security checks we entered the chapel. The stained glass windows are beautiful and take your breath away. First impressions after you have climbed the stairs are of mind blowing beauty - they are truly a work of art. Do not miss this if you get the opportunity to view

Smaller than I thought.... There was a very long line, but I was determined to see it. Although smaller than I thought, it was very beautiful. This also is considering that it was a very gloomy day so the light was not strong and not much was filtering through the stained glass. Still worth the trip...and wait, in my opinion.

Gorgeous. This is about my tenth visit to this lovely small church. Even though it is in the midst of renovations, it is just so beautiful. On a previous trip we went to a trumpet and organ concert. If you have an opportunity to hear a concert hear, do not miss it, it is such a special place. Try to arrive a bit before two p.m. to beat the after lunch line...

Here is a hint...... After passing by the extremely long lines for several days we decided to do the Conciergerie first and we were able to enter the ticket line(about half a block down) and purchase a combo ticket. We did the prison first and then went to the St Chapelle line and entered the small line on the left side of doorway, went thru security and went right in. So if you see the lines extremely long go to the prison ticket office and purchase the combo ticket.

Sainte-Chapelle-a jewel box as they say-close to Notre Dame. It is well worth going-see Notre Dame and then cross the street and go a block-ask any Paris native then for directions. Do not miss it - the stained glass windows are wonderful-go to the second floor.
A Hidden Gem. Go when the sun is shining in the early afternoon so you can see the amazing stained glass windows.

Don´t miss. Don´t miss it! Beautiful, the window take the breath out of one!
You have to queue but it is worth it!
Best stained glass. Just beautiful. More oustanding than I had imagined and not half as crowded as Notre Dame.

Amazing, but the line is long. I've been to Paris before but never been to Sainte-Chapelle. Decided to pay it a visit since it's supposed to be magnificent. The line was quite long and I think we waited somewhere between 20-30 minutes to get in.There was another line to get into the Palais de Justice and it was considerably shorter. There is a security check-point before getting into the property which causes the line outside. A couple of Japanese tourists used the shorter line and snuck into the line for Sainte-Chapelle at the security check. It really annoys me that people are so sneaky, but I didn't want to cause a scene so I let it be.Inside in the courtyard you can buy tickets. I think it was 8 euros per person, and it's free if you're between the ages of 18 and 25 (and from Europe). An elderly French couple spent ages before us, paying with check and it seemed like they tried to get a lot of information on the site from the woman sitting at the ticket booth. She should've told them to speak to someone else as a long line was forming.The sight; you arrive at the entrance of the lower chapel. It truly is a wonderful sight, but the real magic is on the upper level. It was breathtaking. Unfortunately parts of the chapel were covered due to maintanence, but it should be finished by 2013. Other chapels will not impress me much after seeing Sainte-Chapelle! It was a long wait to see the two floors, but I'm glad I did it - even though I probably won't do it again.If you have pre-bought tickets you should not have to stand in line (I saw a lot of people with pre-bought tickets waiting in the same line with us until a guard informed them that they could cut the line, good to know!)
Went to a recital. Beautiful setting and acoustics, heard Vivaldi's Four Seasons
Stunning. Worth the wait to get in and see this fantastic church! In some ways much more intimate and amazing than Notre Dame
Up and Coming Sight in Paris. the stain-glass is unsurpassable. Make sure you get your Paris Museum Pass or be prepared to wait.
rude. Bought the "skip the line" museum pass but it was not honored.
Windows amazing, but long lines. Worth seeing, but the chursh is small and you wait a long time for a 10 minute view.
Worth the wait in line. Fabulous stained glass - 0ver a 1000 scenes from Bible

Like walking into a faberge egg. What a breathtaking space to walk into. The stained glass is amazing. Such beautiful colors. Easy to visit is you are planning on going to Notre dame. Almost more impressive.

Beautiful. Visited Sainte-Chapelle for a concert. Performance of Vivaldi's Four Seasons and Pachelbel's Canon. An amazing experience. The principal violinist was really good. Pachelbel brought tears to our eyes. The stained glass windows are beautiful. The venue certainly enhanced the musical experience.

Cathedral of glass like no other.. Build from 1242 - 1248. Light shines through stained glass like God's grace shining down to earth. It shines brighter here than in any other church. 15 separate panels of stained glass. Two-thirds of it 13th century orginal!

Breathtaking. Photos don't do Sainte-Chapelle justice. This site is simply breathtaking. Give yourself enough time to sit and wonder at the stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle. The Rick Steves audio tour (free download) provides a good overview of what you see here. Stand near the top of the spiral staircase where guests enter the upper chappel and just watch people's reactions as they lay eyes on the windows for the first time. Take time to go next door to the Conciergerie, especially if you have the Paris Museum Pass.
Incredible stained glass windows. The windows tell a mass of history and biblical stories, but are very difficult to decipher, as the images are so small.
amazing. I saw a concert in this Chapelle, and it was magical. if you get the chance, do it!

Amazing. Amazing, amazing, amazing. The best of Middle Ages art at its peak. I recomend to visit first the Medieval Cluny Museum and get known in what to expect of the Chapelle first. After go there. Feel the climate. Do not jump to photograph early. Just see. Take your time. I recomend reading before the visit the book of Apocalype/Revelation at the Bible. Why? Because the main glass in top of the altar is about it. So you will recognize the Revelation episodes at the stained glass. You will never see the Revelation described with such beauty.
Concert at St Chapelle. Look out for their regular concerts - not expensive but the best location to listen to beautiful music!

Amazing architecture.. Right next to the Cathedral of Notre Dame. Much smaller but very impressive. The stained glass was increadible and the painting of the cielings was impressive. Definitely worth seeing. Get a Museum pass for the days your there and skip all the ques.

Beautiful.... It is beautiful and included in the museum pass, so recommended, although, after seeing so many magnificent places in Paris this one is not that jaw-dropping.
Wepassed by and the queue was huge (no priority for passes) but then we came back 20 minutes before last admission and it tooked a few minutes to get in.
Can skip. Rather pricey. Line was long and was only in the church for 20 minutes.

Beautiful and intimate concert. We attended an event concert of Vivaldi. It was a beautiful venue with the setting sun streaming in through the gorgeous stained glass. The 5 artists were flawless and seemed to enjoy performing as much as we enjoyed hearing them.
Classical Concert at Sainte Chapelle. Was doubtful about the quality since it seemed very touristy, but was pleasantly surprised. The setting is of course magnificient. Highly recommended.
Nice but small. Nice but small. Not the feeling of a top attraction. Go with museum pass is fine, if buy a ticket for it, a bit expensive. Worth a visit without long queue.
Amazing. Very seldom am I wowed - but turning the corner up the stairs and coming into a cavernous room with amazing stained glass windows left me speechless.
Extraordinary stained glass - don't miss it. Line is always long now, in contrast to 10 years ago when no one seemed to know about it. Go to the head of the line with Paris Museum pass

Jewel close to heaven. This chapel is truly exquisite--I think a "must see" in Paris. The stained-glass is rich and jewel-toned, the gold lustrous, and the blue ceilings intense. I also attended one of their concerts--Vivaldi. The lovely music, the light coming in through the glass at sunset--it made my chest hurt it was so beautiful. This is a special place. . . what more can I say.

Long Queue for Security Clearance, but Beautiful. Beautiful tall stained glass windows depicting stories from the Bible. It is being renovated at the moment, so one side (inside) is covered with plastic. It took 40 minutes to get in because it is situated within the Palais du Justice so you have to go through their security. If you have limited time in Paris and cannot afford the time to queue, go and see something else.

Almost Perfect. We were there in May 2012, and seven of the stained-glass windows are being restored, so the effect of this lovely chapel was somewhat compromised. But astonishingly beautiful nonetheless. Probably best after the work is done on a sunny day.
Breathtaking stained glass windows. Small not crowded and lovely. Not to be misses and just a short walk from Notre Dame. If you have a museum pass you can also skip the line to get in!
Just beautiful and overwhelming.... This chapel is very special and the windows are incredible. Even if there are always a lot of people it is worth to wait. Incomparable...

Bach Concert Excellent. My mother, cousin and I attended a Bach violin concerto at Sainte-Chapelle. The music in such an outstanding ambiance was second to none. Top-notch musicians in a top-notch, beautiful setting. Who could ask for more? You won't believe the stained glass windows until you see them for yourself!

A must see while in Paris. I honestly felt this was the most beautiful place we visited while in Paris. Though not as big or famous as Notre Dame the stained glass is like nothing I've encountered before. It is located on the island not far from Notre Dame and attached to the Parlaiment building. It is a little tricky to locate on the island (Ile d'cite). Pictures can be taken.
gorgeous. This is a must see! The wait was only about an half hour and was worth it. The stained glass was spectacular and was better than we had expected.
Small but worth a look. Museum pass does not let you skip queue as it is a security check. Worth having a look although still ongoing work on some of the windows.

a must see. This church is a magical masterpiece. It's unlike any church I've ever seen. The stained-glass windows go all the way up to the star-studded vaulted ceiling. Some renovation work was going on when we were there.

Don't pass this one up. Since this is on the same island as Notre Dam, it could be overlooked and that would be unfortunate. This church is as beautiful as any we've visited in Europe. The signage isn't great inside and when you first walk in you're in the lower area, which they have staged with a small gift area. We almost didn't see the small staircase leading up to the main church - at first we thought "is this it?" But having seen pictures, I knew it wasn't and spotted the small sign leading to the staircase. Well worth visiting and not nearly as crowded as Notre Dam. Also, our Paris Museum Passes helped up bypass the line, and we highly recommend getting the pass as well.

Simply beautiful. Unbelievable variety and depth of coulour. I have never seen such a maginficent example of stained glass. Price is a little steep but simply beautiful. We're going back to attend a concert tonight and check out the acoustics.
Gothic genius. This is the superlative gothic experience. Possibly the most beautiful church I have ever seen

vivaldi in beautiful surroundings. a lovely way to pass an evening in paris. Rather than visit during the day buy a concert ticket and spend an hour in the evening admiring the stained glass while listening to some music. a real highlight of our trip
Okay, I guess. This chapel was supposed to be one of the "not to miss" tourist sites. Pretty, but shows up better in the photos.

Great Church. The stained glass windows on the second level are spectacular. Make sure you grab a card in your language that describes the content shown in the windows. A small set of binoculars would be useful in seeing the upper part of the windows. Taken as a whole these are the finest set of stained glass windows I have ever seen and I have seen many.

Wonderful Vivaldi Concert in an Iconic Setting. The stained glass windows in this chapel are inspiring. Dates back to Louis IX. See it all by itself, or book tickets for a concert in the evening and double your pleasure.

The most beautiful chapel on earth. The secret treasure near the Notre Dame. Tiny, perfect and breath-taking. A hidden gem, with gorgeous stained glass. The first floor, for the peasants, may trick you into thinking there is not much to this site. But climb the stairs for the most spellbinding experience you have had. Truly spectacular. You will linger as the sunlight shows the stories from the bible in a way that all can appreciate. Such artistry and beauty. A concert later in the evening delivering Vivaldi was so poignant, we didn't want it to end. The highlight of our trip.

Beautiful chapel. This is one of the most beautiful display of stained glass windows in Paris. The chapel is surrounded by the glass and the story of the windows. Sitting quietly in the chapel with the sun shining is a very memorable experience. A visit here is very different from the huge crowds at Notre Dame. I would put this one on your list of things to see in Paris.

Lovely concert and beautiful setting. we wanted to book a concert and thanks to advice on Tripadvisor booked tickets when we were in paris for a concert 2 nights later. Although the concert was short , it allowed us to go on to eat later and the setting was lovely. No need to book the dearer seats- just get there early to guarantee seats together. We would like to go back to view the building in more detail.

Magnificent Windows. We waited in line for 45 minutes to get in but it was worth it. The sun coming through those stained glass windows took my breath away. We highly recommend the Vivaldi concert in Saint Chapelle. It was wonderful. This was the highlight of our trip to Paris.

Spectacular stained glass. I visited this little chapel several weeks ago and was awed by the stained glass and the architecture of the lower part of the chapel. I have been to Paris numerous times but had not visited this hidden gem.Definately, worth a visit!

Be prepared for long security line. Saint-Chapelle is located next to the Justice Department so be prepared for a very long security line even with a museum pass. Even if you aren't religious, you'll appreciate the awe-inspiring stained glass windows especially in late afternoon especially if you learn about their history beforehand. But don't be disappointed if you expect something more after such a long wait.

Better than Notre Dame. A definite must and in our opinion a better visit then Notre Dame although the external features are not as overwhelming as Notre Dame. Again the queues may be daunting for some.

worth visiting. this place is worth visiting, but i would not rate it as one of the most beautiful places in Paris, like others do. Minus is that the 1/3 of glasses are covered and being under reconstruction. The 8.5 euro price could be less i think...

Poor Luis XV. Indeed is impressive what ancients french kings use to do with their money... This chapelle was built to host the supposed remains of Jesus Christ´s crown of thorns that Constantinopla´s king sold to Luis XV for a unbeliveable price (three times than the spent to build the chapelle).The place is unbeliable beatiful, it has vitrals out of imagination, but prepared, the queue to get in may take you out of your nerves. As long as the Chapelle is located inside the Paris Justice Palace every single living thing wich enters the place must be revisted by "simpathetic" french police men...Worth if you are a Paris Freak like me
Amazing, spectacular place. This church is a little gem, hidden inside Ministry of Justice. Definitely worth a visit. The lines aren't always long, and the experience is unique.
Beautiful chapel, but a long wait. We waited outside for ages, but it was worth the wait to see the beautiful stained glass windows. I wouldn't do it if I wasn't so into history and churches.
A Jewel in the City. Stained Glass windows are the best in the city- maybe the world?. Gorgeous chapel. Long lines to get in- even with the 1+day museum passes.
stained glass. Small place but stained glass windows are quite impressive. Research in advance and you may attend small recitals or concerts in the chapel, which would be nice.

Go early to avoid the que!. Read The Hunchback of Notre Dame before going, to get a real feel for the histroy. The wait to get in was longer than any other, so go early. Even in the rain, we waited two hours
Beautiful stained glass. Worth the stop, especially if you have the museum pass.
Gorgeous, don't miss it. Beautiful, in fact breathtaking. Worth waiting in a queue for.
Beautiful stained glass. Interesting but too bad there were too many people inside a very small space!
Best small chapel in France. Don't want to give it away. Stand in line or go early or late but go. Preserved by being a storage space for years. Look at details linger awhile sit in a chair and gaulk
Don't overlook this, near Notre Dame. The stained glass windows are amazing. Not large, but not to be missed
Fabulous stained glass. Access was a little cumbersome but the stained glass windows were fabulous. Some restorative work going on.
Very beautiful stain glass.. The stain glass is spectacular. The rest of the site (which is free because this is the palace of justice) is worth wondering around.

Couldn't get in this time due to the queue.. April 24th we went by the lovely Sainte-Chapelle only to find it closed for the midday. Came back after 2:00pm only to find a line a mile long. I did not want to stay for a minimum of 2 hours and so went shopping instead. I write this as a warning to plan your time carefully and go very early. I did see this lovely chapel several years ago and agree with all the high marks.

Spectacular stained glass. Beautiful small chapel, with stained glass windows all around that begin with Genesis and proceed to the Last Judgment. Even with restoration going on, worth a visit. Having a Museum Pass allows you to enter for free, but everyone has to wait in the security line.We went back in the evening for a concert, which was quite wonderful as well.

Be prepared to wait. Even if you have the Museum Pass, everyone waits in the same line here to go through security. We passed the church three times with a line longer than we were willing to stand in. Finally got in after their lunch break and still waited at least 45 minutes to get in. Windows are unbelievable. They are restoring the windows and about a third are covered, but it's still amazing.

Magnificent vitrailles (stained glass). Lower chapel somewhat subdued, with an elegant ceiling pattern; the upper chapel with spectacular stained glass windows, especially on a sunny day. I think it is the most beautiful church in Paris.

Small but stunning!. I went to Sainte-Chapelle on several occasions to watch baroque and classic musical ensembles. The towering stained glass windows are dazzling in the day and in the evenings the place is a hauntingly beautiful setting for the concerts. I highly recommend that tourists make a concert in a historical place a part of their itinerary.
Window heaven. The most beautiful stained glass windows one can imagine.unfortunatley half are under restoration which takes away from the expeperince somewhat. Still worth a visit
A religious experience. A place you'll never regret if you really believe.

Amazingly beautiful. The stained glass here is more beautiful than any I have seen anywhere else in the World. Many people miss it and it is 2 mins walk from Notre Dame which is lovely in it's own right but the glass is not a patch on that at Saint Chapelle.
Breathtaking glass. Our last cathedral we visited in Paris, and our favorite. The late afternoon sun shining through the huge stained glass windows was unforgettable!

Concert and tour. We walked through Sainte-Chapelle and also attended a concert there. Both were excellent. I had read that the lines here were some of the worst, so we went right when the chapel opened. No wait at all and it was very uncrowded until right before we left. When we were getting ready to leave we did see a line starting to wind around the chapel. This is a place I could sit quietly for a long time, the stained glass was breathtaking.

Stained Glass at it's best. Beautiful little church with a lot of history. We took the wrong entrance at the Palace of Justice and asked a young policeman for directions and he told us to follow him as he took us directly to the church. The church was crowded but we found a seat and could view the windows and follow the guidebook.

Just another chapel. Lot of people will disagree with me. But I will share my opinion. We had Paris museum pass but unfortunately at this site it doesn't shorten your wait. You have to stand in the same line as everyone else. The whole experience was not worth the wait. The chapel is small, true that it has some amazing stained glass work but it is similar to work that we have seen in chapels all around the world. Go on a sunny day otherwise just skip it. do other important sightseeing sites of Paris first. Go here last if time permits. we were very enthusiastic before we went there but it was a bit of disappointment. So it is your call. If chapels are a must do on your itinerary than go for it otherwise enjoy many other charms that Paris has to offer.

The upper chapel is wonderful. Take the combo ticket Sainte-Chapelle + Conciergerie next door. The Chapelle is a marvel. Read the stuff explaining how the vitrals were made and what they mean. Half of the vitrals are hiden behind scafoldings (work in progress). But i wouldn't miss it. Better on a sunny day... On your way out enter the palais de justice up the stairs. Next : the Conciergerie and its huge medieval room...

Superb stained glass, terrible queues. The stained glass, along with that at Chartres, must be the most beautiful anywhere. It is a good place to start if you are trying to introduce your children to culture as the chapel is small and if it weren't for the truly horrendous queues, quick to visit. if you don't want to spend 2 hours queuing you need to get there as soon as it opens, alternatively visit out of season.
a must. most beautiful 14th century churchattend a musical concert there

So beautiful!. I had visited Sainte Chapelle 17 years earlier and the sight of the beautiful stained glass windows had always remained with me. My memory had served me well and it was as beautiful as remembered. This is truly one of the gems of Paris. Restoration was occurring and in great need of as many of the painted wall murals are sadly deteriorating. So happy I could spend another afternoon in Sainte Chapelle
small but great. one of the oldest place in Paris but a beautiful one.

Stunning Windows. Many travelers just go to Notre Dame and miss the tiny Sainte-Chapelle, which is situated in a government building, requiring a queue through security. But once in, the experience of seeing the chapel and it's unbelievable stained glass windows is truly exceptional.

You must visit this out of sight treasure. Of every place we visited in Paris, this was by far the best. The entry line was long and I had to persuade my young daughter to wait, ensuring it was absolutely worth it. Afterwards, she agreed.

More than hpoed for. Attended a concert on Easter evening. The musicians and singers were extraordinarily talented and the lighting which enhanced the beautiful stained glass windows made the performance and venue an unforgettable experience!!!

Chamber concert. Ste Chapelle is one of the gems of Gothic architecture. Go to a 7 PM chamber music concert. As the sun sets, the light through the windows is fantastic. The east side windows are currently blocked for restoration work. The audience tends to be mostly tourists who applaud at inappropriate times during the concert, not a bummer.. but do not be surprised.
Don't miss. This is stained glass heaven. It is an architectural gem. Those who call it the jewel box of Paris are right on. Kids loved it as well.
Magnificent. Try to see this place when you have a sunny day. Incredible to imagine that they have removed all of these stain windows during the war to protect them.....
Wow Amazing Stained Glass Windows. This is well worth your time. The views in this chapel are breath taking. If you will be in Paris for several days look into the art/museum pass.
Take in a concert here. We went to an evening concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons. It was spectacular and is the best way to see Sainte-Chapelle.

Transported to Another Time. We came here on the advice of a friend who recommended we buy online (www.classictic.com/Sainte-Chapelle) advance VIP tickets for an evening concert in this magnificent royal chapel. We did, and it was one of the most memorable experiences we had in Paris. We attended Baroque Follies, a trio of master musicians played flawlessly on period instruments; a harpsichord, violin, and recorders of various sizes. The sunset through the exquisite stained glass windows was delightful, and the music transported us to another time. This is a very special place.

Gorgeous by itself but even better as a setting for a concert.. We heard Vivaldi's Four Seasons at the Sainte-Chapelle a few years back. The late afternoon lighting streaming through the stained glass window panels, along with an excellent execution of Vivaldi's Four Seasons, equaled an amazing precursor to a great night in Paris!
Intimate historical miracle of glass. Spellbinding experience in this glory of glass, so beautiful we returned in the evening to attend a musical concert. This is not to be missed!

Small but Beautiful. Went on a rainy day and had to wait in line, but it was worth it. The upstairs part with all the beautiful stained glass was magnificant. I am sure on a sunny day, it is unbelievable. Be sure to sit and take out one of the large cards that explain each window.

Stain glass to be seen on a sunny day. 2nd floor completely surrounded by stained glass and spectacular ceiling on 1st floor. Museum pass work but doesn't bypass the relatively slow line (compared with others in Paris).
Spectacular Stained Glass Windows. Some of the prettiest I have ever seen (and they tell a story) and I have seen many in Spain, Italy, France, etc.
Give up!. The church is lovely, but is in a very bad shape, under maintenance. It should be closed till the end of renovation. Not a good place to visit right now.
Beautiful Stain Glass. Do not miss if you are near Notre Dame in Paris. It is only several blocks from Notre Dame

Beautiful, colorful, amazing. This was one of my favorite churches out of all of those that we saw while in Europe. I just loved the colors here. There were hand painted ceilings, columns, etc. The stained glass was amazing. Well worth the visit!
Blow your senses. Magnificent! Wonderful stained glass. Queue is a pain but does move fairly well.
Worth the visit!!. Its a small but amazing chapel....you must visit and attend for a concert !!! they have quite often during spring time....

half of the vitrages is no restavration. On the first floor there is some suvenier shops
The vitrages on the second floor are on restavration from one side
Costs 7,5Euro
Stained Glass wonderland. The glass is wonderful in this relatively small and interesting chapel. My favourite in Paris

You cannot miss it. In my opinion, the most beautiful church in Paris. The second floor is like walking into heaven. Watching at those beautiful vitreaux windows on a sunny day is certainly an inspiring experience.
Beauiful stained glasse. Very beautiful and well worth the thirty minute queus

A must see.. We got a 6 day museum pass and were fortunate that Sainte-Chapelle was included. I have seen many beautiful churches in Europe, but this is among my favorite. The stained glass windows create such a beautiful effect.
Historic, beautiful. SainteChapelle is an historic building with the most beautiful stained glass.

Oh WOW!!!. We were in the security queue before opening time. We got through security in good time and were able to skip the ticket queue with the Paris Museum Pass. We entered the lower chapel. We were overcome with the sense of how old this church was. The walls were hand decorated and the stained glass windows were very decorative. It seemed small and was rather dark. Once we had looked around on this level, we then climbed up to the upper chapel. This chapel was the reason I had included this church on our must visit list given DH's interest in stained glass but even I wasn't prepared for the sheer size of the windows in this chapel. I got a crick in my neck looking up to the top and these windows were full length nearly to the floor. They were massive and the colors and scenes depicted so amazing. It was an Oh Wow! moment. Even though the windows down one side were currently being restored and weren't visible, this didn't detract. There were grey skies outside. The view inside on a sunny day must be stupendous.
Incredible rose windows. Hidden gem - a must see for anybody visiting Paris!
Gorgeous. In the upper part of the buiding it's like being inside a massive jewellry box. Absolutely beautiful.
Expect a wait. We loved Saint Chappele. The most magnificent stained glass. Expect a wait. Some hotels have tickets you can buy in advance
Stunning little Chapel. It's small, but worth the visit, as you will rarely find such glittering gold arches anywhere else.

Incredible stained glass!. Sainte-Chapelle is a beautiful little gothic church in the shadows of Notre Dame. It is well worth the visit. The only thing that would have made viewing the stained glass better would have been sunshine.Even with gray, overcast skies, the stained glass was brilliant & well worth the price of admission. If you are on your own near Notre Dame, look for the church by the Palais de Justice.

Almost too much to take in.... The beauty of the stained glass and the stories within those windows and the atmosphere of this place are breathtaking. The timing of a visit does make a difference; the sun behind the windows adds to the beauty so afternoon is best.

Look for concerts advertised in front of St. Chapelle. Try to buy student rate because any seat is excellent. Theperforms are above expectations. The atmosphere memorable. Paid 16 euro student rate for middle of chapel seat next to a group of college kids from FL on break. Nice to see people dress more than casual for the event. Vivaldi. Recognizable scores. Worth it.
Visit to Sainte-Chapelle Paris. Nothing to dislike - go and see the exquisite stained glass windows I have never seen anything like it

Magnifique!. Be prepared to wait in line to visit Sainte Chapelle of the Rose Window fame, located on the Île de la Cité. It dates from the 13th century and was built to house the Crown of Thorns which is now kept in Notre Dame and only exhibited on Good Friday. Although you must contend with the crowd, especially climbing the narrow stairs, they do try to control the number who enter at any one time. However if you can ignore others and just focus on your own experience, the stained glass, the arches, painted columns, two floors of beauty, everything will just make your heart leap. They provide multiple language sheets that inform you of the history and meaning of the windows and other features. The gift shop also offers a range of souvenirs and pictures that are better than the ones you are likely to take.

Beautiful cathedral, with unbelieveable stained glass. We really enjoyed walking through the upper level of the cathedral. The stained glass is beyond describeable....it hard to believe the building has been there so very long, and it such an integral part of France's history. The chapel is definitely a site to visit.
Best of all the churches. Gorgeous stained glass windows, close to the Conciergerie which had great art exhibits.

Worth the wait out in the cold. Stood in line for 45 min. in 40F weather to get in--and it was well worth it. Unfortunately about half of the windows are currently blocked for cleaning/repair, but the others are just gorgeous when the sun comes through. Go EARLY in the day, and go upstairs immediately to the upper chapel for the most intense experience. I highly recommend small binoculars (which I wish I had remembered) to be able to see the hundreds of images.
Attended a concert there!. Great place to listen to Mozart. We were there on Easter Eve (is there such thing?) and the occasion was perfect. We will not soon forget the experience

Must see Paris attraction. Was undergoing renovation when we visited and several bays of stained glass windows were covered with scaffolding. Still an incredibly beautiful place to visit. Don't miss it. A few flights of steps to see the main windows, very narrow staircase. Make sure you don't take scissors, tools or other similar objects as they will be confiscated at the security point, and not returned

Beautiful Chapel!. Impossibly high ceilings with ornate colors and a beautiful rose window, Saint-Chapelle is worth a 30-45 minute visit even if you don't go to the Concierge. Originally built to house the crown of thornes, which is now at Notre Dame, this is one piece of "art" you shouldn't miss.

Exceptional stained glass in a beautiful church. expect 45-60 minute queues to entergrab a guide when you reach 2nd level to interpret the stained glass windowstake in the Conciergerie which is wonderful to understand the elements of the French revolution

Glittering. The lines are long, but the wait is worth it. I have never seen such spectacular stained glass windows. The volume and story of the work is overwhelming. It was lovely to arrive early and be able to sit and contemplate the setting. It is a mystical experience in a special place.

St. Chapelle Reconstruction. St. Chapelle is as spectacular as the guidebooks say. It is well worth the visit, but with two caveats. One side of the interior of the church is behind scaffolding, so there's no viewing those stained glass windows. The line to get in is horrible. We went late one afternoon, hoping to avoid crowds. wrong! The person monitoring the line told us to come back first thing in the morning because there is no line. Wrong again! We still had to wait an hour. Part of the backup were two tour groups which got to go to the head of the line. Going through security is laborious. I would still recommend getting there first thing in the morning. By 10:30 the cathedral was packed. I later read in Rick Steve's guide to Paris that Easter Monday is a national holiday. Many French people take off the week on either side of that weekend. This was my 5th time to Paris, and I had never seen lines like we encountered at the monuments and museum!
Don't skip. If your in Ile de la Cite, a must see. there is a big restoration of the stained glass underway but still marvelous, it doesn't take long either.

Beautiful, but very small inside.. Very beautiful glass mosaics, but the time in line and the price is close to too much for the very small room inside.The service at the ticket disk was terrible - here we met the crankiest Parisian lady in our whole trip

One of the best stain glass examples in nthe world.. Upon entering the main chapel you will be over whelmed by the beauty of the stained glass work. The fact that it was constructed in the 12th century makes it even more impressive. a recommended stop.
Sunny days required. An absolute must to see the stained glass windows is a sunny day. Good any day, but when the sun shines the windows come to life.
Astonishing. This may be the most beautiful place in Paris. The chapel windows are in the process of being cleaned. It is fabulous. By a Paris Museum pass and save time when the lines are long
Small but beautiful. Beautiful stained glass. When you go upstairs, head to back row of cards that have all the explainations of what scenes are depicted in the glass--I almost missed it!
A jewel, should not be missed. A couple of blocks from the Notre Dame but a world away in art and beauty. It is work the trouble to go through security go see the church, especially the second floor.

exquisite beauty;open your wallet. The good news: stained glass windows are all you have heard about and more. Absolutely beautiful colors, light and artistry. These windows are literally walls of dazzling color, most created centuries ago in an era of deep faith and belief in Divine Right of kings. The bad news: Originally, this place had to be funded by declaring yet another Crusade. It still needs funds. Not an active church anymore, there is a hefty entrance fee (as opposed to the other, free churches in Paris), long lines and a Sistine-Chapel crowding in the space itself. Forget any aesthetic contemplation - people are jostling about and are quite noisy. Also, there are concerts held regularly there, mostly Vivaldi's Four Seasons (which has nothing to do with the place). Don't go. These are simply tourist-trap concerts, played by rote. And the space was not built for Vivaldi, so any of his music gets lost and muddied. Check out St. Suplice instead; you can listen to a free mini recital on the best organ in Paris at 11:30 AM most Sundays, in between Masses.

A wonderful church and sometimes wonderful concerts. We didn't queue to get in here, rather we bought tickets for an evening concert which was divine. A friend told that were he to be turned on to The Church, this beautiful and spiritual building would be the only place in the world which might do it! There is beautiful ancient stain glass windows and a wonderful circular one. This building is on two floors and historically very interesting. Well worth visiting.

Standing Inside a Jewel. This beautiful church is a particular favorite of mine. Completely surrounded by stained glass, I felt as if I were standing inside a jewel. The only downside to my visit this particular time was that there was large scaffolding on 1/4 of the wall were they were doing cleaning & restoration work, but I guess it has to be done some time. I guess I'll just have to come back when it's done. :)

The most beautiful cathedral in Paris. If you only see one, skip Notre Dame and come here. Take the small stairs to the second floor and see some of the most beautiful stained glass windows in all of Europe.
Brill. It rained alot while we were there so didnt get to look around as much as i would have liked but still great to visit!

Don't miss.. One of our most memorable evenings in Paris was attending a concert at Sainte Chappelle. It is beautiful, and was cool, in April. We picked a performance including Vivaldi's Four Seasons. Bought tickets across the street at the Tabac store, the cheap seats, on the afternoon of the performance. Seeing the crowds waiting in line to get in that afternoon had me concerned about access to the chapel in the evening, but it was misplaced concern. If you have researched this particular concert, you will know that there is an online web site that will also sell you tickets, but only for the first 2 front sections. We were fine with where we sat. For an April evening, there was no problem getting tickets on the day of the performance. For the 7:00pm performance you are told to be there at 6:15pm, and at 6:10pm there was only a short line waiting to get in entrance #4. This allowed us to be in the first row of the last section, and since the last 2 rows of the section in front of us were not filled, there was a little breathing space. YMMV. The acoustics of the cathedral were excellent, and the performance exceptional. It was a great evening.
Stunning!. Walls and walls of stained glass! Amazing and so beautiful!
A must see in Paris!. It is a jewel of a church. It takes your breath away when you enter. It is one my favorite churches in all of Europe. Don't miss this!

Very impressive but the construction took away from it.. I visited the Sainte-Chapelle in April 2012. You can immediately see why this is a famous landmark. The stained glass is really amazing. When the glass comes in through the windows, it createa very cool atmosphere. However, a few things made this visit less memorable and (almost) not worth the time:- Line to get in. We got there at 9AM, opening time, and still had to wait 1 hour to get in through security. The Museum Pass doesn't help you get past the queue in this case. I guess this is normal for the famous landmarks in Paris, but it still wasn't fun. We did walk by later at different times and saw both shorter and much longer lines than the one we experienced, so it seems to be sort of hit-or-miss. Recommend moving on to something else in the area if the line is outrageous as you probably will find it shorter at another time (at least in April).- Construction. The church is under construction through most of this year. It doesn't diminish how impress it is but it made it harder to enjoy. We couldn't see an entire side of the church and the noise was very distracting in what should be a very quiet environment.Overall, it is something interesting to see but not as inspiring as some of the other sights in Paris.

Simply Stunning. This has to be one of the most beautiful churches I have seen (and after travelling through Italy for 3 weeks I saw a lot). The 12th Century stained glass is breathtaking and I would say well worth the slightly expensive entry fee.

So beautiful. Ascending the circular stairs to the top floor of Ste. Chapelle is rewarded with a breathtaking experience. The stained glass windows are one of the most exquisite things I have ever seen. Ethereal and glowing with the brass chandeliers illuminated, it's quite a moving experience. The painted columns and walls of the first floor are also very beautiful. It is my favorite church in Paris.
Beautiful Stain Glass. Incredable that such a building was built so fast in 1242 and with such beautiful glass. A must see when visiting Paris.

A beautiful surprise. I have somehow missed this church on my other visits to Paris. I am glad that I finally decided to check it out. What an original concept!!! A two story chapel! It has an absolutely magnificent interior with ornate stained glass windows, royal blue colors and the fleur de lys symbol everywhere. It was originally built by Louis IX to house his religious relics he brought back from the Crusades. It is definitely worth a visit. Buy your tickets ahead of time if possible and skip the lines.

Sainte Chapelle and Vivaldi. A wonderful experience to hear a passionate performance of the Four Seasons sitting in a work of art. Ordered ticket from Classictic.com before leaving the US. Ticket, charge all came off without any problem and e-ticket was available immediately. The 7pm concert allows you to appreciate the beauty of the walls of stained glass in the twilight. Go early for best seats. But simply sitting in an intimate space, surrounded by the beauty of more than one thousand stained glass vignettes, is remarkable and moving.

Timing is crucial!. The stained glass panels are truly exquisite. However, we arrived as the sun was beginning to set (the walk was longer than anticipated) and I believe we did not experience the full "jewel-box" experience. It is probably best to save this visit for a sunny day or a concert in the evening (when the lights illuminate the windows). The stairs are narrow and quite steep but it is worth the climb.

Simply stunning. The thought that it has survived from the 13th century is mind-blowing in itself. Just looking up at the ceilings of both the lower and the upper chapels is like nothing you can imagine.The effort of the restoration of the sttained glass is to be applauded.I got the joint ticket with the Conciergerie for 12,50 euro - very good value.
Stunning. Beautiful stain glass windows. Words cannot begin to describe them. I highly recommend a visit!!!!!

Like being inside an enchanted Jewery box!. This beautiful cathedral was built to house the ultimate relic of Christ's thorns. It has flor to ceiling stained glass, and iit is a breathtaking sight. It's a quick visit if the lines are not too long, so no need to plan a full day around it
Outstanding. The stained glass windows are fantastic. Truly breathtaking.
WOW. Keep going cause it is a long way in. Don't think that you are going to get photos in the Sainte-Chapelle, cause it is not allowed.
Don't be late!. Extraordinary stained glass, currently under renovation.
Little treasure. The security line is kind of a pain, reeeal slow but the chapel is worth it then. Would make sure to visit it when the sun is shining though to get the full effect of the windows.
Thrilling experience!. We saw a quintet perform Vivaldi's Four Seasons, at Sainte-Chapelle.....Wonderful!!!
under renovation. While the cathedral was undergoing renovations - they stained glass was fabulous.
Brought me to tears. The beauty of this chapel overwhelmed me. Words cannot describe.

The best hidden chapel in Paris. Beautiful small church with incredible stained-glass windows. If you go, I'd suggest visiting as part of the Paris Museum Pass. We were able to bypass a huge line with our pass, which was fantastic. Nice to stop by if you're visiting the nearby Conciergerie or Notre Dame Cathedral

Beautiful stained Glass. We visited the Sainte-Chapelle because it was in our Paris Museum Pass and we happened to be in the area going to the Notre-Dame; it was the most beautiful stained glass I have seen. Definitely worth visiting for some great photos and unbelieveable space for a quick break and moment of solitude despite the fact that you aren't alone. Breathtaking.

Sainte-Chapelle. This incredibly gorgeous chapel houses 13th century stained glass illustrating many books of the Bible. Gives an almost overwhelming sense of the enduring strength of Christianity over the centuries, grounding one in evidence of world history we've only read about.

Beautiful Church. Sainte-Chapelle (included in the Paris Museum Pass) is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. There was scaffolding when I visited -- they are restoring it -- but the clutter could not take away the grandeur of the stained glass windows. I would come back to see it again, even if it's a relatively small place and I surely saw all of it when I went -- just to be surrounded by those gorgeous windows. Anyway, here are some tips!1. It's a block or so away from Notre Dame, and between the Palais de Justice and Conciergerie, so you can see all four sites at one time. Excellent! 2. Check opening and closing times. They also close from 1 PM to 215 PM, so consider this when you line up (there's a long line) after noon.3. Speaking of the long line, there are plenty of evil people who will cut line. Be aware! Remember who are the people in front of you and behind you.4. Security will check your bag thoroughly with metal detectors and stuff, probably because it is adjacent to Palais de Justice.5. Groups cannot just walk-in. Please check this requirement if it applies to you.6. It's small so if you don't dawdle, you could be in and out in 10 minutes (not counting the time you line up).7. They have a gift shop! Food and drinks are not available.8. Photography is allowed.Don't miss this!
Awesome Church. This church is well hidden and you have to look for it, but its worth the time anc small cost. The stained glass windows are awesome and the colours are breattaking.

Memorable little place. If you come to Paris more than a few times, this wonderful little chaple is somewhere that will come to mind, and you'll say "oh, I haven't been there in a while... I want to go again!"
Beautiful stained glass. This is worth a trip for the awesome stained glass.

This is a MUST SEE church. One of the best sights of my trip.. We had to line up for about 45 mins to get in. There is no short line for museum pass as another reviewer said. It was certainly worth the wait. I am not a church person but totally loved this place. I wish I had known about the concerts before hand. It would be magic to go to a concert there. Yes there was restorations taking place, but it is still worth going. You will not be disappointed.

Go on a sunny day. This was the last thing I did in Paris. I went because my father suggested it. He said it was the most beautiful church in Paris. It is truly beautiful. I gave it a very good instead of excellent because of all the scaffolding and covering of several of the windows. I also think it would be better on a sunny day or later in the afternoon. There may be a longer wait in the afternoon, but the full sun would make the windows even more radiant. Give yourself at least an hour.
You have to visit!. The stained glass windows in this church are breath taking! It was one of my favorite things in Paris.

Impressive. I enjoyed this church more than Notre Dame, which is actually really close by on the same "island". If you go to see Notre Dame I suggest you take the tile to go see Sainte-Chapelle too. Personally I found it more beautiful and impressive. Of course the windows are great but the history is in my opinion pretty interesting too. Check it out!

My favorite in Paris. Don't miss this on your trip to Paris! Sainte-Chapelle is, hands down, my favorite spot in Paris. The glass windows are amazing. Also, there are concerts in the evening. The ambiance...just go. You won't regret it.
Absoultely beautiful and well worth the time to visit.. The line to get in. It seemed that they could not process the people very well.
Renovating. 1/3 of it is being renovated so you will see 1/3 of stained glass right now for a few months.

long waiting line but it worth it!!. one of the most beautiful churches in Paris, this is what all travelling books say about this place, and they are so true! you will have to wait the enter, best come before it opens around 9-9.30 every morning so you will not spend time in the big line. you will definitely be impressed. the conciergerie is 2 min away, it also is a place you should visit, and from experience i can tell you here you don't have to wait to much to enter

Windows that go for miles. Like Heaven inside with just lovely , intricate stained glass windows that are the most beautiful of any church I've seen,. You will have to wait on a long line next to the Parisian criminals because ironically the two are housed next to each other ? Please be in great shape because as with all Paris sights all the stairs are circular, tight and go on forever
Stunning stained glass. Do not miss this. A hidden gem a block away from Notre Dame.
Amazing Stained Glass. Beautiful old Church with wrap-around, floor to ceiling glass windows. Worth the small fee to get in.
Sunday night concert. This was a great addition to our trip. You couldn't find a better backdrop for a great concert.

Ste. Chapelle is beautiful. We came here on many friends recommendations and were thoroughly impressed with how beautiful this chapel was on the Islands. It has a lower chapel (smaller) and upper chapel (bigger), both very impressive and well preserved. The stain glass windows in the upper chapel are breath taking. One recommendation I can suggest is that you purchase passes in advance (would recommend this for all major attractions in Paris i.e. the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay). We waited for nearly 1.5 hours to enter and while it was well worth it, it would have been so much easier to have just done the advanced booking!

Under restoration, but well worth the visit!. The Sainte-Chapelle is almost worth the trip to Paris to see it. We'll have to return to see it again after the restoration is complete. This chapel is a marvel of Gothic art with the most beautiful stained glass windows depicting many of the main stories of the Bible. It takes some patience and a good telephoto lens to see all of the details. Roman Catholics will be in awe, Christians will be inspired, and others can marvel at the beauty of the art. All of our party thought it was more impressive than the main sanctuary of Notre Dame cathedral. If you visit Paris, make time for the Sainte-Chapelle (less than 10 minutes west of the queue for Notre Dame.
This is an often overlooked site. Go on a sunny day and marvel at the most incredible stained glass room!. There is ALWAYS a line to get in. Go early, bring coffee and a croissant, and enjoy.

Very Beautiful!. We visited Sainte-Chapelle twice. Once on Saturday night to listen to a concert for an hour. I'm not normally interested in classical music, but the performance was WONDERFUL. Beautiful music & voices. And the setting was amazing. It was still light at 7 pm so we could see all the colors of the stained glass windows. We then went back on Tuesday as part of a tour, so we got to see both the lower and upper chapels. There is some restoration still going on, but it is beautiful to see.

Astonishing!. Make sure you go up the stair case to the next level! A good time to go is after 4 pm - lineup seems to shorten up. Took us about 5 mins @ 5pm to see one of the most beautiful displays of ancient stained glass you will ever see. Another reason to go late is to let the lat sun light up the windows. Georgeous! A highlight of our trip

Unbelievable Stained Glass. This tour is self directed, and only takes a little while, once in the church. There will be lines outside and lines within the courtyard. Show your Museum Pass to the guard by the lines and you will walk right to the head of the line...no waiting. A must see - it is right around the corner from Notre Dame as well.
Most beautiful stained glass. The blue color is unique to St. Chapelle stained glass. Renovations are interesting.
Impressive stained glass. This church is known for it's stained glass and it certainly does not disappoint.

Don't judge this book by it's cover!. You could easily walk right by as there is nothing to see from the outside. Big Mistake! Thirteenth Century Gothic Chapel with the BEST STAINED GLASS windows you will ever see in your life. DO NOT MISS IT!

A Hidden Gem!. We were told to visit this by friends - queued up for an hour outside the Palais de Justice for the security check and walked into the Chapel... thought 'yes, nice...' Then noticed an upstairs staircase - WOW thank goodness we did. Stained Glass heaven.
amazingly breathtaking. walking into the chapel feels like entering a piece of heaven . The tallest, stained glass windows ever seen in such a lovely chapel
Less known, but as interesting as Nôtre-Dame. The vitrals are breathtaking. You are inmersed in light. Well worth the queue.
Plenty of French history artefacts..a must see!. Nice atmosphere, with cozy chambers and high glazed windows. Step carefully not to disturb the heroes/kings resting!!:)

Amazing stained glass! Get concert tickets!. This chapel is an amazing jewel box of stained glass. Each tiny window tells a story. Even the mosaic floor is interesting. We also saw a concert - Vivaldi's Four Seasons - and the acoustics for the strings and harpsichord were amazing. Very enjoyable. The cheap seats at 25 euro were still excellent. The entry for the concert is on the opposite side of the courtyard entry, and doesn't require an hour-long wait in line to go through security. Make sure to also look around the gift shop area downstairs if you take the regular tour. They have my favorite gift selection in Paris, especially for kid books and little toys.

Do not miss! Most memorable place!. Recommended by a relative who has travelled the world many times, and goes to France more than once/year. This breathtakingly beautiful building is like none other. Small, will only take a short time to see, but worth it. The hushed serenity of the basement chapel is a place to just sit and take in a feeling of awe not to be found anywhere else on my trip to France. It's almost a tear-jerker. Then take the tight spiral staircase up to where the "elite" were allowed to congregate, with its stunning stained glass and chandeliers. You may be fortunate enough to see the sun hit them at just the right time to create new levels of art on the floor and the walls. Go there!

Stunning. Be sure to visit the Sainte Chapelle in the heart of the Palais de la Cité on the Ile de la Cité. The stained glass is simply stunning. While the often heralded rose windows are the standard in the larger cathedrals, the windows in this small chapel, with their thousands of tiny stained glass components, really steal the show.
Worth the 30 minutes in line!. We did have to wait about 30 minutes but the upper chapel is so breathtaking it is absolutely worth it!

My favorite church in Paris. High-gothic stained glass dominates the interior chapel, which is cozy and accessable, as well as colorful-- due to the stained glass and interior paint. There isn't a single blank stone surface in this chapel!

Stunning.. Beautiful place to visit even if churches and museums are not your thing. The light is amazing. Make sure you don't miss the stairs to go upstairs (as we almost did...) as that is where the main chapel is! If you are into photography, take a tripod.

Lovely!!!!. This is worth the walk across the street from Notre Dame. Unbelievable stained glass windows that tell the Old Testiment story. Competed 80 years after Notre Dame, and never has a glass cracked!!
April in Paris. Long line for such a small chapel but do wait in long because this small chapel is amazingly beautiful.. Well worth the wait.
Worth the wait. Wonderful place. Truly breathtaking. The best part is upstairs so don't forget this. We nearly missed out until we saw other people going up. Queuing was worth it!

If you see nothing else in Paris you have to see Ste. Chapelle. Absolutely gorgeous and well worth the line and cost. I also went to an evening concert here which was outstanding, and the windows were stunning even though it was cloudy and rainy outside. It was cold though, dress warmly for the concerts! The acoustics are wonderful. Even without the concert, this place is unlike any other and should not be missed.

Unexpected beauty. My travel companion really wanted to go here, but I ahd not heard about it and was a bit sceptical. This was completely changed once we were inside. The lower level feels medieval and intimate, the upper level is simply magnificent!The stained glass windows, so many in such a small place, almost overwhelm you.A must see!The waiting line was about 50 minutes and you'll need to go through security. I would love to go there again for a concert. Concert tickets are sold in the brasserie across the street.

worth it!. This was on our "maybe" list, but I suggest you put it on your "must see" - but don't bother unless it is a sunny day to do the windows justice. Big line (security b/c of neighbouring Palais de Justice).
Sunset concert @ st chapelle. We got tickets for the 7pm concert to experience the sunset streaming through the stained glass. We heard Vivaldi's Four Seasons -- played with much passion.
Stain Glass. This church has two levels and the most impressive stain glass you will see.

Gothic vitreaux. I went to assist a concert. Actually is under maintenances works, so there are areas with a limited view. The vitreaux are outstanding, showing Bible scenes, and the gothic style is unique. We have to exit by the Justice Palace, a little bonus.
Absolutely Breathtaking!. This little church was one of the favorite places I visited on my trip. The stained glass is absolutely stunning. Worth the trip!

Unbelievable stained glass.. It's worth queuing to make your way into Sainte-Chapelle which is located within the grounds of the Justice Department . So you have to do a security check on the way in. The first level is just a tempter - the real show is upstairs. Simply beautiful!

Absolutley fantastic!. Not going to make a presentation of The "Sainte-Chapelle". The place is just stunning. It's really easy to find it. Closest metro station are Cite, on line 4 and for RER, line C, St Michel Station. Prepare to wait in line about half an hour or more during summer and be aware that you will have to pass a security control at the entrance.
Sainte-Chappelle - awesome stained glass. The stained glass in Sainte-Chappelle is awesome. A stunning royal chapel in the heart of Paris (very close to Notre Dame.)
Worth the visit. Simply stated, this chapel was beautiful! There is a security check that all must undergo before entering the chapel.

Years of cleaning still needed. The stained glass is amazing, but it is so dingy that it is difficult to see a lot of it. Headsets with a narrative would be helpful too. We went on a sunny day, so there was no excuse for not being impressed, but we weren't. If you have the museum pass, you've got nothing to lose, but if you are paying specifically for it, you might want to direct your funds elsewhere.

Stunning Stain Glass Windows and Odd Rules. Beautiful - but the museum pass does not get you in the express line - but the co-pass with the Concergerie does - at least on that day...very French make up the rules...but its worth the visit!!
Adorable. Great place to visit. Intimate, beautifully preserved. Central location. Romantic and historical.
Worth the long wait. We got there very early and waited for an hour. A small gem of a place, that will elicit a big WOW when you get into the main chapel.

Get tickets if you can.. If you can get into a concert here the acoustics are excellent and it is an intimate, inspiring setting. We saw a quartet and one soloist and it was excellent. Just an hour, but a great first night in Paris activity.
Worth the wait. The queues are almost interminable and move very slowly but it's worth the wait.
Stunning beauty. The artwork and other craftsmanship upstairs are incredible - don't just stay on the ground floor!

So worth the wait to see this amazing church.. The price is 8.50 euros for both the Sainte Chapelle and the Conciergerie but if you purchase together is only 12.50 euros and you can save 4 euros. Also if you have the tickets already you skip the long lines.
Beautiful!. The stained glass in this church is some of the most awe-inspiring I've seen throughout London, Paris, or Rome.
Hidden gem that you shouldn't miss. Stunning windows, all being restored. Very close to Notre Dame. Small fee to get in.
Music in these acoustics. We attended the Easter performance, including Mozart, Vivaldi, Bach. It was a lovely concert. The church is lovely.

Beautiful stained glass. A supremely historic church with unparalleled stained glass, if that's your cup of tea. I'd recommend going later in the day with your museum pass (close to closing time)--as the pass doesn't help with the security line which can be very long during the day. Towards the end they stop admitting regular ticket holders but allow the pass holders in--so our wait was around 10 minutes.

The Must -Do for any visitor. A unique little cathedral,the oldest and most beautiful in the World..worth the queue and the body scan.go upstairs to the Blue Stained Glass,it is a view not to be missed.
Stain Glass Walls. We had missed it on previous trips and were glad to visit. If you have an option - try to visit on a sunny day - the windows are superb and an engineering marvel.

concert in the evening. This little church is probably the most beautiful gothic church.It is great to sightsee in daylight with the sun shining through the colourful windows, and fantastic ito be there in the evening and listen to beautiful music. Our hotel helped us get the very best seats!
See a concert here if you can. We saw a Bach violin concert in this most gorgeous setting Wow

Very long lines and small chapel!!. I love the stained glass of the chapel. But the place is very small, once you are inside that's it, you see all the corners. We went up to the second floor and there was some renovation going on, so that takes away the beauty of the chapel. There was no excitement at all. The lines were long.
