We spent more time just waiting to get in than looking inside the chapel. Not going back there.
Astonishing. A surprising visit...was not expecting to be so moved by the Stained Glass.

Unexpected!. Loved our luck! We were the first ones admitted after their 12:30 - 2:15 lunch break. We ahd the place to ourselves for over 15 minutes. I'm not aure why otheres were so delayed in entering because the line was long behind us, but we were very happy to spend some time aline in this incredible, exotic looking chapel. We loved the stain glass, really amazing. It is small, compared to other local churches, so can get crowded quickly. Because the top floor offers the most beautiful views, we started upstairs and worked our way down.You might also enjoy the Consiergerie, next door. Very worhtwhile viewing experience, seeing the former palace, turned prison. Interesting to see where they held Marie Antoinette before her execution, as opposed to her home at Versailles!

awesome. the stained glass windows are amazing works of art! actually enjoyed it better here than notre dame! i beleive there is a fee to get in but we had purchased a two day museum pass and this was covered...would recommend the pass!

Sainte-Chapelle Concert is a Must. Visiting Sainte-Chapelle to see the beautiful structure, stained-glass windows is wonderful. But you only truly experience the majestic beauty if you attend an evening concert. The one that begins at 7 PM is the best as the sun is setting about that time and you see the grandeur of the stained-glass while listening to Bach, Schubert, Haydn or other classics played by the Chamber Orchestra. This was a highlight of our recent Paris trip.

Amazing - but under construction. The windows, as you can imagine, we're stunning! But, paying to enter and having to wait in a long queue was off-putting. And the noise due to the construction was distracting. That being said, if you're in Paris for 3+ days, go. If you're in Paris just for the weekend, it's a skip.
Beautiful!!. This is a beautiful church. The stain glass windows are stunning. We went in the morning and got right in. You can use your museum pass to get in.

Amazing Stained Glass. The windows at Sainte-Chapelle were everything I'd expected they would be and more! I could not believe the craftsmanship that went into their creation. The only part of this attraction that I wasn't prepared for was it's size. I was expecting a huge monument, when really, it was quite small. Good for a quick outing if you don't have much time but want something to do.
Saintly colours and sparkles. This is an absolute must see in Paris. A long flight of steps emerge into a beautiful chapel. On a sunny day, the colours that come through the windows are amazing!

Beautiful but small!. You might wait a lot in 2 lines, one for security and one for ticket. The chapel itself is small...one downstairs and the main one upstairs...but they are really pretty. Kids don't pay. XIII century stained glass worth the wait and the walls atre a work of art but you will spend more time in line than inside because it is small! Worth seeing and paying to help them restore it and save forever!!
Quite nice.... But...a little church with a long line. Hmm...I believe there are more interesting things to see in Paris, but it's not a complete wash!

Stained Glass Heaven. The reason to visit is obviously for the remarkable panels of stained glass in this chapel. Definitely one of my favorite stops in Paris, even though it was crowded. Don't forget to have some ice cream nearby.
Let there be light!. Beautiful chapel designed to hold the crown of thorns. The light is blocked on one side by an adjacent building which takes away from the overall effect somewhat.
BEAUTIFUL!. the stained glass windows are gorgeous and it doesn't take hours to see all of it.
Wow factor. A big wow factor.Bathed in coloured light. A must see - much better than Notre Dame

This is a stunningly beautiful church. The most magical thing about this church is its stained glass windows. It's probably best to visit later in the day when the sun moves round to the rose window on the west side.
good for concerts, too. The building is sadly in need of a good clean : but the accoustics for small concerts are amazing

Attend an evening concert. We chose to attend an hour concert at Saint Chapelle in the evening rather than tour it. The stained glass is beautiful and in most months it is still dusk at 6:30 when you enter for the concert. It is classical music and they performed favorite baroque pieces such as Vivaldi's Four Seasons and Pachelbel's Canon. We purchased tickets online prior to our trip. We entered at #4 for the concert. It's just left of the gates of the Palace of Justice (golden gates). We also toured the Concegerie prior to the concert and had time for wine and cheese at Les Deux Palais across the street before the show. You do go through security prior to entrance. The music was beautiful in a gorgeous setting and I found it far more memorable than walking through for an hour. It is a miracle that so much stained glass has been preserved over so many hundreds of years. Some people don't realize that every color of glass is hand cut and leaded- read about it before attending a concert to appreciate its significance.
One of my favorite spots in Paris. I love Sainte-Chapelle. There is not much to say about it other than it is stunningly beautiful.

Great Stained Glass. This "tour" is really only 2 rooms so it's not a great bang for your buck. However, you can't see it from the street the way you can the other churches and the stained glass is really beautiful in the sunlight.
Fabulous. Havr you seen this place? It is etherial! The windows are beautiful. I went to an evening concert of Vivaldi and it was inspiring.

Small but powerful (potentially). Compared to the Minster at York....this thing is miniscule. That being said once you get up to the second floor, you are surrounded 360 with immense and endless stained glass. Unfortunately for us half of the glass was being restored, so we were left with half a "wow" and the other half was "whats all that scaffolding doing in here". I'm glad we went and I'd spend the 8Euro (I think) and hour there again.

WOW! Just go there!. Utterly wonderful. Big queues -- get there early. Avoid the cafe opposiet -- coffee is disgusting.The day we went they were showing in the lower Chape,l on their TV screen showcasing DVDs on sale, Monty Python's Life of Brian! Weird....
Breathtaking. This has to be seen - stained glass the best I've seen anywhere - GO!

Stunning. Prepare yourself to be completely blown away. We expected to just visit for a few moments to see what the chapel was all about. My wife eventually had to drag me out. The windows are amazing! It is best to visit on sunny days.
Absolutely stunning.. There's nothing to dislike about this place other than the queues - go for when it opens! But very much worth a visit - even if you're nowhere near this place, make the trip!
Magnificent. We attended an evening concert and it was absolutely divine. Highly recommend.

Beautiful!. Can skip the lines with a Paris Pass. Had some renos when we were there aug 2011. The lower part of the cathedral is somewhat dark, although pretty (meant for lower classes I think) the upper level is amazing (was meant for royalty) and definitely worth the visit.

Extraordinarly beautiful. This was the most extrardinary chapel of all the churches and chapels we saw on our recent trip to Paris, Milan and Rome. The stain-glass in Sainte-Chapelle is otherworldy in its beauty and grandeur. Every person who stood with us in looking up at the beautiful glass was stunned into silence. Don't dare miss it!

The most beautifull "vitraux" of the world. This small chapel holds the most beautiful window in the world. It a very small church, hiden in the midle of Isle de La Citee, but if worth every minute ou need to wait in line to visit it.
Breath taking. This is a MUST see in Paris. Wait in that line. It is worth it.
Beautiful stained glass windows from the Middle Ages. Wonderful Gothic architecture with stained glass windows on the second level. We used our paris Museum Pass to avoid the long entry line.

Stunning... but will be even more so when the scaffold comes off.. If you're planning a trip here I have three tips:Wait: There's currently restoration taking place to the entire church. We went on a very sunny March afternoon and all along the north side the light was blocked out by scaffolding. Obviosuly this can't be helped and is essential to the maintiaing the glass but if you can - visit it another time.Visit either early or late: The stained glass it at its best when the sun is either to the east or west. I would recommend a visit just after it opens or at about 6pm.There was a little confusion on the way in also - just to let you know that firstly you go through a security check point (as the chapel is located within the grounds of the ministry of justice). THEN you follow the signs to the church building (straigt ahead and turn right). At this point don't go straight to the booth by the door unless you bought your tickets before the visit. If you are buying your tickets on the day you need to go behind the booth to the ticket window where you purchase tickets first. Lots of people didnt relaise this and ended up queueing twice.Luckily I live in Paris and can't wait to return once the work is complete to see this stunning church in all it's glory. It's also worth taking a guide book or some notes with you to give you the details on the windows - I used 'Paris Top 10' which gives some really interesting details that you may otherwise miss.

Not to be Missed!. This place is so incredible that when I got to the top of the circular staircase I ran into the woman ahead of me. Why? Because she did what I did, just looked up in wonder. The stained glass is beyond description. And when they finish the restoration on the side they are working on now it will be without compare. But then the lines will be so long you will be unable to get in!

Depends on your taste. My kids really liked this place because of the pendulum. I thought is was good - just would be good to have more information on the various art work - knowing the information in more detail adds dimension to the experience and I felt this missed that dimension.
A lot of reading. Interesting museum - well laid out and labelled in English. A quiet place to visit.

Impressive. To get pass the long line, we bought tickets to both Conciergerie and Saint Chapell thanks to tips from Tripadvisor. This helped and we could also visit a temporary exhibition "Bêtes off" which really gave us an unexpected art experience.Saint Chapelle is one of the most beautiful gotic buildings I have ever seen and the sunbeams through the windows was a bit of heaven.

Loved the stained glass and collection of Gargoyles!. Thought it was a little over-rated and of course there were unavoidable queues (not in Paris Pass).Received some nasty rust stains from the bannister as we climbed the spiral staircase. Needs to be attended to.
Beautiful. I last visited over 40 years ago and remembered it as a high spot. My husband had never been and I was concerned that it wouldn't be as spectacular as I remembered, but it was.
Gorgeous!. This little hidden gem is beautiful--possibly more gorgeous than Notre Dame! The stained glass is just breathtaking, and the intimacy of the space just adds to the experience!

cool inside, if your into old churches. Very grand and powerful inside, like many of these old buildings/churches in paris, if your not a church fan dont go unless it's free, i forget if you pay or not.

HIdden treasure must be visited when in Paris. Once a church, now an attraction that should not be missed. Enter first into a small and lovely ground floor chapel which has a narrow stairwell to the second floor tucked in the back. An elevator may also be used if the old stone stairwell poses difficulty. After climbing the winding stairs, you will step out into a large space totally enclosed with the most beautiful stained glass windows. Even on an overcast day their beauty is breathtaking....Nearly floor to ceiling - practically encasing the entire room in brilliantly colored glass. Placards in a stand offer information about the chapel in a number of languages - and there is a gift shop. Probably the most memorable and unexpected experience of my trip to Paris. Encourage going on a sunny day if at all possible.

The best place in France. Not just the best in Paris, the best in the entire country, and maybe the world. This little chapel, hidden inside a police station, has 30 foot high floor to ceiling all four walls of the most beautiful stained glass windows in the world. The "jewel box" sparklies in the sun, and is quite simply the most wonderful and spiritual place on the planet. Only a block from Notre Dame, most people miss it, but by comparison, it should be the other way around. This is a can't miss!

Beautiful, a gem in Paris.. There are bigger cathedrals to see, few though as a beautiful. If you appreciate stain glass, Ste-Chapelle's windows are simply the the best for rich color, exquisite designs, and beauty.

Tour and Concert. I visited twice--once during the late afternoon to see the wonderful stained glass fully lit and again in the evening for a chamber concert. The church is worth visiting, but the line to get in can be long and the process of clearing security slow. The problem is that Sainte-Chapelle is in the Palace of Justice complex, so to get to the church you have to pass through the security for the government office. It was worth doing, but just barely.

The most beautiful church in Paris. The secuirty line to get in to this church can sometimes be long, but it is worth it. The stained glass windows are the star attraction and they are amazing. This is a definite "must see" attraction.

Spectacular!. We have lived in Paris 3 different times in the last 3 years and have never been here because the lines were always so long. We finally went a couple of weeks ago, and it was definitely worth waiting for! The windows are absolutely beautiful, as is the floor (when I got tired of looking up, I started looking down), and the carvings of different stories from the bible outside the door of the chapel were wonderful. My advice is not to be deterred by the lines (which, unfortunately, are inside as well as outside) and make a point of seeing this beautiful place.

Beautiful stained glass windows. If you have time and want to see another beautiful church I would stop here, but if you are short on time, its one you can pass up. Beautiful stained glass windows that tell the story of the building and probably more impressive than the stained glass windows than the notre dame but a smaller church.
Best Windows. This was recommended by family and friends and is worth the trip

Small but beautiful church. This is a very little church but it's really beatiful the windows and the paintings of the walls are amaizing, there are free guided visits so when you visit the church is a good idea to check if there is one to get the full explanation, it really worth it.

Breath-taking. From the outside, this place doesn't seem so amazing and rather plain but once inside and upstairs to view the historic stained glass designs, all we heard were exhales of wonder from everyone who turned the corner into the chapel.The negative was the wait as we didn't feel it was worth purchasing a museums pass (gets you to the front of the line). 1.5 hours wasn't bad for this kind of thing (very normal for major Paris sights) We wouldn't have thought twice about it except that from the street, the line might look short but there's a second line once you get past that - something we didn't expect so the wait seemed longer than it would have otherwise.
Amazing chapel. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. The windows in the upper chapel are amazing. This is a place that everyone should visit in Paris.

Concert was amazing. Attended an evening concert in Sainte Chapelle. Amazing venue. I recommend the 7pm time while it is still light (rather than 8:30) so you can see the windows. Buy tickets from the restaurant just across the street on the day of the event and you may get a reduced price.
Wow. The restored stained glass windows are amazing. Can't wait for all of them to be restored.

Breathtaking. I didn't expect much the first time I visited Sainte-Chapelle...Interesting architecture from the outside, sure, but that gives absolutely no indication as to what you're in for when you go inside. The wall-to-wall-to-wall stained glass simply takes your breath away. A fairly steep, long and curving set of stairs takes you both up and down into the church itself...my mother has arthritis in her knees and hips and so she found the stairs a bit challenging, but the view absolutely made up for it.

Concert. We attended an evening concert here. It was so, so beautiful--the setting, the music. Anything would be wonderful here. It lasted a little long, and they left the doors open to the chapel, so everyone was cold (even the soprano!), but I will do it again every time I return to Paris. Gorgeous! Don't miss the exposed, ancient wall behind the altar, and ask about it. Of course, the stained glass is beyond description. Go!

Stunning. I had been to Paris many times, but had never previously taken the time to visit Sainte-Chapelle. I'm so glad my wife and I took the time on this trip. It was a moving experience and I highly recommend it to everyone.It can be a bit tricky to find. Although shown on many maps, it's not immediately clear that it's actually INSIDE the Palais de Justice and you must go through a security checkpoint to reach the interior courtyard which surrounds the church.When entering the church, you first go into the Lower Chapel which is quite nice, but the Lower Chapel pales in comparison to the stunning beauty of the Upper Chapel. Recent restoration work on the windows and the interior has brought out striking details. We were simply awe-struck.Chairs are placed along the sides of the Upper Chapel for occasional music concerts. Many visitors were taking advantage of these chairs to sit quietly as they absorbed the magnificent beauty of the space.
Must see.. Superb. I still don't know how the roof is supported, the walls seem to be all stained glass. It's only a short walk from Notre Dame but few people seem to go. Don't be one of these!
standing in a jewelry box. Beautiful, short visit (10 minutes). Included in the museum pass
Glorious stained glass. Think about a beautiful old chapel with stained glass for most of the walls. A recommendation--look for occasional chamber music recitals, the acoustics are fantastic.

Sainte-Chapelle is a Must See. It is currently under restoration, but the stained glass while being cleaned and restored is stll beautiful. Pamphlets in many languages are readily available to describe each of the windows.

one of the most beautiful churches I have ever been in. Quite amazing that this church is two in one. The lower chapel was pretty, the ceilings are dark blue and gold and the stained glass is beautiful. However, take a small spiral staircase upstairs and you come to the grand chapel with the floor to ceiling windows that go around the chapel and are a pictoral diagram from the creation to crucifixion. Since many people couldn't read then they used these windows to tell bible stories to the parishoners. Quite beautiful when the sun was streaming in. Notice the floors, they are also pretty and beautifully colored. The only negative aspect of this church is finding it. Can be tricky, as it is inside the judicial buildings and you need to go thru security to get to the courtyard inside the courts where this church is located. Tip after you come thru security there are free WC down the staircase on the left.

Try to book in advance. We made the mistake of just turning up and queued for absolutely ages out on the street then oddly found we had to queue again once inside but quite stunning so probably worth it.
close to Notre-Dame so don't miss it. Almost completely refurbished and a delight to listen to a classical concert in there (almost every week in season). A gothic pearl!

Wonderful!. Definately worth going!
At first it seems unimpressive but then you go up to the upper chapel and is truely beautiful.
Highly recommend

A jewel of stained glass and beautiful music. One of the most beautiful places in Paris - and where there are many intimate and informal concerts. Watch light poles for advertisements to these. The stained glass defies description, and simply glows, especially at night. Bag search on entry and some wonderful medieval touches still remaining in the architecture.
Sainte-Chapelle worth a visit. This beautiful chapel gets overshadowed by Notre Dame sometimes. The stained glass windows are a beautiful main feature. It's rather small and so interesting.
beautiful. Currently under construction, but otherwise one of my favorite places.
Stain Glass is spectactular. Not a big fan of churches and admission fees, but this was worth it
Don't miss their concerts. A beautiful chapel but also an excellent concert venue.
One of the best places in Paris. The stained glass on a sunny day, the acoustics for a concert
Breathtaking stained glass. It can be a wait, but the inside view is worth it. Beautiful stained glass in a church that is centuries old.
Amazing Light and Beauty at Sainte-Chapelle. The upper chapel is an absolute treasure of stained glass and really one should not leave Paris without visiting it

A wonderful world of colors. Sainte-Chapelle is a glorious attraction. A definite must see in Paris. The highlight of the attraction is contained within the second floor. It is a room bathed in wonderful colors from many stained glasses. Each stained glass tells a dramatic story of the bible. The visit can be done in 30 minutes as there are only two floors with exhibits. The second floor is simply amazing and awe-inspiring. It is one of the structures that makes me wonder about the talent of craftsmanship from a long ago time. The dedication and artistic narrative represents human triumph and beauty.This is a great attraction to see with the Paris Museum Pass. The Pass covers the cost of entry, gets you to the front of the line, and allows you to visit at different times of lighting. It is also a good visit for when you are a little tired of walking. The stained glass floor contains ample seating, so you can sit and take in all the marvelous colors, stories and artwork.

Wow!. Hit this place at the right time, and you will not be disappointed. The stained glass windows are incredible. Not a huge church for touring, so it is a nice break from Notre Dame. Definitely a "don't miss" in Paris.
Stunning stained glass. This is just off the beaten track but the upper chapel is stunning. Buy a museum pass and avoid the long queues

Most beautiful building in Paris. I love Sainte-Chapelle. It's my favorite building in the world. Being inside is a magical experience. The stained glass which surrounds the building creates a special glow in the interior. I spent about an hour here on my most recent visit just sitting and enjoying. It's a very special place with lots of historical significance.
Beautiful!. We had such a wonderful day at St Chapelle! The pictures we took our amazing! The bible in stained glass? Amazing.
Exquisite. a must see, preferably on a sunny day. The stained glass windows in this jewel of a chapelle are truly awe-inspiring.
Breath-taking!. The total wow-factor is present in the lovely history of this little gem. Parts of the church are under repair but it was still a must see.

Beautiful. Hard to tell where to enter. We went to one place that wanted to charge to enter so we didn't enter. As we were walking around the island, we saw it from the back side and entered the church from there. I'm still not sure what that was all about
Beautiful chapel, well worth the visit. You don't need to spend a lot of time, but this chapel is worth the visit for being so beautiful and unique.

Small but surreal. A tiny chapelle just behind the Palais de Justice. Filled with stained glass, the color sparkles when sunlight streams into the space. There is a lower chapel, with a painted Annunciation. After climbing the narrow confined stairs in near darkness, you are greeted by a purely verticalized space, the Upper Chapel, filled with 15 tall glass windows done in the Rayonnant Gothic style, as you enter the upper chapel where the royals worshipped during pre-Revolution days. Here on the stained glass, there are more than 1,000 scenes of the Passion of Christ and Old and New Testaments. It's a startling effect and you're gawking for a few minutes. A really one-of-a-kind experience in this city full of unique experiences. Go on a weekday and pair the visit with one to the Conciergerie nearby and to Notre Dame.

If you have time.... This is a lovely little chapel with beautiful stained glass. At one time it was the home to relics that were said to be Jesus' Crown of Thorns. The relics have since been moved to Notre Dame. There is an 8.50€ entry fee, which i found unusual for a church. Because it is in the courtyard of the Justice Department you have to go through security clearance.  I would recommend this chapel if you have extra time. It took us 25 minutes to go through security and another 15 minutes to buy our tickets.
Awesome. a true piece of history.Hard to imagine a person could have an ego so large to build an entire chapel for himself of such magniicence.

A wonderful experience of light and color.. I visited this chapel, hidden by an outer courtyard wall, just before closing time (around 5 pm). We only had an hour to visit the church, but that was more than enough time to view the majestic stain glass windows on the second floor. Because it was the late afternoon, we got to see the sunlight filter through the western windows and play off the walls and ceilings. You may be tired of visiting churches after a trip to Notre Dame. However, I recommend this experience because it is completely different. Sainte-Chapelle is smaller, so the experience is more intimate. You are literally closer to the stain glass windows. Also, the windows are longer and take up most of the walls, which means that more light shines through.Lovely.
Pretty Stained Glass. Worth a visit before or after Notre Dame. Undergoing restoration to be completed in 2013
stained glass spectacular. you must go inside , best on a sunny day, watch out for line ups, best to purchase ticket or pass before going

Beautiful. Get the combined tickets for the Conceigere as well andyou can skip the queue when you get to the entry line for Sainte Chapelle. Lots of info in all languages around, it is so beautiful if you can visit on a sunny day then that would be perfect. The entrance was difficult to find tho, just up from the enormous ornate gates.

Incredible. I have heard about these windows for years, but this is the first time I got to see them. Words do not describe their beauty. The church building itself is wonderful, but the stained glass windows are definitely a MUST SEE. We did not have a beautiful sunny day, but even so they were just breathtaking.

Loved it ! Amazing windows !. The stained glass windows are absolutely fantastic - come here for them alone !Not sure the cost to enter as we had the Paris Museum Pass so it was included (also skipped the lines)
Concert. We attended a beautiful Vivaldi concert in the Chapel

Marvelous stained glasses. The stained glasses which form almost 70% of its wall are just awesome. Each of the wall tells different story and bring out it best under the sunlight. Its recommended to go there when the sun is up so you could see the marvelous color and stories the glasses portray.
amazing!. We had never seen this church before. What a treasure! These are the most impressive stained glass windows we've ever seen.

Stunning stained glass windows. Beautiful church. When you enter the main body of the church you will gasp at the windows, their size and colour. They soar upwards and you will wonder how the roof can be supported on such slender columns. I visited using a Paris museum pass which I thought was good value.

Walls of Light.. When you first walk into SC you may be surprised to find yourself in a dark low roofed arched chamber which comes to life through the extensive mediaeval wall paintings. This isn't what you've read about although it engenders a strong sense of its past. Then you see the stone staircases that do take you up to Sainte Chapelle itself. Several people I have taken to SC have found themselves without words when first confronted by the experience. It is visually stunning. The narrow stonework thrusts skyward toward the apex of the roof and in doing so creates sense of speed, lightness and movement. As they reach upward they are so slim you feel they are defying the gravity that must be pressing down on them , Between them these narrow stone arches also support the huge expanses of window that create the effect of glass walls or better still walls of light. The overall effect then is of light as an almost tangible substance that as it strikes the stonework and the people within, seems to give them an appearance of existing simply because of the light.There is also a crown of thorns that was purchased by King Louis IX (St.Louis) who built the SC. in 6 years starting in 1242. The crown of thorns was bought from Baudouin Emperor of Constantinople and cost 4 times s much as SC, Rip off if you ask me.

Take your time. You enter the church and it´s beautiful and OK, but not superb. Go upstairs and hold your breath... amazing. Take a sit (there are lots of chairs available) and enjoy it. Each window tells you a whole story. Don´t miss it!!!
The best!. Without a doubt, the most beautiful church in the world. A must see. Try to go on a sunny day so that you can really see how beautiful the beautiful stained glass windows.

Gothic Jewel. The second floor stained - glass windows are one of the architectural wonders of the World. There are almost no walls, only coloured glass.The entry is through the Court building, including passing a metal - detector
Wonderful! Beautiful!. The most amazing stained glass windows, quite breathtaking!
Wow!. While at Notre Dame take a little stroll - you will not be disappointed. Simply amazing!

Don't let a cloudy day stop you!. On my last visit, the entire week was overcast and I was concerned to take my dear friend as I thought the experience would not match a recent visit with clear bright skies. Wrong - - the cloudy day made for a different but equally wonderful experience. The lower light made all the colors very even and brilliant. Each story was actually easier to decipher. A tip - we were hoping to catch an English tour but none were offered during March. Note: In and out of the grand chapel requires stairs up and down, sure footedness is key to a good visit!
Beautiful. So much delicate stained glass. A wonderful structure to see. Amazing structure from so many centuries ago.

A must see. You hardly hear of this site as a "major" site unless you do your research but this is a MUST see. It's small but absolutely amazing. The lines might be long but if you have the time, work it into your visit when going to Notre Dame since it is near by.

Mind Blowing!. Wasnt really sure what to expect, when you first enter the little shop area you can tell how old and steeped in history this place is. its not until you walk through the door that your jaw drops, its a good job there are chairs lining the outside because you could sit there for hours trying to take it all in. It was very busy when we were in there with lots of tour groups but if you can ignore that and just soak it all up its one of the most memorable places on my visit to Paris.

Hidden secret of Paris. Most people know to visit Sainte Chapelle for it's historic value, but the real treat for Sainte Chapelle is going to a concert in the evenings. Baroque quartets are usually performing, and are magical in this setting!

Extraordinary! - worth the wait in line. We waited about 45 minutes in line to see this, and it was worth it. I had been told that Sainte-Chapelle was magnificent, but when we first entered the lower level, I didn't know what all the fuss was about. Then we went upstairs. WOW. This is in my top three Paris sights, along with Notre Dame and Versailles. A must see.

My favourite site to visit in Paris. I love Saint Chapelle and fell in love with it ever since I first visited it in 1988. The church is a rare treasure - the light streams in through the stained glass at various angles throughout the day, changing the look and feel of it continuously. I like to sit there for hours and take in the chapel and the many stories the details found on the stained glass . It's always my meditation moment in there, taking me from the sounds of Paris and into this library-quiet sanctuary.
Beautiful stained glass. The stained glass in this place is something to be marveled at. Even on cloudy days, the room is just washed in light, and you can feel the history.

Most beautiful stained glass. Amazing stained glass windows, we went on a cloudy day and still had great color. This was close to Notre Dame and easy to walk between the two. It is also close to some excellent little restaurants.
Little but beautiful. The history of the Sainte-Chapelle is very interesting. It is little and the visit can be done in less then 1 hour.
Museum pass inclusion. Its included in pass and worth a visit not far fromNotre Dame

If you visit one place in Paris come here. Sainte-Chapelle is an old chapel with an incredible interior. The stained glass to wall ratio has to be about the highest in Europe and it has a unique design compared to other churches in Europe. It is to churches as the Hall of Mirrors is to Palaces. It is a very quiet place because all who view it are awe struck.

The most beautiful stained glass. I first visited the lovely chapel in 1979 and then again in 2000. It's beauty remains the same after all the years in between visits. IT contains some of the most beautiful and unusual stained glass windows I have ever seen. The painted vaulted ceilings are also something quite beautiful. The chapel is a little off the beaten path and not as well documented as Notre Dame but it is worth a special visit. I send friends there all the time and they are always so appreciative of my recommendation. This place never disappoints.

Exquisite - nothing like it!. This church is just gorgeous with its huge dome of stained glass. The glass panels each have a scene from the Bible starting from Genesis to the new testament. Such amazing detail, you will be awed!

Tiny Church, Incredible Stained Glass. This church doesn't look like much from the outside. You do have to wait in a line because of the security check. It is worth it! The stained glass gives such a beautiful effect from the interior. They are doing renovations right now so it looks a bit different than the last time I was there, some of the panels were covered, etc. but it will probably be even more beautiful when they are done.
do not miss. The stained glass is phenomenal. always go to see again

Outrageously beautiful stained glass. We saw this on our last day in Paris and so glad we did. It was stunningly beautiful...gothic architecture is a favorite of mine. However, if you only have a few days in the city, I would recommend checking out Notre Dame and Sacre Couer first...mainly because they are free and don't have terribly long lines (at least not when we were there) and are stunning. But if you are just plain interested and have tired of all the other cathedrals, then St. Chappelle is for you!
By far my favorite church we visited.. This is an absolute must see. Notre Damme is fantastic, but this one blows it away.

St. Louis' Cathedral still awes us. Sainte-Chapelle was the church built by St. Louis IX of France to contain his holiest relic, the Crown of Thorns. The church has an upper and lower level and was originally full of sculpture including life size images of the twelve apostles; fragments of these are now at the Cluny along with the heads of the Kings of Israel, which the revolutionaries mistook for Kings of France. A statue of St. Louis IX is in the upper level and is one of the few early pieces portraying him. The stained glass is fourteenth century and phenomenal. The blue colored walls and golden Fleur-de-lis patterns are still vibrant. A place of beauty and history.

A Gothic Jewel Cask. This is a very gorgeous little chapel. It is full of history and on a sunny day lights up in the most amazing display of color. The walls of Sainte-Chapelle are all stained glass, so if you love color and inspiration don't miss this sight.
most missed fabulous site in paris. tiny chapel made of stained glass, just behind notre dame. unbelievable and magical. concerts are offered here at night, too.
WOW!!. I really loved this Church. The stained glasses are amazing! Its really beautiful inside.Free entrance to -18 or -25 if you are a EU citizen!!
impressive. huge and amazingthe vitro (glasses) are really tall and so impressive.it's near 'notre damme' and it's worth seeing.

A hidden Gem. Make the effort to find and visit this special place. I get a little "churched out" in Europe - each cathedral starts to blend with the others, but not this one! It is very small by comparison and the stained glasswork is extraordinary. There is a set of spiral stairs at the back wall of the chapel - be sure to go upstairs and have a look. I won't say anymore, be surprised!
A stained glass miracle. Tucked inside the massive Palais de Justice, Sainte-Chapelle is one of the absolute 'must-see' attractions in Paris. It is an amazing tribute to the medieval glass makers.

My expectations were too high!. Unfortunately it was a cloudy day I visited the Sainte-Chapelle and I could not see the whole beauty. It is really small and nice for sure, but nothing special for me for 8 euros...

Impressive church. A great church, it has in fact two great chapels. The smaller one is located in the ground floor and shows an impressive display of clerical art. The largest one has one of the most impressive glass that I've seen in a church so far. They are extremely big and well decorated with religious scenes. The light and colours they cast in the church's interior are unbelievable!
People gasped when they entered. Well worth money. Truly beautiful. Highly recommend. Wish I went to a concert there. They have some in evenings.

Most beautiful church. Sainte-Chapelle is the most beautiful church in Paris. It isn't very large and it takes a bit of finding (you have to go into the courts complex and through security) but it is worth it. The colour of the ceiling has to be seen to be believed and the stain glass windows are just stunning. It is well worth it to find it and pay the entrance fee.
Beautiful Building.. Great to go see especially on a sunny day. Glass windows are beautiful.
Lovely Light Show. Amazing stained glass surrounding the upper chapel. Totally worth the visit. Highly recommend visiting when the sun is out - it hits the stained glass and is breathless.
Beautiful. The upstairs is georgeous but it's not very big to walk so you can finish this quickly.
Loved it even more this time. We took our time as we did not have our children with us. We could absorb the beauty of the place.
Beautiful... Round the Corner from Notre Dame and the Louvre it's an overlooked gem, the stained glass windows here are a sight to behold. One not to be missed.

Gorgeous Stained-Glass. If you are only planning to visit one church, this one should be it! The stained-glass windows are breathtaking! The church is smaller than I expected, but we loved it none-the-less. A definite must see!
Free with museum pass. It was nice to pop in with our museum pass and admire the nice interior of this cathedral. However we still prefer our visit to the Notre Dame next door.

Wonderful stained glass windows. Make sure the weather is good when you go to enjoy the stained glass windows. There are laminated cards on different languages available explaining the stories on the stained glasses, you have to be fast or be patient with the English cards as they get unavailable more than the others. Sit awhile and enjoy the chapel.

75% stained glass chapel from 1190ish. The chapel is undergoing needed renovations to be completed in 2013. There are 2 chapels here and the piece-de-resistance is the upper chapel accessed by a very narrow staircase. There you will find a chapel almost entirely made of stained glass windows telling the story of Christianity. It is breath-taking and not to be missed.
Breathtaking. Really worth a visit. The stained glass windows are simply breathtaking. hardly any queues also which is nice!
Wow. I have never seen such beautiful windows in such an old building. Loved it - took mega amount of photos.
A rare beauty. This small church, reveals a real feist for the eyes on its second floor ! If you go around 3p.m. you will see the glass glow with the setting sun. Absolutely wonderfull!
Awe Inspiring. I had never truly appreciated stained glass until seeing this chapel with sun streaming through its beautiful windows. Another place that would be good to go on a sunny day.

Great at any time of day!. No need to only go in bright sunlight since the ability to study the individual stained glass pains is often easier with indirect sunlight. Your museum pass will not get you through the line to security, but once through it will get you ahead of the ticket buyers (any line on the street means you get at the end of it!)
Hidden Gem!. Make sure you pay this beauty a visit! You won't be disappointed.
Beautiful!!. Take time to just sit and soak it in! There are multi language cards to help follow the themes. However, thebest effect is in the overall view

Amazing. It seems a very small spot to visit, but alone the magnificency of the cristal walls are worth every single minute of it, you can't help but wonder how on earth were they able to build that massive and elaborate piece of art

Just gorgeous. Worth the line wait.. I'd been to Paris three times before I finally came here. It's now my favorite spot in the city and is excellent for photo ops. The stained glass is just beautiful. It's very cold inside in winter, though.
Awesome beyond words !!!. There is nothing one can say about this place, except that it is just so truly beautiful.
Show of Stained Glasses. The stained glasses are something else. This is a small chapel in the heart of Paris. Very close to the Notre Dame.
Worth a visit.. The stained glass is very impressive. But somehow not awe inspiring. (probably because renovation work was going on)

breath-taking!. this tiny church is hidden down a side street, you may not even notice it's there but I would definitely suggest people visit.The narrow spiral staircase that leads to the main church gives you no idea what to expect when you reach the top... I didn't see a single visitor who didn't gasp at the sight of this beautiful room.Read up on it's extremely interesting history before going to really appreciate it.

Worth the lines.. After waiting in several lines, I finally made it into St Chapelle and the first look is very overwhelming! I would recommend looking in a guidebook because it is difficult to discern what is going on in the stained glass on your own. Part of the stained glass also tells the story of how the Crown of Thorns came to be in France--very interesting!
unbelievable. Ground floor is interesting, but as soon as you're up the stairs it's mind boggeling

Amazing Stain Glass Design (Inside). Beautifully craved stain glass designs. There are chairs inside the main hall for you to sit down and enjoyed. While we were inside, sunset approached earlier due to winter. Shade of sun rays shined through the stain glass. Creating layers of feel for photographers to capture this moment
Amazing Concert Venue. Went to a concert one evening here. Absolutely wonderful! Highly recommended. Buy the premium seats and sit right up front.
marvellous. Great stained glass windows and nice souvenir shop. Explanations of pictures in most languages.

Pretty small two storey church with incredible stained windows. Despite strong safety measures at entrance and sometimes long queues(situated in France's main Justice buildings) this small church is very worthwhile for the incomparable stained glass windows. Also it is quite unique in being two stories. You can beat most queues by sporting your Paris Museum Pass, which is a super invention and recommended for all Paris visitors that like museums.

Beautiful Stained glass. Don't miss this beautiful chapel. Worth the price of admission to see how well preserved the windows are and the amazing colors the glass sheds. Not a highly publicized destination but worth it.

Breathtaking windows. We have travelled to Paris before and had not been to Sainte-Chappelle, but are certainly glad we went this trip. It was a beautifully sunny day and the bright light enhanced the beauty of the stained glass. I would definitely recommend this site, but try to go on a sunny day as I think a cloudy day wouldn't do it justice. We had a short wait, but I noticed a separate line (no wait) for people who had a museum pass.

A Gem. Liked : a masterpiece of medieval architecture and stained glass. There is hardly any queue.Disliked : got a little noisy inside. People ignoring the signs requesting quiet. Don't let this put you off though.

Most beautiful church in Paris. Images of this church had stayed with me since seeing it over 25 years ago, so I was keen to see if I would still find it so beautiful. Answer is yes! It is small but absolutely stunning and very different from all the other churches you might see in Paris.

Stained glass jewel box. Really hadn't heard of this attraction before my friend led us to it. It was originally built to house the Crown of Thorns and a piece of the cross which has since been moved for public viewing on occasion. Once you take the last dark and narrow winding step up to the second level, you won't believe your eyes. Natural light lights up the walls of stained glass windows each of which tells a religious story because in those days a lot of people were illiterate. Their beauty alone will leave you speechless.
Incredible chatedral and stained glass windows. The stain glassed windows were just awesome. Hard to believe what went into making them.
Need to see it!. An entire room made of stain glass is stunning. Nothing more to say! Go see it.

there's a climb to get in. Its beautiful and worth the time to visit however there is a very narrow spiral staircase to get to the main area which might be challenging for some. I enjoyed it there however. its a short visit - you don't need much time to see it.

Stunning stained glass. This small but spectacular chapel has the best stained glass windows I've ever seen. Because it is a small chapel, you can an amazing view of the colours and their reflections on the walls. And you can take pictures!

Prettiest Church in Paris. We visited this church without knowing what to expect and were overwhelmed by its beauty. We initially thought it only consisted of the first floor chapel and would have been satisfied since the first floor is beautiful. After discovering the second floor chapel, we sat for close to one hour just gazing at the stained glass. This is a must see in Paris!

Gorgeous stained glass windows. Not easy to find - but persist! In through the Justice building ( not far from Notre Dame) this beautiful little church - with the magnificent big windows is a gem! Visiting in January remnants of Christmas still on view on the ground floor I made my way up the small winding stairs to the first floor and the magnificence of the brilliant, tall stained glass windows of Sainte-Chapelle made even more brilliant which the sun shining through!

Been here twice, everytime it is special!. Aloha from Kaua'i!Saint-Chapelle is truly a breathtaking experience - while we visited it on our first visit to Paris in 2010, we went again Sept. 2011 and this time we enjoyed a Vivaldi concert in the evening.Either way the majesty and beauty of this place will bowl you over. It is easy to find, and if you have the Museum Pass, you can by-pass some of the lines (not the Security Line however) - and it is well worth a wait to get in and see the breath-taking stained glass windows.Attending a concert there was truly indescribable - I've never, ever been in such an amazing location to hear such beautiful music. And very inexpensive as well.We are going back to Paris this year as well and I'm sure we'll try to attend another concert there - it was just magical!
Breathtaking!. One of our favorites. A must see. Buy the museum pass and skip the long line.

Astonishing stained glass. This small chapel not far from Notre Dame was built by St. Louis to house his relic of the crown of thorns. The ground floor entrance level is just typically antique, but the upstairs main chapel is awash in colored light. The sheer amount of stained glass is unbelievable. If you're interested in beautiful medieval churches, this is worth a look. A Museum Pass can help you bypass at least part of the line (and can be purchased at the Tabac shop across the street from the entrance.) Adjacent to the Palace of Justice, so security is fairly tight.
Amazing Stained Glass. An amazing construction for the early 13th century walls full of stained glass. Wow!
...must place to visit in Paris!. ...a historic place with priceless stained glass!!

Amazing place- but the queue?. When you wonder into the upper part of this chapel you will find your breath is taken away. Partly by the stunning beauty of the place and partly because in winter it's bloody cold! the only downside of this place is the slow queuing system to get through security.
Grandiose but shabby. An amazing building and space but sadly quite shabby. Needs a lot more restoration.

Stunning!. So worth the wait queuing. We were lucky enough to visit on a sunny afternoon. You first walk in and its dimly lit but the decoration was still lovely, you walk upstairs and the bright colour from the sunlight through the stained glass is just amazing!
Beautiful. One of those hightlights that is easy to miss, but don't!
The wait is worth it!. Buy the little guide book and read up, it is a fascinating story of when and why this little gem was built. You will not believe the stain glass work.
Beautiful. The stained glass and sunlight are so ethereal, you will know the presence of the divine on earth. Check out a concert there. The acoustics are great.

a marvel!. It has always been my dream to get to see Saint-Chapelle, but every time I was in Paris something came up that prevented me from satisfying my interest. Finally I managed to visit it, and I was stunned. Of course, the pictures of the chapel are good, but they'll never give you the full impression of its exquisite richness and beauty. The stained glass is amazing, one of the best I have ever seen in the world, and the whole interior looks like it's a Faberge product. My advice: plan your visit for the low season, otherwise the queues are enormous. I was there on a November weekend, there were only five people at the ticket office, and about two dozen inside the chapel.
Must see!. We visited Sainte-Chapelle on a bright, clear winter's day with the sun shining through the stained glass windows and it was breathtakingly beautiful.

A little gem!. This place certainly has the wow factor! Hidden away in a courtyard, I wasn't really sure what to expect- my boyfriend had picked it out as somewhere we should go. Theres a chapel on the ground floor- small, and intricatley decorated, then up the narrow spiral staircase to the top part the most beautiful stained glass windows. Definitley a little gem and worth a visit.

Church fit for a King. Probably the most impressive church in Paris. Notre Dame may have the name, Sacre-Coeur may have the views, but the Sainte-Chapelle is a stationary fiest for the eyes. The pictures of this can be found on the Internet, but like most sites, in order to be truly appreciated it has to be seen in person. I am surprised more people and travel guides don’t have this rated higher. It is not an all day visit or even one you can linger around like the Louvre or Eiffel Tower, but it is still something that will leave a lasting impression on you. I would also recommend a magnet or even a stained glass ornament to take home for the memories.
go for the view and the neighborhood.. my daughters were able to climb the tower, but I can say that the view from the front steps is amazing.

Take a Walk with Context Walking Tours!. Like much of Paris, without the accompaniment of an English-speaking intellectual Francophile, the experience would be devoid of added texture. I chose to walk Sainte-Chapelle and Notre Dame with Context Walking Tours, and our guide was most conversant on the Biblical stained glass forming Sainte-Chapelle's windows, Marie Antoinette's last prison cell next door, as well as the wondrous Cathedral of Notre Dame. The morning tour allowed for sunshine to illuminate the windows for great photo opportunities. Bring your camera! And visit the giftshop in the basement for some unique presents for those you left at home :)

An enchanting place. This is a Gothic masterpiece, built in the 13th century. the interior is beautifully airy because the walls are made almost entirely of stained glass.I think it is an absolute must see. It is unequaled.

Stained glass - floor to ceiling all around. Unique 2 level church with incredible floor to ceiling mind blowing stained glass windows upstairs. Check out information cards in all languages explaining the windows.
Ok. If you like stained glass then this is worth a visit but it was over priced.I am glad I visited but would not rush back
Tiny Nice Place. If you have claustrophobia, do not go. It has tiny stairways to go the principal room. But it is incredible

Beautiful, detailed Cathedral of Glass. The tour of this Gothic church (very near Notre Dame) begins in the bottom sanctuary, which mirrors the upper level on a smaller scale. Unfortunately, access to the upper level is via a very narrow spiral staircase so this, like many Paris attractions, may not be accessible for some. From the outside, it doesn’t really look beautiful, more functional. The windows just look leaded; but inside, with the light shining, they are beautiful! In the main sanctuary, there are 15 panels of stained glass with over 1,000 different scenes that cover the entire Christian history. Some of the scenes are too high and too small to see, binoculars might be useful? The altar was built to display the Crown of Thorns (now at Notre Dame). If you like Sainte Chapelle, I’d also suggest a trip to St. Denis to see the Bastille.

Less known, but essential if you enjoy stained glass. This chapel is small compared to the great cathedrals, but it's all about the stained glass. On a sunny day it's spectacular. Plan to spend some time just staring.

Stunning stained glass. A friend suggested we go here. The church is on two levels. The windows in the upper levels are really beautiful and will be even more so when fully restored. The restoration continues until 2015 and does not seem to affect visitors' appreciation of the glass. We visited early February and found the church extremely cold- much cooler than other places we'd visited. We queued 20 minutes for a security check before the cash desk (unlike other churches, you pay here- €8.50)
Beautiful.... The stained glass in this church is really, really beautiful. Couldn't stop myself from saying 'wow' repeatedly in this place. One of the best places to go!

Worth the 8 euros for the glass. The stained glass is beautiful but the church is small. Notre Dame is free and much bigger. Sainte-Chapelle is recouping the money it is spending on restoring the glass, and we were happy to do our bit. Congratulations to Velux who are putting up 5m euros to cover half the costs involved.

Incredible Stained Glass. Built in the 13th Century by Louis the 9th to house religious relics including the 'crown of thorns' which apparently cost more than the Chapel. The upper part of the chapel is almost entirely mediaeval stained glass with hundreds of individual biblical scenes. The effect is overwhelming on a sunny day and the details are too much to take in. They don't tell you what happened to the crown though.Just one word of warning - it's freezing cold in winter.

Awesome Stained Glass Windows. When we got to Saint Chapelle, it was closed until 14:30. Apparently they can close when ever they want. We waited for 45 min in line. This was our second trip to Paris & on my list to see was Sainte Chapelle. The Museum Pass doesn't give you prriority entrance here. The security line is not fun especially in winter when you need to take off jackets etc. But, the wait was so worth it! The most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. Take the information brochure & read each window. Take some time to just sit here & drink it in.
Amazing!!!. Don't miss it if you are going to Paris! Make sure to include going here on your way to Natre Dame.
Beautiful Windows. I love radiant Gothic churches and Ste-Chapelle is an excellent example. The stained-glass windows, now being renovated, have to be seen to be believed.

Luckily the sun came out. We were so fortunate during our trip last week that the sun came out for us to see Sainte Chapelle in all its glory. After 3 days of misty rain and drizzle we were rewarded by a full day of sun to enjoy this impressive Chapel with its 15 beautiful stained glass windows.We took our place with many others in craning our necks to try to pick out the windows of note but they are all so beautiful that they are all to be enjoyed.
Crystal Light. Far more beautiful than Notre Dame but be sure to go on a sunny day when the window glow with colour. A truely remarkable place and one you will never forget.
Beautiful Archetecture. One of the prettiest churches I've seen. Too tired after the long climb to go in, but was worth the hike!
Amazing. breathtaking, the windows are a must see, a little on the expensive side but definitely something you won't see anywhere else.

A Great example of Stained Glass Windows. Its a lovely church to visit with its amazing stained glass windows. Very near the Lourve and the Concierge and notre dame. A walk around this area and over the little bridges of the seine is very pleasant.

Breathtaking. This is a quite incredible building - do make sure to ascend the winding stairs to the second floor - this is where the most amazing stained glass windows turn the room into a magic box of colour

Beautiful. I've been to Paris a few times and I have to be honest, the Ste-Chapelle was never on my schedule. This last trip I wanted to do something different, and talk to a few friends and one of them suggested the Ste-Chapelle, so glad I listened to her, this old building is magnificent, the stained glass is just plain beautiful. It is very close to the Notre-Dame Basilica but a little bit hidden if you ask me, you actually have to enter La Gendarmerie (metal detector, x-ray machine and all) and there in their court you will find the Chapelle. The entrance was 8.5 Euros.

A marvel to behold. This is perhaps the mos-visited church in Paris. On the Ile de la Cite, not far from the Notre Dame, the Sainte-Chapelle is known for long lines.Go early or late to avoid being crushed and pushed
Fourth time. The upper half is majestic, but the lower might be my favorite...very detailed and cozy.

Stunning stained glass, beautiful music.. Visited August 2012 - In the Quartier Latin, you will see many posters advertising classical music concerts in various churches. I went to la Sainte-Chapelle and was planning on seeing les Quatre Saisons de Vivaldi AND the canon de Pachaelbel (two of my favourite pieces in one show), but showed up to early - for the other show (I don't recall which composers), but when I told the hosts, they were happy to let me stay for the second show and even sat me all the way up front. Try and go early so you can see the gorgeous stained glass.

Wait for a sunny morning to enjoy this jewel box!. What a find! The upstairs section of the chapel is glorious and you will enjoy taking your time to study each of the beautiful panels as the sunlight makes them light up.
Magnificent!. A must if you like stained glass. Highly recommend 1( go on a sunny day, and 2) take binoculars. Without binoculars, you can really only see the lowest of the more than 1000 scenes.
A must see. Wow the stained glass was so impressive, especially when the sun came thru them.

When in the Chapel, you feel like you are in heaven. The access through the Sainte Chapelle is right in the corner of the Notre Dame Cathedral, right ahead the Cité metropolitain Station. The visit really pays the boredom of waiting in the security line.The wiay the sunlight reflects in the vitrals is simply magic. This is a little perfect place to wonder if heaven does really have little special places ion earth!
Take the time while visiting Notre Dame. Amazing architecture just beyond Notre Dame. Sure to impress even the non-religious, Saint Chapelle is one of the highlights of central Paris.

sooo colorful!!!!!!!. Ohhhhhh woooooww! the church is the most beautifully decorated church i have ever seen in my life!! Sainte-chapelle was pretty small from the outside u forget all about that when u enter!! the colors are still bright and clean! Discounts r given to students on tickets!

Simply breath-taking. This is a small but very beautiful chapel, which on the right day with good light behind the stain-glass windows is simply breath-taking. It is one of the most beautiful spaces I've been in.
Stunning. The most amazing French Gothic church in all of Paris. The beauty and size of the 13th century stained glass is simply amazing. Make sure you go on a day when the sun might come out.
The best church in Paris. Everything about this church is beautiful. It is also less frequently visited, making it a more enjoyable experience.

Simply amazing...the most beautiful stained glass in Europe. A masterpiece in all senses....you will be astonished by its beauty...a gothic architectural gem, and just a few steps of Notredame Church...another must see!!

You just have to go! Amazing stained glass. Just beautiful! Smaller than I thought it would be. Stairs a bit claustrophobic (narrow winding stone staircase with enough turns that you can't see the top or bottom for awhile). But apart from that - just beautiful!

A jewell in Paris's crown of wonderful things to see,. A hidden jewel
Should not be missed.
A truly wonderful place to see what it must have been like to worship as an aristocrat or a more lowly member of the congregation.
The interior is mesmerising. It is certainly worth finding your way to Ile de Cite and the Palace of Justice

Outstanding. Do not miss this on a sunny day! It is worth standing in the long security line to see stained glass windows unlike anything you will see elsewhere. Skip it on a cloudy day.
When you first walk in, you will wonder - go upstairs and you will be wowed!

A real Jewell. La Sainte Chapelle is a very old and beautiful Chapelle, near la Congiergerie which was a famous "Prison" during hte old time- The Queen Marie Antoinette -KIng Louis 16 and their children where emprisonned there before beein beheaded during the French Revolution-

Take the time for this church. A friend had told me not to miss this church, or I may have passed it by. The windows are breathtaking. Just be careful not to go around lunchtime, as they do close. We found this out after waiting in line only to have the cord put in front of us at the point when they were closing for lunch. We did go back and were glad that we did.

Beautiful stained glass. A must see in Paris. Since you have to go through a metal detector (it's close to the Ministry of Justice) try to go very light. If you go in winter time make sure you have very warm cloths. Go on a sunny day so you can see everything better, also take binoculars.

Magnificent jewel in the crown of Paris..!. This jewel which dates back to 1248 is one of only a few excellent examples of medieval christian structures to still exist in such beautiful condition... It is somewhat tucked away but more than worth any and all efforts to locate... Each of the many times I have been to Paris over the past 15 years I always find time to make it here... It is truly a jewel and you will see it sparkle on a sunny day... The stained glass of the upper chapel which to say is just about all glass other than the roof, is perhaps the best example of this art form and dates back to the 13th century as well... So, figure out your best weather day and head on over to see the jewel that is the most brilliant in the crown of Paris..!
Saint-Chapelle, beautiful. Visited in January so no queuing at all. Very beautiful and with no crowds around a chance to stand and admire the fantastic stained glass.
amazing stained glass!. when you are going to see Notre Dame..this is five minutes away. the windows inside are awe inspirirng..a must to see!

Breath taking. Ascending the narrow stairway into this ancient space can only be described as spiritual. The beauty of the chapel's stain glass cannot be overstated. We were there later in the day, so the sun was up, but not shining directly on the windows, which I thought was perfect. If you have the time sit and imagine all the people who worshiped in this space. Amazing.
Stained Glass. Beautiful stained glass and not crowded. Quite expensive for what it is.

glowing jewels. it's breathtaking to be there in the morning as the light streams through the floor to ceiling stain glass that surrounds you...like a huge box of jewels in the sunlight...wow... love it....

Queuing time. The windows were spectacular, but we had to queue for a long time both outside on the street and then again inside the complex. It was worth it. Reading about the stories of the windows was great.

Absolutely unmissable - my favourite place in Paris. However this on this visit we encountered a very unfriendly woman at the ticket office: my 23 year old daughter was entitled to reduced entry fee as an EU citizen, but you must have your passport to qualify - her UK driving licence was not acceptable. Fair enough, I suppose, but the woman didn't have to be quite so rude to us.
A STAIN GLASS JEWEL. This church is renowed for its stain glass, so be sure to take it in on a sunny day
Beautiful Stained Glass!. You have to see it in person to appreciate the beauty of the stained glass. Takes your breath away!
Get there an hour before closing. They shut the entrance line down early, so get there an hour before closing !!

Stunning stained glass. A must-see in Paris. The stained glass, now mostly renovated & cleaned, with the light shining through, speckling the floors and visitors, can be a magical moment. The royals may have "let them eat cake" (or brioche), but they sure knew how to spend the wealth of their countrymen on fantastic treasures!

The wonderous world of coloured glass.. Look I can't explain how truly magnificent this place is. The sheer expanse of handcrafted original lead light is a sight to behold. It challenges the imagination and grips your emotions whilst taking your breath away!

Stunning colours. We loved our visit to Sainte-Chapelle. We climbed up the narrow, stone, winding staircase to see the stained glass windows in all their glory. The colours are stunning. A definite must-do in Paris.
Do not miss this. Our first trip we went to Sainte-Chapelle. The stained glass windows are beautiful. I would love next time to see a concert here. We just didn't have enough time to see it all.

could not enjoy due to reconstruction. i was only able to see a small room because most of the building was under renovation. what i saw was, anyway, worth seeing. but it took me 3 weeks to get inside. one week I went and it was closed, next week again, and the other week i was able to get in. this was may be because of the renovation but i suggest you checking out via a website or a guide that it is open.

Beautiful place... but not well cared.. I wasn't lucky to see all the stained glass of the upper floor because they were doing some maintenance works and a big metallic structure was covering them, but they are really gorgeous and definitely worth seeing it.In the lower floor instead I was very surprised that there were some tables on the left side with souvenirs and every kind of items for sale, not really the feeling of a church. And then, someone draw a curtain behing those tables to discover a small wing chapel which was used as a kitchen and storage space! That really was incredible! I couldn't believe that such a beautiful place was used like that. Besides, the floor was very dirty, I imagine as a result of the maintenance works going on.
Sainte Chapelle. Although the first floor is quaint at best, the second floor took our breath away. Clearly the most magnificent stained glass windows on earth.
The Glass!. When I walked up the narrow circular stairs and entered the upper church, I was transfixed. The stained glass windows are transcendently, stupefyingly unbelievable.
Very Old Chapel.. Most beautiful stained glass windows. Very close to Notre Dame.
Take a very wide lens.. Cut your exposure down and bring the widest lens you can find for this ocean of Stained Glass.
One of a kind. Amazing stained glass around four walls - nothing like you have seen before. Simply stunning. A must see in Paris - you only need 20-30 mins there but make it part of your visit.

hidden treasure. Not so well known probably because it is hidden behind the conciergerie and Palais de Justice but so well worth a visit, a few steps away from Notre Dame. It is a small chapel but it's architecture one 2 floors with the low chapel and high chapel and it's gothic vaults + stain glass make it an exceptional example of gothic church. If you are lucky enough to get there when the sun shines, you will be overwhelmed by the beauty of the place. It can be seen & visited in 40mn so you can get there later in the day (but beware that you can't get in after 16:15 and it closes at 17:00) to avoid the queues althought both times I've visited I never had to queue. Also each first Sunday of the month museums are free so good tip if you can plan your trip accordingly..

Much needed restoration in progress.. Wonderful colors and many stained glass windows --- steeped in history make this a good stop after a morning at the Louvre. There is a major stained glass renovation going on - although it does not disturb your visit - and I hope next that some of the painting, which makes this place so magical, will be next. The location is rather odd, the entry being right alongside the courthouse.

A gem - but not a destination. St. Chapelle is all about the stained glass windows, and they will make you go "Wow!" even if you are annoyed and tired from the long lines and Paris's most thorough security check. But there is a limit to how long you can look at windows. Plan for 15 minutes, 30 maximum for this site. It was worth a 45+ minute wait, but don't plan on spending half a day there.

Music at Sainte-Chapelle. Walking into this Chapel at 6:30pm on an early summer night, by breath was literally taken away. I believe I literally gasped. It is gorgeous. The best part, we were not just touring the facility, we were there for a concert! When you go to Paris, check the internet for concerts as Sainte-Chapelle regularly hosts classical music performances. We saw a marvelous performance of Vivaldi's four seasons. It is an intimate yet soaring space. The music combined with the sacred beauty and history is simply too much to adequately describe. I cannot recommend enough. This is a stunning destination, with incredible history, and a memorable present. Go!
Stunningly Beautiful. You have to see it to really appreciate it - but Sainte-Chapelle is remarkably beautiful.

Chapel ceiling floats on stained glass walls. I visited Sainte-Chapelle on the Ile de la Cite because it was reputed to be the most beautiful chapel in Paris. You need to enter through the municipal offices, requiring security screening. You first visit a small chapel under Sainte-Chapelle, then you walk upstairs to the main chapel. It is truly stunning, the very high eiling seems to be held up by walls made entirely of stained glass windows, the supporting stone columns are thin and are barely noticeable amid the splendor of the windows. Although I haven't seem all the chapels in Paris, this one would be very hard to beat.

Small but beautiful church. The Saint - Chapelle is beautiful but very small and if you been to barcelona and of the churches there it may not compare. However the sheer oldness and beauty is quite special...Definitely try to go in the morning when the sun is shining and highlighting the stained glass windows..
WOW. STUNNING!!! Regardless of the number of hours you have to wait in line, it is a definite must see.

After you've seen Notre Dame it's a short walk away. Beautiful ... wonderful stained glass and a very short walk from Notre Dame. After this wander around St. Germain or head on over to the Orsay on the night they close and you'll have a wonderful day!

Glorious Sainte-Chapelle. Glorious! We attended an evening concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons. It was amazing. As the concert starts the light streams in the spectacular stained glass windows. As the concert progresses the light slowly disappears and you are left with a golden glow from the interior lighting. This was an amazing experience. Try to purchase advance tickets on line as these concerts are very popular.

Must see - better than Notre Dame!. There is no way to skip the initial line, though your Paris museum pass let's you skip the second line. Stunningly beautiful stained glass windows are the highlight.
Beautiful!. Be sure to see both the chapel downstairs and the upper, grander one.
Try to go in the morning or midday for the light. Special Special Stained glass. Both the upper floor and the lower floor. Try for a sunny day early to midday for the best light
Most beautiful church!. It is definitely worth going to.. like standing inside a kaleidoscope. Some of the most beautiful stained glass I've ever seen in a church.
stain glass window art. visit here on a sunny day to enjoy the windows..a charming little chapel worth finding...

Favorite Church in the World. This is by far my favorite church in the world - the stained glass is stunning (try to go inside on a sunny day for the best effect). You can't bypass the line with the Museum Pass due to the security checkpoint so go when they open to avoid a long wait - but it is definitely worth the wait - breathtaking!

Sainte-Chapelle is a wonder. This site is one of the wonders of Paris. It is a late medieval building built to house religious relics belonging to the French kings. It is now surrounded by the Justice Ministry and thus entry requires security checks (no sharp objects). Go early as the lines form up out on the road. Admission by the Paris Museum pass is included and allows one to skip the ticket queue inside the compound, but everyone is in the same line for security. On entering the building, one comes into a rather dark room with some decorations and a gift shop. Then climbing a very steep circular staircase, you enter the upper chapel which is mind-blowingly beautiful, especially on a sunny day. Much of the walls of the structure are tall colored glass windows that illustrate biblical stories. The color and craft have to be seen to be believed. It is possible to "read" the windows--some cards in various languages provide the deails. Access is controlled--so one could, in high tourist seasons--have to wait on line for maybe two hours if very late into the day. Again, the museum pass does give you a queue-cut in the inner courtyard by the ticket booth.
impressive. The stained glass is amazing, beautiful old church!

A hidden jewel. So beautiful, not to be missed. Go on a day when there is sunshine to fully appreciate the incredible stained glass (which is basically the entire chapel. Make time to see this treasure. Sometimes there are concerts here, if there is you will see flyers posted.

limited hours for tourists. We tried on two occasions to visit Sainte-chapelle. The 1st visit was on a Sunday and the chapel was closed. Only Parisians would close a chapel on a Sunday. On our 2nd visit, we joined a long queue at around 3:45pm, and a minute or so later a security guard established a cut-off point about a dozen people in front of us that would be the last to gain admittance that day. According to our guidebook, the chapel should have been open until 5:00 pm, but we were denied admittance.

Sainte-Chapelle - Quick & Dirty. Sainte-Chapelle was a stunning building to visit. The stained glass was more detailed and beautiful than any I'd ever seen. Though I certainly don't regret visiting it, it was likely the least exciting thing I saw in Paris, and that's saying something because I still found it beautiful. It was just sort of a quick visit; interesting and beautiful, but no huge impact.
You need to see this. The inside of this chapel is well worth the visit to get in. Take your time and really enjoy the colors of the stained glass.

The windows were amazing. Just fabulous. Worth the time to visit. There was some construction going on around the church but it did not take away from the ambiance. Could not get over the beauty of those windows.
Amazing! Go on a sunny day.. One of the most under-rated churches in Paris. Be sure to go on a sunny day.

A must if you are into gothic. Even the part of it was closed during our visit and the fact that probably only 1/3 is saved, Sainte-Chapellle stays one of the nicest example of gothic architecture well worth visit. The chapele is not big but the the details are impressive. Would be great to take a tour of it if you can, as we did Try to get yourself a ticket in advance, we waited almost 1h to get in.

What a surprise!. We went to Saint Chapelle and it was just gorgeous. But the surprise is when you walk thru a door and up a few stairs ---- the stained glass... wow! It is just breaktaking. Don't miss this.

AMAZING!!!!!!!!. I have visited a number of cathedrals around the world - all were beautiful, but none compared with this one! You enter the facility into what is basically the basement. Beautiful, though dark. You walk up some spiral stairs into a room which literally takes your breath away! Back to back windows from ceiling to almost the floor which floods the room with color.Though this is about 1/5th the size of Notre Dame, there is no comparison - this one blows it away!DO NOT LEAVE PARIS WITHOUT VISITING IT!!!Note: This is covered under the museum pass.
Lines were too long. Decided to skip it, after seeing the flying buttresses at Notre Dame. End of December, raining and cold and the line was at least 1.5 hours long to get in.

A medieval jewel in the middle of Paris. Most of the tourists ignore this church.
